Reviews.Title: “Really great service, great central location”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff everywhere. Even the parking lot attendants would ask if you need directions, not once, but every time, and at any hour. The location is perfect, just a few minutes drive to Universal Studios area, less than 15 minutes to Disney area, 15 minutes to the airport, 15 minutes to downtown Orlando, so it's very central. And two major freeways are very close. Just remember Highway 528 exit #1 is the best place to exit for the hotel (coming from either direction). Rooms were nice, although not five star. No HBO, no stereo in the room, but very comfortable bedding. Average size room, but nice big bathroom. Views aren't really that interesting, but I would think a pool view would be best. Small mini fridge in the room, nice big desk and chair, also lounge chair with ottoman was nice. Room was perfectly clean everywhere. I thought the shampoo bottle was really small, just enough for only one shampoo. If two people in one room, it won't be enough shampoo. Insulation between rooms was fine, but I could hear people in the hallway through the door, but not too serious. The pool was nice, had a little "lazy river" area you can float around innertubes on. I only went to the breakfast buffet, but it was decent, but not lavish. Good fresh fruit, omlette station etc. On the weekend days, the hotel was very full, several events going on, and the garage was not big enough to accomodate everyone, so many cars were parked somewhat far away on a lawn, but I'm guessing that is rare. Parking is charged daily, as in internet. Nearby about a 5 minute walk is a Mobil gas station with a 24 hour convenience store; A few more minutes away is a McDonald's, Red Lobster and a small supermarket. A 5 minute drive away is the part of International Drive with many restaurants, night clubs, shops, malls, etc. which was nice. There was a mix up at checkin, Kayak sent Hilton the wrong dates, not the fault of Hilton at all, so it took 15 minutes to check in, but they offered me two breakfast buffet coupons for my time, which was really very generous and nice. Very friendly staff throughout here.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hilton near I-drive”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: Visited hotel for a business conference. Very upscale Hilton with a beautiful lobby and nice rooms. very nice pool although it can be a bit crowded when the hotel is full. We really appreciated the adult only pool. Clean with excellent staff service. Good proximity to many nice restaurants and bars on International drive, close to outlet malls, and not far from the airport. Not particularly convenient if you are going to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: eagle167
Reviews.Content: My family and I drove to Florida to start a 2 week family vacation. I thought it would be nice to go a day early and stay at this hotel, (as it was rated #1 here on Tripadvisor) Wow what a disapointment. Where do I begin, how about, standing in line for 25 minutes trying to check in.......... or the fact that they nickle and dime you for EVERYTHING!!!!!!!! Need Wifi in your room- it'll cost approx 15.00/per night, parking 12.00/per night, want to play miniputt at the hotel- average out approx 20.00 for 4 putters/ 30min. Need to make a local call..... it'll cost ya. oh, and be aware..... READ the holder that the key card comes in.......our's stated that if you DONT want a paper in the morning you need to let them know otherwise your room will be charged 75cents everyday. This hotel has NOTHING that is complimentary..........so after all that we decided we'd just go down and sit by the pool- and relax yeah... right. where should we sit....? on other people's laps? I've never seen a more busy pool. and it just got more, and more busy. Now what....... we decided to go for a walk- other than a Denny's, McDonald's and a Walgreen's there isnt much around to walk too. You'll have to take your car to get to any shopping or entertainment. The next day I decided to go to the Marketplace on the ground level to grab a quick breakfast- 1 bagel with butter on the side.......almost 5.00 with tax.........are you kidding me??? I had purchased a package that let us have a later check-out that day- what a waste - while my husband packed up- I called the next resort to see if we could get in early- we wanted out of this hotel as soon as possible. Before we left I went down to the front desk to "discuss" my unhapiness, I mean close to $300.00/night I should be able to say something, but yet again, long line up....c'mon, it's time to hire more desk staff. I stood approximately 5 minutes and overheard 2 other people discussing how unhappy they were with everything costing a small fortune. We left. The rooms and beds are par with a Fairfield Inn by Marriott or a Holiday Inn at best. I will never stay here again and have advised my friends the same. A $220.00 night ended up costing us almost $300.00 -pathetic. I'm sure there are other hotels in the area that are just as nice but more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RFJ74
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time! The hotel is amazing and our room was very clean. each person we talked to was friendly and offered great directions and recommendations. Wish we had spent more time enjoying the amazing pool area!

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: CarmelJ0
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is clean, bright, and airy. The staff was friendly and navigating the expanse of property was not difficult at all. The hotel is very close to International Drive, making it easy to find decent restaurants off-property by car. There are slim pickings by foot. The top level of the parking garage is at lobby level, so you don't have to lug your bags around as much. But most important was the bed. It was incredibly comfortable. I did not want to leave. Seriously. This is a great hotel with a great location, and the bed almost guarantees a good night’s sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Convention Center South Hall”
Reviews.Author: IraBfromCSG
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at this Hilton for a weekend athletic tournament held at the South Hall of the Orlando Convention center. The hotel is connected to the convention center with a short walk between the two buildings. Checkin was efficient, service excellent, and all employees were friendly. The poolside restaurant makes it easy to enjoy the pool, with food and drinks easy to get. There are more that enough seats poolside, and a large presence around the pool (lazy river, volleyball net, tennis, etc.). Prices were reasonable, and free breakfast on the 19th floor for Hilton Honors upgraded guests. A very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalServicesGuy
Reviews.Content: In Orlando on business and took a weekend break here. This hotel has every facility you find in a conference hotel. The Executive room was fine, noisy aircon though. The Executive Lounge is very busy with kids on the weekend - what do you expect on a weekend in Orlando? No Sunday papers there. It has an Honor Bar and food - not the free beer you might get elsewhere. Stephens Restaurant is excellent if expensive. You can walk to a small supermarket and other local restaurants near the exhibition center. The Orlando Pointe approximately a mile away is a lively area with bars, comedy club, cinema and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd time here!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer0003
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying at this hotel. We traveled with friends who loved it. I would stay here again. We had a great vacation and spent more time at the hotel pool than we did at any of the parks. Very clean and hotel staff very accomodating. We've recommended this Hilton over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: xhotardx
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my travel companion on the "executive level" of the hotel. Basically this floor was key card restricted, and had a "special" lounge which served breakfast and snacks throughout the day. The lounge was a nice touch, however the rooms were just about on par with what I expected. They were clean and well kept upto the Hilton standard. The one thing that we did notice at this hotel was how many staff members there were. There were literally staff members at every turn. At times it felt a little frustrating, as you couldn't help but running into someone who was trying to help you and it felt like you needed to frequently tip. For example, to exit the parking structure there is an attendant. You simply need to swipe your key card to exit and enter. However the attendant comes out of the booth and offers to swipe your card for you and make recommendations for restaurants and places to visit in the area. Its a bit of overkill. The pool area was fantastic, and you must visit the lazy river. I personally took about 7 laps on it. Also we visited the spa, which was a very nice treat. It was a full feature spa with a steam room, rain fall showerhead and all the other goodies you would expect to find.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Gym, Bad Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: VacationDude
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business in an executive level room. Overall the room was typical Hilton quality. I liked the walk-in shower rather than tub with shower. Doubt all rooms are configured this way, however. My room did not have the best air conditioning. It took way too long to get the room to an acceptable temp. This would definitely be an issue in hotter weather. The common areas are nice and BIG since this is a convention hotel and accommodates the masses. I especially liked the workout facility, as the gym was larger and cleaner than most hotels offer. Also, the equipment was of good quality. While the gym and common areas were nice, I did not care for the executive lounge. The service in the lounge was poor, the food was not replenished, and the floor by the bar was sticky night and day. I guess they don't bother to clean the floor much. Finally, the breakfast in the lounge was lacking hot options. I have experienced much nicer executive lounges. Aside from the service in the lounge, everyone else was super friendly and helpful. I gave the hotel an average rating because for the price, I expected more in terms of the lounge and the location. There are other hotels closer to the convention center that allow one to walk to numerous bars and shops, but this Hilton is a bit off the path and slightly too far from the action.

Reviews.Title: “almost the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: 2600marinaman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel if you like modern decor. Too much glass, mirrors, and chrome for me, I prefer the warmth of wood. Great staff and service with two beautiful pools and lazy river. Immaculately clean, even the rest rooms by the pool were nice. Lots of areas to stretch out throughout the property. Down side are the exorbitant daily cost for parking, unbelievable food/beverage prices ($14 for room service Starbucks coffee) and the nerve to charge registered guests for internet access. Even McDonalds offers free wifi! Staff went out of their way to be friendly and the areas around the pools were very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “PURE room review”
Reviews.Author: bethany c
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, I was told I would be staying in a PURE room. Didn't really know what to expect, but this room smelled so pleasant. Being an allergy sufferer and prone to sinus headaches, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I slept so sound and woke up with NO sinus pressure, pain, or congestion. I couldn't believe it and had to inquire about the air purifier in the room. it is like magic! Highly recommend a PURE room and the awesome pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: RalphDenver
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at this hotel for a recent conference I attended. This hotel is very nice and everything is very clean. The rooms are modern and beds comfortable. I found the staff working there to be very friendly and helpful. The pool area was a great place to relax with a slide, lazy river, and hot tub, as well as a fun bar to get drinks. I will say I found everything from Wi-Fi to food to be extremely over-priced, but no different from anywhere else you travel and there are cheaper options nearby. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great property with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bostonsig
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando has a great layout and an adults only pool and jacuzzi area besides the regular one (this is huge as I like to be able to relax and not hear screaming kids). The staff is super friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed being able to relax and felt the place was more resort-ish than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: atl30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend getaway. The ammenities are aweome. We really enjoyed the pool area- beautiful pool with great landscaping, comfy chairs, umbrellas if you want shade, and a great staff. The lazy river is fun- it's nice that they don't charge you to use the rafts. Everyone working at the hotel was very nice and helpful. The room was very quiet. The window shade was great- didn't let in any sun- perfect for sleeping in. The only thing that could have made our trip better was having a mini-fridge in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lion_in_Exile
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to thank Jay and rest of the staff at the Hilton Orlando enough.. After an exhausting drive from New Jersey, we arrived at the Hilton Orlando to be blown away by not just the Hotel and its amenities but by the genuine friendliness of all the staff. We arrived late in the evening on a Saturday and after dumping our luggage, the kids spent some time around the fire pits toasting smores.. The room, was outstanding, as was the poolside facilities.. If anything, the website does not promote exactly how good the pool area actually is.. Lazy river, slide, family hot tub etc etc, kept the kids entertained (without too much supervision) pretty much all day. Thanks again Jay, Chris and the rest of the 3 Amigo's ! We will be back again next Easter...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new hotel, great for conventions”
Reviews.Author: landcuo
Reviews.Content: I went to a convention at this hotel. The service was excellent and the room was very clean. Perfect bed. The hotel has a great gym that was useful when I was exercising. I ordered room service and they gave me a caesar salad larger than my head that was covered in about 3 lbs of chicken (hey, it's America!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new and clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph D
Reviews.Content: Great location fro the hotel next to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Orlando, great stay close to I Drive places to eat”
Reviews.Author: Ndalsteve
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. The pool area was nice and very well maintained. Great place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Exceelent Hotel for a reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: SpecialKPottersville
Reviews.Content: There was nothing that the Hilton Orlando did not have - Lazy river, slides, multiple pool (family and quiet), hot tubs, basketball, golf, We especially enjoyed that sunny spacious exercise facility with high ceiling and floor to ceiling windows. In addition to multiple eating choices (outdoor, casual, and upscale) Rooms were very clean and updated and staff was very friendly. Nice families. Locations was perfect for both Disney and Universal Studios. Would definitely recommend it. Nice spa with reasonable rates

Reviews.Title: “Well located in the epicentre of family fun!”
Reviews.Author: frankieandsandy
Reviews.Content: Visiting Orlando from Australia, we found it to be the best place we'd ever visited on the globe for family FUN! This city is built for families! The Hilton Orlando is perfectly located, within close proximity to an abundance of theme parks, attractions and internationally reknowed places of interest. We visited Seaworld, Universal Studios Island's of Adventure and the Kennedy Space Centre - and everything was organised by the fantastic concierge service at the Hilton. The concierge staff are very thorough, quick and full of helpful tips which really made things easy for us. Our check in was also very quick and our room was spacious and well appointed. Our family didn't want to waste any time to reaching our destinations each morning, so a quick breakfast from the Marketplace cafe was really handy. My advice would be to allow one day just to sit by the pool - it's one of the best pool areas I've EVER seen (and I've seen many). It's also very quiet during the day when most guests are out exploring Orlando, so a great opportunity to soak in some sun and have some relaxed fun with the kids. We dined at David's Club Bar and Grill twice, and found the service to be INCREDIBLY slow, so I'd advise to give this one a miss if you're hungry! The staff at the Hilton were very friendly and professional, this would certainly be our hotel of choice if we returned to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay was had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel45
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was very comfortable. The beds had luxuray bedding and pillows. The bathroom was well maintained and cleaned perfectly everyday. I enjoyed the amenditites located near the pool and lazy river. The fire pits were a nice added attraction. My family was thilled with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Vegas-style hotel misses the mark - especially in service”
Reviews.Author: NickK7501
Reviews.Content: Found myself at this hotel for a business meeting. Though I reserved a non-smoking room, it was immediately clear that my room had been smoked in. A call to the front desk shortly after check-in didn't help. When trying to find the restaurant serving breakfast, there was no signage. After finding it and being seated, I was ignored for at least 10 minutes (though there was plenty of staff). After I finally got a waiter's attention, I was then hovered over for the rest of my meal. After checking out, my colleague tried to retrieve her back from the bell staff. They had one bellman and he was off doing something so this process took much longer than it should have. Overall, at best, this hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “A resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Tristan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during March Break. Was initially concerned about the fact that this is also a conference hotel, and hence might be crowded and stuffy. I was relieved that those concerns were unfounded. The conference area is off to a separate wing of the hotel. The facilities are fabulous: two pools, lazy river, tennis court, basketball court, mini-golf, running track, professionally equipped gym. The room was clean with a fair size bathroom. The latter wasn't luxurious by any means, but in fact, rather basic. Also used the spa, which was luxurious, and had a good experience. The hotel is not close to the main strip of International Drive, but there are three restaurants and a Walgreen within walking distance. We also took the trolley ($1.25 each way) to the Premium Outlet mall, which took about 20 minutes, not counting the wait. If you have a car, it's much easier to get around. The only complaints I had was that the buffet breakfast cost $22/person (not worth it at all), and wireless internet was $14/day. If you need to use the internet to check-in for your flight, however, you can do that and print your boarding passes for free in the Business Centre. But go there early - it closes at 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the convention. Traveler but not good for families”
Reviews.Author: cjr15
Reviews.Content: if I was traveling to orlando for business or a convention this would be the ultimate hotel I would shot for but the facility is not family friendly. for those looking for an equivelent family friendly Hilton resort try bonnet creek

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: twoguysinnc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. Service in the bistro and by the pool was non-existent. No refills or follow up by service staff. Rooms were clean and okay. Front desk staff was friendly Carpet cleaning at 2am on the last day of our stay was unexpected and prevented a good nights sleep. Front desk argued with me and said that there was no cleaning in the hallways but I could clearly see the guy with the carpet cleaner in the hallway. They refused to do anything about it or to send up security, i asked for the manager in duty and was tod that they did not have a manager in duty at this hotel. Disappointing to say the least. With all the options in Orlando, I will not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Bob c
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is adjacent to the Orange County Convention Center. The hotel hosts many activities - bars & restaurants. My room was modern and well appointed. It was also extrememly quiet. I was here for business and didn't take advantage of the resort's ammenities. It is quite a walk to the Universal BLVD retaurants - you'll want to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: GsoKnight
Reviews.Content: This is a convention hotel, so it practically empties out for the weekend. We've been here twice and gotten a fantastic rate on the bid engine at Priceline. Our most recent visit was over Easter weekend, which also happened to be our wedding anniversary. The check-in process was smooth but slow. In spite of what I said about empty weekends, it was Easter and jammed up with many families checking in. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and when we returned from dinner that night we found a tray of exotic and delicious candies in our room with a congratulatory note. The next day my wife bought a book in the gift shop and mentioned our anniversary. When we came back to the room, there was another gift waiting for us. The hotel itself is fairly new, clean and well-maintained. In spite of all the families there, it was also quiet. The lobby is spacious and attractive. The rooms are pretty standard, but comfortable and clean. The pool is impressive, with a nice hot tub (jammed with unattended kids - a pet peeve of mine) and a long lazy river. The pool has plenty of access, including a zero entry area. There are plenty of chairs, games to play and a good bar. The only low point is that the service was slow, especially on our first day. There is plenty of parking, including covered parking. I think it was 18 bucks a day for self parking. Steep! The Hilton would get five stars except for the slow check in, expensive parking, slow pool bar service and not policing the hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers97
Reviews.Content: Was there for a convention. Had to rush out of meetings to enjoy the lazy river, pools and water slide. We had a blast enjoying the outdoors. The service at the pool bar was great. The food was good. We walked the lazy river to get some exercise. There is also a nice walking trail. The coffee shop up staffed to move the crowd so I appreciated that. The gift shop had a nice selection. The taxis were much faster than the shuttle (makes multiple hotel stops). If you have 2 people or more, taxi is the way to travel to and from the airport for the same price. We beat our shuttle friends by an hour. I love hilton resorts! Internet was a little slow and $15/day. It was included with our conference so I was really happy about that. Some days the housekeepers were a little lax.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: mediumrare506
Reviews.Content: I've used the Hilton Orlando for both business and family leisure. Nice rooms and staff. Excellent internet access and swimming facilities. Did not use the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Close to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: RowdyRedneck
Reviews.Content: This is an overall wonderful hotel in the Orlando area. Also, it is a great place to use your HiltonHonors points if you are a frequest Hilton travler. This hotel feels more like a resort in the carribean because of the lush landscaping, huge pools, lazy river, and waterslide. The lazy river is amazing with several waterfalls. It is lots of fun for kids because there are numerous places on the lazy river where you get sprayed. There is a also a large basketball court area for kids. In addition to the terrific pool/lazy river area, the hotel is absolutely first class. The rooms are really nice with very comfy Hilton style beds. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers as well as families looking for a place to relax in the Orlando area. SeaWorld is only 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Inadequate staffing”
Reviews.Author: pwcmd
Reviews.Content: The arrival and departure process was smooth and efficient. The hotel is new and rooms are nice-sized. The bathroom was not large but was adequate. Shampoo and other toiletries were small sized but good quality--not the "Clear" offered in many Hilton properties. I particularly like the fact that there are ample electrical outlets in the room to charge your camera batteries, your phone etc. Many older hotels have few outlets and they are all in use. Beds were comfortable. If you are attending a meeting some of the ballrooms are so far from the main hotel area that you may wish you had brought a "scooter." Banquet food left MUCH to be desired. It was overcooked and nothing was particularly special. My main complaint about the hotel is their trying to get by with too few staff. Our room was not cleaned until nearly 5PM. We decided to eat lunch in the Bistro. There was a long line and we decided to go to the pool grill in the interest of time but there were no vacant tables there either. We returned to the Bistro and waited. Once seated we waited and waited and waited. Our waitress indicated that staff had been sent home in the interest of saving money and neither the kitchen nor the wait staff were able to handle the number of diners. The large lobby bar was never staffed during our stay and we had to to go David's Club for cocktails. The lounge area had large chairs and cocktail tables that were difficult to accomodate our group of eight even after we moved chairs and tables around. The lounge could use some smaller, more comfortable chairs for groups. Service was good but drink prices were fairly high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: mekkd
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the staff at this hotel. Ryan at the concierge desk was very helpful and personable. He went out of his way to help us and try to save us money. Thank you for everything Ryan! Also Matt and Ben in the front of the hotel were also standout employees. Ben noticed that we were in av cab for. Quite a long time and sensed something was wrong. He took note of the cab number to make a report. We were very impressed that he noticed we were having some difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: justme028
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Restaurants are good but overpriced, same for bar. pool area is beautiful. The only issue I had was one night my room key deactivated, I went to the front desk at midnight, there were only two employees behind the counter each helping a customer, I waited 25 minutes to get a key, manager was no where to be seen. Also, the concierge desk was left unattended twice during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: QuincyM_b75
Reviews.Content: We went down there to enjoy Disney and this hotel was awesome in every aspect. Only flaw was that they shuttle to attraction area was running by “mears” and only 3 times in the morning and 3 times in the afternoon. It wouldn’t be a problem If you had missed it since there was city bus stop “111” and “iride” close to hotel which was cheap and easy to access. “111” goes to airport & Disney land. “iride” goes to sea world. Room was clean, neat with new decorations. Pool was clean and enjoyable, gym was great specially was 24/7. You definitely need to go there and enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BlackCoffee4Me
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights to attend a conference in the hotel. Room rate was fair compared to surrounding properties, but by the time they added on charges for everything else, it was far too pricey. Looking at my bill, one night cost: $119.00 for the room $14.88 room tax $20.00 valet parking (self-park is $13.00) $1.30 for taxes on the valet parking... $14.95 for Internet access (per day) $22.00 breakfast buffet 75 cents of that daily room rate is for the USA Today newspaper. So what did I get for those dollars? A fairly spacious room with an unbelievably UNcomfortable bed. Three nights with only a few hours' sleep and I was very grateful to get back home to my own mattress. The room was clean and had luxurious supplies (thick towels, good coffee maker, nice TV, down comforters.) The whole place was really clean and the staff was polite and helpful. However, by the time I tipped the bellman (required to use them unless you haul your own bags - w/o luggage cart), tipped the valet, and tipped the waiters in the buffet, I spent an average of over $200 per day. Compare that to the nearby Hampton Inn which is just as clean and beds are always comfortable - free parking, free Internet, free breakfast, free newspaper, free use of luggage cart... The Hilton just didn't give value for money. The kicker for me was the room service menu. The prices were so high I realized this place probably catered to Saudi Sheiks visiting Orlando to take their kids to the theme parks...

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoItsme
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We were here for a Disney/Universal studio vacation and it was no more than 15-20 min drive there. Large pool with lazy river, great location, facitilities and amenities. I really liked the Peter Thomas Roth shampoo/conditioner/lotion. Breakfast was good too, service was even better. The pool was pretty crowded but we still enjoyed it alot. The lazy river made a huge difference compared the ordinary pool of other hotels. At $170 a night including tax, we thought it was a great value and would consider staying here again. The only con- the "market" was quite a walk and of course a little pricey too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kev1438
Reviews.Content: This hotel, though large, seems a lot more intimate than it appears. Lobby area doesn't go on forever, and the bar and restaurants are in close proximity to check-in. Gym is an easy ride down the elevator, and is quite good with a nice selction of machines. Pool is right next to it, as is spa. I've stayed twice, both on executive floor and admit that the food options are limited and the room often crowded with families. But in the evening when the honor bar is open it is pretty quiet and easy to sit and work in. Very good business center. Rooms are standard Hilton, beds comfortable. Perhaps rooms are a little small compared to other hotels. Easy access to the sprawling convention center with covered walkway providing some cover from sun. Easy to get to local restaurants and to and from airport. Beware that out around the convention center you need a taxi to get everywhere and parking is not cheap. It can be more expensive than other hotels connected to convention center but is a lot easier to get around and much less of a headache.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Hilton Orlando”
Reviews.Author: turkeyMiami
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this wonderful hotel. We come to Orlando frequently and this was our first visit at this hotel----but it definitely will not be our last!! Wonderful service and great amenities!! Awesome pool! Since Hilton Honors member-got to enjoy the Executive level which was very nice!! Highly recommend this hotel for business and pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kingmoonman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Orlando for two nights in April. Our family enjoyed our time there in the pool, the lazy river, and on the basketball court. Pros: +Great pool area. +Lazy river is nice. +Three basketball hoop court (rims from about 5 to 8.5 high). +Very clean. +Staff was very friendly. Cons: -Try not to get run over in the executive lounge by people grabbing dinner of cold popcorn chicken and roasted vegetable tarts. It's not worth it. -Lazy river requires work to keep moving down the river. You have no choice but to get sprayed, which could be a pro or con depending on the air temperature. -People who feel like they need to have a great place for a newspaper and towel to sit for the morning have most of the good spots taken by nine. They roll in to keep their newspapers company around one. There were still loungers available around the back of the lazy river most of the time. -Ice maker on our floor was broken for the duration of our stay. There was no indication it was ever going to be fixed. -Make sure you keep a "heads up" when playing on the basketball court. Some people's kids think it's funny to throw stuff off the public balcony’s seventeen floors above. It's not.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond exceptional!! We most definitely be back to this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Carla B
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned home form a fantastic week at the Hilton Orlando on Destination Parkway. This hotel is beyond extraordinary, I cannot say enough about what a great experience we had. I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and stay at hotels all over the US, so when I stay somewhere that makes an impression it sticks with me. I typically do not write reviews, but in this case I just had to tell everyone else about what a great experience we had here. This hotel is by far one of the nicest we have ever been to. The staff here is so friendly and helpful which made this hotel our number one on the list. We will 100% be returning guests. Even before I arrived I was so pleasantly surprised by how helpful the staff was. I had called the hotel before arrival to inquire about a bigger room upgrade since we were traveling with all the kids, I was helped by Sayara who went out of her way to set everything up before my arrival so that I didn’t have to worry about anything. Sayara was amazing and should be recognized for going above and beyond. We stayed in the signature suite on the executive level with connecting queens and the suite was huge, beautifully decorated with a modern décor as was the connecting queen room. We have 4 kids, one with a wheelchair and there was more than enough room, the kids absolutely loved it. Our maid was very friendly and rooms were always spotless. We also had an awesome view of the pool which is amazing in itself! The pool area is exceptional, it has everything you need, a waterslide, lazy river, quiet pool and private cabanas. There is no need to leave the hotel since it has all the amenities you need. Kids also loved the basketball court with kiddie size basket. The hotel also offers golf, volleyball, pool tables, foosball and has fires each night where the kids roasted smores. On Easter Sunday they had a very well organized Easter egg hunt for the kids which we took advantage of. Like I said, this place is amazing!! Again, best hotel stay we have had for our family vacation. The front desk management (specifically Keith C, Vincent B, Jay S and Chris M) are absolutely fantastic, they went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. They are all so eager to please, they deserve a million kudos!! We appreciated their kindness and service with a smile!! Always checking on us to make sure we are enjoying our stay and doing anything they could to make it even better. Excellent service from all of them!! We were by the pool most days and took full advantage of the Tropics bar/restaurant. The service was great, the one stand out waiter was named Chris B, he is super friendly and was great with the kids, cannot say enough about him. On my son’s birthday he had a cake made for him and brought it to us poolside as a surprise! We were so appreciative and he did this all on his own, all we could say is wow!! Since I am a diamond member we also had access to the executive lounge on the 19th floor which we went to every day of our stay (several times a day). The breakfast was great, had many options to choose from, too many to list, this saved us a ton of money since we didn’t have to worry about buying breakfast every day for 6 people. At 5:00-7:00 every day they also have appetizers in the lounge and then dessert at 8:00, the food was very good and it was so convenient to be able to go to the lounge anytime during the day for water, soda etc. If you have a choice definitely upgrade to get access to the lounge. The staff in the lounge was always very pleasant. However, Mario in the lounge was beyond helpful and friendly to us! Somehow he also found out it was my son’s birthday and he brought him a gift basket filled with chips and candy and other snacks. He is so thoughtful and this was so unexpected which makes it even nicer! Both Chris and Mario deserve a raise, they both have such great customer service skills!! We made sure to let their management know that they were exceptional and should be recognized. We did not want to leave this hotel, and cannot wait to return again, do not even hesitate to stay here, you will not be disappointed I promise you that! Cannot even put into words how great the hotel and staff were for our stay!! Exceptional, exceptional, exceptional!! Amazing staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lola D
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was absolutely stunning, one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The location was perfect, especially if you like the theme parks (very close to both sea world and aquatica and not far from the Disney parks) The rooms were lovely (not overly spacious, but who spends much time in the room anyway?) The Hotel was pristine and spotlessly clean. Everything was very modern and luxurious. The facilities were very good (shops, breakfast etc..) And free wi-fi!!!!!!!! Being in Orlando you probably won't spend much time at the Hotel but i found myself wanting to stay rather than going on days out. The pool area was amazing, I spent hours on the lazy river which was fab and looked beautiful at night as it was all lite up. The food and drink at the poolside bar exceeded expectations (normally bar food is nothing special) They did great pizzas and cocktails. I would most definitely stay at this Hotel again!!! I am already planning my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top!”
Reviews.Author: barbsab88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times and have yet to be disappointed with anything. The lazy river is really enjoyable and there were a few hot tubs to chose from, which my boyfriend and I really enjoyed - come the quiet night time it seemed each couple had their own to privately enjoy. This hilton has a few neat extras that others do not - The fire pits and basketball courts were a really cool surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for disney and universal”
Reviews.Author: PMCNorthville_MI
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 night stay. Very nice place and between disney and universal. Let us visit both. Pool is very nice with good drink service. Only bad things were parking and traffic on I drive. Convention going on and events at the hotel made it busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Disney and International Drive”
Reviews.Author: ASyed
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 5 year old over Easter and had a lovely time. Reception was great and thanks to Stephen for arranging a cake and card to celebrate my sons birthday- all off his own back. Pros: location Cons: No complimentary transport to Disney. But public transport is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: just-facts-here
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful, friendly and accomodating. Location is a $7.50 cab ride to Seaworld. Disney is quite a bit further. By the way they do have a complimentary shuttle to Seaworld which you need to book in advance or else get stuck with the cab ride which isn't so bad. The lazy river is a huge plus. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the room was very clean. Quite expensive if you are a family of four though. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. Maria made eggs to order and started your day with a smile, she was so charming and kind. Had dinner for 2 at Davids Club, my ten year old son and I, cost around US$75, no alcohol, just dinner and dessert.The food was great, the service even better. We had a waitress named Jaztony, she was a gem, charming and made us feel very comfortable, went out of her way to please. The big plus was probably that they had Starbucks coffee at the Marketplace. Was able to get my daily dose of caffeine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort---so much more than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Sara B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our children (ages 6 and 9) here after disembarking a fabulous Disney Cruise. Leaving the ship is never a good feeling and I had low expectations that any hotel was going to measure up to the great week we had just had. I was wrong. We LOVED this resort hotel! The room was spacious, modern, clean, and quiet. The front desk staff was kind and helpful. We stopped for breakfast at the quick service shop for yogurt parfaits and baked goods and it was good quality food and the prices were reasonable. The pool area is gorgeous...plenty of towels and lounge chairs, live music, zero entry pool, lazy river, good food and cold beer. What more can you ask for?? We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “So sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler5700
Reviews.Content: What a stay!!! Close to everything but away from the madness. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hilton honors member get great perks ...so join before you go. Continental breakfast (when crowded they opened the resraurant for a satelitte location) and then drinks and appetizers at night (but crowded). We all loved pool. We didn't have time but they have a putting course and ball courts. We had s'mores at the fire pits. Everything we needed they had and it was near an outdoor mall full of fantastic restaurants. We had a quick drive to any park we wanted. We will be back again!! Our 3 kids wished we lived there...

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen T
Reviews.Content: It is beautiful! Such a great pool area with hot tub and lazy river! The staff is so nice. The rooms are clean,comfortable and classy! I went for a long weekend with my family and we had a great time. The Tropics restaurant by the pool had delicious food! Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pidcack
Reviews.Content: The pictures don't do it justice. There are basketball and tennis courts, executive putting greens, and an adult "quiet pool" in addition to the fun pool with water slide and basketball. Also, included pool tables and foose ball tables. The pool tables are well used. The only thing missing was a ping pong table.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, families, or pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: bschiavoni
Reviews.Content: I find myself traveling to Orlando about every 4-6 weeks for work, and always stay here now. After trying several different hotels in the area, including some that are rated 5-star (i.e., J.W. Marriott Grande Lakes), I found this one to be the most consistently nice. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well-furnished, the spa is superb, and the lazy river is great for kids and adults alike. And if you order room service, get the salad with strawberries. I do not usually like salads, but this one is DELICIOUS!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RELAXATION”
Reviews.Author: msumoore
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at this property for the National Plastics Expo that took place in the attached Orlando Convention Center. I didn't want to leave the property! It was so relaxing, the property has 3 outdoor pools, 2 hot tubs, 3 basketball courts, 6 putting greens, a 1/4 mile jogging track, a tennis court, and 2 gas fire places. There is music playing around the pool and fire pit areas all day. The service was outstanding at the outdoor pool bar/restaurant, as well as in Spencer's restaurant, and David's club. The rooms looked brand new because of Hilton's commitment to continuous upkeep. My closet interior paint had just been touched up when I arrived, unfortunately, I had already hung up my clothes in the closet before Lillian (a maintenance tech) nocked on my door to tell me to be careful of the fresh paint in our closet. Lillian took it on herself to turn my bad situation into an opportunity for Hilton's service to shine. Lillian called down to houskeeping and had my shirt dry cleaned at no charge, and it was back in my room the next morning. Although the Hilton was at the top of my price range, I plan to go back with my family someday soon, so that they too can experience the relaxation and service that I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: linzif
Reviews.Content: Great location, good big rooms and all I now expect from billion. Worth getting on the Hilton honours reward programme as free wifi and breakfast costs would've added up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: leahleah311
Reviews.Content: Stopped in on a quick business trip at this hotel. Excellent meeting facilities, great open space wtih a very modern feel. You didn't get a sense that you were in Orlando (lots of kids running around with tourist-type parents) at this facility. Top notch dining options and good service.

Reviews.Title: “great convention center hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: JMH_10
Reviews.Content: While I haven't stayed at any competing hotels around the convention center, I see no reason to try anywhere else. Room was spacious, comfortable, and entire hotel was spotless (even in corners). Staff was hospitable with even security and parking lot attendants providing helpful suggestions/directions. Check-in was not seemless but mistakes were promptly fixed. Using Disney's resorts as a benchmark, the Orlando Hilton is a luxury hotel with fixtures/decor and cleanliness that is comparable to the Grand Floridian and hospitality that's good but not exceptional. Positives: Great pool with separate areas for a lazy river, slide, water basketball, zero-depth entry and a quiet pool. Despite the size of the hotel, the pool area was not overly crowded but there was a short wait for towels. The hotel has a quarter mile jogging trail, putting golf course, basketball court, ping pong and fooze ball tables. Negatives: Although Disney and Universal Studios are fairly close, alternatives are more convenient. Charge for self-parking

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: salliejanep
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff is completely accomodating and friendly. The rooms were large and comfortable. The pool is amazing with plenty of places to sit. You can eat and drink poolside. The food is average. I found the alcholic drinks to be expensive, $11, but they were good. The hotel is next to a conference center, so there is no shopping and few restaurants within walking distance. I bought a package online that included free breakfast, snacks/bar and dessert. Fabulous! I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “To quote lil Jon, "WHAT? & YEAH!"”
Reviews.Author: Fritz1weaver1
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Service was outstanding from the time my wife and I arrived. Definitely worth the $ and we will return. Spencer's was out of this world, food, service, and atmosphere were just right. Would have paid more if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for serious relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: sschroeder
Reviews.Content: My family and I just enjoyed our 3ed visit to this wonderful resort/hotel. As frequent visitors to the Orlando parks we find that the hotels location is ideal. The property is minutes from Sea World and the International Drive attractions. Located just 1 mile from I-4 it is 5 minutes to either Disney or Universal studios. It is also a few blocks from the B-Line, if traveling from the airport (MCO). The super convenient parking garage is situated a few feet from the front desk. Check-in is very fast and professional. This hotel is also attached to the Orlando convention Center and also offers great conference facilities. The rooms are very large with great bedding, a fantastic flat-screen TV, and upscale bath amenities. We also love the pool for its lazy river and the zero-entry swimming area. The executive golf course is also enjoyable. We have dined at all of the dining venues offered by the Hilton. The sports bar is great as well as the coffee shop and pool-side bar. The surprise for my family was how good their steak and chop house is. Spencer’s is located off the main lobby for dinner. We dined here this past Saturday and the food and service were astronomical. We enjoyed excellent salads, dry-aged beef and lamb, and desserts. The price was about $160 for two but it was worth it! I highly recommend the Hilton Orlando for your next trip to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I have been to”
Reviews.Author: 16weekayeartraveler
Reviews.Content: My visit to this Hilton was a mix of business and family time. I was to attend a convention at the Orange County Convention Center, which is connected by a covered walkway, this was real nice. Let me comment on Matt, one of the valet guys. He was very helpful without being a pain and appearing to look for a tip. These guys on the car line know how to get cars in and out, keep the lanes clear all the while being polite and personable. A tough combination. Being a HiltonHonors Diamond Member, they upgraded our room. Noting fancey, but very nice and clean, all the things you look for. Mini fridge, safe, newspaper, lots of pillows and towels a robe, access to the executive floor for snacks and breakfast, super nice folks every where we turned. While ol' Pop was at work my wife and daughter went to the pool (I snuck down there after the convention) and man what a pool it is. Wonderful chairs, tons of towels, the pools, water slides and lazy river are worth coming to this hotel all in it's self. They had a great wait staff to fetch a drink or food for us. Just over the top is the only way to discribe this pool. All is all, this is a great hotel. We are going back later in the year to spend time at Disney, we have cancelled our rooms at WDW and will stay at this hotel, that is how much we liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation!”
Reviews.Author: Shatara R
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel that I always enjoy coming to. We spent the last weekend of Spring Break here just to get away without getting away. This pool is probably the best pool of all the major resort pools in Orlando. You can easily spend an entire day out there enjoying the lazy river and awesome water slide. The breakfast buffet at Harvest has a very nice spread (although a little pricey $22 for adults). I love the accessibility of the hotel lobby from the parking garage (unlike Hilton Bonnet Creek). The hotel also has a great location on International Drive right next to the 528 expressway. If the weather is nice out, Pointe Orlando is a nice walk to get dinner or drinks. Plus it's fun to take the pedicabs back at the end of the night. The rooms are average sized, but the bedding is very soft. The bathroom is on the average to smaller size. This hotel leaves just a tad bit to be desired being a 4 star hotel. Unlike the JW Marriott, there are no robes, no turn down service, and no separate shower and tub. However, I would have to come back here for the pool!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it --> Work/Play/Relax”
Reviews.Author: 247HardWorker
Reviews.Content: I loved my little get away at this hotel. My son came up to see me and we did not have to leave the resort. We stayed by the pool both days and enjoyed the lazy river and the water slide. I was upgraded to a "Pure Room" (at least I think thats what it is called.) It was nice. Easy breathing thats for sure. I am not going to try to explain all the benefits of the allergy free room. The lady at the front desk explained it but my mind was about getting to the pool so I did not pay too much attention. Here is a link though if anyone is interested. http://hhonors1.hilton.com/en_US/hh/landing/hww_pure/index.do Anyways . I truly loved it here. I could eat, go to the spa, hang by the pool where kids were fully entertained and enjoy my son without leaving the property and that was my goal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: What a Beautiful Resort! Rooms were average, but the resort itself was fantastic! The lobby is gorgeous, the kids had a blast in the pool. Lazy river was a huge hit, as was the slide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: huskylove
Reviews.Content: Loved the pools, waterslide, lazy river! Kids would've spent all day in the pool area. Restaurants & bar pricey but Orlando seems to be that way across the board... Would recommend! beds were super comfy with LOTS of pillows which we love Oh & our rate was great because did it via priceline - otherwise I bet the rates are high..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: amisrn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Hilton Orlando at the end of our trip. We booked a deal that included 4 tickets to SeaWorld. The price was quite reasonable considering that the SeaWorld tickets are fairly expensive themselves. The hotel gives you the option of valet or self-parking. Either way there is a charge, about $13 per day for self-parking and $25 per day for valet. We opted for self-paking, which was conveniently located at the rear of the hotel and the top tier of the garage is the level of the lobby. Check in was smooth and the reception staff was friendly. Our room was immediately available. The room was nice. We had 2 queen beds and there was adequate room for all 4 of us. Our room had a view of Aquatica park. The hotel is very close to all of the major Orlando attractions and they offer shuttle service. However, we decided to drive to Sea World because the shuttle space is limited and the times were not convenient for our itinerary. The hotel pool area is spacious and lush. It did not seem crowded even with the amount of people there. The Quiet pool area was closed for a private party, but with our 2 children we stayed in the family pool anyway, Our 6 year old enjoyed the slide. There is also a water basketball court, water sprayers, two zero-depth entry areas, and a lazy river. Only staying one night, we didn't have a chance to check out the other amenities, but everything seemed very nice. The halls were quiet and the beds were comfortable so we got a good night's rest. The bathroom had a double sink and spacious shower. The hotel hosts many conferences, so I could see it getting a bit crowded at times, but it was fine while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Clean Hotel, Great for Travel with Family”
Reviews.Author: shashahing
Reviews.Content: I spent the week at a conference during March 2012...the hotel is very nice and clean...very friendly staff. I ate lunch at the Bistro down stairs near the pool, it has indoor or out door dining. Several other dining options available. The pool has a large lazy river, big slide, and lots of space for the kids to play. Business hotel with lots of family options...all around great place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay at”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler2011
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing! Beautiful every turn you take. A pool that rivals a water park, staff that are on their toes to take care of every need, and conference rooms that provide for a pleasurable business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HighwayTraveler72
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the Hilton Orlando. Excellent Pool area. Clean room. Got a great deal on this hotel-even with the parking fee. Perfect if your going to Sea World. It was a great base for our trip. Didnt eat at the hotel but very close to Ihop,Red Lobster,Denny's & Mcdonalds. Close to 2 Walgreen's too. The best place we ate in the area was NYPD Pizza. Great Pizza & well priced. Its Next to the Publix grocery store. (take a left out of the self parking exit then a right at the next road and go about a mile or so-on right). Only bad spot of the stay(which isnt the worst thing ever but a bit disappointing). Waterslide was shutdown early 2 nights of our stay even though sign by slide states its open til 9PM everyday. Overall Great Stay!!! Would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and amenities, excellent convention facilities; maid service only deficiency with daily room redo

Reviews.Title: “Please get better restaurants and keep rowdy crowds under control past 10 p.m.”
Reviews.Author: downtownresident
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. Nice, comfortable rooms. Great beds and pillows. I like the refrigerator. In fact I find the refrigerator a necessity because the hotel food is awful (there's a grocery about 5 minutes away), but I'll get to that later. I am here for work, a 4-day conference that starts each day at 8:30 a.m. For some reason a group of people decided to party where there is a waiting area for cabs and valet and they did this with a cooler full of drinks until well past midnight yesterday. My room was close enough that it was a bother and security apparently was not effective enough to bring them under control after I called at about 10:30 p.m. I had to change rooms because of this and it took at least an hour, putting me in my new room at about 12:15 p.m. So that's one gripe. The hotel shouldn't have a lounge area in that spot or management should make sure people just sit there to wait for a cab or wait for someone to park, not to hang out and party all night. My other problem is with The Marketplace and the food in general. The Marketplace runs out of fruit and salads. The restaurants in the hotel do not serve healthy food. I'm not a vegetarian, but I like vegetables and healthy food, especially while I have to work and travel. There's not a single healthy vegetarian dish on any menu in any of the restaurants. The Bistro, which purports to be healthy and local, is horrible. I had a spinach salad that was partially rotten and topped with grilled chicken that must have been a week old because the top of it was all discolored and crusty - not to mention cold. I returned the salad only to have it replaced with a slightly less disgusting version of the same. I was not charged, but still endured eating it since I was in a hurry. David's is OK. The ahi tuna tacos were tasty and the Cesar salad was edible, but not very good (too much dressing and they give you half a romaine head that you have to cut yourself, making it difficult to keep from smearing the dressing everywhere). Everything else on the menu did not seem healthy, except maybe the mussels, minus the fries. Spencer's was also just OK and ridiculously overpriced. I had diver scallops, and while the scallops themselves were pretty good, the cauliflower-cheddar puree with pesto was so salty that it overwhelmed the scallop and masked the flavor of the pesto. It tasted like mashed potatoes that were too salty and too runny - no flavor of cheddar, no flavor of cauliflower - just salt. Plus, I got three medium-sized sea scallops, just a tad larger than a quarter in diameter, for $27.50. If it was fantastic, fine, but that's a bit of a rip-off for a mediocre meal. Further, it seems like these restaurants (especially The Bistro) are advertising that they feature local treats. I saw nothing of the sort. On a positive note, service was good at all places (except maybe Spencer's since I was never asked whether I liked the meal).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Love this place....Hilton Bonnett Creek is a close second but this pool is a little better...love how the lazy river is separate and the pool bar n grill has great food...loved the bbq chicken pizza and strawberry pina coladas...the rooms are beautiful, bed comfy and they will do a courtesy extend on the checkout time to 1 pm if you ask....also very close to InternationalDrive which has tons of restaurants, shops, activities and a great outlet mall at the end of I drive...my new favorite hotel in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: SDS112384
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought our 2 year old to stay here for a weekend get a way. The hotel is great for families and located in the middle of everything! Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were cleaned well. Would recommend this hotel for any family. Pools were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business, too”
Reviews.Author: CapeCod64
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of reviews here from vacationers. I spent a week here on business recently, and found it an exceptional business hotel. Great business center (UPS operated), quick walk to the Convention Center and overall an excellent layout for conferences. Banquet food was excellent (as a meeting planner, I see plenty of mediocre banquet food). Spencer's Restaurant is a highlight. I do not typically dine in hotel restaurants with clients, but Spencer's came so highly recommended... we went ahead. Most definitely one of the best meals I've ever had. I highly recommend the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Yet”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: Easily the best Hilton I have stayed in. I am Diamond Elite level so I have seen a few. Really clean, comfortable and new. I didnt use it but the resort pool looks excellent and would be brilliant for families. The biggest highlight was Spencers Restaurant, it was amazing! I usually go out of my way to avoid hotel restaurants. Don't make the same mistake I nearly did.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Relaxing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Potosi24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights/4 days and had a lovely time at the hotel. The staff is incredibly nice and very service oriented. The place is immaculate. The relaxing pool really was relaxing and the spa peaceful and calming with a generous and friendly staff. Whenever we are in Orlando, we plan to stay at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: familyzoo
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 ( 2 teenage girls) stayed at the Hilton Orlando for 2 nights. The service was wonderful and the pool area was fantastic! Loved the lazy river, slide, and pools.The room was stylish yet comfortable- will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan E
Reviews.Content: Had the worst Hotel Experience ever. We paid for a Pool view and Romance package and what we received was completely different. The kid checking us in actually had no clue what the romance package consisted of and just handed us an envelope and said here you go. Complete disrespect. Would advise anyone interested in staying here to not get the romance package and consider a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jrk011
Reviews.Content: The hotel deserves the good reviews that can be found on tripadvisor.com. Yes, it does charge for parking ($13 per night) and yes, it does charge for internet access (didn't try). But so do most other Hilton hotels and having stayed in several of those in other US cities I can easily claim the Hilton Orlando to be the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in middle of soulless wasteland”
Reviews.Author: cal_traveler2
Reviews.Content: Attending a convention I stayed at the Orlando Hilton. The hotel itself is very nice. The room was well sized, and well apportioned. Mine was nice a quiet, which I always appreciate. The pool area was great, although being at a conference, I didn't have much time to enjoy it. The biggest drawback is that while the Hilton is a nice, self contained island, it is that - an island. There is nothing to walk to (except the convention center - whoo-hoo!), so if you want to eat anywhere except the hotel restaurants you have to drive, take a taxi or walk about a mile. I guess that's pretty typical for this area though. The Starbucks in the lobby is great, and the steak house was also nice, but who wants do that every day? I also can't get over the trend that the more you pay for a hotel, the less you get. Internet was a charge, as expected - but to charge for internet even in the business center?!? Come on guys, catch up to the Super 8 and provide free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: 47Driver
Reviews.Content: A while ago I wrote a review on a Hilton being an example of the law of diminishing returns as price is concerned. While I believe this law is still in effect, the Hilton Orlando does it's best to destroy it. For starters, you have to pay for internet. This fact continues to befuddle me. McDonald's has free internet, but a room at almost $600 a night you'd think something as easy as internet would be included. After all, the electricity is included, and today internet is getting as important as electricity! However, this trip was as a family vacation, and I promised at least the first three days of internet free me. We upgraded our room, and didn't know what to expect of the upgrade request. The suite was better than the suites I'd gotten used to while staying at the Hotel Inter-Continental in Central America. I'd say it was close to 800 square feet. Being on the 9th floor, I was expecting the water pressure to be lacking, and was presently surprised.We had two bathrooms, a living room, dinning room with big dinning table, office area, refrigerator, great coffee pots, and two queen beds. This was a nice upgrade from the two queen room we reserved (get your Hilton Honors Card!). Some folks have discussed having to pay for parking, but I swiped my room key card, and didn't pay for parking. We didn't stay at this hotel as a jump off to any theme parks. I'm not a big fan of theme parks. We did just want to hang out and relax as we got over jet lag. This hotel is perfect for just hanging out and relaxing. The gym is huge (if this fits under relaxation!), the spa is pricey but available, the fire pit was great to roast marshmallows, the lazy river was great to lounge in on a tube, the pool is more of a water park than a pool, the quiet pool is nice for those who don't appreciate kids and the water slide was impressive even for this big kid. Anytime you order a drink from the pool side bar, it will be expensive...so just expect it. We spent two whole days just at the pool. Very relaxing. It was close to great restaurants, all the amusement parks, and shopping. This said, I would never stay at this hotel as a launch point for parks. I would rather stay on the Disney campus for the Disney thing and drive from there for the other parks. If you are looking for a relaxing few days outside of theme park entertainment, business trips, conferences or things like this; the Hilton Orlando is it. We loved our time at this hotel. We will remember it with fondness for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed here longer!”
Reviews.Author: Sara R
Reviews.Content: Our Atlantic Beach weekend crashed and burned (see One Ocean Resort review) so we decided to stay at the Hilton Orlando for our remaining night in the Florida area. What a great choice! We wish we had stayed here from the beginning. We arrived around 10am (check in is at 4pm) and expected to have to wait for a room, but instead, we were told that our room was indeed ready. We got to our room and were very pleased. It was bright, clean and spacious. We changed into our bathing suits and headed to the pool. What a joy! The lazy river was fantastic. We spent most of our time by the "quiet pool" and just relaxed. Since we had gotten there early in the afternoon, we were able to find 2 chaise lounges together. The room was quiet and we slept well. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service!”
Reviews.Author: Wonderfulworld2009
Reviews.Content: I am so glad we decided to stay in this Hotel. The service was outstanding! During our 7 day stay we were always greeted with a smile and all the staff were very attentive and helpful. Upon our check in they upgraded us to a very nice room at the executive floor. The room was very clean and with an amazing view facing the pool. Breakfast was included in our rate. It was delicious, you could either choose from the buffet or a la carte menu.The executive club was really nice and also served breakfast, however the breakfast in the main restaurant was better and had more choices. The property is very nice, the pool and lazy river are amazing. We went in december and still enjoyed! They have an adult only pool, which was great to relax and get away from the crowd. We rented a car , it is next to International drive but it is easier to rent a car if you are staying here. They do charge for the self - parking , however, it is a gated parking with security and close enough from the lobby so you don't have to walk a lot to get to your car. Overall it was an amazing experience and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel - Not Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ray H
Reviews.Content: My family and I travel to Orlando from New England a couple of times a year for vacation and have stayed at many different hotels. This hotel is not bad, and I am sure great for business travel, but in our experience there are much better places to stay for a family vacation. Here is how we break down where to stay and how this Hilton stacks up using a 1-10 scale with 1 being the lowest. LOCATION (4) Good location for Universal Studios (though if you actually stay at a Universal hotel you get into the park an hour earlier than everyone else) as you can drive the back way and stay off of I-4. This took us 15 minutes. Great location for Sea World/Discovery Cove as you can almost walk there. Bad location for all of Disney World. While technically only a short distance from Disney by car you have to take I-4 and it is always (even at night) bumper to bumper and difficult to navigate and determine the proper lane for your exit once you figure out which one to take. I regularly drive in Manhattan which is easy compared to I-4. We eventually decided to just get off of at the first Disney exit and then navigate through their road system as it was less hectic. No matter what park you are going to it is going to be a half hour due to traffic and that can make an early morning even earlier which does not lend itself to a relaxing start to your day. If you plan on spending more than one day at Disney World this hotel is not the best choice. There are many other non-Disney hotels much closer. HYATT REGENCY, HILTON BONNET CREEK AND BUENA VISTA PALACE ARE ALL BETTER OPTIONS. POOL (7) The pool is important to us because both my son and wife love to swim. The Hilton pool is a very nice medium to large pool with a water slide, good size lazy river and a hot tub. I would have given it a better rating but for two issues. 1 - It could have been a bit warmer as it was somewhat cool at times even though it was in the low 80's during our visit. 2- (and this is the biggest reason for a lower rating) SMOKING EVERYWHERE. While the pool was often almost empty when we were using it the seating areas around the pool and poolside bar were full of people traveling on business many of them smoking and surprisingly a good deal of cigar smoking. At other hotels we have stayed at there has been smoking sections by the pool so it is easy to position yourself away from it if you desire. At the Hilton there are not restrictions so you can not avoid the smell of cigarettes and cigars. We even had to get out of the lazy river because three men were floating around on tubes smoking big cigars. THE SWAN & DOLPHIN AND THE HYATT REGENCY HAVE BETTER POOLS FOOD (2) We did not eat at the resort as the prices were much higher than any other place we have stayed. My wife travels three months out of the year on business and she commented that this is often the case with hotels that cater to business travelers because they are using expense accounts instead of their own money. There are some okay places nearby but if you don't want to eat at Denny's or the like you have to get in your car and drive somewhere. ALL OF THE ABOVE HOTELS HAVE BETTER AND ARE NEAR BETTER FOOD. IF YOU STAY NEAR DISNEY'S BOARDWALK THERE ARE GREAT RESTAURANTS THERE. VACATION FEEL (1) When we travel on vacation we like to feel like we are on vacation. Unfortunately (for family vacationers) this hotel's connection to the convention center and airport fill it with business travelers. We rarely saw other families. The hotel itself is clean, you can park fairly close to the lobby and the elevator to the pool lets you bypass common areas and just step outside to the pool but the view from the hotel is of parking lots, garages and other buildings. Not much greenery or landscaping except by the pool. All in all it is a bit sterile and most of the people we talked with were on the elevator in business attire and weary of traveling. This hotel is not designed with kids in mind. ANY DISNEY HOTEL EVEN THE LOW BUDGET ONES HAVE A BETTER VACATION FEEL AS DO THE HOTELS NEAR DOWNTOWN DISNEY. RESERVATIONS & HOUSEKEEPING (1) We reserved a room with a king size bed and our reservation confirmed it's availability. We called two days before we arrived and were again told yes we have a room with a king size bed. When we checked in we were told they only had a room with two queens. We pointed out that we were staying for eight days but they said there was nothing they could do. I have an allergy to down. Everything in the room was down (pillows and comforters). We asked to have some non-down items brought to the room. They brought pillows and some very thin blankets but only enough for one of the beds and then never returned. They do have hypoallergenic rooms so they must have other comforters but we were told they did not. I don't care that much about housekeeping as I can make my own bed but if I did they would not have scored well as it was sporadic and on one occasion they took the thin blankets off of the bed and put them in the closet leaving the bed with only sheets. THIS REMINDED ME OF THE OLD DAYS OF CAR RENTALS WHERE YOU WOULD RESERVE A CAR AND THEN THEY WOULD SAY THEY RAN OUT. HOTELS NEED TO JOIN THE REST OF US IN THIS CENTURY. OVERALL (4) It never really felt like we were on vacation when we were at the Hilton for all of the reasons I have stated above. The hotel is clean. The staff we dealt with were friendly but we always felt like we were almost where we wanted to be but stopped just shy of it. I often found myself walking in a hallway surround by business suits while I was in my swim gear and felt like I was skipping school. They charge for parking and internet. Do not be fooled we have stayed at plenty of hotels in Orlando that do not charge for these things so shop around. I would say this is a good hotel for business but not a good choice for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sneakurs55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, it was a little hometown vacation. The hotel is beautifully decorated, has an awesome pool, spas, lazy river and two fire pits. Everyone at the hotel was very accommodating. We didn't eat in the hotels restaurants, they seemed pricey for what they offered. Being locals we ate at another hotels restaurant that we knew and loved there food, Napa Restaurant in the Peabody is just down the road and is excellent! Our room was very comfortable and it had a small frig which was concealed in the dresser. This is a hotel that we would look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: FREQNTTRVLER
Reviews.Content: Management of this property is dedicated to paying attention to all the little details to make your stay a memory of lifetime. During our stay our little girl fell ill with a fever and vomitting and needed a down day of rest and quiet. The hotel accomodated our request for a larger suite as we were in a standard double bedded room in order to provide the privacy of a seperate bedroom. Not only did they assist us with our move, the Manager on Duty insisted on sending up a complimentary care package of assorted juices and fresh chicken noodle soup. The room service personnel checked in to see if there was anything else they could offer to make her more comfortable.This attention to detail is truly appreciated and puts this property at the top of my list of all time favourite hotels. The onsite ammenities make this a resort all by itself. We hope to visit again soon. Thanks again to the team at Hilton Orlando for the caring special touches to make our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Pool area is impressive! Solid 4-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melwyjak
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here even after the reservation snafu I wrote about earlier. It turns out that the Hilton was not as bad as Loews hotel at Universal who held onto over $440 for over two weeks after we cancelled (well w/in given timeframe)! I had to contact executive office or I’d probably still be waiting. Again – my advice is not to use debit card. PROS: We had a great stay. The pool area is impressive. We had the place to ourselves so I imagine it’s chaotic during peak season (occupancy was around 25%). The lazy river was fun (be warned, your hair will get wet!). No charge for tubes. Fun slide for big kids. There is quiet pool, fire pits and cabanas available for rental. And a basketball court. I was happy to send my husband and kids to Universal and hang out at the pool all day. It was nice to have the pool to ourselves but pool bar closed early and only had wait service on w/e. TIP – they do unlimited soda refills and will bring a pitcher so you don’t run out. We had a Parlor suite which has one big room w/ attached 2-queen guest room. This is ideal for family of 4 or larger or anyone wanting to spread out. The closets and bathrooms (1 sink, shower/tub combos) are tiny so we were happy to have two of each. The suite room had full-size couch/sleeper, 52-inch HDTV, desk, two easy chairs and a large dining table. Suite had small frig, no frig in regular room. No robes in room but they’ll provide upon request. Ate twice at David’s – very good food and service. The mussels and Wagyu burgers were yummy and if you like a Reuben, try the pork belly Reuben. CONS: No major complaints. It is a giant hotel that caters to business/convention travelers so don’t expect personalized service. I mentioned it was my husband’s birthday and not a peep. Son became violently ill one night and the room was not cleaned until after 5 pm next day when they knew we had to strip linens and use most of the towels to clean up. No follow up from staff.
