Housekeeping will not change your sheets unless you remember to put a card on your pillow. The same goes for towels – have to put on floor or they won’t change out. Easy self-parking ($) back side of hotel but they wouldn’t let us use their luggage carts so we had to carry everything in ourselves. The breakfast buffet was average – no cook-to-order stations. They said the lack of fresh items was due to low occupancy. We go to Orlando twice a year and will likely stay here again for pool area, location, food quality and comfort of suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: PSLtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night, but we enjoyed the pool/spa, lazy river, and fire pits. Enjoyed a HUGE mojito pitcher from the pool bar, even though it was cloudy and a bit chilly during our stay. Loved the mix your own trail mix counter inside the sundry/snack shop. We experienced great customer service and overall had a wonderful stay. Very convenient to all the action on I-drive, as well as SR 528.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I was here for 2 nights, and as a Hilton Diamond member I didn't want to leave. The hotel is in prime location for all of the excitement on International Drive (the strip) in Orlando. The restaurant food was excellent and service in all area was great! I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, grounds, and gym!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie P
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; beautiful landscaping. The grounds and pool facilities are the best part of the hotel. I loved the gym and outdoor jogging track, as well as the fire pits located out by the pool. It’s a great place to read or have a drink. I had a room right off the elevator and was expecting to hear lots of noise but I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was considering the hotel was very busy for NBA All-Star Weekend. Overall, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The only negative were the wait times for room service. I waited 45 minutes or longer each time for room service when I was ordering a burger or chicken dish. I asked the room service attendant on the phone when ordering if she could leave the burger in my room so I could take a quick swim and shower before I ate having worked all day. She impatiently said no I had to be in the room when they came or I would not be served, I was a little put off by this but I waited an hour for my burger.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool!”
Reviews.Author: Missmolly27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to get away. We decided to stay here for the convince of Idrive. Luckily the weather was amazing and we got to enjoy the pool. We had a server named yana at first and she just wasn't very pleasant so the next time we went to the pool we were a little weary but we had Katie serve us. She was a blast. Recommended the Caribbean colada which I though was delicious!! We decided to hang out there because of her. She also recommended some local stuff for us to enjoy. Katie told us about their sports bar David's which my boyfriend and I are really into. The food was awesome. My boyfriend had the pub burger and was in love. I ordered the pig wing which Jory recommended. Over all our stay was delightful. I would definitely recommend it to my friends and go back to visit just because of Katie at tropics. Without her saving grace we would've never returned.

Reviews.Title: “very nice convention hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa J
Reviews.Content: I want to personally give a 5 stars service to Cinthya and Dung from the executive lounge and Josh from the marketplace. They go out of their ways to help me with smiles on their faces. On the other hand, Nicky from the executive lounge CAN'T STOP TEXTING and she's just too focused with one particular guest. I meant we pretty much pay the same rate to be there so why does she treat us different from other guests??? I would definitely be back to this hotel because of the outstanding services that your employees provided. Thank you Hilton Orlando staff and can't wait to be back here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for convention center”
Reviews.Author: ks-bike-rider
Reviews.Content: This seems like a relatively new property. It was immaculate throughout. The staff worked very hard to keep our meeting running flawlessly and even accommodated a number of requests and changes over our stay. Being that I am only a HH tinfoil level member, I was awarded a room immediately above the front drive. Surprisingly, it was as quiet as could be. None of the traffic could even be heard throughout the night, as there was a big party in town.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience- wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sle3364
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I stayed at the Hilton Orlando for a four night stay in conjunction with a conference my husband was attending. I called with a few questions and Joanne in the general manager's office was so helpful!! When we checked in (the process was painless due to the exceptional help of Josh K.) we found out that we had been upgraded to a suite. It made the stay so enjoyable! The rooms were great- we had a king bedroom and a livingroom (which my daughter used as her bedroom with a rollaway). We were on a low floor with no view but that was the price to pay for the extra room (so worth it to get two bathrooms)! The executive lounge is a great deal- we ended up having the provided snacks as our dinner several evenings! We enjoyed the pool- lots of towels, chairs and umbrellas. My daughter and husband floated down the lazy river and even used the slide! My husband used the gym several times and said it was very well-equipped. The most important component was the exceptional staff. We travel quite a bit and stay in many hotels--- the staff here was truly exceptional- very helpful and always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Off DisneyProperty”
Reviews.Author: Dmc56
Reviews.Content: Great location, right across from Downtown Disney! The hotel needs updating! I stayed in a suite on the 9th floor, it was noisy, paint was peeling from the ceiling in the bathroom, the walls were dirty, and my room was cleaned once during my 3 night stay. On my next visit to Disney World, I will not be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Mainenh
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Great, friendly service, amazing pool and lazy river! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Just for the Location”
Reviews.Author: janwholeboxndice
Reviews.Content: Maybe I spend to much time in Asia were the service is spectacular but this hotel just does not cut it in the area. The location is great if you are going to the exhibition centre , which I was. The rooms are a good size. Being a HH member this allows me access o the club and that is a joke. I guess my real issue with this hotel is the lack of food outlets ( considering if you do not have a car the hotel is isolated ) and then the lack of service within. After walking out of the main and only restaurant basically open at night ( I (female ) was left waiting on my own for 15 mins ) I decided to order room service and that wait was an hour. This hotel caters to the conference groups but in no way is it set up for such. I continue to stay due to the location but wish there was something else better within walking distance. Pity as not a reflection of the Hilton Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel as it was attached by a walk way to the Orange County Convention Center the location was great - the service was better. The 5 days we stayed here were very pleasant.Room Service was lovely and the restaurants we ate at were very good.We thought the grounds were awsome. The firepits were fun at night and the lazy river a nice touch.Appreciated the quiet adult pool. The rooms were nice, clean and always sleep well in the comfy signature beds- not special however certianly modern and super clean. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Close to the freeway a short drive to all major attractions and shopping. Walk to some restaraunts

Reviews.Title: “Great property!”
Reviews.Author: djkief21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during NBA's All-Star weekend. Connected to the Orange County Convention Center, which was convenient for all the events. Rooms were nothing spectacular (comfortable but not overly luxurious), but the pool area was great, nice large weight room, basketball court, and friendly staff. Close proximity to the theme parks as well, and about 25 minutes to downtown Orlando. Also close to the outlet malls, which were about 5 minutes away. Good location and nice hotel to stay at for a trip to Orlando. One downfall was the erratic maid service - one day they didn't clean my room at all, and the next day they came by at 8:45am and woke me up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glu2012
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very clean, friendly staff, the beds are awsome, the room service although expensive is very good. The only negative point was the water pressure on the shower, very poor for a hotel like that. Loved all the restaurants onsite and there's also a starbucks in the hotel. Couldn't ask for more, I'll definitely recommend and stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “100% Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: jdybnsn
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at this hotel in February at the start of our holiday, and having stayed at various upscale hotels in Orlando in the past, now rank this one amongst the best we have ever experienced ! First big adavantage is its location - it so easy to find and get to from MCO airport and just a 15 min easy drive. You can't miss it from the Beachway ! Its a good central location too for all that Orlando has to offer., Second the rooms and facilities are superb - better than anything Disney resorts offer and the staff are just as nice !! Nothing is too much trouble, and they have a wonderful helpful/friendly attitude towards their guests - especially the front desk and the lady from the spa. We thoroughly enjoyed the fabulous pools/lazy river, the gym and the jacuzzi. My only (small) gripe would be, having to pay extra for the WiFi & pitch & put golf. We stayed in an executive room which I would 100% recommend due to its access to the executive lounge - well worth the additional expense, and significantly added to our overall enjoyment of the hotel. Only one word of warning if self parking - Just watch out for the concrete posts in the parking lot - my husband forgot he'd parked in front of one and drove into it as we left the hotel ! - so again, we were very glad we were so near to MCO, as we had to return to get the hire car replaced before continuing our journey ! As a point of interest, at the end of our holiday we made the mistake of trying the Hyatt Grand Cypress for two days - well, not a minute went by that I wished, and oh how I wished (!), we had returned to the Orlando Hilton instead !! I nearly cried at the difference in how we were treated in comparison to this place. Thank you Hilton - you are certainly getting it right for your guests here, and we will be recommending you to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and family”
Reviews.Author: icechick93
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled as a family to Orlando and stayed at this holel for a conference I was attending. As luck would have it for my 11 year old son, we were surprised to find out the Mega-Con conference was also being held the same weekend. Not only were the conference facilities perfect for me, my family was thrilled as well. We ate at David's Club restaurant several times and the food was great, as well as the service. The pool is amazing (as seen in the photos). The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I wish they had a small restaurant to sit to eat breakfast, although they do have a Starbuck's coffee shop with a small variety of items to purchase. I requested a handicapped accessible room. The shower was wheelchair accessible (good for those that can't step in and out of a tub easily), but the room was very narrow. I did not have my chair with me (used my cane), but the room was extremely narrow and would have been very difficult to navigate with a chair. I would have preferred a room with a view of the pool, but my son actually preferred the room facing the convention center and parking lot so he could see the people coming and going in their Mega-con costumes. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “simply... best hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pajosjunkbox
Reviews.Content: my wife, myself and our 11 year old son stayed at this hotel in mid february, for 5 nights. we got a really good deal. have been looking since, as we already are planning a return trip, but cannot seem to get as good a deal! Staff were very friendly, from the restaurant staff to security. Check-in was fairly quick, even though there was quite a crowd around when we arrived. Check out was even quicker, with an express type system... your bill is left under your door on your last night, and if you are satisfied, no need to call at the desk. we had buffet breakfast at the bistro included in our rate, which was top class. Gave us a great start to a long day at theme parks and such. Food was very tasty. We considered upgrading to allergyproof type rooms, but the regular rooms were so clean and fresh, I really couldn't see how they could be improved upon. Large tv with good selection of channels. Rooms were among the quietest in any hotel I have stayed in. Good bath and shower. Fridge was handy. The leisure facilities were perhaps our favourite part. Large pool and lazy river, which never seemed to be very busy. There was so much to do, we forgot to try out the slide. Poolside bar was nice too. Other things like fusball and pool tables, basketball, putting greens, tennis courts, all at no extra cost was cool too. If I had to try really hard and try and find fault, then prices for some things were a bit high, ie, $15 for 24h internet access, $10 for a sandwich at the marketplace shop, $15 for overnight parking, but I could allow for these considering my overall rate was so good. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wish every hotel was this nice”
Reviews.Author: SanCapTravel
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a last minute get-a-way with my wife and 3 yr old son to Orlando for a couple days. Scored a great deal at the Hilton. From the moment you arrive, you feel very welcome and the place in general is spotless! Great restaurant options, beautiful pool with slide, lazy river, hot tub, pool bar and other activities that we didn't have time to enjoy. The room was equally as nice with two very comfortable beds, great bathroom, flat panel TV and adequate fridge to keep drinks and small snacks cold. The parking fee and Wi-Fi fee is a bit much, but I am sure as most of the clientèle seemed to be business oriented and the hotel being a 4 star property, those added fees aren't noticed by too many. I would definitely recommend the property to anyone visiting the Orlando area that is looking for a truly first class experience!

Reviews.Title: “nice...could have been nicer...”
Reviews.Author: thomasannen
Reviews.Content: nice lobby..fast service...friendly desks and fast check in. 2 bars on main level. david's seemed understaffed at times and service was not always timely. had one really happy upbeat waitress that was excellent. bistro downstairs was very good for breakfast. you could also sit outside and eat near pool area but in shade. try to get there before 10 am as the pile of guests greatly increases. although bed and pillows were nice, i had a few cons - ice maker on 6th floor was broke and empty and looked like it had not worked for a long time. dirty glasses weren't replaced and 2 left and never came back. replenished coffee bar supplies did not happen. the remote did not work very well. i left note for maid to report and take care and it was never done. poolside bar did not open until 11 am and closed early, i think 7pm but could be wrong. i would get back from dinner and want to sit outside for a nightcap and fell the nice breeze and it was always closed. it was surprising as most everyone there is vacationing here in winter so they can sit out and enjoy. i also thought a couple of bottle waters in the fridge in the room isn't too much to ask for a $200 plus room. location is close to airport and international drive where good food and shopping never ends !!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsmlink
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for a trade show in February. It's in the same area as several other major hotels (Peabody, Rosen, etc.). The property is very well kept both inside and out. I stayed in a standard room with a king bed. The condition of the room was very good. The bath was well maintained and sparkling clean. The room had a standard desk setup with wireless internet available. One thing that was lacking was a fridge/mini bar, but no big deal. Overall, it was a nice, clean room with all the required amenities. I paid a special (show) rate for the room (about $250 per night), so I'm not sure what the regular rate would be; it's definitely worth at least what I paid for it and probably more.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: GhLez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend. This was our first visit to this really quite beautiful hotel and I am glad I chose it. We normally stay at the Hyatt but decided to try the Hilton based on Trip Advisor reviews. This trip to Disney World was a birthday treat for my daughter. First the room - We had a room on the Executive Floor with a pool view. Superb, well appointed rooms with the most divine beds and CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN!!!!! The bathroom was also quite clean and had plenty of towels – which one requires when traveling with a 5 year old. Housekeeping was good about keeping everything well stocked. The hotel should be proud of their housekeeping staff. The Hilton was a great place to relax and get away from it all after the hustle and bustle of Disney World each day. The breakfast and snacks in the Executive lounge were ok – I liked that they had plenty of fresh fruits and vegetables. Please consider adding hot breakfast menu items. My daughter’s favorite thing was the hot chocolate and s’mores at 7pm and off course the lazy river. Overall, the service was discrete but attentive and nothing was too much trouble. A superb place to stay! Recommendation: Consider giving cupcakes as a birthday treat for the little ones. My daughter got one everywhere we went and asked why the hotel didn’t get her one. You can rectify this oversight as we will be back in March for spring break! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This is what a Hilton is Supposed to Be!!!”
Reviews.Author: lpaulkelley
Reviews.Content: Wow! Where should I start? First, I'll start with pre-arrival. My family and I were early in arriving, so I called to see if I could check in early. Not a problem! Upon arrival, we were greeted with a friendly valet person and bell servicemen, both eager to please and very helpful! Even though we were checking in early and there was a lot of activity due to people checking out, the arrival experience was swift and pleasant. As a Hilton Honors Gold Member I was upgraded to an executive room floor and given access to the executive lounge. I was traveling with my family and was disappointed that a suite wasn't available, but that's okay. We got a room with two queen beds on the 18th floor, what a great view and very quiet! I highly recommend a high floor. In regards to amenities, there isn't much this hotel does NOT have. Restaurants, shops, a spa, a 3 ACRE HEATED POOL, a lazy river, two fire pit areas, poolside grill/bar, cabanas, basketball court, putting green...just astonishing! I could have spent my whole visit outside and been okay with it. The whole place seemed spotlessly clean, even considering its huge property and the volume of people. Man, this place was hoppin'! Our stay was on a Friday and Saturday, but it still seemed like a half/half mix of business travelers and families (maybe going to Disney?). The executive lounge was quite impressive with its spread of food/snacks/beverages. Actually, the only negative I have of the whole place was the lack of protein available in the lounge during breakfast (they had hard-boiled eggs, but I'm wary of eating those from a buffet). I can't stress how pleasant all of the staff members were. Everyone had a smile on the face was eager to please. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Orlando for any reason, business, pleasure, single or family.

Reviews.Title: “Service 2nd to none.”
Reviews.Author: travelhound14
Reviews.Content: I have visited this property for business a couple of times and each time I have always been treated like royalty. Great amenities, nice atmosphere... just great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay all around.”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Since I guess there wasn't a big convention, we got a decent rate, but I guess it can get a little expensive. The whole property is great. Rooms are well appointed. Amazing that once you turn on the hot water, it comes out! We've been to many places and the pool was one of best we've ever been to (especially for an 8 year old). This is a walk in pool, heated, and not too deep, so great for my son. Also had a cool water slide that my son did over and over and over. We also enjoyed the fact that hilton gold members get free access to the executive lounge that saved us big bucks on snacks, breakfast, etc. Perhaps the only cons for the hotel and charge for parking of $13, but it is very convenient. Also, if you are just going to the Disney parks, then it is more convenient to stay on a Disney property, but if you are planning to go to Universal and/or Sea World, then this is perfectly located. Overall, you can't go wrong if you pay the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: smk0523
Reviews.Content: I agree with the overall sentiment that this hotel is well situated and nicely appointed. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are comfortable and spacious. I didn't love that the hotel charged for many things I thought should be included with the base amount for a room reservation, like: parking, internet, and breakfast. I still recommend spending the additional money to book your room with breakfast, otherwise, you'll spend much more when you get there. The breakfast, although not included with our reservation, was very generous and offered great selection. The employee making omelettes happens to be the best I've seen. She services the station and cooks 5 omelettes at a time -- all while greeting each guest with a smile. Very much enjoyed the omelette she made all three mornings of my stay. In general, the staff was exceptionally friendly, helpful and courteous. My husband and I greatly appreciated all of their help in planning out our days. The location is approximately 20 minutes from Disney, so it's not a bad ride. The shuttle buses seemed to be few and far between though, so if you're staying here and planning to go to Disney, I suggest renting a car. Otherwise, stay at a closer hotel. Although I didn't use the pool area, it looked very nice. There's too much to do in Orlando to want to spend a day by the pool, in my opinion, but if you disagree, then this hotel definitely offers a lot of bang for your buck. The pool area is very similar to any resort area hotel with a much lower price tag for this hotel. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Spotlessly clean. Lovely pool complex.”
Reviews.Author: Stubbyfolks
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here. Room had two double beds, safe, TV, fridge etc. Was cleaned daily. Bed very comfortable. Quiet at night. Felt safe. Car parking quite expensive. Hotel restaurants pricey so we ate out- there are plenty of cheaper places to eat nearby (IHOP, Sizzler etc). Well -located for seeing Universal parks & Seaworld. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Good!”
Reviews.Author: tangotangocharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights here for a meeting. Very conference focused hotel. Got upgraded to Executive Floor - I have never seen so many kids in the Executive lounge but it was a weekend. Did not need to but internet or breakfast. Rooms are excellent and housekeeping was good. Laundry was reasonably priced and efficient. Concierge, bell boys etc very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “hilton hospitality”
Reviews.Author: findsthegoodspots
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors participant because of properties like this one. this was our first visit to this hotel and stayed there because of show at the convention. Everything was first class and the help very accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience from the Moment We Arrived!”
Reviews.Author: els_46
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Orlando with my twin 8 year-olds after reading many good reviews here. I have traveled quite a bit - for work and pleasure, with and without kids - and I have to say this was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The staff was amazingly helpful and generous with time and guidance and the hotel itself is beautiful and great fun. I was a bit worried because of the proximity to the convention center and some reviews which noted that the hotel wasn't really kid-friendly. My experience was the exact opposite - it felt like the staff was working hard to make the hotel attractive to families and really bent over backwards to be welcoming. The facilities themselves are clean and great for kids with a water slide and lazy river as well as a basketball court, volleyball court and space to run around. We stayed on an Executive Floor and it was well worth the extra money - we had a great continental breakfast every morning, snacks in the afternoon and dessert at 8 as well as coffee, water and other beverages all day. Can't say enough good things about our experience there - we are already planning our next trip to Orlando and planning to stay at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “family had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: yoshispeach
Reviews.Content: although I did not attend, my husband older son and friends attended a stay at this hotel. They had a wonderful time! They had two suites with connecting parlor room. This is the second time for some of them at this hotel and both times they had rave reviews. They got to enjoy the light breakfast, snacks and dinner hordorvey:) type foods and they really enjoyed the desserts in the evening compl. to executive floor which is awesome if you are a Hilton honors member. Since they were all there for a convention for mega or comiccon type thing this was great for the boys to eat on there budget:). They loved the pool with the lazy river and spent hours at the bonfire they found is enjoyable after a long day. The boys also said the gym was great. my husband said two of the boys said the parlor was larger than there home I am so happy the got to enjoy such a wonderful hotel and experience. Nomally when the boys come back they talke all about the convention but this time it was all about the hotel. I think I need to make a trip to orlando myself for a stay here at this hilton. My husband who travels frequently says this is by far the best hotel. Even beats the waldorf.. sorry... still hilton owned though. He said its a wonderful hotel especially for families. They did have miniature golf but time did not allow for that this trip... Only one comment he had was for parking but it was discounted for hilton members so that make it better:) Very clean hotel and upscale look! Thanks Hilton for making my boys weekend so wonderful see you next year... I might just have to tag along:)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: msa1164
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Orlando Feb 18. Huge hotel and very busy. As always, amazing, comfortable bed, super clean and comfortable room. Got a $100 rate, so good value this weekend. Some minor issues - Pricing for other items: ridiculous expensive Internet price ($15), expensive buffet breakfast ($20), pay to park - either valet or self service. Wait time for checkout was extremely long - waited over almost 40 minutes. Use express checkout! We did not use the pool area, but it look as advertised - beautiful and inviting. Parking was in rear of the property and a bit of a hike but not bad. All in all, beautiful, comfortable and busy hotel with some issues.

Reviews.Title: “a stay of quality”
Reviews.Author: mrbeco
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a convention and got more than just a convention! Jennifer greeted us at the front desk and lay a foundation for a great trip! she found a king room vs a double queen for my wife and I. and helped us to feel right at home explaining all the extras this hotel has! and it has lots of extras! beautiful grounds with a great kids pool slide, lazy river, 9 hole putting course and walking/running track! the executive lounge and their staff were great about keeping the trays full and coffee hot! And there was a walkway right into our convention! Great job to the staff and management on a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Finally good service prevails!”
Reviews.Author: RonArmstrong
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a conference at Orlando and we used our Hilton membership to stay at the new and connected Hilton. From the moment we arrived the staff had the perfect attitude (something I discovered quickly lacked in the remainder of Orlando outside anything named Disney or Universal or Hilton). From the pool area to our room access was easy and elegant. They boast some of the most accessible and fast elevators I have known. My only complaint is this: hire someone with serious acoustic engineering background. While very attractive visually the aural clutter wore me down. The restaurants and bars were particularly difficult to enjoy if you wanted to use your hearing the next day. Otherwise I think is safe to say this Hilton is in my top 3 stays (at Hiltons that is)

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ashli_R_97
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. The vending machine was not working on my floor so I called to get some water and they brought 4 bottles at NO Charge. Love the Hot Tub. The only thing that I would say needed help was the water pressure on the shower. If you have thick hair check the pressure when you get there are call for repair.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and again”
Reviews.Author: JulieKJ
Reviews.Content: After spending four horrible days and nights at the Hotel Indigo in St. Petersburg, (on business) I headed immediately to the best hotel in Orlando. I had to decompress before returning home. My room was ready when I arrived and the staff, as always was friendly and so professional. There were several VIPs there, yet the guests were (or appeared to be) oblivious. Each guest is treated as if they were the most important person in the hotel. You can't get that attentiveness anywhere else. The Executive Lounge staff calls you by name, as does everyone else. The lounge is always clean and well stocked. The expresso machine is a great touch. The continental breakfast is just enough to hold you until lunch. Recently they added home made cinnamon buns to the offerings. I also noted an upgrade in the evening snacks. On Friday they had pot stickers and Asian shrimp. The fire pits on the pool deck are so inviting. I love sitting out there at night with a glass of wine and enjoying the night air. We ate at Davids and they have some very interesting new menu items. One of the stand outs was the pumpkin ravioli. The side salads are crisp and the bleu cheese dressing was outstanding. The beds are so comfortable and sparkling clean. Also, I enjoy the glass shower in the king room. My parlor suite was big enough to have a meeting for 10-12 without feeling crowded. The location is great for conventions as well as entertainment on International Drive. I know it is strange to talk about elevators, but these are so fast, and always available. You never have to wait more than 30 seconds to get one. I also like the fact that there are 2 banks of elevators, so people on the high floors don't have to stop 15 times during the peak times. I stay here as often as possible and have never once been disappointed at all. Thank you Emily, Holly, Brittany and everybody else. You are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LordDougMacIver
Reviews.Content: I was there 2 weeks in January 12 with my girlfriend and it was amazing. What a great staff there. Especially at the Davids Club, the Marketplace and the Concierge. Now this Hotel is with the Hilton Vienna my Favorite. I Tested the Room Service, Car Rental, Lazy River, Pool, everything was great. My Girlfriend was very happy there, thank you all so much - we are from Germany, but we will def come back!

Reviews.Title: “Level of service”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many quality resorts, however I must say that NO one has ever surpassed the service that I have received from the Hilton. I would especially like to acknowledge the very personable and competent individuals at the front check in counter. Rooms were very clean with nice appointments. I would highly recommend this resort

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: MegCole
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable but standard. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Most impressive is the outdoor space: pools, hot tubs, lazy rivers, and cabanas. Only disappointment was with the breakfast buffet: $17 for standard hotel free continental fare? I think not!

Reviews.Title: “Great tradesow hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mighty10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton for a tradeshow at the OCCC. Very lovely pool and common area. Has a spa and several eating options. Do not like that there is a charge for Internet in the room. But the staff has been very friendly and the breakfast good. It can be a hike to the west convention building.

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting and family vacation location”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hilton Hotel. Rooms are nicely appointed, clean, and the bathrooms are roomy. The gym is awesome here. Executive room: Makes being a Hilton Honors member worthwhile. I was here for a large meeting, and the convention area and meeting rooms were always very clean. Concierge is fantastic here. Lots of recommendations for restaurants, ground transportation, shopping, etc. Make sure you utilize them if you need anything. Pool area is amazing. We had a beautiful reception outside around the pool, and it was awesome at night. I wish I could have enjoyed the lazy river!! Very nice location to everything!! Ask about the trolley. Room service was awesome, particularly for my need of a grilled cheese sandwich at 1:00am. 2 nights in a row. One thing I did notice here on the meeting side was the customer service. The servers were sooo friendly. They helped with my gluten free situation, and also helped another person who came in late for lunch. The food was being packed away, but the server ran into the back and was able to grab my co-worker a plate of food. I was greeted by every staff member during our meeting, whether it was grabbing a bottle of water or eating breakfast. Wonderful. There is a UPS Store onsite, as well as a Starbucks Market. I loved the market, but I have to say the service in the coffee shop was so-so. Example: After ordering my coffee, I had to wait until the "barista" was done texting before he started my drink. Then, my drink sat there a little bit longer while he sent another text. Conveniently, a manager walked in and that cell phone magically disappeared. This happened 3 times throughout the week. Maybe he was texting his "how to be a barista" instructor?? Doubt it. Either way, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: irwins0001
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a conference at this hotel. I had a great time. I had access to the executive lounge. It was fantastic! Wonderful service. Rooms are modern, clean, and well stocked. Dinner at the steakhouse was great as well as the food at the conference. It was a little too cold for my kids to use the pools, but they looked like a lot of fun. Great location for all the parks. Staff is quite friendly, always smiling and saying hello. Gym/spa is very good.

Reviews.Title: “We live in Tampa and visit this Orlando hotel a few times each year.”
Reviews.Author: Relax099
Reviews.Content: So the fact that we keep going back speaks volumes. This is a nice, newer and clean Hilton with a fantastic pool area. We go for the weekend and don't leave the hotel - we hang out by the pool and float in the river all day. We have lunch and dinner at the pool bar/restaurant. The food is quite good - try the burger, the pizza (they make a special one for us with goat cheese, caramalized onions and balsamic vinegar drizzle) or the chicken fingers (real chicken trips, on the kids menu but adults can order). Food and drink prices are reasonable...and as for the room rate, if you're a Florida resident, there is a special rate (runs $100-$120). And at night, relax by the fire pit and get ice cream from the coffee shop inside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip Thanks to Hilton and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kristine K
Reviews.Content: Our trip was fantastic and the hotel was wonderful. Perhaps the best part of our trip was our server, Colin, by the pool. Thanks! You were hilarious and gave us some great tips about Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ChuckandJack
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Actually there were at least 3 conferences being held at the hotel at the same time. One might expect this to cause poor service but everything was great. At check-in the young man at the front desk was exceptionally helpful. My room was spacious and well appointed. The executive lounge was quite nice and featured the usual fruit, yogurt, muffin spread. Greatly appreciated were the bottles of water located under the coffee machines. Special recognition to the banquet staff who went out of their way to provide a substitute lunch item due to allergies.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by customer service!”
Reviews.Author: nydolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to the Orlando Convention Center where we attended a trade show. It is very large and not new-new-new, and they gave us an extraordinarily low room rate, so we weren’t expecting much. We were very wrong. The rooms were comfortable, nice view of the pool, lovely flat screen tv, in room safe and refrigerator. Super-comfortable mattress and pillows. As a short person, I must again say “What the heck is this tall bed trend?” I had to climb on a chair to get into the bed (top of the bed was about the height of my hip!). Bathroom looked recently remodeled, but was not “new,” and there was no separate stall shower. We had a large window, but would have preferred that it open a bit for fresh air. We didn’t love the “energy-saving” motion activated temperature controls...and they were able to over-ride them for the duration of our stay, so that we could keep our room comfortable - a huge and unexpected plus. Housekeeping was detail oriented. We opted for valet parking and they were super efficient - we never waited more than two minutes. The spa is pricey, but they were able to accommodate us with desired services on relatively short notice. And the health club - WOW!! Super-impressive, loads of brand new machines, clean, well-lit. Check-in and check-out were problem free and quick. We were most impressed that there were none of the little tacked on unadvertised “fees” that often accompany resort hotel bills. That being said, we feel that a Hilton level hotel should not be charging for wi-fi connectivity (we used the free wi-fi at the convention center). The only glitch during our stay was the one morning we had breakfast on premises - we do not eat at the buffet, and in a half empty room, they could not get a menu item order out within 25 minutes. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Orlando and would love to check out the beautiful pool - we simply ran out of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneinMD
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - immaculately cared for. Have been here 3 times for conferences, and found amazing service each time. The catering is delicious, as are the onsite options. Connects to convention center thru an outdoor walkway - just beware of wind. The staff made me feel as though I was the only guest there all the time, and went so far out of their way to accommodate me! wonderful - will go again! On a side note, the Dennys across the street is the nicest Dennys I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, big and high end”
Reviews.Author: WalterBTV
Reviews.Content: Booked via online bidding site and was pleasantly surprised to get a great hotel at such a great rate. Had to pay for parking, however hotel is only 2 years old, big, clean and great fixtures/furniture throughout. Wish every hotel I booked were so nice. Would stay here hands down anytime in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: solkNewYork
Reviews.Content: I was moved to the Hilton Orlando by the Peabody hotel due to being overbooked, I’ve stayed @ the Hilton right when they opened up, Great place, Clean, comfortable, courteous, nothing but great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Need to check out the pool next time”
Reviews.Author: nigeldkat
Reviews.Content: We've been here twice but always in Jan. We loved it both time. We need to get back when it is warm enought to use the pool. It looks really cool. We really enjoyed lunch and breakfast. Both nice meals.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: Blm0098
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights last week while working one day in Daytona Beach and One day in Tampa. The Location and the facility were perfect. All personnel were helpful and respectful of my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for covnention center”
Reviews.Author: Vtstock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice for events at the convention center. both time service was fantastic from check-in to check out. convenient to convention center with a starbucks on the way. love the lazy river and pool to relax after a tradeshow. it made it feel almost like you were on vacation. rooms nicely appointed and very clean. no "florida" musty smell. cabs always readily available. only piece of advice if you are attending a convention at the nearby center know which hall and plan the walk time accoridngly. North can be a 15 minute walk

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: S1Alex
Reviews.Content: New, clean, comfortable and easy to use! Drove up after spending a day over at unversal and check in was a breeze. You can save some money by avoiding valet and pulling your car around the back of the hotel. Stayed here at the tail end of the Dog Show and it was REALLY cool seeing the champion dogs around the property. Hhonors Diamond stayed on points and was upgraded to the executive level. Pretty good breakfast in the morning with the usual spread. Nice coffee machine. Exceptional value and will seriously consider this hotel whenever i return to the area. Only drawback would be its proximity to Disney (still only 15 mins away).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place”
Reviews.Author: luxuryjunkies
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, friendly staff, and good rooms, lovely pool area, everything you need after a day in the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Orlando for a couple of nights and it was the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the rooms are modern and spacious. Best of all though the staff were phenomenal and go out of their way to provide first class service at every opportunity. From Natasha, Emily and Brian at check-in to Nicky in the Executive Lounge I couldn't ask for more and I can't wait to visit again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: gracie6684
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando over New Years to go to the parks and book this hotel due to its proximity to Disney. The lobby, facilities and pool were immaculate. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were nice. The staff was more than willing to help. My only gripe is that parking is VERY expensive ($14/day) and you can only park at the hotel. We didn't get a chance to really hang by the pool, but I'm sure it would have been awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Mattyboy777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September of last year. I don't know where to start! The place had a really good atmosphere, everyone was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was super tasty. The pool area is incredible with a slide, lazy river and free eight ball and table football. I hope to stay here again in the future sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: KelleyAndMatt
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the bad reviews as this is the #1 place we prefer when visiting the Disney area. It is right across the street from Downtown Disney, has some of the best shuttle services to the Disney parks outside of the Disney hotels themselves, and one of the only hotels that offer the special magic hours at the parks. Consider this: are you in Orlando for the hotel, or the parks? If you choose the latter, then you want the best services you can get that will not only get you to the parks ASAP, but also provide those special extras like early entry or after-hours stays - and this hotel provides those services. If you need to have a quality room and choice of food and drink, then this hotel is a great choice. We are hotel snobs, always prefer Hilton to any other chain hotel, and are seldom disappointed. The room: our room was quite nice, clean and comfortable. We traveled with our then 16-year-old daughter and shared the room with her. There was plenty of room for us and it was always fresh and clean. Outside of our room there were private areas for sitting where she was able to sit and talk to her friends via her cell phone that were plush and comfortable. The shuttle: the shuttle service to the Disney parks (as with them all) provided transportation to Epcot, the hub of the area where you find buses to all other parks. Service was provided roughly every two hours, making it extremely convenient for us as one of us was attending a conference and could then hop a shuttle to meet the rest at the parks. The shuttles ran early and late and were comfortable with friendly staff. We purchased our tickets in the hotel at discount. We were able to get coffee and a quick breakfast easily inside the hotel, or sit and eat a nice spread for a more relaxed breakfast. Great way to start the day. Overall it is the best price and place around within the Disney band - check out the other Hiltons, the one on Palm Parkway is an atrocity to the Hilton name and is more expensive. Go figure... we would absolutely go back to this property again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Was there for business but returning with family”
Reviews.Author: SplashFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous if you're attending the convention centre as its about a 5-7 minute walk through the hotel and walkway. The pool here is outstanding and because it's away from the theme parks it isn't crowded (the parks are only about a 10-15min drive away). The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable. Coffee maker is small but efficient. The bar fridge is large enough for keeping a few breakfast items or snacks. Pool is wonderful and service at the pool is good. I did notice a sewer odor by the back of the pool area - not in the pool itself! It was more of a drainage system issue in the service area that the pool passes by. I noticed that all over Orlando you can run into this odor near drains on streets and in malls - not sure why but it must have to do with the temperature and the way they plan their sewage systems in the city. So it was unpleasant but you also passed it quickly enough. The spa and gym are great as well. The hotel staff were very accommodating and arranged to have the NHL playoffs shown on TVs in the lounge which was great given that the NBA playoffs are on at the same time and Orlando is not an NHL city. The concierge and car/taxi hops were very helpful and quick. Overall an excellent stay and I'm taking my family back this May. I will provide an updated review after that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in the heart of fun-land”
Reviews.Author: Dayzee19
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property numerous times for a conference I attend in Orlando. I'm reviewing this as a business traveler to this property - not as a family in town for Disney. The rooms are very clean and well maintained ( the hotel is still fairly new and looks to be so). The elevators are FAST, as is the wifi. They have a good coffee-bar just off of the main lobby that is well-staffed in the morning, and aslo fast with espresso drinks. They offer nice salads and sandwiches if you're tired of the big biz dinners. Room service was also very good and quick, with friendly non-intrusive staff delivery. Even with all of the famillies at the property, you can still find a nice quiet chair pool-side to read a book or get work done. The gym is BY FAR the best hotel gym I've ever used. Their selection of machines, free weights, balls, yoga ,mats, etc makes you feel like you're at your monthly gym back home. I've never had to wait to use any equipment - it is usually only 1/4 full. I've never seen any broken equipment, and all of the treadmills and ellipticals have their own TV screens. I had a great facial and massage at the Spa...I only with the spa had later hours for those of us stuck in long conferences all day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: ZipsnBucks
Reviews.Content: This was a quick visit to Orlando back in April. My wife was already staying at the Hilton for a conference and I flew down to meet her for a long weekend after her conference. The hotel is located near the convention center. Disney and the rest of the area attractions are also very close. The hotel is very close but I chose the self parking as we were going to be in and out frequently. The pool area was very nice including the lazy river. The food and drinks at the pool was very nice. Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great amenities”
Reviews.Author: anniversarycouple93
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at this conference hotel for a day at a great rate ($110) and was very impressed with the pool, lazy river, and rooms. Newer place - very clean. The food and beverage prices were VERY high so it might be better to eat off-site if on a budget. Beautiful spa and fitness center. There is a parking fee too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for convention events”
Reviews.Author: Philip D
Reviews.Content: Bed and pillows great, room big, bathroom size good (but shower/bath only average), quiet, staff friendly and efficient, convention price good, Bistro entre cobb salad good, sports bar big, access to convention center by skyway great. Plus when I got to the airport I discovered I had left my credit card at the Bistro. Called, they had it and volunteered to overnight it (at no charge). I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our new go to hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: cbarilla
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that we could go to in Orlando FL with our son age 11 that would keep him occupied and this was the place to say the least !! If your looking for an all around Classy hotel that you will not have to leave this is it. The Giant pool has everything from Basket ball to water slides. Right behind that is a Pretty big Lazy river that has water cannons,volcano's,mist and all lived with lush tropical landscape. Our son was in his glory the whole time. AS for adults that want to get away from the kids they have a all adult sections with Private pool and hot tub with no kids allowed. Drinks and food at the LARGE poolside bar/cafe are also great. Me and my wife have been back 2 times after that just to stay and hang at the pool. Inside the hotel you will find many eating and drinking options that will sure meet anyones needs. This is a must stay top of the line FUN hotel and we will stay everytime we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: sagencyinc
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. Not only is it beatiful, but it has everything you could ask for. The place is brand new and every room is perfect. the outdoor pools are wounderful. love the quiet pool the best. I will allways go the this hotel every time I am in Orlando.strongly recomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Center Site”
Reviews.Author: walker-roamer
Reviews.Content: Currently Jan/12 and 48 degrees so I didn't do the pool but it looks awesome...very Las Vegas style. Did the concierge level on 19th floor. You pay for your drinks and the food display is meager at best. I was surprised that the room wasn't bigger, It was very clean but adequate at best. The main restaurant was closed for lack of business (I was told they only had 2% of the rooms booked at this time). Well, it was very cold outside....All that was available was the Bob's Sports Bar in the Lobby. The staff was friendly but not overly helpful. The main reason to stay here is that it is only a 5 minute walk to the south part of the convention center. If you stay at the Peabody hotel it could be 15-20 minutes of fast walking. But overall the Peabody is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Service is one area that sets this Hilton apart. But, style, room, pool and location don't hurt!”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel go out of their way to make guests feel welcome.  I noticed the exceptional service as soon as I got out of the car.  Ben, a young man raised in Orlando, did an especially nice job with my first interaction on property.  First impressions are important, but often a good impression with service falls short on the second and third interaction.  This wasn't the case here. I want to note other impressive interactions because of impressive 4 star service that may rival many 5 star properties.  A few top performers included: Elvis - bellman  Daniel - concierge Wendy - executive lounge Eric - Chef  The hotel is nice, but what made this Hilton great was the happy, friendly, enthusiastic individuals who made all of us feel welcome. We had one of the multi room suites with a large living room in the center. It was they typical design with two bedrooms (1 king room, 1 double room) that can be locked off when not sold.  We never received turn down service and we never called requesting the service.  This is a pet peeve of mine as I don't always remember to call and request the service. If you decide to stay at this property consider a visit to Spencer's and make sure you give Chef Eric's desserts a try after an onion soup and steak.

Reviews.Title: “PHENOMENAL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Len H
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at Hyatt Grand Cypress but they screwed up our reservation, they gave away the room with a view that we booked where they charged us $160 more, then didn't honor our reservation said, price went up, wanted us to pay another $100 more, and to top it off teh horse back riding activity the agent said they have, wasn't true, they haven't had it in teh last 2yrs!! the customer service there was horrible so I caled hilton&when they said they had a room, cancelled Hyatt&went to hilton.. We didn't expect anything coz it's just to get a room since we drove 3hrs to get there.. but we were surprised&happy that Hyatt screwed us up coz if not we wouldn't stay in this hilton hotel. Service was excellent..everybody was nice, we got a military rate and a late check out.. the latest we're ever got from any hotel!!!! 2:30pm.. maybe becasue it's the 2nd of january&its not busy but still, no other hotel even other hilton has ever given us that.. everything we asked for was given,we requested coffee and extra towels and they brought it up in just few mins, followed by a call from the front desk to ensure we got what we requested. The hotel didn't have the canoe,rock climbing,bike rides etc that Hyatt was offering (not sure if these even exists as their horse back riding didn't ) but the lazy river was fun..we felt like kids again, the hotel was clean and Spencer;s steakhouse was excellent!!! Service by Jackie was amazing!!! we love this hotel and will certainly come back!!!! This is a hidden gem..even if its not near Disney and a short drive from Seaworld..this hotel is now at the top of our list!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing All-Around!”
Reviews.Author: SamZ130
Reviews.Content: I am very critical of service industry establishments - hotels, restaurants, etc.- and will make my opinion of excellent or poor service known. The Hilton Orlando provided some of the best service I've ever received at a hotel. My husband and I stay at high end hotels regularly for business and, while I expected good service, I could not have anticipated the intensely positive experience we had at the Hilton Orlando. Every single staff member with which we came in contact was more than helpful and eager to engage us in happy conversation. Especially of note are: Kit, Stephen & Indyia at the front desk, as well as front office manager Matthew; Lia and Kaitlyn at the hotel bar/David's, and Eric at Tropics/the pool bar/restaurant. The pool is great, with two zero entry sections (perfect for little ones) and a lazy river. The pool "bar" offers full service food and drinks, and there are fire pits and a putting green outside. Anything we wanted, we were able to find at the hotel or they could direct us toward it. We stayed at the hotel during New Year's Eve and Florida Citrus Sports' Bowl Week, and even though we weren't there for any of the bowl games, we felt very comfortable in the hotel. The Hilton hosted the entire FSU contingency (team, alumni, fans) for that game, and multiple USC and Nebraska fans for the game on 1/2 and while it was clear that there were many game fans were there, we never felt like we weren't important even though we weren't in the majority with the rest of the guests. We usually stay at more 'exclusive' hotels, but if every Hilton hotel is run with the care and efficiency of the Hilton Orlando, we will now be a Hilton family. We travel to Orlando every three months (or more) and will definitely be making the Hilton Orlando our 'home hotel.'

Reviews.Title: “Provides what one would expect”
Reviews.Author: Lee59
Reviews.Content: The hotel does what one expects of such a place well. The room was clean, and the linens were reasonably new. The bed was comfortable. We were on a relatively high floor looking in the direction of the Disney resort, although that is quite far away. The in-room dining menu was short, but quite tasty. In general, the food was a bit heavy for me - even the salads. The coffee shop was not quite up to snuff, and it was not possible to get truly fresh OJ. We didn't try the resort amenities, although some friends were justifiably a bit miffed that the hotel did not want guests doing their morning exercise running on the golf course, even well before golfers arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Refuge from Amusement Parks”
Reviews.Author: imssc1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here First week of December for 4 nights. We are 60 and saw Magic Kingdom, Epcot ,Universal, and Animal Kingdom. First room was musty, and mildew and this was on Executive floor! We switched and toilet did not work and AC set at 70 degrees, and could not lower. We were told we had to have a tech set it to VIP status to cool down to 66 degrees. Every other day we had to have it reset. Exec. lounge was spartan. They ran out of Coffee cups to go the second morning. The Receptionist said they would deliver them from the 1st floor at NOON!!!!!!!. I went back to my room to get my larger cup. Housekeeping made up our rooms the second night, but left all but one pillow on floor! They left a dirty rag in the tub, and the toiet was still running. The one and only bathrobe disappeared. I called the Mgr on duty and he apologized and offered to reimburse me one half the points I booked the room for. He said it would take 2 weeks. 4 weeks later and 6 people in Dallas Central office i finally got them. The self park was atrocious. No ones card ever let you get in or out without a guard on duty. They admiitted they had a compiter glitch. The employees were responsive, except for the Hilton Honors Exec. Lounge People. They were clue less and always talking to each other, ignoring their clients. The good things: Breakfast superb. Great servers. Concierge very professional. Would probably stay at this property again. It is not up to Starwoods Hotels standards, but clean and good value for U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location staff and pool is wild”
Reviews.Author: MushuAnd
Reviews.Content: After the insane crowds at Disney and universal it was a haven of peace and quiet. Swimming pool had lazy river, slides, great menu. Close to Loads of restaurants. Inhouse restaurants not much choice. Weird menu at sports bar and grill. Wanted some home comfort food - not menu gymnastics. Rooms comfy, new and clean. Club floor great for break snack drink but too many kids that were not well behaved. Would have paid to have a NO. Kids area. Only ten minutes to hotel from theme parks - right beside Seaworld. Great quality and value.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!! Best hotel we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ajkirby29307
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is an amazing family friendly, couples, or business travel hotel. It had excellent very friendly helpful staff. The rooms were spacious and clean. The pool area and fitness center were above and beyond the norm. My husband and son loved the lazy river and the water slide. We also enjoyed the smores by the fire pit. I love how close the hotel was to Universal and Sea World. You are right in the middle of everything,but still feel like your away from the hussle and bussle of the city. The views from any room are amazing. Although we werent using the convention center facilities, it was nice to know it was right next door. When we return to Orlando in the spring and every time after, this is where we will stay. WE LOVE THE HILTON ORLANDO!!! They could put wifi in the rooms though, you have to pay for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “What's to say?”
Reviews.Author: mafootje
Reviews.Content: A new hotel with very nice rooms. It also has several restaurants on location. There's a huge fitness room and also large pool area with several options to sport. Very nice staff. Points of critic can be the high price for WiFi $14,95 per day / device. No free WiFi anywhere in the hotel, made use choice outside lunch to get some free WiFi. Parking is also paid, self parking is possible. Water pressure on 12th floor was low in the shower. But don't let this keep you away it really is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jencck
Reviews.Content: We are locals and escape to this hotel for a weekend here and there. We had a terrible experience at another so-called "top notch" hotel down the street, so we came back to the Hilton, where we should have started in the first place! Service, cleanliness, rooms, pools, etc... ALL above outstanding. They took a horrible experience and turned it back into a great couples getaway for me. I can't say thank you enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good, caring, on top of things management”
Reviews.Author: PedroSpiller
Reviews.Content: The facility, lobby, amazing pools, fitnes center, rooms are not only beautifuly designed, top in class, but also very clean and well maintained. What truly makes the hotel very special is the employee attitude. Ask at the bell station where a shop is, and you get a delighted smile and an immediate escort there. Ask at the pool bar for a drink prepared a certain way, and again you get a real smile and a genuine extra effort. Ask the housekeeper for extra coffee day one, and she remembers every day. The service in the sports themed restaurant, David's Club, is personable and a pleasure. In the executive lounge, Keath, Megan, Nicki remember your name from first contact, ask what you plan that day, and enquire that evening or next day how it went. Yes, I think everybody working in the Hilton Orlando feels he/she is on a team and is working together. Very refreshing! Several months ago while staying there, guests were overflowing the executive lounge, guess hotel was quite full. Someone I had not seen before working in the lounge (it's a small crew)bussed my breakfast dishes. I asked if he was a new employee. He said no, he was from a different department but knew the lounge needed a hand. I struck up a conversation about how that attitude was something one can feel at Hilton Orland. As it turned out, after I introduced myself, he revealed that he was the Resident Manager, Chris Mueller. I'm pretty sure his hands on, lets work together attitude is a big reason for the grand sense of teamwork.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a convenient walkway to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: dives-k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a conference at the Convention center. The rooms were gat, the staff friendly and overall environment was comfortable. The lounge below has an elaborate selection of wines and spirits, and the food is decent as well. I did not get a chance to enjoy the pools and other amenities at this location but heard great things about it from others who were staying there. The location is a little further away from the restaurants and strip malls though. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Far from West Convention Hall, A/C problems”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Orlando for 4 nights while attending a meeting at the West Convention Center. We did not realize when we booked how long the walk is from the hotel to the meeting site (25-30 min). As a Diamond HHonors member we were given concierge lounge access, which included breakfast, hors d’oeuvres, desserts, and an honor bar. The room was moderate at best in size. Bathroom was adequate, with excellent water pressure. The thermostat did not go below 68, and so it was not possible to cool the room adequately for sleep. This is a reasonable convention hotel if your meeting is in the South Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous week”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful and the entire hotel was very clean! The cabanas at the pool were fabulous and provided additional privacy and party atmosphere. The service was great

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Customer Service by all”
Reviews.Author: Screechingwheelz
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. Everyone made areal effort to make us feel welcome. Stephen on reception was particulary good in helpingus with our room at check-in. If there is one small point of criticism it is that the Executive lounge food and facilities were not quite as goodcas some other Hilton's I've stayed in. But would i go there again? Definatley!

Reviews.Title: “"Very nice and modern hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Callen O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for the AKC this past weekend. I felt in love with this hotel as soon as I got inside the hotel. The check-in process was excellent...I was able to get a really nice room with a great view :) The pool looked amazing and I didn't go in the water because it was a little bit chill for me. There was this little convenience store called "the marketplace". It took me 30 minutes to get everything I need for my stay. Dung and Blanca were extremely helpful in assisting me with all the great choices that marketplace had to offer (pizza, sandwiches, smoothies, pastries, chips...) Dung also helped me to bring the bags up to my room...He delivered such an exceptional services. I can honestly said this is a wonderful hotel with a very well-trained professional staff. I will definitely be staying at Hilton Orlando again and again whenever I'm traveling to this area. Very well done Hilton Orlando!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yoshi808
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel at pretty reasonable price. Has a gorgeous pool & a little river you can drift on with an inner tube. Staff was very friendly. Only drawback is parking is not included & is $15.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel Without the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavenUS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times when I visit Orlando for business or pleasure. It is conveniently located near the Orlando Convention Center and International Drive (I-Drive). The hotel is new, the rooms are awesome and the resort-style pool area is A-mA-Zing. As a Hilton Honors member, I am always upgraded to the Club Floor and enjoy the amenities offered such as free breakfast, free appetizers at night, refreshments throughout the day, and a place to read magazines and newspapers. There are several restaurants on site with all price levels to suit your budget. There is also a snack area directly off the lobby that offers Starbucks Coffee, incredible desserts, bagels, etc. A definite benefit when you want to grab & go...There are also many restaurants and shops nearby on I-Drive, so you don't have to feel inclined to eat at the hotel. The pool area has a separate area for adults fenced in to keep the "kiddies" out. There are tennis courts, a volleyball area and outdoor open-air restaurant offering salads, burgers and other delicacies. You can eat under the huge gazebo or have a waiter take and deliver your order by your chaise lounge chair. There is a huge pool, as well as another area with a "lazy river" style pool, where water jets gently propel you around the islands with palm trees and water features. They even offer a texting service when you are ready to retrieve your vehicle from the valet and you receive a response text that your vehicle will be ready within 10 minutes. So far I have never had to wait be the time I arrived to get my car. They also offer self parking, but there is a charge. Go for the valet parking. They are extremely friendly and they don't steal the change from your ashtray. I intentionally left a specific amount of change in the ashtray and the same amount was there the entire stay. This property is a must when you visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A Flagship Property”
Reviews.Author: CudBeWors
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from one of the premier properties in the chain. Ample lobby accomodates those countless clusters of convention guests. Well-trained professional staff. Considering typical conventiin event timing, elevator wait time was relatively minimal. Sufficient food services highlighted by superior offerings at Spencer's for Steaks and Chops. The Marketplace could be a bit hectic at lunch. Exhaustive meeting space capacity designed to accomodate almost any concievable event. We were particularly impressed by diligent, friendly service provided by the audio/visual department. Only problem was lack of adequate hotel data base for employees; resulting in guest being misdirected to a pharmacy that was unacceptably distant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Nice facility”
Reviews.Author: davuda
Reviews.Content: Have actually been to this hotel twice in the last couple of months for business. The facility - both inside and outside the hotel- is well maintained and clean. Kids would love the very large pool. Service is excellent. Rooms are very comfortable and reasonably spacious. The exercise facility is top flight. Resturant next to exercise facility is quite good - food on site is pretty pricey - but nothing outside of what you would normally expect. Would readily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Off International Drive”
Reviews.Author: JetRTW
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely modern, friendly hotel with great facilities. The lazy river is fab, although it was a little cold in November. The rooms were clean and the beds super comfortable. The staff were great although the concierge service seemed a little inexperienced. Would be a great place for those with a car but for those, who like us, don't have one, there may be better options. We have written about it in our blog along with lots of photos: http://jet-rtw.blogspot.com/2011/12/hilton-orlando-destination-parkway.html

Reviews.Title: “A very nice upscale Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DASarasota
Reviews.Content: A great place for business dealings and social events. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff were extremly courteous and professional. The only downside to the hotel is the uncomfortable beds and the lack of free wi-fi. ($15.00)

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is a terrific hotel with an outstanding, outgoing staff. I booked the room several months prior to the stay as my daughter was participating in a dance convention that was held in the hotel. My wife/daughter arrived about 6 hours ahead of me (I was returning to MCO from a business trip) so I added her name to the reservation and was told that the check-in was not only smooth, but my wife was greeted a Hilton Honors Diamond guest. The entire time we were on site, we were greeted with genuine, friendly "hellos", "how is your stay?", "may I do anything for you?", etc., without at all being excessive. Though I did not attend much of the dance competition (just my daughter's performances), the conference facilities were well suited for such an activity. Several other large events were underway at the same time, though the hotel held all of them without any issues. The fitness center was a welcome surprise and was closer to a heath club than the typical hotel fitness center, with most all of the major weight and cardio machines. All of the equipment was in excellent condition, neat and clean. Though we did not eat many meals at the hotel, those that we did have, including a large room service order, were very good. Though a Florida resident, I still find myself staying in an Orlando hotel 8 to 10 times per year. From this point forward, that hotel will be the Hilton Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “very impressive”
Reviews.Author: travel2much777
Reviews.Content: This was an extraordinarily comfortable hotel experience. The staff were attentive and friendly, the facilities were well maintained; and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. It's within walking distance of cheap food and a $3 cab ride to more upscale restaurants. I particularly liked the layout of the lobby and lounge. It was spacious and a comfortable place to get work done outside the room. And, the hallways have balconies from which you can watch the fireworks at Disney. As I was at a conference, I, unfortunately did not have the opportunity to use the leisure facilities; but, they looked fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: WLLHickory
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Hiltons; however the Hilton Orlando at 6001 Destination Parkway impressed me by the enthusiasm of their staff ... particuarly housekeeping. My room and the common areas were spotless. I attended a conference with over 4,000 people and the staff were everywhere - windows, bathrooms, refreshment areas all shined ... it was a remarkable experience. While I would not have previously considered this hotel for a "getaway", I am now. WLL

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tpowellwow
Reviews.Content: We just left this hotel on Saturday after having been there for a week. We had a great time and there really wasn't anything bad to say about anything. The room was great. We upgraded to a suite which was great with kids. The food was very good, especially at the pool side grill. We loved the breakfast buffet and the food in the executive lounge. Even though it was chilly, the day we spent at the pool was nice since the pool was heated. This is a really nice place and i would stay there again if we went back to Orlando area. The staff really goes out of their way to make an enjoyable experience when you encounter them. It's a mostly business crowd which makes it seem a little less noisy by the pool. The workers were very friendly. We loved Gayle, our morning waitress from Scotland. She was great every day. We went to Disney parks every day almost and had no trouble getting there and back. You can see Sea World out your window and Universal Studios isn't far away either. There is a charge for parking which hurts a little because staying off site from Disney forces you to pay $13 /day for parking at the hotel and then you have to pay another $14 a day to pay at Disney, so it's one fee for your daily parking and another for night time parking. A week of that adds up tacked on to the car rental fee as well. However, that has nothing to do with the quality of the hotel. Very nice place. A little more pricey than some other places, but it was very clean, well attended, great perks with the HHonors executive level status. Again, we would stay here again. My son wanted to stay in the room all day one day and that was fine with us. Great hotel. I hope to go back again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my conference stay”
Reviews.Author: QuitePickyTraveller
Reviews.Content: I only did a quick visit with a two night stay at this hotel since I was attending a conference at the Peabody which is only a 10 minute walk away. There is really nothing for me to complain about. Very friendly service, I was upgraded to the executive floor given my HHonors status, beds were fantastic, plenty of space in the room which was well equipped, complimentary WiFi... I had no time to check out the pool are or the gym unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fine Property!”
Reviews.Author: Toemoss22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel....great location......and family friendly! The pool is great and compares w/ Hilton Bonnet Creek. They do have pool service and food is good! I always make it a point to stay here when traveling through Orlando and have stayed 6+ times in last year. Hotel is very accessible from freeway and convention center. Have not had a chance to enjoy any restaurants on premise other than pool bar but love the accommodations! Rooms are well appointed and have refrigerators. The staff is very professional and on top of the game. They always get it "Right" the first time! Always a good choice to stay here-

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern lobby and rooms. The guestrooms (and bathrooms) are spacious. An ideal place to stay if you are attending a meeting at the Convention Center (if you can get a good rate).

Reviews.Title: “Better value than Disney!”
Reviews.Author: rey_reina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here November 2011 and couldn't be happier. Several complements from my children (5 & 8 years old) below: 1. We love the pool.
