It's the best pool we've been to because it's not busy, the slide is awesome and there's a lazy river. (What mom/dad loved: it was all included in their reasonable rates). 2. We loved s'mores night! (What mom/dad loved: We received a tray with s'mores kits for all of us for the big fire pit they have by the pool. What a great touch!) 3. We love the lounge! (What mom/dad loved: Hilton Club Exclusive Lounge had continental breakfast, afternoon snacks, evening hors d'ouerves...we were well looked after!) So there you have the children's reviews for Hilton Orlando. We travel to Orlando 2-3 times a year. We have stayed on Disney, Universal and Nickelodeon properties and all have been decent experiences but the Hilton was fantastic value with all the amenities you would need for a family. This will definitely be our property to stay at from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chefexpert
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, with great views. Close to Sea World. We were on the Concierge Level floor 19, so I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, and evening snacks and drinks. The staff from the front desk to the restaurants are outstanding. The valet and bell service were outstanding as well. Had a nice dinner at David's which is like their upscale sport's bar. Overall this hotel is worth every penny. Live it up, and enjoy it! Make sure to take time to utilize the pools, they are well worth the money. We enjoyed both the lazy river, hot tubs, and the other pools. Towel service available right at the pool area, which is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yasserradwan
Reviews.Content: the hotel was far from the city center , but nice and clean nice swimming pool , staff was very helpful , i wish i can visit again

Reviews.Title: “Service was average at best.”
Reviews.Author: skiercanuck
Reviews.Content: Make sure you ask for a room close to the elevators...the trek to our room at the end was long with children. We had bad service, front desk checked us in to a king as we stood infront of him with a family of 4. Then is was long getting put into another room. We even offered to pay the 50 dollars more for executive floor but they couldn't get themselves organized to accomodate us. Disappointing as a hilton honors member.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: scmcb
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Quick and efficient check-in. Room was large and comfortable. Was there on business - the hotel is connected to the Orlando Convention Center South Building via a covered walkway which was extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service”
Reviews.Author: mrscac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a shining star that stands far above its 4-star counterparts. We stayed for a week for the American Academy of Ophthalmology conference. For a hotel to achieve excellence and blend both business travelers and families is telling. The employees exude a pride so rare these days. From a welcoming check-in after traveling across the country with two small children (18 months and 5 1/2 years) to hailing cabs with carseats to asking housekeeping to clean our room at a certain time each day to the smiles from everyone we encountered. The hotel is connected to the Orange County Conference Center and is a walkable distance but the bus pick-up and drop-off for the meetings is conveniently located just outside the coffee house in the lobby. The coffee house is basically a Starbucks with packaged candy and a few drinks, nuts, milk and cookies for sale. The lines moved quickly. The Bistro near the pool area is excellent for breakfast and lunch. The breakfast buffet is convenient and good as are the selections off the menu. Service is terrific here. The steak house offers delicious, upscale dining with local, organic fare. Service was impeccable. The gastro pub was large, club-like with a bar, lounge areas with televisions to watch the World Series, and a large dining area with comfortable chairs and dim lighting. The food is outstanding. One can choose healthy items (salad with shrimp I ate every night there) or the burger with breaded and fried bacon. Blue chips on the side are potato chips smothered with melted blue cheese and drizzled with balsamic. We were seated promptly and blended with business travelers and other small families. The burgers by the pool looked delicious although we did not eat there. For families needing snacks for their children, we walked to Walgreens nearby for baby cereal and other items. The gift shop carries toiletries, fun jewelry, tasteful clothing and souvenirs. Very nicely done. The beds are very comfortable. We all slept peacefully. Not once did we hear neighbor noise. No stomping from the floor above us, no hallway noise. Room size is decent, decor is modern. The cleanliness is impeccable. It was comfortable enough for the four of us with two queen beds and one crib. The business center is convenient and allows you to print boarding passes for the flight home. The other raves about the pool area and fire pits are spot on. We enjoyed s'mores in the evening and the pools by day. The lazy river was fun although the baby was very unhappy about being sprayed in the face by the one faucet we couldn't avoid going by so we never went again. Would love to go back when we can enjoy it because it sure looked like fun. Our little girl enjoyed the shallow end of the pool. It was doable with both children by myself. Plenty of lounge chairs and space. There were also plenty of towels handed to us as we entered. I was able to run for an hour on the treadmill in the fitness center early in the mornings. It is roomy, there are plenty of treadmills for everyone and overall a very nice center. It was too dark to enjoy the outdoor running track. Visited the hair salon for a baby haircut that was decent and they got us in the same day. The concierge was very helpful in securing recommendations and reservations at a couple of wonderful restaurants off property. Matteo's Italian was outstanding, as was Oceanaire. We took the very confusing but charming trolleys to and from, although we caught a Metro bus on the way home from Matteo's, which was a longer distance away. The trolley stop was not clearly marked. We took a 15-minute cab ride to Disney World for half a day one day and another to Sea World the next day. We also enjoyed a special meeting night at Universal Studios. We found all three to be heavily commercialized but worth taking the little ones out for some fun and magic. Again, we appreciated being able to walk to the hotel lobby and hail cabs and shuttles with car seats. And the driver installed them for us. How nice to travel without lugging them ourselves. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travelers and families alike. The entire staff goes above and beyond the call of duty for everything that is asked of them. With a smile, no less. I really appreciate how they all treated our children with such patience, kindess and respect. They took the time to talk to them in a manner that fosters politeness and teaches them how to comfortably engage with adults. Our wake-up call, bell person and shuttle with a carseat were all dependable for our very early a.m. airport departure. It was a pleasant and wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: seashore1826
Reviews.Content: The spa and masssage was laittle pricey but it was a great experience. Very good massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Classy!”
Reviews.Author: Tampamichele
Reviews.Content: Being Hilton Honor Diamond members we stay at many Hilton hotels. This hotel was definitely one of the nicest so far. The valet was courteous and prompt, check in was very smooth, and our room was roomy, clean, well appointed, and tastefully decorated. The hotel offers a very relaxing lounge area, and many dining options. It's also located within walking distance to the Orange County Convention center and very close to dozens of very nice restaurants and tourist venues. The best part of the hotel is the "resort" style pool area. It's truly beautiful! There is also a lazy river, basket ball courts, poolside cabanas, and relaxing fire pit areas. The only real negative I have to say about this hotel is that even though the pool area stays open late, the bar and grill does not. It was unfortunate for us, after our evening volleyball tournaments, when the kids just wanted to hang by the pool...it took a long time for us to get our food "to go" from the restaurant inside. Other than that, this hotel was definitely one of the "best" Hilton has to offer and I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Made my business trip more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: RobinontheRoad
Reviews.Content: No one likes to work on the weekend, but my Saturday to Tuesday business trip stay at the Hilton Orlando really helped. The hotel is beautiful...I understand it's pretty new. My room on the 12th floor overlooked a parking lot of the Orlando Convention Center, but the weekend I was there it was full of amusement park rides for a convention. How fun to see the ferris wheel lit up at night. The room was beautiful, clean, well-appointed and most importantly quiet. The bed was heaven. If i could have taken it home with me I would have. I used the fitness gym one day and it was bright, clean, and looked out over the pool area. Very nice. The staff was very friendly, and I got a call from Security after I left informing me I had left behind my glasses. That's nice! My only complaint was that the TV channels went in and out. Channel surfing in my hotel is my guilty pleasure as I don't do it at home. Oh well, i just got more sleep. I was very happy with my visit and would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Katie server at tropics”
Reviews.Author: Missmolly27
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton and enjoyed their pool. Katie was my server and she was excellent. She recommended a sandwich for lunch and a few of their specialty drinks. She was very informative on what there was to do in Orlando as well. I had a blast with her. Just wanted to send a special thanks to her for making my stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Travelhelp4
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Orlando for a trade show with my husband.   I had a choice of the Peabody or the Hilton. I wish I had selected the Peabody.  First the positive.  The rooms were very nice and the beds extremely comfortable. Now the negative.  Despite being recognized as a Hilton honors guest, I was not offered the access code for free internet.  My husband paid for access the first day.  When I found out that honors guests could get free access we asked for the code but no one offered to refund us $15 dollar one day fee. Additionally, no one provided us information about the $1.25 trolley that provides transportation to most of the sites.  The bell caption was aware we were looking for an economical way to get from one place to another, yet they put us in a cab and told us it would not be too expensive to use it to go to dinner.  Wrong! One way trip, approx. 3-4 city blocks long cost us $10.  Using the trolley $1.25   Word of caution about the trolley! Be sure to have exact change.  The will not provide change.  If all you have is $5.00, your one way trip $1.25 trip will cost you $5.00.    Lastly, the hotel restaurant - closed on Sun. and Monday.  Really?

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for business and family alike!”
Reviews.Author: FAMURattler
Reviews.Content: My first experience at this hotel was for business meeting, and my most recent stay at was for a week long family vacation. On both occasions I was very impressed by the cleanliness and efficiency of this hotel. The staff is friendly, the grounds are nice, and the rooms are clean. For conventions/business people, the convention space of the hotel is more than adequate to hold moderate sized conventions. For larger conventions, there is a covered walkway that connects the hotel to the Orlando Convention Center. For families/those having fun, the hotel grounds feature a large pool w/slide, lazy river, tennis court, jogging trail, fire pits, putting greens, basketball court and well appointed fitness center. The property is about 20 minutes from Walt Disney World. My family had no issues with the daily commute from the hotel to the various Disney Parks - it was a breeze! For a family vacation, I found this resort to be a great value for the money (we got the $119 kids eat free rate). As a Hilton Gold Member, I was able to use the executive lounge on the 19th floor for continental breakfast in the morning and appetizers in the afternoon. The evening appetizers were a great money saver. We didn't have to resort to eating at fast food establishments, table-service restaurants or expensive theme park food. I've also stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando (adjacent to the Bonnett Creek Hilton) which is another solid property. This hotel is very similar in layout and style to the Bonnett Creek Hilton. Overall, I'd say between the Waldorf, Hilton Bonnett Creek, and Hilton Orlando, there are some great Hilton properties in Orlando! A great way to use/earn Hilton HHonors points.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Deal”
Reviews.Author: godivaleeflorida
Reviews.Content: I am going here for a two night TG getaway next week and I decided to use Priceline and just go with whatever they choose. The first time I used Priceline I ended up at the Sea World Renaissance and now we are going here. The reviews for the Hilton Orlando look great. I only paid 70 bucks per night on Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay anywhere else in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: JulieKJ
Reviews.Content: All upscale hotel rooms have nice linens, clean bathrooms and nice toiletries. The difference in hotels comes down to only one thing- the staff. Do they take a personal interest in each and every guest? Are the needs of the guest not only met, but anticipated? There is no better staff than the one at the Hilton Orlando. It seems to be almost impossible to satisfy the business traveler, the conventioneer and the vacationing family. Add in the romantic weekend couple and that makes it an incredible task. I travel under all of these lables every year and this is the only hotel that brings me back time and time again. On a recent stay, I left my cosmetic bag. The day I checked out, I got a call from security telling me about the oversight. They hold all lost and found items for 90 days. I retrieved it from the helpful and friendly security guard on this trip. I have forgotten items at other hotel chains and never been contacted to retrieve them. Great personal service is this Hilton's trademark. There is a convenient walkway to the Orlando Convention Center. One of the best steakhouses in the country is Spencers. The deli makes great sandwich combos for the "grab and go set." The roast beef was very tasty and served on a fresh roll. My favorite restaurant is the poolside bar. The really big burgers and daily flatbread specials are my favorite. The staff in the Executive staff prepares for your arrival with a pre-arrival contact by phone and email. It is easy and convenient to check in at the executive desk. The continental breakfast is just enough to get you going. If you are in the mood for a full American breakfast, the Bistro has a great breakfast buffet, with an omlette station. the lazy river pool is a great way to relax. For even more relaxation, I retreat to the quiet pool hot tub. Romantic evenings start with a glass of wine by the blazing firepits. It just doesn't get much better with these surroundings and the incredible staff. Every person has a smile- all the time. No matter what the question, the staff will get the answer for you. I have been a regular guest for the past 18 months and will continue to return to this great hotel. I just booked a graduation luncheon for next year and I am confident it will be outstanding. This last trip was a combination wedding anniversary and family celebration for our son's promotion at work.when we returned from dinner, we found a beautiful cake and a bottle of wine. We enjoyed it for two days. That made our special day even more so. If you spend even one night at the Hilton Orlando, you will be hooked. Thank you Doug for assembling the perfect staff. Thank you Emily- you are the very best! Thank you Holly, Amy, Nicky, Alex, Mike, Brittay, Natasha, Ashley and everybody else. I will see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Never enjoyed a resort in Orlando more!”
Reviews.Author: StewardessFl
Reviews.Content: Don't just take the Best Price / Best Offer listed on hotel website! Scroll down and click on special offers. The best price offered was $149, but down further was a special called Kids Eat Free (we don't even have kids) for $109. They gave us free drink coupons instead. This price seemed obscene for what this place offers! The "backyard" is putting greens, Giant pool, awesome lazy river, bars, games, a fire pit, on and on. We chose it over high end Disney resorts because we just love Hilton beds! Pretty place is on its own quiet side road with lots of trees around. Covered parking w/security, easy/close access to elevators to rooms. Wonderful hotel staff. As if it couldn't get better, our first room had an odor, so we were comped use of the lounge upstairs. Free breakfast, free hor' dourves, free late night desserts, free coffee machine that made everything from cappuccino to lattes... We will be looking to pay extra to add this room to all future stays at Hiltons everywhere! Oh, one night I was in need of a massage at midnight after a day of thrill rides. The spa closes at 10pm, but they booked me with a woman who was on time and had the strongest hands imaginable. She totally fixed me! And she only charged an extra $20 over the regular spa massage price, and she came right to my room. She didn't even expect a tip!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! She got a hefty one though. This Hilton is fantastic. Classy place. Moments from Sea World and Discovery Cove. Same day laundry/dry clean services. Very clean and attractive. Very comfy beds! Rooms have lil fridge. LOTS to do for families on vacation out back. My husband and I enjoyed the fire pit out there at night. Professional staff. Happy staff even. TO DIE FOR lil chocolates circle cakes in that upstairs lounge at night! The densest choco fudge cake I've ever eaten in my life, and husband thought it was rum cake of some sort. Just booked the Ocala Hilton for Thanksgiving & will be inquiring about those lil cakes!!! Also ate the mini hot dogs in one restaurant, different and tasty. Was looking for the ribs sliders, but they were out. Fish n chips was ok. Food was all from a nicer restaurant, can't remember name. Stayed 3 nights and will stay here again for sure!!! Oh, and a free shuttle, but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Second review...it just gets better”
Reviews.Author: ivanrmcc
Reviews.Content: Well this is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and also my second review. Last time I was there with the family, this time was a solo business trip attending a conference. This is just a great hotel in every category, staff - wonderful, beds - fantastic, a great nights sleep, rooms - just the right size and very well appointed and very clean. The hotel is beside the convention centre so it can get very busy but it is big enough to cope with large crowds and if you are driving there is lots of parking available. The pool complex is a highlight and a fantastic place to relax after walking the exhibition floor (or theme park) all day. But for me the jewel in this crown has to be Spencers Restaurant. If this place doesn't have a MIchelin star, it should have. It is not cheap and not that kid friendly but the service and food are exceptional...come hungry as there are just too many things you will want to try. I can't wait to get back here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gotarheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Orlando next to the Convention Center on International Drive for four nights in November. I booked this hotel because: 1) I knew the Hilton beds would be good 2) It has everything we would need on-property 3) The pool area looked inviting 4) The price when booking ahead on the guaranteed rate was much less than similar hotels. Paid $99/per night and was extremely glad that we chose this hotel. It is beautiful, well-staffed and boasts high-end rooms/beds at a low price. The pool area is fantastic. On our visit, the hotel was not busy at all. (Note: This review might be quite different during conventions) The pool area only had about a dozen people in it and we had the hot tub and lazy river all to ourselves. There are several restaurants on-property as well as one great late-night bar with a fantastic patio. The patio has gas-fired, open-flamed heaters with seating in front of a big-screen tv. You can sit in a comfortable chair and watch Monday Night Football outside while enjoying a cocktail and smoke without bothering anyone. Perfect. My only gripe is that everything on-property is very expensive. A vodka/cranberrry will cost $10 in the hotel bar. A so-so breakfast will run about $20. Take my advice...walk out of the hotel, cross the street and enjoy a hearty IHOP meal for half the price. The cooks at this particular IHOP have been there for a long time and put on a great show...and also cook a great meal. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cmhcoop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a trade show next door, but would definitely come back with the family. The grounds with the pool, lazy river, gym and restaurants make it very fun for the whole family. Needless to say, the proximatey to Disneyworld is also a huge advantage. Lots of restaraunts and shopping within walking distance as well. My only complaint is that I felt the parking seemed a bit too high ($13 for self park, $20 for valet) At the cost of the hotel, it should be free or lower priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DrTom234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for a conference in October 2011. The weather was bad so I didn't get to use the pool facilities, although they looked really nice. The exercise facilities were beautiful and the restaurants and bars were top notch. It was only a block to walk to several sit-down and fast-food restaurants and to the International Drive Trolley. Sea World is about a $7 cab ride and you could probably walk there. The rooms were nice and clean but nothing special. Service was great. The only thing I would recommend is that if you are going there for a conference at the Convention Center, find out which part of the massive convention center will host your meetings. While the Hilton is connected to the Convention Center with a covered walkway, my meetings were in another building which was a 15 minute walk away. The Peabody would have been more convenient for the West Pavilion.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably clean. All about service.”
Reviews.Author: MadrugadaTampa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week. I am so critical when it comes to cleanliness in a hotel. Wow, this place was clean! Our kids really wanted to go swimming despite the freezing rain and wind. The pool attendants went out of their way to make our experience special. One attendant sat on a stool at the top of the waterslide in the cold wind and rain, just for us! We were so comfortable here, and we all slept well. The breakfast was overpriced as most hotels are. $20 for a buffet. All I wanted was oatmeal and ended up spending about $12. (Didn't order juice or coffee). Our room had a very obstructed view, but I think they placed us strategically away from other guests since we had kids and there are many business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Max0323
Reviews.Content: I was just at this hotel last week for a convention and I was extremely impressed with the friendliness of the staff from valet to housekeeping. It was a breath of fresh air in the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of anything bad to say”
Reviews.Author: anniebob29
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando over the Columbus Day weekend, which saw historic (literally) amounts of rain fall during our stay. Despite the horrible weather, the Hilton Orlando ended up being the perfect hotel for us on this visit. We had booked two rooms, with a request for adjoining rooms, which I was told would more than likely be accommodated. The day before we arrived I confirmed the rooms but was told we would not have adjoining rooms after all. Imagine my surprise and pleasure when at check-in late the following evening, the desk clerk quickly and easily gave us adjoining rooms -- the first hotel in Orlando that has ever accommodated this request!! The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. We required a rollaway in one room which was promptly sent up, and at no extra charge (although one was quoted prior to check-in). (Speaking of charges, this may also be the time to note that this hotel is one of VERY few I found in the Orlando area that offers a government rate for government employees.) The staff was all very pleasant and helpful. There was a "marketplace" near the hotel lobby where one could purchase pastries, coffee, juices, and other breakfast items, at a reasonable price -- other items were available but we only ever needed breakfast. Best of all the pool area was fabulous. We only got to use it at night but it stays open until 11pm and has a great lazy river and lots of inner tubes. We had VERY limited time to use the pool and arrived at 8:30 one night to find the water slide was not running. I asked what time it closes and the attendant replied that it closes at 9pm but she hadn't turned it on that night because no one had asked for it (bad weather, remember). She offered very cheerfully to turn it on for us until 9pm so that our kids could enjoy it on the only night they'd have a chance to, which I certainly didn't expect her to do and appreciated very much! I forgot to mention the location -- literally 5-7 minutes from Universal, straight shot down Universal Drive, and about 15 minutes from the Disney parks, in a very easy commute. Careful taking a cab back from Universal, however, as the driver may try to take you the "scenic" route (aka the highway) which took 20 minutes and amped up the fare! Great hotel for business or leisure. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jody B
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are top-notch, so friendly and helpful! The rooms are nice with comfy beds, small refrigerators in the room and a nice location. It is a LONG walk to the West concourse of the convention center and the hotel restaurant options don't offer a lot of variety. However, if you stay here, go to David's and get an order of the Blue Chips. OMG...these are just about one of the tastiest things I've ever had! My only real complaint is that housekeeping is pretty sloppy. One day they left a toilet brush in my bathroom laying across my hairbrushes. GROSS! Another day they didn't empty the trash or change out the ice bucket and take the used glasses with them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mashadeca
Reviews.Content: By far, one of the best hotels. Great service! Clean rooms! Wonderful pool area! There is not one thing that we could say bad about this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels”
Reviews.Author: RevDoc2014
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great and comfy. Views were great. We stayed on the 15th floor and could see seaworld and Disney with ease. Great place to stay, esp if you can get a deal here.

Reviews.Title: “Top to bottom perfection”
Reviews.Author: Young2by2
Reviews.Content: Hard to imagen but this is my third stay at this hotel in the last 90 days for business. Each stay has impressed me more and more. The staff seems to really be happy and excited that you are here to stay with them. Shawn the vallet is a fantastic example of this. Stephine at the front desk went out of her way to make sure I was welcomed and happy with my accommodations. The hotel is spotless and you could eat off the bathroom floor! I have already booked my next stay 5 weeks from now.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as Convention Center Hotels Get”
Reviews.Author: McAliente
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is a modern, well maintained hotel literally adjacent to the Orlando Convention Center. The hotel is very well maintained with spacious, comfortable rooms; fantastic beds and linens and all of the standard Hilton amenities (bathrobes, spacious bathrooms, ironing boards, room safe, etc). The hotel has 24 hour room service, though the late night menu is limited primarily to pizza. And the location is convenient to the restaurants and bars on I-Drive. For Hilton Club members, the top floor breakfast is solid, and the club level is extremely large and comfortable. Finally, the hotel is extremely family friendly, boasting a huge pool complex and a lazy river. Yet the hotel accomplishes this without feeling over-run by families. Its a big hotel -- and they manager to balance business and families very well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lazy river”
Reviews.Author: mjpino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a quick ride to Orlando to visit his parents who were staying at this hotel for a convention. What a nice surprise it ended up being! We hung out by the awesome pool all day. The lazy river was so relaxing; we must've gone around 20 times. The waterslide was a lot of fun as well. The room was clean and comfortable. We went to dinner at Universal Studios, which is located right down the street. We look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrkKookla
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was awesome. Great service from valet to front desk ...everyone was super nice and accommodating. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and exactly what you would expect from a convention hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AandCreviews
Reviews.Content: The staff make the stay even that much better. We were able to check in early enjoyed a king room with a very comfortable bed. The pool area was great and the service impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this hotel just a tad disappointing though... But well recovered!”
Reviews.Author: StevenOzbun
Reviews.Content: Ok so the hotel is great and the service is good too. BUT there was one memorable moment where we were seating by who appeared to be an amazing guy who seated us in VIP at Davids and said he would be back to check on us. Well, he NEVER did. We were so happy at first then were so disappointed. Ugh. So anyhow. We decided to go back to Davids a couple days later despite the clammy sweaty flake that never came back. Our server Katie was absolutely amazing. She dealt with our requests for shrimp cocktail which they serve only at Spencers which is great by the way. She went all the way there to get it she is so great And so is the manager candie! They made up for the inept VIP server jayrazz or something like that. Love the Hilton! Thanks Katie and Candie. You rock!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Very Expensive Amenities”
Reviews.Author: grateful_travels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando for a week for business. I had a great stay, but had I not been able to charge everything back to my company, I may not have been as jazzed about the stay. All of the staff were wonderful and helpful. The room was clean and large. I had a great view of the pool. The bed was really cozy with nice, soft linens and tons of pillows. The pool was nice, and the area is HUGE so it never seemed to be crowded, and the service staff in the pool area were wonderful. The food was good, but very over-priced (no less than $25 for dinner for one, with one beer included). The internet was $20/day, which to me is pretty ridiculous. And I wasn't able to share the internet between my iPad and laptop. It wanted me to pay again when I logged in from another device. Even the small cafe/store in the lobby had mediocre sandwiches and snacks for about 3x what they should cost. The sodas/water in the machines on the floor cost $3. Also, if staying for business in the convention center, this hotel is a very short walk to the North/South tower, but about a 20 minute walk to the West tower. I found this out the hard way after booking because the hotel is advertised as "across the street from" the convention center. If you walk to overhead connectors, it is a pretty long, hot walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LGreen564
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Just perfect, wouldnt change a thing. Location was great, right on I-Trolly and just steps to many restaurants and seaworld. Staff was great, very friendly. Pool was AMAZING!!!! Request a higher floor, view is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: ds929501
Reviews.Content: Every single employee had a smile on their face and were ready to help in anyway they could! Close to shopping and Sea World! This hotel has definitely got customer service as their priority!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have changed a thing”
Reviews.Author: susaness
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 days/8 nights for a business trip. I ate only one meal there -- delicious salad lunch next to the beautiful, meandering swimming pool outside. The bed was outstandingly comfortable. The room very quiet, perfectly setup for office work where I spent many hours on my computer. Staff was cordial and courteous. The hotel is very conveniently located/connected to the Orange County Convention Center, which is where I spent most of my time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a conference.......but....”
Reviews.Author: badbullgator
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean, and well appointed hotel. The rooms are nice and the beds are good. The property is overall a very nice place. The service goes from hot to cold. Most of the service is good, but a few employees were less than friendly. As mentioned by another reviewer, they charge you for everything they can get out of you. I guess that is standard fro the area though. As much as the property is good and the service is fair, I will not stat again when I am in the area because of all the nickle and dime charges (actually way more than nickles and dimes). I had a package sent to me by FedEx while I was there. This was an urgent package and we had it sent first morning delivery. I did not hear from the desk by 9 am so I called to find out if it had been delivered. It took a while but they finally told me that it had been delivered and that I would have to go down to the UPS store to pick it up. Once I got to the UPS store I found that there was a charge to get my package! Additionally, they package was in storage and they had to go get it. It was 10 am by the time I got my urgent package. I stay in hotels over 75 nights per year on business and this is the reason why I only stay a handful of nights in Hilton's (only if they are the only option). I have packages sent to me on a regular basis while I am on the road. The vast majority of the time I stay in Marriott's and every time a package has been sent to me I get a call saying "Mr. B, your FedEx has arrived, would you like to come down or should we send it up to your room?" No charge, no sending it to someone (UPS store) that has no business handling my shipment. This will further reduce the number of nights I spend in Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anniee09
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a great stay in Orlando. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and modern and all other areas of the hotel are immaculate.All staff are extremely helpful. The pool is brilliant with it's own water slide and lazy river it's like a mini free Wet n Wild! There is also a quiet pool for those wanting a tranquil day. The gym is superbly equipped and it's open 24 hours so when you wake at at 4am still on UK time you can have a work out! The location of the hotel is right at the top end of I Drive near the convention centre. It may appear slightly remote but don't be put off - if you have a car it's no problem and if not there are shuttles to the parks and a regular bus service along I Drive and etc. One extra cost not included in the room rate is car parking - $13 per night. We has a fantastic time and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome! tho, i'll never get accustomed to 'convention center hotel convenience fees' c'mon”
Reviews.Author: BMINLGM
Reviews.Content: A great stay at a recent conference, rooms are spectacular, team members always available to answer any question you have, and the rate was great too. Again, if you are shipping a package to yourself or co-worker be prepared to pay a $25 'convenience' fee to the business center just to get the package sprung from their care. Otherwise, a first class operation - keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but show-room new, and fantastically staffed...”
Reviews.Author: W_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler --usually in luxury hotels -- I have to say this staff was, hands-down, the best staff I've every seen. You never heard any of them say the word "no." All in good moods.. all happy and cheerful. Really remarkable. Overall, the hotel is good -- not high end luxury like a Four Seasons -- an excellent value. Seemingly brand new. Clean as can be. It's ridiculously huge, but doesn't have one of those enormous, grand, soaring lobbies..which was nice. They have a lobby that feels like you're in a smaller hotel. The two negatives were -- breakfast buffet was just mediocre and - this is really nitpicky -- but, in my opinion, the hotel wasn't very logically laid out. (Normally when in a lobby, etc., you just kind of have a feeling of how to get to the bar.. and the restaurants.. and the coffee shop, etc. I thought this took more effort to navigate.) Overall, the staff was unreal.. even when under tremendous pressure (I was there with 1000 people for a conference -- so everyone wants to do the exact same thing at the exact same moment),,, all the while, this staff shined. Remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: jonesgirl84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night, October 8th, to celebrate our anniversary and to see a concert in Downtown Disney. The hotel is beautiful, room was clean and felt brand new. I mentioned that it was our anniversary, and a little after we checked in, they came up with chocolate strawberries and a bottle of sparkling wine! I'm a Hilton Honors member, so not sure if that made a difference. Such a great surprise, we were so happy and it really helped make our (otherwise crazy) night great. The "crazy" part of our night is that our car broke down on the way to our concert that night (in the pouring rain). I called the concierge and they gave us tow numbers, taxi number (so we could get to the concert) and the name of the nearest garage that they recommended. We made it to the concert, got our car towed the next day, and still managed to have a great weekend. The only sad thing is that we didn't get to enjoy the pools--the weather was terrible and it was storming the entire time we were there, so the pools were closed. They looked beautiful though, and the lazy river seemed pretty large. Highly recommend this hotel--great location, beautiful rooms, incredible service! We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location let's it down”
Reviews.Author: Bikerian60
Reviews.Content: It's a big US Hilton and that comes with everything you expect - and to be fair delivers albeit without muc style. It's location ( for Orlando) is just a bit off - away from the parks, airport and international drive.

Reviews.Title: “great, but not for family”
Reviews.Author: Baquba
Reviews.Content: Checked in Thursday October 13, 2011, checking out Sunday. Almost everything great, Huge, beautifull hotel. Bell stand/valet/registration/maid service workers all friendly and great service. Eexcept not the best for family I have two kids 2 and 6. “family pool” and lazy river way to cold. My kids lips are blue after 5 mins, my wife will not get in past her waist. The quite pool seems to be heated better, but we get the stink eye if we go there with the family. No good dinner choices for kids just fancy restaurant. I have stayed at many high end hotels all over Florida, I have never been told that I am doing anything wrong. I guess I was wrong, but within seconds of getting into executive lounge for snacks, manager was very concerned and ask us to leave to get shoes for our 2 year old, wife did. Anyway, not felling the family love I told managerI was not pleased, but I did apologize. Coincidentally security was there 3 minutes later. I felt the stink eye and left. Off to eat out again. Should have taken family to Hilton Grand vacation club. I usually go there, heated pool is perfect, kids and family can eat and don’t get the stink eye or feel threatened by managers and security.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hays1476
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights in September. Very attractive, clean modern hotel close to sea world and in between Universal and Disney. Fantastic pool area with awesome lazy river. Lovely fresh food, lovely gardens. Staff at reception, executive club, bell desk, concierge and shops were all wonderful. Only negative was maid service, our room was never attended to until mid to late afternoon every day of our stay. Most days between 2 and 4 pm which is not acceptable. Hilton website states crabtree and Evelyn amenities in room which I love and use so was looking forward to using these and not having to bring my own but the amenities in room were a different brand with quite a masculine scent. Would like to stay again but maid service needs to lift their game.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Woody517
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it going on...From the time you step out of your car to the time you leave, you are greeted with smiles and sincere appreciation for your business. My room was spotless and wonderful. It overlooked the very inviting pool...everyday all I wanted to do was lay by the lazy river... I did eat at Spendcers one night...Food and service was phoneminal. I honestly can not find one negative thing to say about this hotel. Go and Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “All Hiltons should aim to be this good.”
Reviews.Author: TGU-ORD
Reviews.Content: All Hiltons should aim to be this good. SO good that Hampton Inn management hosted their convention here last week! Just returned from my 3 night stay. I was going to the Disney parks, have stayed at the Hilton WDW which I was not impressed, but decided to check this hotel out because of its overwhelmingly positive review, and I will repeat what others state, this hotel is OUTSTANDING! I am HH gold member, was issued a top floor, executive room, pool view. I asked for more room since we were a group, and was issued a Parlor Suite! This Suite is an adjacent room that includes a living room/dinning room set up! Outstanding! It has an extra full bathroom, wetbar, large flatscreen TV. Turndown service each night (includes a mint, mood lighting, curtains closed, tv turned on to smooth music. WOW!) Small details make a difference. The hotel is large, attached to the convention center and designed to have capacity for large conventions, but it does not have that stale feeling that other megahotels have. Everyone was friendly! The executive lounge is large, plenty of seating, continental breakfast till 11am, has an espresso machine that I made my best friend, dinner snacks at 5pm, desserts at 8pm. – this is truly something else! The food quality was top! and it is not fried mystery meat, this was good! Also full stocked Honor Bar. Staff is super friendly and attentive, Holly assisted us at Exec L and she was super friendly. I did see a manager come in at breakfast to check up on things, so it is good that management is doing its best. The big pro this hotel has is that it is 2 years new, so everything works, all top notch, comfortable beds. I used the gym, it is large, clean, new, plenty of machines, precors have tv screen, has huge windows and tall ceilings. I also used the steam room in the spa ($15 charge, free for gold/diamond). Spa is very nice! I also used the pool, it is huge, loved lazy river! Check in was quick, friendly staff. The biggest tip I can give to people is if on vacation, even business, spend one full day in hotel just enjoying it, the pool, volleyball/basketball courts, the gym, etc.. It makes no sense to quickly get out of there to go to a water resort when the hotel has one included! The only thing I did not like is parking is extra, per day $20 valet, $13 self….but if you self park, you drive around the hotel to the back and the entrance leads you to lobby…total less than 5 minute walk…this is not like other hotels that you go into adjacent massive parking structures that you have to walk for what seems like a mile. I can go on and on, but this is one of the top US Hiltons I have stayed in, and I have been diamond/gold for the past 5 years, should be a Conrad, . Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and what a deal!!”
Reviews.Author: daLesters
Reviews.Content: We (myself, DH, DD (8) ) stayed at the Hilton October 1- 3 after finishing a 7 day cruise. We booked the hotel directly through SeaWorld as part of a package deal. If SeaWorld is on your agenda for the trip look at thier website for potential packages!! For about $400 we had 2 nights in a pool view room (after signing up for Hilton points), 1 Day admission for all three of us to SeaWorld (included a free second day that we did not use), 1 Day All Day Dining for the three of us and 3 front of the line passes (more on the passes below). The room was beautiful, clean and spacious (especially after 7 days in a cruise cabin!!) The beds were beyond comfortable and we had more than enough space for all our luggage. The lobby is huge and reminded me of a big Las Vegas resort type of hotel. There was a Starbucks, a store for wine and snacks, a few restaurants and a really nice looking lounge. None of which we used ;-) There are also some nice restaurants on site (according the the info). We spent our first day just hanging out by the pool. This is one of the best pool areas for a hotel, resort, all inclusive resort you name it, that we've experienced!! The temp of the pool was perfect, the lazy river was great fun = so impressed that they just provide the floating tubes, no rental required!!! The hot tubs in the evening were fantastic! We had a drink and a snack at the pool bar - fantastic food! The chicken wings were huge and soooo tasty. The chicken strips for DD were really good too - and real chicken breast, not formed nuggets!! We would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location can't be beat either - a quick drive to Disney or Seaworld or the Outlet mall!! Anything you want in Orlando is an easy drive away. So about the Quick passes...this is the one negative of our entire time at the Hilton. After checking in we were told to talk to Conceirge about obtaining all the passes and info we needed for our packed. We had printed our tickets online and DH was told that the quck queue passes would be given to us at Seaworld....hmmmm nope. When we arrived it took no less than 4 different Seaworld employees to help us out. Finally a fabulous lady in Guest Information provided us with 3 VIP passes. Turns out this happens almost daily - the hotel says we get the passes at the park and the park says we should have obtained something from the hotel. We stopped by concierge at the end of the day to let them know about the mistake and they were "oh yeah that happens all the time... oh well". Something needs to be done to fix the communication between these two because it is not the guests issue to fix!! I will be contacting Seaworld and Hilton on a letter in the near future to advise them again of this issue. Any questions feel free to message me!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieannAGM
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is amazing. The people are super and the hotel is beautiful and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: tespaulding1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night visit to this hotel and have nothing but praises for the staff. The room was beautiful, I believe the hotel is only a year or two old. All of the lovely touches that make Hilton so successfully. The room and public areas shined because they were so clean. The room was refreshed each evening as we were out for dinner. Bed turned down, mints, soft lighting and soothing music in the back ground. The food was outstanding, we ate numerous meals there. The experience at Spencers was top notch, many thanks to Tom and his assistant server for the delightful service. They were entertaining and professional at the same time, we just loved it. The stand out item at this hotel has got to be the staff. Each and everyone shared a level of service that you don't see very often anymore. The general manager was in the lobby daily, many different times making sure that this level of service is consistent. Without a doubt, when traveling to Orlando, whether on business or pleasure, the Orlando Hilton is a must stay! I look forward to returning. Easy access to the airport, with the attractions just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: Kimmo63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Orlando for 7-nights. Our room on the 14th floor was only average (it was too small). The hotel restaurants and the food were ok. The pool area and the fitness room were excellent. Location was also good. E.g. only five minutes walk from the I ride trolley route. Trolley was nice and easy to use, you just hop on and hop off from the trolley. Many outlets and restaurants were on the route / on the International drive (it was also cheap to use, e.g. three day pass $6.00 per person).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kharisma1
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel today- beautiful, brand new, super friendly staff. But most importantly, we got to our room and the carpet seemed wet- we weren't sure we were comfortable with how damp it was so we called the front desk. Within 5 minutes maintenance was in our room to begin working on the issue (carpet cleaning hadn't dried yet), and with a new room assignment and keys for us!! No better way to judge customer service than in response to a problem, and in all of my years in many hotels, never has customer service been better. Wonderful hotel, really fun pool area, great for the family. Looking forward to the rest of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Overall has a business feel to it not one for the family trying to enjoy the I drive area of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: jogall30
Reviews.Content: Expensive for what you get. They wanted $15 per 24hr for Internet! Pool area was clinical. The valet staff were the best - great fun & always attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BCmarietta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is updated, clean, and beautiful. It is the perfect place for business and families. The service is the best I have ever experienced. My only negative was the cooling. I never felt I coul get my room cool enough. But this is not a deal breaker - I will be recommending this to everyone I know going there.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! the spirit of hospitality lives on!”
Reviews.Author: TheMangoMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week long convention and all I can say is WOW! What a great place I am a little jaded when it comes to hotels but this one helped me regain my confidence that there is still hotel people that can do it right and do it well at the same time. If you want to treat yourself and relax this is the place to be thanks Hilton Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Varvara H
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hilton. It has a water slide, a great lazy river, and 2 huge pools. There is a poolside bar & restaurant that has good food and great service. There are outdoor TV's which make drinking a Margarita and watching football a lot of fun. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Employees are friendly and helpful. It's a very nice place to unwind after the exhaustion of Disney & Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: TXTwoStep
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks brand new, staff is helpful, smiles and is everywhere you turn. In this lean times it can be hard to find a bellman or concierge at a nice hotel but not here. Located between Sea World and Universa and 7 miles to Disneyl, its located close to eveywhere you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Walesvisit0r
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel. Spacious clean rooms and great service. We probably waste some of the many facilities as dont have time to use them but what we have used has been very good indeed. Many attractions, restaurants and chain eateries, plus wonderful outlet shopping all so close by.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa A
Reviews.Content: Just finished a five night girls' getaway with my daughter. My expectations were blown out of the water with the Hilton Orlando. From the moment we pulled up to the lobby, we were given the royal treatment. The customer service was by far the best I have received at a hotel/resort. Every employee was friendly and went out of their way to make our stay great. My daughter (and me) could have stayed poolside for the entire five days! From the beautiful landscape, the music, the food, and especially the lazy river, we were in heaven.The room was clean and tasteful. The amenities were over the top, and the restaurants were fantastic. It is more the worth the price for this resort. We didn't want to leave on our last day. We are already looking forward to our next stay at the Hilton Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business and Family”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. I used this hotel every month for the past 5 months. The service is impeccable and immediate. They have been very helpful with requests that arise from entertaining clients. Further, this hotel is great for the family to meet you at the end of a trip. The slides, the pools and the proximity to the parks and I-Drive all perfect for any type of central Florida vacation. Without question, I would recommend this hotel to any level of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: I'm a Silver Diamond HHonors member. Over 100+ nights a year in hotels. Mostly Hamptons or Hilton Garden Inns as I pay my own business expenses. However, my family came with me so I booked this hotel because I thought the pool was great. My girls, 5 and 10 year old never left the pool(s) and I was entrenched in the lazy river. We didn't need to go to a water park. Saved $200 right there! Outstanding staff that is second to none including the top tier hotels. Immaculate public areas and the room was top shelf. Management is always roaming around inspecting the troops and making sure guests are taken care of. This is the best hotel, in its class, that I have stayed at in over 30 years of traveling. Kudo's to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Seven64
Reviews.Content: This is 4th time we stay at the Hilton in Orlando. The hotel always has excellent promotions if you prepay your reservation. Rooms are spacious and clean. Location is close to Disney and Universal. The hotel has an excellent pool area which includes a lazy river. Great to relax after a day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay @ Hilton Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Dargarov
Reviews.Content: Staying here with my family over a long weekend. Was planning on splitting 4 nights between this property and the HGI at Sea World but changed our mind and cancelled the HGI once we saw the property. The staff is clearly on point due to a major convenstion with every possible employee offering assistance at every opportunity (even the parking attendant is standing outside his/her booth offering assistance with entry/exit from the parking deck. Spent our first day at Sea World and took advantage of excellent shuttle service that we booked through the concierge. Today we spent all day by the superb pool including trips down the lazy river and water slide. Management offerred to extend our stay at the weekday rate so we have cancelled our HGI reservations and will stay here through the weekend. Got an executive floor upgrade due to my Hilton Honors status and we are really enjoying the free continental breakfasts, hot hor's d'ouvres, and nighttime desserts. As an added bonus, we can clearly see the Disney fireworks from the end of our hall on the 19th floor...very cool! Only been two nights but, so far, the Hilton Orlando has been an exceptional value and a fabulous plae to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination”
Reviews.Author: daraou2000
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hilton Orlando for a weekend getaway with my husband. I am local but I did not feel at all like I was fifteen minutes from home. It was a beautiful hotel and clean. The pool was great. They had a large pool for families and a nice size pool for adults only as well. The lazy river was great!! Very relaxing. All the staff were very helpful. The food was good as well. The executive lounge was nice with a good breakfast. The price was well worth the stay. You are close to lots of tourist destinations as well. I would definitely stay again and bring my child too.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, well-priced, pool area outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Cathy A
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of Hiltons, and their quality is almost always reliable, but we thought this one was just a cut above, especially for the price (click on "specials" if you are booking online, & you can pay considerably less if you pay up front, which is of course non-refundable but quite a savings). We have gotten a lot less quality at other hotels for what we paid, and the pool area is a destination in itself! The rooms are pretty standard, but nice & clean, up-to-date with very comfortable beds. We paid a little extra for the upgrade for a higher floor with a pool view, and wow, we loved looking down on the pool area. We were there for a family weekend getaway, and we spent all of Saturday enjoying the gorgeous pool, lazy river, and really fun water slide (which is not just for kids, by the way!). too. The pool area is very well-staffed, and we received fabulous service from the poolside servers. The other thing I must mention about the pool areas are that they are extremely well-designed in terms of space & landscaping. There is a separate adult-only area, and we never really even saw it - which tells you they accomplish the privacy goal there. I was expecting the "family area" to be crowded & noisy, but the design was genius, it did not feel that way at all. When you are on the lazy river, you might as well be in some secluded tropical paradise, it was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience for a work trip”
Reviews.Author: laurmadillo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando for a work conference in September of 2010. This place was incredible! The pool was gorgeous, the rooms were clean and up to date, and the catered food was even really good. There were tons of meeting rooms, helpful staff who could direct you if you got lost (the place is huge) and many places to eat and get snacks. Dinner in the restaurant was pricey but delicious. The hotel is central to many things. I would even stay there with my family. Our organization had such a great experience that we booked the Hilton to host our conference again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be staying here again, and I would highly recommend this hotel. We paid $99 for a one night stay (plus taxes) and it was a bargain. I have been going to Orlando at 3-5 times a year since I was born and this was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in Orlando for the value. The hotel is walking distance from the convention center on international drive. It is about 30-45 minutes to the UCF area depending on traffic. The room was spacious and very clean. Room service was quick, and Spencer's (Hotel steakhouse) was amazing! There were 6 elevators in service that led to our room, so we never had to wait for an elevator, which is a big plus. I hate valeting my car and was pleased to see a self-parking option in addition to the valet. The parking garage led right into the hotel lobby. We were unable to use the pool because we were only there for one night, but it looked beautiful. I noticed there was a slide and a lazy river. We are definitely going back to this hotel, and we do the pool will be something I make time for because it looked amazing. Overall I don't have any complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing. Resort appeal.”
Reviews.Author: travelfam61873
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orlando Hilton for a spring break "get-a-way." We had relaxation in mind and skipped the "theme parks" as we have teenagers. We absolutely loved this hotel. The pool is top-notch resort style. Rooms are nice and they upgraded our rooms without us asking. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite resort ever!!”
Reviews.Author: DaytonaBch
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando resort is our favorite resort now! We've stayed here twice in the past month for weekend stays with our children. We all loved the pool, waterslide, lazy river & basketball in the pool! The front desk associates were wonderful and very welcoming. The guest service associate even remembered us from a previous stay. We were there for my son's birthday! They made our stay extra special! Everyone at this resort definitely is focused on making the guests' vacation a wonderful & positive experience! We used to stay at the Disney resorts, but the we will now be staying at the Hilton Orlando resort from now on! We were able to ck in early. Everything was new. The beds were extremely comfortable! The associates were very friendly and went out of their way to make everything perfect for us! We are residents of Florida, and usually spend at least one weekend per month in Orlando with our children. Thank you for an awesome fun filled weekend with our family! We didn't even leave the hotel! The kids loved the pool area. Food was great and reasonably priced at the pool restaurant! We'll see you again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0305
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an event and thought the service and staff were top notch! the pool was great and room service was fast and quality!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Business, not so sure about for a leisure visit”
Reviews.Author: Jules-Nottm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Orlando for two weeks on our annual visit to the US; we were attracted to this Hotel as it was new and we have stayed at other Hilton's and enjoyed the service and quality of the rooms/food. All the facilities are bright and modern, a choice of two restaurants, a beach bar, sports bar and deli store. The main clientele are business trips, with the hotel situated right next door to Orlando Convention Centre. On th first night we were unable to enjoy time in the bar due to some very loud customers literally shouting at each other in the Bar, the beach bar by the pool had already closed at 8pm so we were confined to our room with some food/drinks from the deli store. We complained to the Hotel Management the next day and were given an apology and some comlimentary drinks. The room was bright, clean and modern overlooking the Pool area, the bed and pillows were very comfy and we were happy with the room facilities. Buffet style breakfast, typical of Hilton was served and was lovely. This is a good place to base yourself for exploring Orlando, right next to the Bus station across the road but you don't get disturbed by any noise. We ate dinner in both the sports bar and steak restuarant and cannot fault the food or service; all staff were friendly and professional. We ordered room service a few times and this again was a good standard and typical of Hiltons. Although this is a great Hotel with good amenities I wouldnt recommend it for a holiday/vacation as it's mainly business travellers in the Hotel. We visited in February/March 2010 so not sure if the atmosphere improves in the summer. The pool area ans lazy river with hot tubs and seating was well laid out and relaxing, the spa and fitness area were good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and right by Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1313
Reviews.Content: I got an email in advance of my stay to check in on the Club level. They had bfast and snacks there too as well as bottled water. The gym is huge. Rooms were clean and bed was comfy. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but let down by the charge for wifi”
Reviews.Author: Zills
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our vacation, pool area was especially good, room comfortable but we felt that the cost for wifi connection was exorbitant at almost $14 not even per room but per device!!! The room description we viewed when choosing this hotel listed wireless availability in rooms alongside iron, ironing board and hair dryer - no mention of extra payment and in this day and age I would expect wifi to be complimentary. If a charge must be made why should it be at least twice as much for 24hrs than I pay per month at home. Other than that complaint I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: Oak01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Orlando Convention Center for a function. The overall property is very nice, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool area, cabana's and lazy river are all excellent amenities. The rooms and bathrooms are both decent sized, bedding very comfortable. The downside of this property is the noise you can hear from the hallway's of doors opening, closing and people talking. In addition, you can hear water running in the bathrooms of adjoining rooms. For a property that is new within the past 5 years, this is somewhat frustrating and one would think would be avoidable in new construction.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Sevice Best Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: drjeff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was attending a large convention and the hotel adjoins the convention cneter. Was I surprised. I have stayed at Hilton wordkwide and am an Honnor memberl This is by far the best run Hilton that I have ever stayed in. Kudos to the management. I attended this same convention last year and stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Denver. This hotel was better. From teh chamber maids to the mangers there is a can do attitude and they make your stay here wondreful. The food in the restaurants is excellent. The property is immacualte. There are 2 elevator bays with 6 elevators each so syou never wait more than a few minutes for an elevator. I am usualyy very critical but have only great things to say about this hotel. FYI there are 2 convetnion center buildings which do adjoin but mine was in the second building so even thoug the Hilton adjoined the convention cneter I had to wakl 20 minutes vis overed walk way to the second building so ask where your convetnion will be held before you book. Any way this hotel is much nicer than the Peabody which adjoins building number 1.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - when it's not too busy”
Reviews.Author: em04
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly new so the rooms and grounds are all still clean and beautiful. We checked in on a Saturday evening, my husband is a Diamond member so we got a room on the higher floors with access to the Executive Lounge. My husband went to check it out and said there were lots of families so we went along with our daughters. Seeing as I have kids I shouldn't complain about others, however I expect mine to behave and if they don't we leave. The Executive lounge was packed and there were kids in line taking full trays of food for themselves as soon as it was brought out, I watched a little girl who had been left there by her mother scoop every last spoonful of dip from a bowl on the buffet onto her plate. I understand this is Orlando so you get a lot of family travelers but if I were an actual Executive, I would not be happy. As for the adults I'm not so sure how honourable users of the honour bar were. We didn't even bother checking what it was like the next morning at breakfast. We went for a walk by the pool that evening and it too was crowded and noisy. At this point I was not too thrilled with how this stay was going. However the next day as more people checked out on a Sunday it was like a completely different place. Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was busy but pleasant. Good food, and good service. We spent the morning at the pool and had a great time. We walked around the coference areas downstairs and it was all very nice. Although it's no fault of the hotel, the experience you have based on the other guests can really make or break a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: phototrip
Reviews.Content: Highly Recommend for vacationers! After a day at one of the area attractions or work, this hotel has the best pool area. Pros Clean Friendly staff Great pool area. Relaxing. No pressure servers. Rooms are well done. Checkin was painless. Cons Not close to the I-trolley compared to other hotels in the area. Not walkable to convention center compared to other area hotels. Concierge weren't as friendly as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton-Orlanfo”
Reviews.Author: Dinstuhl
Reviews.Content: This is by any measure the flagship hotel of the Hilton fleet. I was there 3 years ago for the grand opening and it was as shiny and new as you would expect. Visiting 3 years later and the property is still as shiny and new but the staff has become more experienced and if possible more congenial. Simply put this is a wonderful hotel from the outstanding steaks in Spencer's Steak House to the water park and what I would consider to be moderately priced. All in all, one of my favorite places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pal0211
Reviews.Content: I just checked in (9/15/11) staying for 7 nights for a conference. I am impressed with the property and everyone I've come in contact with, from the bell staff, front desk and business center. The hotel is immaculate, my room is spotless with great beds, modern bathroom and beautiful grounds. I'm looking forward to my stay...and coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Hotel in Region”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for one night last week but it was well worth the short trip. Had to attend a meeting at the hotel and I was definitely impressed. The check-in was quick and smooth and the desk agent was informative. The room was beautifully appointed and fairly spacious. The bed was comfortable and was a king so it was also roomy. The desk area was well laid out and there were definitely enough outlets in the room in convenient places to recharge phones and connect laptops. The bathroom was also well equipped and clean. In room safe was useful and big enough to hold two laptops. We had a view of the newer side of the Orange County Convention Center and noticed there is a covered walkway to the convention center which seems convenient. Only downside was the need to pay for parking (not unusual for anywhere near the convention center) and having to navigate through the one exit when everyone left the meeting at the same time (we are talking about over 1,000 attendees), made for a long wait to get out of the garage. They need to get a better system for this. Overall an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris_traveler25
Reviews.Content: This year I went on vacation to Orlando. I hadn't been there in a little over 25 years. Everything has changed so much. Anyway, my reason for staying at this particular hotel wasn't just for vacation. I was also there for a convention. The hotel is conveniently located next door to the convention center but it is also near a lot of other places as well. No need to rent a car even though you can if you wanted to since a Hertz Rental Car is located on the property. However, why pay for a rental when you can purchase a 3 day pass on I-Trolley for $6. It takes you all up and down International Drive and drops you off at any major attraction with the exception of Disney. But you can always take the public bus to Disney. The major bus station is one block away on Destination Parkway. Take bus #111 to Disney. Just make sure it's traveling the right direction. One bus is going to Disney and the other is coming from Disney. My mother and I loved the hotel room. It had a hidden room safe and hidden refrigerator. However, no microwaves. That's the only thing I didn't like. The restaurants were ok in the hotel. Not that the food wasn't good. It was but some were a bit expensive. But at the same time, you have restaurants up and down International Drive where you can get a meal for a really decent price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jbj0709
Reviews.Content: Just back from another 2 night stay at the Hilton Orlando and it was just as good as our first time! The woman at check in was delightful and efficient, our room was nicely decorated, large enough for 2 of us and very clean! The bed and comforter was very comfortable and I really like that they have large towels in the bathrooms. The pool area is very large and they have plenty of chaise lounges, we enjoyed the lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorites”
Reviews.Author: DemandingGuest
Reviews.Content: Despite the location (away from Disney a bit), I stay at this hotel often because it is so awesome. It is new, and beautifully appointed. The stairwell from the lobby to the pool level, with its glass and aluminum structure and fused glass chandelier above, is a visual treat. The pool was so much fun, even I enjoyed it. The Lazy River was a great time with the water spouts or cannons shooting at us. My son and I had a wonderful time. There is no need to wait for a convention to stay here. For the price and quality, there are few hotels in the area that compete. Even if you are spending time at Disney or Universal, it is only a short (5-10 min) drive to either, and you will save big money and be esconced in luxury. Here's a tip; Get the concierge upgrade. The executive lounge that comes with the upgrade is relaxing and has great food/drinks. It was the perfect place to wind down and have a little something to eat. The cost is small, but the value of the upgrade is worth every penny. Here's another tip: The road (Destination Pkwy) didn't show up on my car's navigation system. Try using "Hawaiian Ct," which is what Destination Pkwy changes to when it crosses International Dr. Don't worry about the building number (6000) because once you are in the area you will have no trouble seeing the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, but I didn't leave completely WOWed.”
Reviews.Author: MsDanger
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2 night stay in the Hilton. This was a weekend trip to celebrate my significant other's birthday. Right off the bat I'm going to state what disappointed me. I called ahead, I let the front desk know I was staying for a birthday, and were there any amenities or options available? I was quickly transferred to another department (it might have been food services) I was told I could buy a cake, but when I asked for for more information and prices I was told I'd have to speak to someone when I got there. My whole point of calling ahead was to surprise him and Hilton, you basically shut me out. I'm guessing because I'm not a member of a Hilton rewards there's no obligation to impress me. That being said the only other thing I want to point out is their rooms. Its not that I did not like them, its that they didn't impress me all that. For a 4 star hotel, it was just average, nothing spectacular I've seen much nicer 4 star rooms, but I understand this is a huge corporate run hotel. The bed is comfortable, the linens are clean, everything is modern, I did enjoy the mini fridge and the arm chair and ottoman. The bathroom had a few hairs in the tub (YUCK!) but it was free of any scum and mold. Now, the property itself is WHY this is a 4 star hotel. This place is huge, massive even. I was very impressed, I loved the lazy river and the water slide was great. There is SO much to do here. You could stay here a couple of days and make a vacation out of it. I LOVED that the pool was open until 11pm. I loathe sitting in my hotel room at 9pm with nothing to do, I'm a night owl. At night there were fire pits and that was a nice touch. I can't say much about service or staff, I was barely in the hotel and the only time I spoke to any staff was during check in. Now a few things I have to rant about....$14 to park? The Double Tree down the street and MUCH closer to Sea World is only $10. A daily charge of internet access? Why are hotels still doing this? And 4 star hotels at that, all your doing is upsetting customers. Besides in this age of technology all I have to do is use my phone as a wireless router. The prices for food here are RIDICULOUS. I know I'm on vacation and should/do indulge, but $22 for some OJ and 2 muffins? The mark up on that is ludicrous. FYI, if you leave the hotel and make a right on I-drive there are TONS of places to eat. From what I've heard there's a little breakfast place in front of the Double Tree hotel (right on the other side of the highway) that is suppose to be great. I travel to Orlando quite a bit; I got a great deal on Priceline so if I could find another deal like that, I would probably consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of family friendly amenities but pricey”
Reviews.Author: WYO_Canuck
Reviews.Content: We attended a convention here in September 2011. The hotel lobby is clean, modern and inviting. Check-in was a breeze. I did note the hotel offered fresh air rooms (which stuck me as a little odd) but when I walked into my non-smoking king room I understood why there was an option. The room had a definite smell of having been smoked in for years. The accessories, furniture, carpet and bedding all looked clean and new so I don't quite understand the reason for the odor but it was very noticeable indeed. I don't consider myself overly picky or sensitive, but I did find it annoying that the hotel offered a fresher "pure allergy" room for $20 more than the standard ns King accommodation. The beds were very comfortable, internet service was speedy, coffeemaker had "real" half-and-half (which was a nice surprise as I usually bring my own when I travel). The room was equipped with a nice large tv and safe as well as the usual accoutrements. There was, however, no makeup mirror in the bathroom which I found quite surprising.
