I had one meal at the hotel in David's Club. The meal ($40) was very nice, service was good, but the after dinner glass of house wine in the bar was $13, which I considered very pricy. The hotel did also have a spa however I found the rate of $190 far to expensive to consider. Excellent amenities in the way of a swimming pool (two of them) with plenty of lounging spots, a water slide, cabanas, hot tub, a jogging/walking path, tennis court, and even a putting green. Do see the hotel photos of the grounds, I imagine they are a great draw for families who want to wind down from a day at the local attractions. There is a relaxing pool bar and lounge, and a charming little gift shop run by a very lovely woman. There is also a Marketplace for grab-and go snacks, soda, and some Italian gelato which is made on premises. Breakfast restaurant (called The Bistro) is downstairs adjacent to the pool, they feature a buffet for $20 ppsn or a la carte items. Cab from the Orlando airport will run about $ 45. Meares ground transportation is $30 round trip, a better value. Overall: nice hotel especially if you can take advantage of the pool area, but overpriced in the bar and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ipanema09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Orlando with family in august. Very new, great pool area (with private cabanas) and fitness center with the newest cardio equipment available. No doubt it is a very kid friendly hotel. Nice restaurant for dinner at the lobby area. Great Location, just besides The Convention Center. Room was clean and met Hilton standards. Internet is very fast and free for gold/diamond members. Breakfast was just ok at the executive lounge, crowed every morning. Valet parking a bit pricey. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: magocytosis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. I was in town for Surf Expo 2011 and stayed at this property. The staff was fantastic, even when I needed two sets of silverware at 2:00 am!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a convention”
Reviews.Author: tracyldale
Reviews.Content: We attended a convention here over September 7-9, and had a nice time. The convention staff was nice and attentive, the restrooms were well kept, and everything was serviced very professionally. The hotel itself - the bed wasn't too bad. A bit harder than I typically enjoy, but surprisingly it was still comfortable. The rooms have all your typical needs and were well dressed and kept up with. The maid service was excellent. All the staff that we encountered were very nice, including the valet service that we used - everyone was helpful with full information offered. The pool is great, and they have large inner-tubes with handles on them that can accomodate most sizes of people for their lazy river pool. The lazy river pool isn't as in depth or nice as the one at J.W. Marriott, but we appreciate the little extra's like the inner-tubes. The "Quiet Pool" was also a plus, as the piped in music is a little quieter then everywhere else. The main pool was nice, as well, and we really saw very few children, probably due to the location and the fact that it does seem to host quite a few conventions (there was at least one other at the hotel during this time). The restaurants were hit and miss. Spencer's, which is the nice, high end steak house, had no openings until about 8PM due to previous reservations (not a problem), so we sat in the bar area. We told the Maitre'D that we'd be eating there (and he offered to help the three of us fit into the bar by moving a couple of patrons down a chair, but we decided to sit at one of the tables, instead). We literally received no service until one of us went to tell him we hadn't been served - and it's not like there were no waiters...several were standing around looking a bit bored (we assumed the reservations were staggered, as there were a lot of empty tables in the main dining area). Not a problem, he was gracious, and after that our service was perfect. Main complaints - this is a HIGH END steak house. Simple things were overlooked (I asked for blue cheese stuffed olives in a drink, "if you have them" - I received Feta stuffed with no indication; the soup wasn't very interesting, the food was overpriced and varied - for the prices they charge I expect excellent food overall). We also dined at David's Club, which was great even when swamped. It's a bar with big cushy chairs, and a friendly staff - the food was solid, not amazing, but for a bar it was a bit higher end and decent enough. The "Marketplace" had good food, but it was extremly overpriced in some departments, and others not so bad. Typical for a "resort style" hotel. On another Convention note - some of the people that I met while there were served UNDERCOOKED chicken from the dinner that was sponsored that night (not a buffet), but, everything else was fine. Overall, good hotel, I would return, and wouldn't hesitate to come for a bit of a vacation trip if there was a convention there considering the pools and services are pretty empty during the day. The location is across from the Convention Center, and there are a ton of restaurants in this area, along with other things that a family could easily enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “My FAVORITE Orlando hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolegirl811
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. It's our little weekend get-a-way. I love the lazy river, and like that the river, pool and slide are in close proximity to eachother which makes keeping track of busy children a breeze! Recommend the pool bar! Drinks and food were amazing. Rooms are very nice quality and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: floatinginparadise
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 month old and I stayed here the weekend of July 4th. Our initial customer service impression wasn't great. We arrived tired, after an 8hr drive, on a Friday around 4pm. There were only 2 people working the check-in counter and it took us about 20 minutes to check in. Everything after that was fantastic. The pool and lazy river were wonderful. I personally enjoyed eating at the poolside cafe, as it was the only place we ate at during our stay. I thought the prices were good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, well-located hotel - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aliwat
Reviews.Content: My family visited this Hilton and the Orlando area in March and we could not have been happier. The property seems almost new, it's in a perfect location (right between the airport and Disney) and close to a million restaurants, Sea World, etc. The staff were all friendly and VERY accommodating and the property, restaurants and pools were all fabulous. I am still daydreaming about that lazy river... Thank you so much for making us feel so welcome, Hilton Orlando - we will be back next March!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: frekwentflier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to this hotel for a combo vacation/conference. I'm a Hilton Gold, so I received a room on the top floor and had access to the Executive Lounge there. The hotel is very new and beautiful. The room was medium-sized, but plenty large enough for the 2 of us. The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. The bathroom had a walk-in shower and granite countertop, very nice! There is both a mini-fridge and safe in the dresser drawers. I didn't know there was a safe as it is hidden in the top right drawer. The mini-fridge came in very handy for keeping drinks cold. The real draw to this hotel is the pool area. Simply put, it is amazing! The pool is very large! The water slide and lazy river were a lot of fun. There is a second, smaller pool, but we didn't visit it. We only ate in the Executive Lounge and conference, not any restaurants. The food was OK. I expected a better offering, but it was OK. We also had dinner at the conference we attended. That food was excellent! And the lunch provided at the conference was very good too! You can pay extra and get a pool-view room or a fireworks-view room. We chose to do neither. The gym was the best I have ever seen at any hotel I've stayed at! And the spa beside it was wonderful! As a Hilton Gold, I was able to get access to the spa facilities for free. I used the steam room quite a bit, and it was nice to be able to use this facility while at the pool rather than going up to our room. The other huge positive to this hotel is the amazing staff! EVERY single staff member we came across said hello with a smile. They even had staff manning the exit from the parking garage just to make sure you could get in/out OK. The young ladies in the Executive Lounge were top-notch! I could have done without the $13/day self-parking fee, but I can understand why they charge it. Valet would have been $20, but I see no reason for that as the parking garage is attached to the hotel. You can't go wrong here! This hotel is a mecca in itself and close to everything on International Drive. Definitely worth checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Staff have very very bad attitude - better available for less in the area.”
Reviews.Author: teachertim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here, good hotel in terms of environs and furnishings. Breakfast was good and the pool area was great. NIce quiet adult pool which was good. However, staff were very very rude, worst staff at any hilton I've ever been to. Did not start well because when we arrived, because we did not require the valet, he told us to move the car to the car park at the back - he would not even let us unload there. Reception staff were unhelpful, we asked for additional pillows there times and non ever arrived. Generally, the staff had a massive superiority complex. In my opinion, this hotel is nothing special and not worth paying the extra $$ for. Far better properties for less money in the area. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: park46393
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we are hilton honors members and it was accessible to the convention center where our convention was being held. Although it is connected to the convention center, depending on which wing your meetings are in..it was a very long walk. The hotel is awesome..we truly enjoyed our stay, the rooms are exceptionally cleaned. We did encounter a problem with our room, all of our request are noted on our profile, we were told upon check in that our room was feather-free; however it was not. It took (3) phone request and tips to get the room feather free. The first person that came to the room just verified what we already knew...that the duvet was not feather free and said to call and someone would come and remove and bring a blanket...this was tip #1-someone did come about (5) minutes later to remove the duvet and only leave a blanket at the foot of the bed-(tip #2) we left to eat lunch and returned to take a nap ...only to find that the pillows were feathered...another phone call and tip #3 to have the pillows removed...this gentlemen was the BEST...not only did he remove the pillows...and replace with foam pillows...but he placed the left blanket from the previous person that was laid at the foot of the bed and he placed it on the bed with along with fresh linens that had contact with the feathered duvet that was to have been removed from the bed prior to our arrival. He was great and even asked if we needed anything else...our regret-"we did not get his name"....so after (3) phone calls and tips we finally had a feather-free room. The very next day we informed the front desk that our room was prepared properly and that it took (3) phone calls and (3) different people to make (1) room feather free...the young lady at the front desk seemed not to care...her response..."we're sorry"---!!!!!-is there anything else we can help you with!!!!(in a very non-caring manner-border line -ARROGANT---(we failed to get her name from her badge, and we so regret the fact that we did not) However, Yanina Quinones-whom we only met upon our check in-(she did not check us in -someone else did) we just started a conversation briefly and she remembered us and asked how our stay was so far? We expressed going well now just a little problem on yesterday...she inquired by asking-Is there anything that I can do? so we expressed to her about the room not being feather-free and the numerous (3) attempts to get it feather free..she apologized and stated that she would give us a credit on our account for the inconvenience....wow..what a difference in her attitude and that of the young lady to whom my husband and I made the complaint to-Ms. Yanina is to be commented for great service attitude and her willingness to assist us...she has a pleasant attitude and a beautiful smile...she is DEFINITELY an asset to the Hilton Family. She exemplies good customer care skills-----she is to be commended for her service to the customers and her service as an Hilton Family member. She represents the Hilton Family very well!!!! We look forward to coming back. This is a very beautiful hotel -the food and service at Spencers was awesome, we had dinner there twice. Davids is a great place for food also, we had the best server "Jory" he is great...very friendly... We loved the breakfast buffet in the Bistro. The hostess and the servers are the best. We had Sammy as our server-he is great. We would definitely stay here again as a matter of fact we are already planning to stay for our vacation in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: asteini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at good location. You can reach shopping, dining areas and theme parks in 5-15 minutes by car. Opposite side of the road (International Drive) is a McDonalds, Danny's, Walgreens, etc. We booked a room for 8 nights. 6 nights was The Great Gateway rate (included breakfast), 2 nights was standard pre-paid rate. At arrival (01.00 am) first we parked to the front entrance where we were informed if we choose the self parking (instead of the valet) we have to park to the back side parking lot. It is a good solution, there is an entrance to the hotel also, you should not wait for your car, etc. But nobody was helping us to take our luggages to our rooms. The room was with pool view, 1 king bed. The size of the room is enough for a couple. The room was really average, nothing special. I was waiting more from a new Hilton hotel (eg. a shower in the bathroom, higher quality decoration, etc.). Each day we were in the pool area which was perfect on the working day but on weekend it was extremelly crowded. We think the best part of the hotel the pool area with the lazy river and bar. There is also two other pool (one is quiet pool). And about the disappinting things: 1. We read in the reviews that the staff is very friendly. What we experienced many times that some member from the stuff do not say Hello just after we said. Some of them do not smile and do not try to help us. 2. We called the Guest Service three times. First we asked for repair of the safebox in our room. After 15 minutes we should call them again. They forgot to send anybody. Next time we asked for towels because the cleaner forgot it. After 20 minutes we should call them again when they informed us the towels will be in our room in 5 minutes. And finally we asked for late check-out because our flight was at 9 pm only. They informed us we can not get any late check-out. We have to leave our room at 12 pm latest. It was a little bit strange after we booked a room for 8 nights. 3. We asked information at the front desk about the possibility to take a shower before we leave the hotel because we wanted to be at the pool on our last day also. They informed us we have to pay 15 USD. In this case we can use the Spa lockers and shower. (Why to pay for a shower? We are your guest who paid a lot of money.) 4. The internet is 14.95 USD/24 hours in the hotel. If you go to e.g. the Danny's (or many other places) it is free (even in the parking area). 5. The assortment in the room-service is not fair. 6. As we wrote already we booked the first 6 days at the Great Gateway rate which includes breakfast buffet. But this breakfast buffet is not same as a standard breakfast buffet. The difference is not big it is why we do not understand why it is necessary. If the hotel makes a special rate with special service why it is necessary to reduce the quality. So our vacation was really great but not because of the hotel. There are many hotels in Orlando with similar rate but I think better service.

Reviews.Title: “Large enought to accomodate any need; caring enough to pay attention to the smallest detail.”
Reviews.Author: purplemartinhh
Reviews.Content: Most of the large hotels (I call them convention hotels) that I have stayed at in the past project an image of indifference. This is not the case at the Hilton Orlando. From both a business and personal perspective I was totally blown away by this hotel. I attended a business event (eBay On Location) with over 1000 participants. There were lots of moving parts -- general sessions; meals; breakouts; etc. -- and the logistics and service that the hotel staff was responsible for was delivered flawlessly and professionally. It could not have gone smoother. In addition, the facilities here are complete and first rate, indoors and outside, including the fitness center, spa, pool, lazy river water-way, tennis and basketball courts, dining areas, lounges, etc. Even the parking garage was extremely well designed and amazingly convenient, esp. considering the size of this facility. The guest rooms are spacious, well appointed, and maintained in like-new condition. Plus, if you are a Hilton Honors member there are even more amenities that put this hotel over the top. You cannot find a better price performer in the Orlando area. Finally, the attribute that probably sets this hotel far apart from all the rest is the staff! They are friendly, accommodating, anxious to please, and just plain nice. Everyone we encountered -- the valet who greeted us on arrival, Stephan - the desk clerk who checked us in, the entire executive lounge staff, and the garage gate lady who helped us with a problem (slight accident) after we had checked out & were departing -- went out of there way to make us feel welcome and well taken care of. From afar the Hilton Orlando looks like just another big imposing building on the Orlando landscape. But -- once you go inside you realize that, if you are away from home but want to feel like you are home, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Anniversary Escape & Can't Wait to Return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chevesrule
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the Hilton in Orlando. Although we have been to Orlando and all the theme parks several times with our children, this was our first trip alone to Florida and everything was fantastic from start to finish. Usually when visiting the theme parks we stay on Disney and/or Universal property, but since we didn't have any kids with us this time we decided to try something different. The reviews on Tripadvisor were very helpful in our final decision of where to stay and I am glad we chose the Hilton. When we arrived we pulled up to the front of the hotel and were greeted promptly. A nice young man gave us the options regarding valet parking ($20 day) or self parking ($15 a day I think) and no pressure at all to utilize valet parking. He informed us that the top parking deck connects to the main lobby area and that it was actually closer to the front desk than from where we were currently parked at the front of the hotel. Also, he told us that the valet cars were also parked on that deck. We chose self parking and it worked out just fine. Extremely easy! After we parked our car we went into the lobby and were impressed with what we saw. Very modern, clean and spacious. I will try to attach some pictures later. We were several hours early, but decided to see if we could possibly get an early check in. The girl at the front desk was very nice and immediately got on the phone to see if it would be possible for an early check in. She then informed us that because it was our 10 year anniversary we were being upgraded to a suite and the room would be available shortly. My husband and I were both very surprised, as neither of us could recall ever being upgraded for free before. Anyway, we were directed to the bell station to store our luggage and then we went to the pool area for a swim and an early lunch. We ate poolside and had a few drinks, shrimp and pizza. Very tasty, but the service was even better. The pools were immaculate and not overcrowded at all. I am assuming that in mid-summer it would be a different story, but early September was no problem at all and the weather was hot and fabulous! Percect pool area for adults and/or kids. Around 1:00 we were notified that our suite was ready. We went to get our luggage and Doug was super nice and helpful with delivering our things to our room. Gave us some good tips while visiting Orlando and how to see the SeaWorld fireworks from the hotel. Nice guy--and when I saw him throughout the week he always referred to us by name. Honestly, every staff member that we encountered was very friendly. Our room was awesome and spacious! Bed amazing. I slept soooo good every night! The decor was lovely and everything in the room was very clean and modern. The housekeeping staff was top-notch. In fact, one night my husband and I returned from a long,long day at the Disney parks and he told me one of the safes was wide open. Well, I thought he was kidding, but he wasn't. As we were thinking back, we realized that he actually forgot to close and lock it. I had a mini panic attack and was about to cry, but was absolutely shocked to discover that not one single thing was stolen!!! Believe me, there was LOTS to choose from too! I informed management, as I know people will always complain if something goes missing or isn't right, so I wanted them to know about all the positive things during my stay. I also liked that there were several elevators, so no long wait and never overcrowded. Overall, we had a wonderful time and can't wait to return!!! Oh I almost forgot; the location for us was perfect. Very central to everything we needed. Very Close to Discovery Cove, Sea World, Aquatica and Universal/Isands of Adventure. Short drive to the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney (prob 10-15 mins with traffic). I would not hesitate to stay here again and if you are considering visiting the Orlando area, whether for business or pleasure I would highly recommend staying here. The service is fantastic, decor very clean and modern, location fabulous and very reasonably priced for everything you get!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Beautiful Time!”
Reviews.Author: Aileenbz
Reviews.Content: I loved it, the hotel staff was very friendly and are there to please your every need. The hotel areas are very clean and modern. We ordered room service and food as well as the service was great! The management is doing a very good job.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: easilyfound
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay here one night, but ended up staying 4 nights due to hurricane Irene cancelling our flight home. Was here with two teenagers and we really loved it. Room was a bit on the small side, but beds were super cozy and comfortable Without question the best, freshest food we've ever eaten at a hotel buffet breakfast, extremely fresh and delicious food, and very reasonably priced. ( I believe it was $10.95 for adults and $7.95 for kids). We spent lots of time at the pool - the slide is really fun (but gets slippery, be careful!), and the lazy river is also great - sometimes its a little too lazy and doesnt move much, but its fun). We ate at Davids which was good, but our favorite place to eat was by the pool at Tropics. Extremely friendly staff, and literally one of the best burgers we've ever had (and the ahi tuna also outstanding). Really made it enjoyable to just sit by the pool, order some lunch and enjoy the day. Pool and Tropics staff very helpful and attentive, and just laid back and very friendly. They should really be commended. Hotel was pretty empty so no problem getting chairs or umbrellas. My only suggestion is that some of the concierge staff, while friendly and helpful, were not totally familiar with all of the hours of operation in the hotel (for example one of them told me the business center was closed, when it was actually open) - this could be because the hours change, not a big deal. We had one minor problem when we ordered room service one evening, after waiting about 40 minutes (they had told us 25), they not only apologized profusely for the delay, but gave us the food at no charge. That's really good service, and things like that, and the pool, and the friendly staff, will certainly have us coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Floating down the Lazy River”
Reviews.Author: mavington
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great food and great pool area. Very convenient location and a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay...!”
Reviews.Author: FremantlePrison
Reviews.Content: To all the amazing staff at the Hilton Orlando, thanks so much for a lovely week...! Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (bar none), the wild mushroom ravioli at davids club was divine, and our meal at spencer's can't be put into words. We loved every minute of our stay there. If we ever make it back to Orlando we will be staying with you for sure...!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice- awesome pool area!”
Reviews.Author: Ryoko_Izara
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay at the Hilton for a few reasons, but it turned out to be perfect! The hotel is in a good location, right off International Drive. It's walking distance to Aquatica, and if you're up for a bit of a hike, Sea World. The hotel itself is really nice. My husband and I went for our first wedding anniversary, and were really happy. We only ate at one of the restaurants for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was good, and was only $10.95- quite a deal in Orlando! The pool area is what really sets the hotel apart. It has 2 pools- a large one with a nice water slide, and then a gated 'Quiet Pool'. There is also a lazy river- super great, its longer than the one at Aquatica! The whole pool area is very tropical, lots of palm trees and foliage. There is also plenty of lounge chairs, even when it was crowded. The fire pits were alot of fun too. There are 2 large ones outside of the pool area. I didn't know until I saw someone order them, but the hotel has s'mores packages available with sticks to roast marshmellows! Fun! The hotel staff was super nice, very helpful. There is a gate guard at the self parking, and anytime we left they would come out and ask if we needed directions etc. FYI- self parking is $13 a day. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We were there for a getaway, but it would be a fun hotel for families too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonstar328
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. The rooms were clean, and the bed was soft. The pool area was amazing. They had a wonderful pool, a jacuzzi, a slide, and a lazy river. They also had a few other activities around the area (basket ball courts, fooze ball, a pool table). And if that's too much excitement, you could also hang by the quiet pool or the fire pit. Great for families!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax. Nice pool area and Lazy River!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: Very central location on International Dr. close to restaurants, malls and attractions. Spacious room and bathroom. Breakfast was great and staff helpful and friendly. Had to pay for the parking but with all others benefits it was worth it. Concierge desk has tickets for all major attractions for sale in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Friscojill
Reviews.Content: Drove up to hotel and was able to leave my car in the large circle drive while I checked in. Check in was fast and friendly. Kit G. was extremely helpful and gave us must see places throughout the area. The room was very nice with a flat screen T.V, desk, large chair and side table by the window. The bathroom was spacious with granite countertops and a very clean bathtub. The towels were oversized and a crispy white. Each room has a frig. and safe and extra linens in the closet. We saw Sea World, Disney and many other park fireworks every night. They had a huge pool area with a lazy river, large open pool with basketball nets, a big slide, large whirlpool and adult pool. At night they had several fire pits in the pool area where you could toast marshmallows for s'mores. The chairs in the pool area were super comfortable.The bar area at the pool was great and the waiters are friendly. Food was okay, drinks were better. The hot wings (ordered not spicy) were so hot we could NOT eat them. They had a convenience shop/store within the hotel that had yummy ice cream for the kids and Starbucks coffee. They also sold wine, chips, cookies and many other items. The prices were sky high but the young man that worked there was cute and made us mothers laugh. We had the bed and breakfast package and was given breakfast vouchers for the restaurant downstairs. It was fantastic. They had fresh fruit, waffles, cereal, bacon, potato's, bagels, and the best scrambled eggs you have ever tasted. They also had a beautiful Spa but did not have time to visit it. Overall we had a fantastic time. However, no stay is perfect. The things that I did not like: $13.00 for parking a day or $20.00 for valet. You have no choice if you have a car. The beds were too hard for my liking. The operator was very rude and gave me incorrect information. She did not log my wake up call. Also, she said I would have to pay $6.99 to print off my boarding passes. I've never had to pay for that service. While checking out Kit G asked about my stay and I told him about the rude operator and the $6.99 passes. He promptly printed them out and apologized for her. He informed me that was a free service to all guest. Yes, I will go back and tell anyone I know to visit there. It was extremely relaxing and had lit up paths through out the beautiful grounds for walks at night.

Reviews.Title: “A+ and THIS is where we'll stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: NightSky777
Reviews.Content: Wow! This is one well-thought-out place! As you enter the property, you'll be greeted by friendly, comfortably dressed Valets, come through a large automatic revolving door, be wow'd by the very cool decor-very spacious lobby, and greeted again by super friendly and professional front desk staff. by the way, you'll even love the best lobby music! Highlights: LARGE and varied shaped Pool, LARGE Water Slide, Several Fountains in the pool; Fire Pits; Large Sport Court; large Pool-side Bar/grill; several shaded cabanas, Really Cool "Lazy River" with free tubes! My kids absolutely LOVED IT! Oh yeah, there is a convenience store and a McDonalds about 200 yds away --they loved that too. Nitty Gritty Basics: Elevators are minimal wait and fast. The corridors are full of vibrant color, with nice views at the elevator dock. Rooms are well-appointed, very clean, with everything working fine. Our room had 2 queen-size beds, a large LED TV, small refrigerator, and a small lock box, comfy chair, desk/chair, and ironing board. Bathroom was large, granite, came with blowdryer, and adjustable Shower head. Plenty of Towels. USA Today newspaper at door in the mornings. Nice Location as it was not in too busy an area, yet not far from theme parks (Disney 5-10 mins; UOR 10-15 mins; Shopping/Restaurants/Entertainment 5-10 mins). I didn't use the fitness center or spa, so don't know the cost, or amenities there. Wish List: that there would be a Free Breakfast bar; that the rooms would have a 1/2 size Refrigerator (instead or 1/4 size) and also have a microwave; that internet was free (or at least not $15/day); that parking was free (or at least not $14/day); that the TV had some Music Channels; that the pool stayed open til midnight (11pm not too bad); that the a/c fan was louder or we could check out a small fan; and that there was a COTTON Quilt between the sheet and comforter --i.e. sheet by itself a little chilly, or a bit warmish w/ the added Down comforter, but w/ a Cotton Quilt it would be "just right". OVERALL: My kids and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent meeting space it is very well laid out. Sleeping rooms are comfortable, roomy, and very well kept. Staff does an excellent job! Pool restaurant and the market place are very reasonably priced, and the food is very good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: DRLieberson
Reviews.Content: Here are the things that we found that were great with this hotel: • Great location - to the airport and to the things you and/or kids want to see • Nice price - we were able to get $99/night for a nice room with a view. • Food was outstanding - we went to all the restaurants and everything was excellent, which helped justify the prices! • Service was attentive - whenever we needed anything, from a screwdriver, to additional towels, to directions they went the extra mile. • Nearby supermarkets - you have a fridge in your room so within 2-3 miles there are several supermarkets that you can access easily. Note: they tend to close by 10 pm each day. • The lazy river - It is just marvelous... for kids and adults! The negatives that we found: • Paid self parking - As others have said the self parking is $13/night with in-out privileges. However you can negotiate that if you stay longer or have more than one room. A couple there was able to get it reduced to $7/day. • The "quiet pool" which is basically supposed to be "child-free" is not. Every night we had screaming kids come by to disrupt the calm. Now we have kids (9 and 11) which we love, but we also like to have some quiet time. Otherwise if you are with kids or without this hotel is a really nice option considering what you are paying for. It is clean, friendly, and you get your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property!”
Reviews.Author: WDWCM87
Reviews.Content: This is a newer property, maybe less than 2 years. Lobby is very well appointed. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The pool is great! In fact it has one of the best pools of any hotel in Orlando. A few that are better are JW Marriott (Great Hotel) & Disney's Yacht & Beach Club (My fav Disney Hotel). The Bonnet Creek Hilton is just as fun as this Hilton. The Club level could offer a better selection of breakfast items. There are not hot items other than oatmeal. Why not have hot pans of eggs and bacon or sausage? Over all this is one of my favorite hotels in all of Orlando. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel and service for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: weddingselectionsnsd
Reviews.Content: We booked our room for Fri / Sat night before school started for our annual 'end of summer getaway'. It was our first time here. From the minute you get on the property - before we even got out of the car, the customer service was impecable. Beautiful property. The pool area / lazy river / waterslide was awesome. The poolside bartender Eric makes the best Mojitos! Vincent at the front desk was A+. We enjoyed our stay so much, we added an extra night! The 24 hr fitness center is state of the art. The kids had, besides the pool area, tennis courts, basketball courts, soccer field, pool tables & foosball to enjoy. They also have a putting green. Complimentary shuttle to Seaworld is so nice. We also were not in a poolside room, but caught the great fireworks show from our 15th floor from Seaworld. We were so impressed and have already planned our next stay. Something we noticed, the management interacted with the employees in a friendly and professional way - made us feel like it was a great place to work and that they were being appreciated. Our opinion re: parking / internet fees - yes, it does seem odd to pay for self park but considering the quality of this place and the price - you just have to figure that into the rate. Internet same thing - it could be free - but I think then the prices would be higher overall. I personally did not take my laptop as I normally would - and it was great! I did not have the temptation to ck on the business or anything for 4 days - I enjoyed our family time! The room itself - very nice / clean. It is a small fridge and no freezer or microwave but you do get a coffee maker. Hairdryer, iron / board. Overall I have to say the service is what makes this our favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & amazing pools”
Reviews.Author: FRWorldCitizen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in August 2011 for an average of 149€/night +12.5% tax, breakfast not included. 14th-floor rooms with view of pools. Very nice modern hotel ideally located on International Drive. Standard rooms are clean and spacious with an extremely comfortable king bed, a desk area, a large drawer-dresser, a full-sized bathroom with a bathtub. Bar fridge, safe & cable HD TV. Wifi $14.95/day. Facilities include a small Starbucks Coffee corner, a bar, a steak restaurant, 3 swimming pools (large family pool, lazy river and quiet pool with jacuzzi), a convenient pool bar, a huge fitness room with lots of gear, and a spa center. Valet parking $21/day. Few miles distance from main chain restaurants on International Dr, shopping outlets/malls and theme parks. Staff extremely professional. Cons: Instructions given at the time of reservation to have both rooms on same floor were not taken into consideration on arrival, thus delaying the check-in process... Wifi much too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel; shame about the charges”
Reviews.Author: johnybegud
Reviews.Content: I had booked this stay as a special. We had previously travelled to Orlando (6 years ago) on a package tour from UK and was determined to have something better than the terrible motel we had then! The Hilton is a relatively new property well positioned on International drive. We had a car so this suited us. Those without may find the location a little away from things. First, the good points. Modern hotel; pleasant staff; lovely pool (which we didn’t use). Bad points (which I did know about before booking): parking ($21 per day valet parking; $13 per day to self park on their property (plus taxes of course)!! Internet (even some of the motels we have been to offer free internet) but the Hilton charges $15 per day. And this is fixed to one device, I could not log off from my iPhone for example and my son log on later with his. Room service is a complete rip-off. There is a $4.50 delivery charge PLUS a whopping 22% service charge (not including tip!) On top of this of course are local taxes. One burger, plus two kids burgers cost $60. There is a minibar – but it is empty!! There was also a $10 supplement per night to get a pool view. The main restaurant was cloed for the duration of cour stay... Summary: smart hotel, severely demeans the experience by all the additional charges. I cannot recommend on this basis, and will find elsewhere on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The pool area is impressive”
Reviews.Author: gbmom_11
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 3 nights at the Hilton Orlando (Monday-Thursday) ... and wished we could have stayed longer. The pool area is the main draw to the hotel. A very large "family pool" with fountain, water slide and basketball hoops was never crowded and pleasantly cool and refreshing. The lazy river is impressively long and the "quiet" pool was a nice place to use the hot tub in peace. The pool bar had typically expensive drinks and food but was tasty none the less. We enjoyed the hummus and the pizza. They also offer pitchers of specialty drinks. Plenty of lounge chairs and nice beach towels are available at the entrance of the pool area with no fussing about "checking out" and "in" of towels ... you just take what you need. The hotel is situated within just a few minutes of many, many chain restaurants on International drive ... which was very convenient for dinner. Only one of the hotel's restaurants is open late and was way over priced. We had a very late dinner and were disappointed in the over priced, small portions of food we received. The hotel room itself was clean and well kept. The bathroom appeared to be brand new and the shampoo/bath products were very nice. The bed was comfortable and the linens were high end. Two minor complaints are the lack of extra toilet tissue in the bathroom (had to ask the maid for a roll) and the AC. The room was consistently humid, no matter how low we turned the temperature. The bathroom would benefit from a fan to exhaust the shower steam. Parking is $13 per night (to self park, which is very convenient in a ramp attached to the lobby) and internet is $15 per day. Both charges are ridiculous considering the hotel is located in an area which has plenty of parking (this is not Chicago) and even McDonald's across the street has free internet. Petty charges ... which add up. The concierge and front desk staff was excellent, friendly, and offered great advice on theme parks and restaurants in the area. Maid service was also excellent and timely. We will stay at the Hilton Orlando again .... and hope to make it a longer stay so that we can enjoy the great pool area for even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: buzzgator
Reviews.Content: We are locals here in Orlando and wanted to do something fun before school starts on Monday so we checked in for just a one night get-away. It was flawless! The lobby was wonderful and had a great smell when you walk in. The check in was fast, courteous, and professional. The room was spotless and the beds were INCREDIBLE. Had a great night's sleep. The pool area was amazing. I work in the travel industry so I stay in a lot of hotels. This one is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: GMKISOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night to end our Florida vacation before flying out of Orlando. I prepaid and upgraded to the executive floor which offers complimentary drinks, breakfast, snacks (hot & cold). Well worth the savings to prepay. Hotel is very nice, pool area is great for kids and adults. We were disappointed with the on site restaurants. They only had 1 place open on a Thursday night at 8pm plus the marketplace store. The 2 other restaurants were closed. Seemed quite odd to me. Overall I think it's a great place for a short stay but would not recommend for extended stays as they do not have suites or any kitchen amenities (fridge/microwave) in most rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow34
Reviews.Content: For those that want to visit all the attractions but don't want to stay on Disney property, this is the perfect choice. My family and I stayed here for a week and chose the hotel for it's location, cost and the pools. The lobby area on arrival is beautiful and staff were very helpful with a smooth check in, which was nice after a long day traveling. Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking the front of the hotel and although we couldn't see the pools it gave a great view of the SeaWorld fireworks at night. The room was also very clean with wonderful housekeeping arriving whilst we were out. The breakfast buffet is extremely reasonable at $10.95 for adults and $7.95 for kids and food was fresh and inviting. We did not eat at Spencer's Grill on site as there were many other off site alternative restaurants. The hotel is about a mile to Aquatica, SeaWorld and Discovery Cove with Universal Studios and Disney about 5 miles which wasn't bad. What I also liked about the hotel's position just off International drive was the incredible choice of restaurants for every budget and only a short drive away. The hotel was extremely quiet during our stay as the convention center next door had no events on and I believe it can get busy so you might want to check into that if you book here. This was advantageous to us however as there were no noisy neighbor's at night! My children loved the pools with the slide and lazy river and used these daily, a nice treat if you want a quiet day away from the parks. One thing we did not like, was allowing smoking around the pool areas. We were quite surprised about this but this seems to be a common problem in the parks too so not sure what the Florida law is. Overall, we did enjoy our stay and would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: nitemonkey
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for families traveling to Orlando. Location is just a 10 minute drive from the airport, and situated very close to Universal, Disneyworld, and strip of restaurants on International Drive. The pool was the biggest hit for my son. We swam and ate lunch at the poolside restaurant two days in a row. Staff was very friendly and rooms were clean and kept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Burgers by the Pool”
Reviews.Author: GoGreene
Reviews.Content: I didn't have much time for play, but the hour that I did manage to escape to the pool was phenomenal. The poolside restaurant has the best burger...salad was great too. Poolside waiter service is available. You can order your food, tan, and eat without leaving your seat. I was veyr impressed. It was a wonderful way to end my business trip. The accomodations were nice and clean as well! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: pftambur
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new property that is connected to the Orange County Convention Center. The halls and rooms are all very well lit. Each room is equipped with a Refrigerator and flat screen HD-TV. Cleanliness of both the room and bathroom is excellent. Room service dinner arrived when promised and was served "HOT". One of the very best areas at this property was the swimming pool and lazy river in the rear. The kids will love it and you will have to drag them out of the water. Mom and Dad will love the pool area for the food and your favorite beverage service. The location of this property is close to all the attractions: 2 minutes to Sea World and 15 minutes to either Universal or anything Disney. While I am not a huge Hilton guy, I will return to this property next time I am in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and good service”
Reviews.Author: cog480
Reviews.Content: Make sure that if you're staying there for a conference, that the conference will be held in the wing near to this hotel. The convention center is massive, and I ended up walking a longer way in heels than I cared to. I was able to check into my room when I arrived at 7:00 AM, which was very nice given I'd taken a red eye to get to the conference. The pool was very relaxing, and even though there lots of kids, fountains kept the noise to a minimum. I had issues with my breakfast the first day at the restaurant. I left without eating or paying and went to Denny's down the street instead. However, they sought me out and left 2 free breakfast vouchers for me, which was a nice consolation. The breakfasts were much better going forward One last thing - Internet access was not free! Other conference go-ers staying at different places said that their hotels did not charge.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay”
Reviews.Author: poyastropearson
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one entire day and left the next morning. Reason we stayed here only one day was because we left the other hotel early. I wish we would have spent our entire vacation here. Room was on the 12th floor and overlooked the pool. They have a "Lazy River" which was GREAT. I could have stayed in that lazy river and pool ALL DAY AND NIGHT. Towels were provided for at pool entrance. Plenty of loungers around the pool. Staff were very courteous and ready to help with any problems(even though there were no problems). I would highly recommend this to any person at all. We will definately be staying here next year. We did not order of the menu but looked at it and it was a bit pricey. We had a rental car, so we just went out to eat. There are alot of restaurants (casual, fast food and fancy) in the area. On a scale of 1 to 10 I would rate this around 10&1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools”
Reviews.Author: melsian
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms ok - food expensive. The breakfast is not worth the money, the coffee was weak, they had run out of food at the buffet and it was overall a farce! Also the menu at the pool would get a bit boring if staying longer than a week - not a huge choice and certainly not for vegetarians. IHOP is close by, although busy, food good and better value. Starbucks in the hotel is very, very expensive and always a long line.

Reviews.Title: “More attention to detail needed”
Reviews.Author: mauen66
Reviews.Content: All the details add up to make for not such a great experience 1. Checked us into a room and the next day we were told we had to pack up and move that they wereclosing that floor for maintenance 2. Light didn't work in the room Someone would be right up to fix it It is now 5 days later and it still doesn't work 3. No towels left in our room after housekeeping was finished cleaning our room 4. No toilet paper and as my son was waiting and I checked with the two maids past our room they don't have any on their carts. Had to ask them to take a roll out of another room, more will be brought up still waiting a day later 5. We don't have enough towels at the pool at 10 a.m. This morning so u can have one until we get more-seriously!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: NadiaR13
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and so did my kids. The grounds, lazy river and pool were incredible. The food by the pool was good and the staff was great. What a beautiful place, we did not want to leave. Nadia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jonathan C
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hilton on Sunday 31st July. From the moment we entered the hotel we were met with a very warm welcome. When i approached the check in desk there was a very long que, which went down very quickly due to the proffesionalism of the staff on the desk. I was amazed at how big the hotel actually was. The hotel was virtually right across the road from SEAWORLD. Which was a real bonus, the hotel even provide complimentary shuttle buses to the park. I knew that the hotel was used for business conferences and other kinds of meetings but I had no idea how much they actually accomodated for such things. After we had unpacked in our room we decided to go for a walk around the hotel to explore every aspect. In all, it took us about 45 minutes to an hour to complete our little tour. When we arrived at the pool, all we could really say was WOW!!!!!. The pool bar staff were brilliant, the pool water was magnificant, we honestly felt like we were at the beach. The first night we arrived and the rest which followed, we slept like babies, the room was spectacular, and the bed was more comfortable than my own. When we went down for breakfast, we were met by polite, curtious staff. The food was lovely and well worth the money. The food at the pool bar was good aswell. When we ordered a drink we received free refills on our next order! The staff can not do enough for you! We felt like royalty! All in all our stay at the Hilton Orlando was simply Fantastic!!!!!! I would recommend it to anybody! 10/10 !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful grounds and pool areas!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooner201009
Reviews.Content: I attended a business training at this hotel and loved the grounds and pool areas. After classes ended I'd go up to my room, change to my swimsuit, grab my book and head to one of the pools. They were just beautiful and completely clean. Poolside drinks and food, ordered from the bar at the big pool, were delivered by helpful waiters and waitresses and the music played through cute rock shaped speakers was great. If I had kids, I’d definitely stay in this hotel when visiting Orlando just for the pools. One caution, the poolside lounge chairs are made from squared metal tubing and have some sharp edges. I ran my shin into one and got a deep gash. The pool bar waitress who brought me a band aid said that it happens all the time and showed me her own scars from encounters with these sharp edged chairs. The hotel is new, clean and sleek, and very "how now brown cow" in decoration. The light fixtures are beautiful throughout the property but a decorator was tuned into brown and splashed way too much of the color in public areas - including the downstairs restaurant which is a relentless sea of orangish brown. All hotel employees were very friendly and competent. Food at the pool bar and the restaurants was very good. I recommend the hamburger. My hotel room was clean and more than adequate for a business trip with a comfortable bed and a nice desk and chair, but nothing special as far as decoration and drab to look at with so much brown on the walls, floor and furniture. It smelled slightly mildewed. There was only one small towel rack by the sink in the bathroom for hand towels and no racks for wet bath and beach towels and swimsuits, so it was very difficult to dry my swimsuit. I think this might be a real problem for two or more people in a room using the beautiful pools every day, so be sure to pack a second swimsuit if you’re planning on staying here. There was almost no noise from adjacent rooms and I didn’t hear any hall noise so I slept well throughout my stay. The maids were so nice in the halls and brought the extra towel I requested (to blot dry my swimsuit) immediately. The conference areas were clean and well staffed by friendly seniors ready to direct you to your next session. The conference food was good and the coffee was absolutely undrinkable, so buy coffee in the coffee shop upstairs. My husband joined my on the last day of my visit and we ate at Spencer’s Steakhouse to celebrate our anniversary. The food was outstanding and the wait staff was exceptionally competent and friendly. A trio was playing in the bar and I wish I’d had dinner in the bar during the week to enjoy the nightly music. I’d recommend Spenser’s highly to anyone staying at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SLCGirl22
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favorite places! The hotel is beautiful and the pool is fantastic. They have a wonderful snack shop where you can get Starbucks coffees & pastries as well. We have stayed here several times and I've never had one complaint about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with the family. We all loved the pools!”
Reviews.Author: PDada
Reviews.Content: Good rooms. Good value. We stayed with family (ages 2 to 40) and we all enjoyed our stay. Get the valet parking service. Several lovely pools to suit all ages. We had to keep a day aside from the parks to make the most of the hotel. It's a nice place to be away from the thick of it but close enough. Lots of family restaurants close by. Need a car to stay here. Had dinner at Delmonico's two nights in a row - good food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “This is the new Hilton on Destination Dr. It was a wonderful property!”
Reviews.Author: SeekPeace
Reviews.Content: My niece and I spent 5 days here and had a great time! It is close to Sea World, offers good dining options on-site and has multiple pools. We loved our room and enjoyed the staff. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Aredhead730
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights (mom, dad, 7 yo, 10 yo daughters) while we visited Discovery Cove, Aquatica and Sea World. The hotel has a huge, beautiful lobby. We went to check in and there was some confusion about our reservation.... We had booked the Hilton Lake Buena Vista by mistake but meant to book the Hilton Orlando. Steven at the front desk was very helpful and got it straightened out. He upgraded us to a pool-view room for free. The room was beautiful and had everything we needed. The kids LOVED the pool, lazy river and waterside and we enjoyed sitting at the bar while they swam. We ate dinner at the poolside restaurant the 1st night and Gayle was our wonderful server. She was so friendly and accommodated our every request! We ate breakfast in the Bistro restaurant one morning....a little pricey but it has a great atmosphere and the kids got the buffet for 1/2 price. We looked forward to returning to the hotel each day after visiting the parks. We could access our car easily each day from the self-parking garage, and the hotel was so close to all the parks we visited. Everything was perfect - we will definitely come back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good mix of business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: joyja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family while attending a conference that was being host by the Convention Centre. This hotel cateres more towards the travelling business person than to families. Since it is connected to the Orange Country Convention Center, this makes sense. We pulled up and someone had helped us with our baggages. However, he made sure to point out that he was the valet company and is a seperate department from the hotel's bell staff (who would be the one taking my bags up) then proceed to wait around us expecting a tip. I did give him a tip but did not like that approach at all. After check in, another bell man arrived at our door with our luggages, so I made sure I gave him a good tip too. The sleeping accoomdation was very nice, spacious and modern. They do not have a mini bar but do have some sort of refridgerator. Actually, it was more like a cooler and it took about 4 hours for a luke warm water to get cold. There is a sign stating that this is not a refridgerator and any milk or medicine would not keep. Their beds were very comfortable and the sheets had very high thread counts and were crisp. One of the most comfortable bed I had ever slept in. The highlight of this hotel was the pool. They have a very large pool with zero entry on both sides (think the beach) and the water was extremely warm. which let you stay in the water for a long periods of time. There are 2 pool basketball hoops, a water fountains, water slides, an awesome lazy river and a qiuet pool. There were plenty of umbrellas and lounge chairs all tucked into secluded places and a great outdoor bar and restuarant there. The pools opens until 11 pm but the kitchen closes at 8 pm, so don't think you can have a nice late dinner by the pool if you come after that. They also provide you with large pool towels, fooseball table and pool tables. There's even a huge circular fire pit which they lit up after dark. You can even call room service from that area and they can deliver s''mores ingredient. Adjacent to the pool is a very large fitness which lools very impressive, but I did not utltized. I had a package delivered to the hotel and they charged me a $5 handling fee. I know that some hotel charge a handling fee if you have more than 5 boxes and normally its for a meetings at the hotel, not individual guest. That cost was un-called for. They also charge an internet access fee of $14.95 per 24 hours. I stayed at 5 different hotels while in Florida, and this was the only hotel that charge for wi-fi. Not very impress with the nickel and diming. Over all, it was a nice hotel with nice features but when I am paying over $200 a night, I expected more value out of it.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: JONMCINERN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 18 nights whilst doing disney, seaworld etc, I was with my wife and two young children aged 8 and 4 and really enjoyed our stay.. first the positives very new stylish hotel excellent swimming pool area with lazy river and fun water slide plus kids fountain, fab cabana's - they do cost but on busy days are definitely worth it brilliant and very very helpful staff..in particular Nicky on front desk, jackie in spencers steak and chops and the front house managers josh and Brittany restaurants - ate in davids club which is perfect if you cant be bothered to wander out of the hotel - I would question the wisdom of "black and tans" onion rings though, someone doesnt realise that the black and tans is the name of a very contraversial british army regiment !!, but the food is excellent and wont break the bank spencers chop house - the steaks are among the best I have eaten and I have eaten in many argentinean, french frites restaurants as well as the number one rated NY steak house peter luger.. concierge - very helpful rooms - nicely decorated - neutral colours, very comfy beds, and 37 inch plasma as standard cons - not much really, I did have an issue with the housekeeping, but once front desk were aware they went out of their way to resolve and really looked after us by way of an apology parking - plenty of it, but they do charge and given that this is orlando not London and they have loads of land, I did think this should be free for guests staying long term WIFI - i got this free, but its not normally, why oh why do hotels charge for this.. it would have been nearly 15 usd a night - come on hilton you can do better than this and its a selling point.. All in All this is a great hotel that I would thoroughly recommend and the negatives are small issues and I have no hesitation in recommending - if and when I come back I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: phototraveling1
Reviews.Content: I do have to say, as we were driving there I was getting a little worried about what the hotel was going to look like :/ To our surprise it was absolutely GORGEOUS when we approached the valet, which kindly advised us that we didn't have to spend $20 a day on valet- there is a wonderful self service underground parking garage for $12 a day! The lobby of the hotel and grounds are wonderful. The area isn't in a great part of Orlando, but the Hotel is just fine! We stayed here on July 5 & 6th 2011 and had to go back to Orlando for an emergency July 29 & 30 and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on American Way... Would have MUCH rather had been here!!!! But with circumstances, it really didn't matter where we stayed! Although, now I definetely know which to go back to- Kids would LOVE this place with the lazy river pool :)

Reviews.Title: “No where else worth staying in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here previously during my trips to Orlando. Had a customer service issue recently, which made me hesitant to stay at the hotel again. The resident manager, Chris, quickly pacified my concerns and convinced me to stay with them again. Thank G#d I listened to him. My fiancee and I had an absolutely spectacular stay at the Hilton Orlando last weekend. From valet to check in, to arriving in the room and checking out the spectacular 15th floor view. The stay went from good to great, to even better. We had dinner at Spencer's, their on property fine dining steakhouse. I'm a huge steak fan and have had corporate accounts at Morton's and Ruth's Chris. I've also frequented Capital Grille, Smith & Wollensky, the Palm, and most other relevant steakhouses. Needless to say, my expectations are high. Spencer's thoroughly exceeded them. The steaks were cooked perfectly, with a pleasant charred flavor and all the juices locked into the steak. Our server, Jackie, was friendly and knowledgeable. We took every recommendation she made, including lobster tails with the steaks. Although the meal might have been a little bigger than we could handle, the leftover steak made for some great snacks the next day. We ordered room service and had breakfast in bed the next morning. French toast and salmon baguette were wonderful! Also have to mention that the pool complex is gorgeous and the lazy river was extremely relaxing in the sweltering afternoon heat. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Orlando. Surprisingly, their rates are actually very reasonable. The hotel is conveniently located near International Dr. Feel free to send me a message if you have any questions about the hotel or hesitancy about booking here.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SarahB112
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, very friendly and helpful, at the front desk, concierge, and valet! Every question or request we had was answered in a professional, quick, and friendly manner. I emailed ahead of time to request an early check-in, and received an email response and we were able to check in early. The room was beautiful. I expected a basic hotel room, but it had all kinds of updated, high-end finishes. And we didn't hear any noise from the hallway. A couple of areas for improvement.... --If you are an adult planning to use the lazy river for relaxation, don't count on it. It was full of kids splashing, playing, yelling, pushing, etc. --The "quiet pool" was nice and quiet during the day, but both nights we went there it was not quiet. --I wish the king bed had king size pillows on it.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: WeAndy
Reviews.Content: we are a family of 4, 13yo and 4yo and we enjoyed this hotel alot, kids loved the pool area- so did we!!!!!!!! not crowded at all but it was the cooler months of the year. we plan to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: E2M-coach
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent several days at the Hilton Orlando - what a truly wonderful experience! Every detail was perfection delivered. Highly recommend the Cabana poolside, the lazy river, the pool, the food, the quiet clean rooms, and the service at the drive, front desk and food services were all incredibly attentive, professional and helpful...with expecting or waiting for a tip. Highly recommend this hotel and especially the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: derloc12
Reviews.Content: It was excellent, the room and the entire hotel was perfect, nice furnishings throughout, excellent staff. The hotel is upscale but not pretentious. Lots of families, resort type pool area. Probably the nicest hotel Gym I have ever been in. Top notch equipment and plenty of it. I had a king room on the 14th floor, it was quiet. I paid $119 per night, $14.50 for parking, $14.50 for WiFi. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Pantanel
Reviews.Content: Everything works for this hotel, from location to International Drive and theme parks , to the hotel itself. Great pool and lazy river was fun? Rooms and service were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: luvtovacn
Reviews.Content: An amazing place for families. So much to do for kids and adults alike. Fun pool with slide and lazy river. There is also a quiet pool that is separate. There is an outdoor grill and bar right there at the pool. Plenty of chairs and towels too. Pool tables, foosball tables, basketball, tennis and volleyball courts and a workout center. There are several restaurants on site but we didn't have the need to visit them. While they offer valet parking, we self parked which is very convenient as the parking garage is right there. The top floor of the garage is on the same level as the lobby which is how you will get to your room. However, if you park on the second floor, there is an elevator to take you up 1 flight to the lobby-this floor is recommended on super hot days as your car gets really hot on top. The hotel staff is very professional and accommodating. We booked our room through hotels.com and got a very decent rate and no resort fee. You will pay for parking, but it is what it is. Room was exceptionally clean and beds are soft. We visited Aquatica while there, but will stay again in the winter when we go to Disney and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged and Pool is very SMELLY!”
Reviews.Author: travelingon2009
Reviews.Content: The Rate we was charged was higher than what I agreed on, and the management team would not change it. Its asham they lost a great diamond member over $15 bucks! the rooms was way too small compared to other Hilton Prop. My main issue was the Smell around the Lazy river!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Orlando with perfect pool:)”
Reviews.Author: JustnormalDK
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel during my summer vacation with my husband and my stepson. I was there for 9 night. Everything was perfectly for us. The room is nice and clean. The swimming pool is the best. We love to take lazy river there and my step son love the slider. The swimmingpool is very big and even they have many people here, it still have a lot of space for us. We will come back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Room is nice but pricy and not as convenient”
Reviews.Author: bundan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for conference and my company paid for my stay. Overall the room is clean, new and very nice. Pool area is awesome. But if you're going to Orlando for vacation and plan on going to Disney World/Universal Studio/Sea World, then there're other options available that cost about the same price but more convenient. Disney World offers extended magic hours and package deals if you stay in their resort. I would plan on staying at different resort for different days depending on where you'd like to visit. I believe this Hilton is close by to Sea World but then I didn't go as I was there for business. Walkable distance (about 15 minutes) to convention center, 20 minutes to 3 of my favorite restaurants --> Oceanaire Seafood Room, Cuba Libre and the Capital Grill!

Reviews.Title: “Only attended conference facilities but they were excellent”
Reviews.Author: PAfamily07
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this facility and all the facilities I used were top-notch. While I did not stay at the hotel, I would not hesitate (except for price) to host an event here. The rooms including the lavatories were never dirty even at the end of a very busy conference. The pictures are accurate in the scale of the the ballrooms. I would expect many local people have wedding receptions and similar events here.

Reviews.Title: “Was here for work... will be back for fun”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirl13
Reviews.Content: Great property in Orlando. Every employee I encountered was smiling and helpful. Dinner in Spencer's was amazing - make sure you order the mac & cheese. The pool area was great and made me wish I was visiting for leisure. Will definitely stay here with the family the next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Why bother with theme parks”
Reviews.Author: ivanrmcc
Reviews.Content: So we went to Orlando to visit the theme parks, 2 adults two kids (4&10). But after visiting the pool complex in the hotel the kids didn't want to leave. Even when we visited the Disney parks after a couple of hours the kids would ask " can we go back to the hotel and go to the pool now??" I was actually there for a conference at the Orlando Conference Centre and brought the family along as well. This was a great location as the conference centre is connected to the hotel and there were lots of things for the family to do while I was at the conference. Food in all the restuarants was very good although the selection poolside was limited and the opening hours of the the poolside cafe were limited also. Great Service throughout the hotel and in all restaurants & rooms were well appointed and very clean. Although a little expensive I would highly recommend this hotel as a base for exploring the Orlando area. Lost of parking, easy access onto the highway system and a stop for the I-Drive trolley is just across the street. But if exploring the area is too tiresome this is also a great place just to kickback by the pool(s).

Reviews.Title: “Management team comes through”
Reviews.Author: vkapella
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took an extended weekend break at the Hilton Orlando. We booked one of the Hilton upgrades that is offered with some hotels. This upgrade reserved a pool cabana at a lower price. We really enjoyed our stay and would return to this property in the future. However, our stay didn't start off on a good foot... Our initial experience checking into the executive floor was less than we expected. When asked about our cabana reservation, the staff member didn't know how to check on it and basically told us to call the spa. We expected a more proactive approach. Also, my wife was not happy with the quality of the suite we were assigned. Finally, on the day we were to check in to the cabana, the entire adult pool area was closed. It turns out that management listened to our complaints and took immediate and effective steps to ensure our satisfaction. It was nice. We especially want to single out for praise "Mike" from South Africa who explained to us why the adult pool was closed and really bent over backwards to make sure we were happy. In general, we felt the property was upscale at an affordable price. It has a convenient location. The pool area was large with lots of ammenities for adults and enough to keep kids interested as well. I recommend the property. First the pluses. - Nice pool and grounds area - Loved the cabana's around the adult pool Initially we were disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility”
Reviews.Author: gheathington
Reviews.Content: Was here for a convention - picked the Hilton so I could get my points. Wow - good choice. Walking distance to the convention center (actually connected via a covered walkway), rooms were very nice - slept like a baby on the fab linens. Staff were excellent. Overall, great even for a Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pelican_CandE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton only one night on our way to Loew's Royal Pacific for our Universal Studios vacation in June. We really wished we had stayed longer before moving over! We have 6 and 8 year old "water animals" and the pool area was amongst the best we have found to entertain our entire family. We all went on the waterslide and played basketball in the pool for hours. Best of all loved just floating round and round in the very nice lazy river. There were plenty of toobs and loungers for everyone. We used the healthclub once and it was top of the line and very clean! We have scheduled another trip back in August and we just cofirmed our entire stay at this hotel. Can't wait to spend more time there, I would definetly recommend this hotel. We got a high floor with water view...view of pool was very tropical. Very fiendly staff. We did not eat at the hotel (since only there for such a short time).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: schase_03051
Reviews.Content: I got a decent price getting a vacation package through SeWorld.com for this hotel. The price has increased a lot since we stayed here last August. The pool and lazy river were again a wonderful amenity for the hotel and great to come back to after a day at the parks. Housekeeping was sub-par. Beds were made and towels replaced but nothing else. I called to get some shampoo/soap on our return at 10:00pm and I was tyold they would be rignt there - no one every showed up. Next morning I called again and got one shampoo and no soap.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Erika28
Reviews.Content: I think we were really unlucky with our stay here and am disappointed to be writing this negative review- I had spent ages searching on Trip Advisor for all our hotels on our road trip and was confident that I had made the right choices! From the moment we arrived at the Hilton Orlando we had a negative experience. We had been travelling for 12 hours to get to the hotel so were tired on arrival and all we wanted to do was get to our room, shower and then go for some dinner! Our bags were taken from the taxi by the bell boy and after 30 minutes we still didn't have them in our bedroom, we phoned down and chased it but it turned out they had been "lost" we finally got our luggage after nearly 50 minutes. The toilet seat in our bathroom was broken when we arrived but this was fixed quickly so that was good. We were given a $25 resort credit to compensate the misplaced luggage. About a mile away is Orlando Point where there are several restaurants and some shops, we got a taxi there and walked back- took about 20 minutes. There are also a few restaurants within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. Our first day we went to Animal Kingdom in the morning- we got a taxi from the hotel. TIP- if you get a taxi to Disney make sure the hotel staff put you in a checker cab, (they know this but failed to do it for us!) the cost of the taxi to Animal Kingdom was about $35 but we then had to pay an extra $14 to get into the entrance area- you don't have to pay this if you are in a checker cab. We got the shuttle bus & then rail to Disney Magic Kingdom which was free and took about 10 minutes. Our 2nd night we planned on using our resort credit in Davids Club restaurant but as we sat down and ordered drinks I was asked for ID which I didn't have on me as had left everything in our room as we didn't expect to need anything other than our room key that evening! I understand they do ask in but the staff were very rude when I said I didn't have it and refused to serve me, I'm 30 so don't normally come across this! (I didn't get asked for ID anywhere else throughout our time in Florida!) We decided to go and eat elsewhere as weren't happy with how they dealt with my lack of carrying passport! We went to Red Lobster across the road which was cheap and cheerful but also happy to give me a glass of wine :-) Next day we got a taxi to Universal which was about $15, Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure are quite close together- about 5 minutes walking and there are plenty of restaurants on the walk in between! On our 3rd and final night in the hotel myself and my sister were exhausted after a couple of long days walking around the theme parks so went to bed about 10.30pm, just as we were falling asleep (about 11pm) there was a banging on our door, we ignored it as thought it might have been on next doors room but it was knocked on again so my sister got up and looked through the peephole, there didn't seem to be anyone there but as she walked away someone let themselves into our bedroom. It turned out to be housekeeping bringing us clean sheets which we hadn't requested! We couldn't believe someone would let themselves in at that time of night after someone hadn't answered the door- I'm just glad we heard the knocking otherwise it would have freaked us out even more!! We had ordered room service for breakfast on our final morning so that we could use our resort credit but when it was delivered we found out we couldn't use it- just another frustration! We did eventually get the breakfast free of charge because of the inconvenience so that was good but the breakfast wasn't that nice and worth all the hassle! All in all the hotel itself was nice enough- nothing special but what you would expect from a Hilton- nice big reception area, reasonable size bedrooms and lovely looking swimming pool. However because of the several bad experiences we had I would not go back and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but lots of hidden extras”
Reviews.Author: Martyn J
