Reviews.Content: We stayed here over new year in 2009. the hotel was new, and in peak condition. However, upon arrival we were immediately hit with a $12 a day parking fee!! not lised when booking. We booked because I like to use the gym, again this was extra, and not included. We did find out that you can opt out of the daily newspaper delivery and have the cost added to your bill which worked out at about $0.50c perday!! however we still received the newspaper, so small graces etc. The Hotel food was good, the link to the convention centre made access to international drive easy, and our room overlooked sea world which cave an excellent evening fireworks display. The hotel also had a small running track, and a excellent gym and spa. overall the hotel was superb, but the hidden extras were a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every way”
Reviews.Author: cubstink
Reviews.Content: We were there for a convention...five nights. The rooms are fine, service great, food very good in the restaurants we tried. The pools are beautiful and they have their own lazy river with inner tubes. The hotel is only about two years old. The only mistake we made was to not try the steakhouse in the hotel. We went to Johnny's Hideaway about 30 minutes away, spent alot of money and had a mediocre dinner. Next time, we just stay right at the Hilton. And they have a firepit out by the pools. A truly beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Memories! Allergy friendly resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RN4FL
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 young children that took advantage of the facebook memorial day weekend special deal. First let me start by saying we CAN NOT wait to retun on another great trip to the amazing resort! We stayed 4 days/3 nights and our special included free breakfast at the resort buffet resurant overlooking the pool each day. They have an Incredible omelet station and the kids were treated like royalty thanks to Jessica their own personal dietitian....2 of our children have profound food allergies and Jessica and staff oversaw all their food prep and presentation with eagle eye details that won the hearts and tummies of the whole family. Then after spending the day by the fabulous pool/waterpark our package included an awsome dinner pool deck side for all. The food at all three onsite locations were not only delicious but the selection to choose from was stupendious. We truely loved the PURE room we had, the house keeping staff are not only quick and effecient they are also extremely courteous and repectful. All the staff that we encounted, which were numerous on this trip were above and beyound even the best Hilton standards. My children loved the lazy river, the pool basketball, the zero entry pool play area and especially the water SLIDE! As you may have quessed all of our family ages 4-9 for children loved this resort. On a side note, many of our family were ill on the first portion of this stay, the staff to our amazement made arrangements to provide us with in-room service of allergy freiendly popsicles, gingerale/soda's, crakers and anything else our little ones needed to help speed their recovery free of charge. That is service that goes further than than any other resort we have ever stayed in Orlando. We have stayed in Hilton's all over the US and Scotland, but for now we will be calling the Hilton Orlando our home away from home favorite! Thank you Tammy, Cynthia, Jessica and all of our new wonderful Friends for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel but a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: FizzUk
Reviews.Content: I would say this is one of the largest hotels in Orlando - it's huge! It reminded me of the larger hotels in Las Vegas. Checking in was pretty painless although there was always a queue at the desk and a wait. The imposing reception area was smart but clinical. The rooms were excellent and provided everything needed. They were also nice and quiet. Car parking was expensive at $20 per day - this must be one of the very few hotels that charge for parking in Orlando. The hotel was at the end of the International Drive area so a bit out on a limb although there was a bus service close by. The layout of the pools was great. Although the designated "quiet pool" turned out to be very noisy with a group of people drinking and shouting and spoling the peace and tranquility. Hilton staff continued to serve this group with alcohol even though they were extremely rowdy and were also drinking their own alcohol. They should have been asked to move to the general pool area but they weren't! There were also unacompanied teenage kids using rubber rings in this pool too. The business centre offers free airline check-in facilities which worked very well. All in all it's a good hotel but it lacks the warmth and friendliness of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RachaelAnn22
Reviews.Content: Went here for my 29th Birthday celebration! My mom, my 4 year old daughter and I stayed from June 21, 2011-June 24, 2011. The entire hotel is gorgeous, spotless, and overall amazing! Our room was extremely clean and we had a view of Sea World and Aquatica. We could see the fireworkd at Sea World from our room. The pool area is unbelieveable! Pool is huge, there is a waterslide, and a lazy river! There is a basketball and volleyball court. The bar/grill at the pool deck is so good and you can get served at your lounge chair! On my actual Birthday the server brought me out a piece of chocolate cake (complementary) while I was relaxing in my lounge chair. It was so delicious! One of the BEST hotels I've ever been to. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel with a great steakhouse and a fabulous resort style pool area and slide.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPeapod
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. This is a perfect hotel forth business traveler who wants to be right by the convention center but bring his or her family to Orlando. If you can book the rooms for 120 or under it is a great value. Valet and amenities are not cheap; this IS a Florida resort after all. But the pool are is very very nice. There is even an outdoor fire put for marshmallow roasting on cool nights during the winter! The steakhouse on site - Spencer's - is fantastic. The hashbrown side dish and the truffles cream corn side pair beautifully with a medium rare prime rib. (Brussel sprouts were the best but they took them off the menu. Boo!) This hotel is a solid bet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: powertravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Orlando for three nights for a tax conference and family getaway. It was a convenient conference hotel with nice amenities. The hotel food was the typically overpriced selection, but it was convenient to other options. The pool was very nice and a lot of fun. If you are looking for a quieter hotel option in Orlando outside of Disney, this is a good choice. The staff was helpful and pleasant when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Brittany!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheR0adAgain2011
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Orlando Hilton was cut short by a death in our family requiring us to return home immediately. Our family wanted to thank Brittany Cascanet, Front Desk Manager for her professionalism and kindness.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Much Needed Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CRY505
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have not been to Orlando for several years and decided it was time to visit. We really needed a vacation away from the every day routine and the Hilton Orlando really satisified our needs. It is exceptionally clean and the pools are outstanding. I would have given it 5 stars if they did not charge $13 for parking (valet is more), $20 per person for a buffet breakfast which is overpriced, and the worst of all is that they charge $15 per person in the room for internet service. I only needed to use the internet for 1 day to inform my job that my flight was delayed and the hotel would not even give me 1 hour of free usuage to do so. You would think after staying 6 nights that they would have let us do so as a courtesy but no such luck! Many of the area restaurants/hotels offer free WIFI and much a cheaper breakfast value also . Overall it was a great stay and I would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Special employee service makes stay memorable”
Reviews.Author: Ruth29Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Whilst staying recently at the Hilton Holtel Orlando, Florida, we were very impressed with the special service provided by a junior service manager. Karim Hashwani provided exceptional service throughout our stay at the hotel, taking it upon himself to look after our concerns. As an example, when we were trying to source a certain special gift for one of our children, Karim took it upon himself to check all of the local stores for this item, and when unsuccessful, located the item through online purchase, even sorting out the forwarding hotel address details for us. Such thoughtful and innovative service surely deserves a special commendation, as he ensured that our stay at the Hilton Hotel was comfortable and stress-free. We see Karim as a person who should be given responsibilities to meet his true potential for senior leadership in the future. Regards, Ruth and Brent Lewis

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: tampacleaner
Reviews.Content: We all came to Orlando to enjoy Harry Potter world on thursday night's release . . . we did go and loved it. Our highlight was the pool at the hotel !! Yana (pool server) took care of us - she was simply amazing; Mike (food manager) spent good time talking with us and promoting the hotel . We promised him that next time we come we will eat at spencers. Both Yana and Mike took our family stay-cation and made it a great vacation - thank you. We will defenitely come back

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BlueBellGal
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando frequently for business & the Hilton Orlando is always my first choice. The hotel itself is beautiful-location is convenient for my work and the staff is top notch. The restaurant in the lobby is always great service. I don't mind paying for the extras at this hotel as they do go above & beyond. If you have time, enjoy the pool area!

Reviews.Title: “fine for a business trip but....”
Reviews.Author: mblumenthal
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel for a business convention but it was out in the middle of nowhere. They charged for internet access

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too much for extras”
Reviews.Author: sc1234_11
Reviews.Content: I picked the Hilton Orlando because of the pool and that did not disappoint! It is beautiful with lots of fun activities - lazy river, water basketball, water slide, hot tubs, fire pits.The hotel was clean and beautiful, staff was good, concierge went out of her way to help you. But... restaurants were over priced - $4.00 for a cup of coffee in the bistro! They charge you for e verything possible, including daily parking. It would have been nice to have use of a small washer/dryer area. Hotel had wash service but again ridiculously priced. We had to drive 5 miles to a laundromat. No available computers to use for free like other hotels have so you can print boarding passes etc. Again, they charged you for wifi and prinitng. Also would have been nice to have a local restaraunt guide in the room or available in lobby, since no internet to look it up (unless you paid for it). It is a very nice hotel but the extras proved too expensive for a family stay and if I had it to do over I would have booked one of the other resorts that offered kitchenettes and laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: PickyNewY0rker
Reviews.Content: The overall hotel is nice, the beds are great and the pool is perfect for kids and adults. The downside is they charge 17 dollars a day so you can have the privilege of parking your own car and even more if they do it for you. They also want 15 per day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: lid535535
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice and upscale. Good location, the amenities were great. We were a family of 3 and we loved the pool area. Centrally located for us and our vacation, close to family that we came to visit. We would definately stay here again, it was a very beautiful hotel and grounds area. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A top-notch hotel all the way”
Reviews.Author: KManNewYork
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive things about the Orlando Hilton. A first class operation from every step, including check-in. The pool is comparable to those of the finest resorts in the Caribbean. The rooms are extremely clean and new.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel. #1 doesn't seem high enough.”
Reviews.Author: DebiDJ
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando with our twin grandsons and two friends this weekend. The hotel was marvelous and we had a wonderful time there. The rooms are beautiful, especially the white bedding. We ate in the Bistro restaurant twice. The food was great and the service was warm and attentive. The pools are great and our friends spent an afternoon with the boys. We still aren't sure who had the most fun. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a play to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great!! But watch out for the concierge Amanda!!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and very well located!! The suggestion I make to individuals who do not plan to drive is to do your research on the types of transportation around... You have the 111 that is right across the hotel and it takes you to Disney world for only 2$!!!! You have the iride trolley very close by that goes up and down international driveway!! I went with my best friend and we made a huge mistake by asking The concierge Amanda - who is absolutely rude and it appears that she dislikes people. She gave false information on purpose to get ride of us and ended up costing us a fortune in transportation - gave horrible recommendations to places - that were pretty shady! This lady only looks out for own interest and it seems all she tries to do is sell rickets to theme parks ( which they get commission on).... But fortunately for us there was an amazing concierge that also worked with the wicked witch - Susan!!! The most helpful individual in the Hilton Hotel!! She helped us with everything!! It's hard for tourists to be fully prepared because you need time to get adjusted in a new city - Susan eased us in the adjustment... Another downside of the hotel is wifi is not available at the lobby - you still have to pay and it's really pricy...Other than those two downsides - I do recommend the hotel and suggest Susan for ppl who need guidance for activities, theme parks, restaurants and transportation?

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Rattler93a
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a very convenient location to all of Orlando's attractions. Sea World is just a walk down the road and Disney is certainly accessible but a few miles away. With that said, without a rental car, it would be expensive to get around to most other areas and dining at farther venues. The high spacious ceilings in all areas from the conference areas to the lobby and in the hallways to the rooms has a major drawback. There are no sound deadening materials to absorb conversations and noise, therefore, expect a not so quiet but energetic atmosphere. Even the hallways outside of the rooms allows for conversation monitoring 50 feet down the corridor. I often had to seek the out of doors areas to make phone calls when not in the guest rooms. Rooms are spacious and include all of the needed amenities. Fairly quiet sleeping in comfortable beds that have the feel of home. The pool system is just short of spectacular and only duplicated at the theme parks. A hotel associated with conferences, this is a place that takes care of all your needs from roominess to service and meals. Walking distance to the Orlando Convention Centers and local restaurants and fast food chains gives many choices to hotel fare. I'd stay here again providing conference rates are in effect.

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved #1rating!”
Reviews.Author: allioops03
Reviews.Content: Picked the Hilton Orlando because of reviews and pics of pool area.... And was not disappointed!!! From the outside , the Hilton is nothing special. Just proves" you can't judge a book by it's cover"! Beautiful lobby, lovely & spacious clean rooms that look like new. Same for the bathrooms. We took the bed & breakfast option . Buffet at The Bistro which was excellent. Loved , , loved the pool area and lazy river. Didn't get as great a rate as others but would definitely would stay again. Even with ALL the choices in the area this is the resort to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JaxDrummer
Reviews.Content: The lazy river was wonderful, it was great having the floats right there ready for use. Disappointed with the lack of service in the poolside bar. Said down at a table, made eye contact with 2 servers and then waited for another 5 minutes. No one came to the table so we left. Nice to have the Real Coffee Mugs and 2 cup coffee maker in the room, the creamer was rancid and we could not enjoy the coffee we made. Great to have a mini fridge for drinks and breakfast items for the kids as we were visiting Sea World. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: vnessbel
Reviews.Content: I was taking a staycation for my Birthday, also known as staying in your city but just getting a hotel for a mini vacation. This is hands down the best hotel. The service is excellent, the amenities are more than one can ask for, the rooms are perfect and the price is right. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Orlando or Central Florida for family, fun business or staycations! The pool, lazy river and slide are a huge plus too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool, great price!”
Reviews.Author: lovelylady28
Reviews.Content: We came here over 4th of July weekend and had an awesome stay. Initially, we were going with a Disney moderate resort but the more I looked at the hotel online the more apprehensive I became. So after looking on trip advisor we decided on Hilton Orlando and so happy we did. We booked through the hotel website and were able to get the room for 109 a night over 4th weekend! The pool was amazing, the slide was thrilling and lazy river was huge. My husband and son ate on property and loved the food. The rooms were immaculate and room service was prompt and friendly. It was also very accessible to Disney and close to Universal. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “This place is AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: llmiller_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just amazing! Everyone is so helpful and nice. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The pool area felt like I was in Hawaii and Las Vegas combined. There was something for everyone. I enjoyed the lazy river with my daughter and then laying out at the adult pool without any kids at the pool was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cabuba
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, well maintain nice and comfy room, good location close to main attractions and plenty or restaurants around, awesome pool. Too bad there is parking fee for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney location and super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: kmerrill
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the doormen greeted us with a huge smile, a great way to start off a family vacation. Brittany at the front desk gave us a beautiful room with a view of the pools. The room was cleaned every day. This is one of the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed at. All the Disney attractions were well within driving distance ( about 20 minutes). I'm only sorry that we were only able to spend one full day at the hotel. The restaurant David's Club offers a large menu and the food and staff are unbelivable. The pools are a great place to relax. We are sorry that we did not allocate enough time enjoying all the hotel has to offer (gym, tennis, basketball, six restaurants, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to multiple attractions”
Reviews.Author: u2fan56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Orlando over the weekend of June 17-19. We were town for few days visiting Disney and the various sites. The hotel has a very big pool area that includes multiple pools and lazy river. We definitely enjoyed the pool area. The room is average side and nothing out of the ordinary. The hotel is very clean. The gym has a lot of equipment and is very nice. The hotel is very close to International Drive and Sand Lake Road. The hotel is only about 15-20 minutes from Disney. The hotel is close to I-4 and the Beachline tollway. We really enjoyed the hotel and had no major issues during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel....we will go back!!”
Reviews.Author: SamprasCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. We stayed there for seven nights. It's not far from Disney and the Universal Studio. In fact, it's pretty close to many attractions. This hotel got a very nice pool, one tennis court, mini-putt golf, basketball court, a water slide, outdoor running track, a lazy-river, and not to mention a well equipped gym to work out. I have also tried their restaurants, very good value and they do not tend to over charge like some other hotels. The staff is very helpful and polite. Top marks! The lobby is spacious and nicely decorated. Parking is not free but very easy to access from the lobby. I will and have already recommend to my friends and other families. I would suggest you rent a car and stay at this hotel. It's close to everything....Finally, this hotel is clean, so is my room. The cleaning ladies too are very courteous. They say Good Morning to you when they see you, not rude at all. If they do a good job, I would suggest you give a small tip.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Leisure_traveler075
Reviews.Content: Why stay somewhere else? Great hotel in Orlando. Extremely pleasant staff, clean hotel, large pool with a slide and lazy river, basketball and volleyball courts, comfortable rooms, oh did I say pleasant staff??? At check in I made a joke about worm cookies referring to other Hilton brands. That night after the pool room service brought us assorted tray of cookies and chilled milk. What a service!! It made us lifelong Hilton customers. Spa personnel took my girls in for kids pedicure and made them feel special without a need for reservation. Thank you for the cookies. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SavoryNotions
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to be staying at the Hilton Orlando for a convention last May. The hotel is nearly new and incredible! The entire facility is gorgeous. There were plenty of dining choices, the concierge was very helpful, rooms spacious, and the pool an incredible retreat after a long day at the convention. We have recommended this hotel to all of our friends making a trip to Orlando for both buisness or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME - We Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: Lifsgud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for AAU Volleyball Tournament 4nights. The hotel staff and facilities were AWESOME!! We had the best pizza thru, room service! Ate appetizers and drinks at David's, wonderful. Ate poolside twice, food was great! Also, ate breakfast buffet which was pleasing to all!! The lazy river was so relaxing after a long day of volleyball especially with a pitcher of amazing spirits from poolside cafe. Daughter's friend lost phone at pool. Security found it and returned it to our room. Hotel staff did little things to make our stay incredible! My daughter got sick, bad cough and Hilton staff accomodated, moved us to PURE room floors which helped tremendously! Will Definitely stay again. Easy walk to the South or Northside of Orange County Convention Center!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always Great..”
Reviews.Author: UESNYC646
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I go to Orlando for business. I am VERY picky about where I lay my head down at night and find this place to be very clean and comfortable. Hope they keep it up so it does not fall into the average category like a lot of hotels do after awhile...

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: msualum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-night stay for the AAU Jr. Volleyball Nationals and found the Hilton to be exceptional. "Attached" to the Orange County Convention Center, where the tournament was held, it was about a 7-10 minute walk (not all indoors, though) The first night, the hotel was overbooked, so most of my daughter's team was relocated to the Omni, about 20 minutes away. What could have been a huge inconvenience was handled professionally, courteously, and pleasantly by every Hilton employee I encountered. Not only did Hilton cover the night at the Omni, they also paid for taxi service to and from the Omni, and the first night's stay at the Hilton! Every employee apologized often and sincerely and asked repeatedly if there were anything else they could do. The rooms were immaculate, well-appointed, and well-maintained and the elevators were very efficient. The pools were very clean, spacious, and diverse and included a lazy river, quiet pool, slide, and fountains. As expected, the food was generally expensive, but surprisingly reasonable and of high quality at the poolside bar/cafe. The concierge provided extensive details about getting the most of a visit to Universal/Islands of Adventure; no one seemed in a hurry and were all so very pleasant. This experience made me resolve to always stay in a Hilton whenever possible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and exquisite”
Reviews.Author: LilCountry256
Reviews.Content: When I walked through the doors my mouth was opened. The lobby was decorated beautifully and the agents were very helpful. I was attending a conference onsite at the hotel and I got a full tour of the HUGE hotel. The rooms were clean, nice, and up-to-date. I slept wonderfully. We dined at David's Club Bar & Grill and the service and food was yummy. I will definitely go back for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Chilled”
Reviews.Author: wychwood100
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's trip to Orlando. As you may see from our previous reviews (!) we are very picky about our hotels and what we like. We had a lovely week here. We loved the quiet pool & the pool bar for lunch. We had a room on 15th floor with an emperor bed which was fine & spacious.The bed was exceptionally comfy for a hotel bed. No bathrobes when we got there but they were quickly provided after speaking to Karim in the Executive Lounge. And wasn't he a gem ... nothing was too much trouble. He even tried to locate an I-pad 2 for our son. He and the ladies in the Lounge were always friendly and accommodating and a hotel is only as good as it's staff! We had only a couple of niggles ... one that the hotel did not provide it's own transport from the airport. We used Mears as recommended by the hotel and it was not a particularly efficient service. Then, on arrival at the hotel, we showed an email that invited us to check-in at the Exec Lounge and asked at the Bell Boy desk outside if we could get our pass for the Lounge to check-in there but was told that we had to get that from the Concierge inside. No offer of taking our suitcases inside. At this point we weren't impressed. But, inside our suitcases were taken, we were given a key to the Lounge checked in there and our suitcases were in the room when we got there. Perfect. The rooms were cleaned to a very high standard, but it would have helped if there had been two easy chairs to sit on rather than just the one when relaxing in the evening. Overall, a wonderful break for us in an excellent hotel. We shall certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet getaway after a day of Disney madness :)”
Reviews.Author: kppj
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was only a couple of miles away from Disney and it catered mostly to business travellers. After a day of being run over by strollers we wanted somewhere nice, quiet and without a lot of kids to relax, the Hilton was the perfect place to relax after a long day. At check in we met one of the front desk managers (Britney?) and she was fantastic she said that they had noticed we were checking in for a long stay and wanted to make sure they made it as comfortable as possible. She even gave us a discount on the daily parking since we were staying for so long (10 days). The room was more than adequate for the two of us and it had a fridge and coffee maker which were both very handy for making hot water for instant oatmeal and storing cold drinks. The pool was also another perk that had attracted me to the Hilton, we only took advantage of the lazy river but the main pool or the kiddie area never appeared to be very busy. We only ate at the bistro restaurant down by the pool and that was for breakfast, the meal was tasty and made with good quality ingredients, they also had a buffet that we tried another day which was good too. Just a short drive down International drive there are many restaurants to chose from and there is a mcdonalds an ihop and a red lobster within easy walking distance. Overall we liked the clean modern feel of the Hilton, it was quiet and comfortable. If I visit Orlando again on a Disney vacation I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronbokaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights during a conference at the Orange County Convention Center. The hotel is attached to the convention center. The hotel is top notch. Great pool area, several nice restaurants, excellent service. The hotel gym is legit...not a typical hotel gym but a real health club. I would stay here again without question. It's not cheap (around $200) but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Orlando Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Wingodi
Reviews.Content: This was the best Hotel in Orlando. This hotel has a great location either if you are on vacation or business. All employees were very nice. Parking is huge and easy to access. Room services was excellent and fast. Beds are very comfortable. Clean Hotel. The swimming pools and near area are great for children and adults. Will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Ellengk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton while attending a conference that was held onsite. The conference staff was extremely professional and courteous and the meeting facilities are well-suited for medium-sized events (several hundred attendees). My room was well-appointed and very clean. My room was on a level of the hotel that included access to an Executive Lounge, which was wonderful. Although I did not need to access the Orange County Convention Center during this stay, this hotel property is adjacent to the OCCC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - staff a delight”
Reviews.Author: Meekay
Reviews.Content: Hotel was slightly low on occupancy , but staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us. Outside pools and lazy river were superb, with a separate pool area for "adults" , where noise was kept to a minimum. Location suited us - just outside of the tourist area of International Drive , bust just a 5 min drive to al lthe restaraunts etc

Reviews.Title: “The pool was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: drjekyll
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only, since our flight arrived in afternoon and didn't make sense to go to the theme parks for only part of a day. Went to the pool. The lazy rivier and the slide were awesome. I went on them almost as much as the kids. They found friends and they then had a pickup water basketall game. We went to the steakhouse. The food was good, but we had no alcohol or dessert and dropped 160.00 for two kids and two adults. Valet parking is 20, but self is 13 and inconvenient. The coffee shop was good and the people very friendly. Doug was our bellman and he remembered our names and was very helpful. Overall we really enjoyed it, but as with all nice hotels, you get nickel and dimed for all of the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel. Attention to detail is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: IrishPrince
Reviews.Content: To give you an idea of their attention to detail, the glasses in the room don't have any water spots. First class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: piggieConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton because of a trade show at the Convention Center. The hotel is wonderful. The lobby is huge and has all the amentities you need. Concierge, Bell service and a marketplace (food, wine and necessitites) The room was a nice size with wireless internet. Room service was prompt and delicous. Although I didn't get to take advantage there were 3 pool areas. One is designated as a "quieter" area without kids. There is also a spa I didn't get to try but looked beautiful. I dined in the "sports" bar which is huge and has non typical fare for a sports bar. There is also a bistro for breakfast and lunch. As I Hilton member I also used the lounge. The manager was over and above helpful. A quick drive down the street gives you a huge array of restaurants to choose from as well as family activiites. Self Parking is $13 and Valet is $20.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xploringtheworld
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrive at the Hilton, we (me and my co-workers) were impress with the friendliness of the staff, the cleaniness of the hotel, and the decor of the establishment. The food was delicious and did I mention how friendly the staff was, from the doorman, bell staff, housekeeping, conceirge, pool staff, and front desk. Because we were on a business trip, we didn't get a chance to enjoy all the hotel had to offer, however we are planning to go back just for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: Lazyshoppinmoma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than i expected. The staff was fantastic, very friendly and helpful. They really care about you here. And the pool, lets just say i haven't seen anything nicer. Everyone will love it, it's very relaxing on the lazy river and the kids will have a ball on the water slide. I HIGHLY recommend. The food and drinks were also out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: starlil2000
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hilton for my son's 3rd birthday. Let me just say the hotel is brand new with great service and an awesome pool area! We were a party of 6 and got a parlor suite which includes a king bedroom, a double queen bedroom, and an enormous parlor in between that had a dining room table, a sofa bed, and a large flat screen tv. We had a total of 3 bathrroms with amazing Peter Thomas Roth products. There was a quite pool, and a family pool. The family pool had a slide and sprinklers that all children enjoy very much, as well as a lazy river that all of us liked to cruise through. On Friday my husband informed the staff that it was our son's birthday and when we returned from Sea World there was a complimentary chocolate cake waiting for us. There is a McDonalds and an IHOP right across the street as well as many higher end restaurants down International Drive. I would recommend the Hilton to anyone travelling with children as well as couples as there is a lot for everyone to do!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with an Incredible Pool(s)”
Reviews.Author: nocurfu53
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night but was a great experience. Check In was a breeze. Lobby is beautiful. The Rooms are goregous. Very large and very clean. Big Flat Screen TV. The Pools are the best thing about this resort. They have several. Adult pool, kiddies pool and a Lazy River Pool which you sit in a tube and just float along and relax! If you are driving there and using a GPS you had better call the Hotel directly. They have a New Address to enter. It is not 6001 Destination Parkway!! The only negative of this Hotel is that they charge you $13 every night for Parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax with the family!”
Reviews.Author: FelicityOrtega
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 1 year old daughter in celebration of her 1st birthday. We wanted to be close to Sea World and this was perfect. The pools were lots of fun and clean. Plenty of towels. Pool restaurant was okay- not too bad, not too good. Rooms were nice and clean. Nice king bed and the staff brought up a crib for the baby. She loved the full length mirrors in the room, too. I recommend paying the $10 extra for valet. They have a svc where u can send a text and your car will be there when you get downstairs. Overall a great place. No complaints. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimm992
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I took a "girls trip" here this past September and it was one of the best trips of my life! This hotel is absoultely fantastic!! The service was incredible, the food was great (we loved the room service!), the pool was clean and well maintained and we loved the lazy river! The restaurant on the lower level across from the spa was our favorite for breakfast every morning! We also spent a day at the spa and VERY much enjoyed it. I would go back here in a heart beat!! Hands down one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great team and great food !”
Reviews.Author: PierreBoup
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. The people were so nice. We were there for 10 sunny days. The 3 pools are great; with great service and food. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. The Spencer restaurant is awesome; Mitch, Jackie & chef Eric were fantastic. The morning buffet is excellent and Dennis was great. A million thanks to the whole team for a great stay !!!! We will be back !!!! Pierre B.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting our expecations and More!!!”
Reviews.Author: britt2588
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel after a busy holiday weekend for just a few nights, I will have yo say that we Found David's CLub to be out favorite hang out. It was a little quite in there due to lack of people in the hotel but Candy the Manager was FANTASTIC she remembered us everytime we were in, she evern took the time to tell us about the area and why Orlando is a great place. She went way above and Beyond my Boyfriend and My expecations! Our Server Jorey was also awesome! He helped reccommend some crafts for my boyfriend making sure that his glass was never empty!!! The food was also amazing! My boyfriend and i agreed if it were not for Candy and Jorey we would have not enjoyed our vacation as much as we did. Talk about meeting our expecations and then some!!! I would Highly reccomend this hotel to anyone!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “I never write reviews but Hilton Orlando is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SteeBee
Reviews.Content: I planned a mini-vacation with my 5 year old son to visit Universal and Islands of Adventure. I thoroughly researched all the hotels within a 5 mile vicinity including the Universal property hotels. After reading all the reviews and comparing the amenities I chose the Hilton Orlando and it exceeded my expectations from the minute we stepped foot on the property. Visually it is gorgeous...everything is brand new and meticulously maintained. Valet, check-in and bell-hop service are extremely efficient and very friendly. Loved the pool bar and menu since they offered more than just cheeseburgers and fried foods. Drink specials were yummy! My son loved the family pool slide and we both enjoyed the lazy river. Even though we were there for Memorial Day weekend, we could always find tubes to float in. After our first exhausting day at the park we had a wonderful dinner at Spencers. Our server, Jackie, was very knowledgeable about the menu and accommodating when my 5 year old started to get sleepy at the table. My steak dinner was comparable to Charley's or Burns (other well-known FL steakhouses). Breakfast at Bistro's was always very good. We tried the buffet one morning and I had my guilty pleasure of Eggs Benedict another day...both meals were excellent. The marketplace had great snacks, gelato and wine to go! One evening on our way back from the hotel, my son fell asleep so I had to carry him from the valet area up to our room. A bell hop saw me carrying my son, my bag and store bags and ran over to help me. He wouldn't even take a tip when we arrived at the room (but I insisted when we saw him the next day). I don't have any real complaints but would offer my realistic opinion. We had room-service twice...fast delivery but the food was mediocre and expensive (as with any hotel I have every visited). Also since I had a young child with me, I assume I was given a room in a part of the hotel that had children too...since I could hear them when we were in the room. Not terribly annoying to me but if this would bother you, I suggest requesting a room away from the families with younger children. There is also an adult pool which is quieter and away from the family pool too. The hotel was an easy 10 minute ride to Universal. We would leave at 8:30 for the 9am opening and never had traffic despite the holiday weekend. We would also leave mid-afternoon and easily come back after dinner for a few hours to enjoy the parks at night. Everyone was so friendly throughout our stay, knowledgeable about the amenities of the property and surrounding area and seemed to genuinely put service as the priority of their job. I sincerely appreciate this in a hotel and the hotel staff since most guests, including myself, have worked hard at my own job to enjoy a few relaxing days. We stayed an extra night since I was very relaxed and my son was having fun...it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: bellson88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently and thought it was a great value. Nice pools, clean rooms and conveniently located next to Sea World and Aquatica. I wasn't blown away by the hotel but I definitely think it's a great value if you are traveling to Orlando and want to stay on I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond fabulous”
Reviews.Author: emilybl
Reviews.Content: Well we are now officially ruined from probably ever enjoying another hotel again. We spent three days there in late May and it was beyond incredible. The staff is extremely attentive, friendly and polite. The pool...oh my gosh the pool. Nothing will ever compare. The room was lovely, the lobby was large and beautiful and everything was immaculate. The only complaint we all seemed to share was that the beds were very hard and the bedding was quite stiff. We never had that "ahhh" moment when we got into the beds. They were a bit uncomfortable for our tastes. Everyone is different so I'm sure others enjoy them very much. We enjoyed eating at David's a couple of the nights. It was very relaxing, food was great and the prices were very reasonable. This was first class all the way. You can't go wrong staying here. We also vacationed in Orlando in early May and stayed at another hotel for 7 days while we did the Disney parks. This short trip was just a getaway with us just enjoying the hotel. I'm glad I didn't book this hotel when we were doing the Disney park trip. The hotel was too nice to leave all day; no one would have wanted to got to Disney. It really is a place to stay at and enjoy the pool all day. The lazy river was so tropical and enjoyable. The slide is surprisingly big and fast. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I'm just very sad to not be there today.

Reviews.Title: “If you either like swimming pools or you are in Orlando visiting the convention Centre - you'll love it.”
Reviews.Author: TheButterflyEffect75
Reviews.Content: Good 4-star hotel, clean, quiet, with fantastic swimming pool area and several bars and restaurants. Located in the vicinity of the Convention Centre, this hotel is the best choice if you have to visit this place. The service might be better (e.g. I had to wait more than 20 minutes before the staff managed to duplicate my keycard).

Reviews.Title: “Expect to be impressed (Diamond Member Review)”
Reviews.Author: LeavingOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: Wow - just when I was thinking Hilton was like a fallen star from a different era this hotel proved me wrong FABULOUS: - the gym (huge, new, complete) - the spa (free for diamond members) - the executive club lounge - the rooms (spacious and sound-proofed) - the restaurant (amazing food) - the pools (multiple -with an adult only) THE BAD: - having to leave

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Convenience”
Reviews.Author: ACI120
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for access to the convention center. Compared to the other's in proximity this one is very comfortable and provides easy access to the center. Not sure I would want to stay here for a vacation trip but a very nice place for business. Service at the pool side bar and the lounge were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay if Visiting Disney but you don't want the Disney crowds”
Reviews.Author: JLC5
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to Disney and we wanted to be away from the crowds at Disney. We booked our reservation for an hypoallergenic pure room and used 2 nights of hilton rewards for our stay. The room had 2 queen beds, perfect for our 3 year old and my wife and I. The room was very clean. The room has a refridge and we requested a microwave, which was able to be accomodated. I had informed the hotel that this was an important week for my family (Wedding Anniversary, Both my wife and my birthday, and our daughters first visit to disney). I asked for 4 things before our visit. 1. could we stay in the same room with the best possible view of the pool considering a combination of reward nights and other rate types. 2. Could we have a microwave, especially important with young children. 3. Could we have xtra bedsheets and towels available. 4. Could we check-in early, we arrived about 130PM. I am happy to say that all 4 requests were met but that is not all. The manager went above and beyond understanding how important a week it was for our family. He provided complimentary Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries on our anniversary. He also went the extra mile to get a our daughter a Mickey stuffed animal (her favorite), bracelet, and other small gifts to make her first visit to Disney a memorable one. The manager also suprised us with a huge birthday cake, professionally decorated and covered with chocolate and fruit. It was awesome and the generosity really made our trip special. Also, the Hilton has a superb pool and water activities on the premises. You do not need to go to Disney's waterparks if you stay here. Save the money. The hilton has a lazy river, and tube slide, a private pool, a bar/restarunt that will serve you at the pool, giant tower and is well maintained. In addition, there is a full basketball, volleyball courts, and a putting green for non -pool folks. My daughter loved the pool. It was a great break from the crowds at disney to go to the pool in the middle of the day when its hottest. Then we would return to Disney at night. They provide free floaties and balls and have basket you can shoot at in the pool. Hilton also has a full service concierge who can help you find great resturant nearby or if you want to find out about Downtown Disney shops. They will make reservations for you and help you obtain transportation if you need it. They were a nice resource and helped us during our stay. The hilton also has really good food in the hotel. We ate at all four resturants during our stay. I'd recommend the Bistro for breakfast (great but a little pricey), Spencers has great prime steaks, salads, and a dynamite chocolate souffle, David's is a nice bar/rst with good food, and the marketplace is pricey but will have what you need. The convienece of having good food in the hotel when we were tired from spending all day at the parks was great. My family and I will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disney. So if you want a great room and great service and want to be away from the Disney crowds, this is an ideal place for families. Car trip to Disney 15 minutes on average. The only thing I would like to have in the hotel that you don't is FREE WIFI. But if your visiting Disney, you will not have much time to use it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool, great restaurant, nice location”
Reviews.Author: samanne
Reviews.Content: The pool area is awesome! There's tons of space and different areas to hang out. There's a poolside restaurant with good food, too. We ate at the steakhouse and it was very good! The service was excellent! The rooms are a little small but nicely decorated. It's on the outer edge of the main drag so you'll have to drive to get closer to the action. But it's right off the highway which is nice to get around, too. You have to pay to park yourself or pay to valet so consider this as an added expense.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing facilities”
Reviews.Author: vanweezy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a conference next door at the Orange County Convention Center. It was super convenient because there's a walkway that connects the hotel to the convention center. I hadn't even looked at the amenities of the hotel before booking, but I was very impressed upon arrival. The pool area is more like a waterpark! There is a large pool, and then a few smaller pools surrounding it. There is a waterslide and a lazy river too. I wasn't bothered by kids playing, but if you are, the quieter surrounding pools are just for you. There were plenty of loungers and towels available, and staff came around often to see if I needed anything. There's a bar and restaurant right by the pool to grab a bite to eat. There is also a sport court and tennis court nearby. I was very pleased with the fitness center as well. It's like a full gym! Numerous bikes, treadmills, and ellipticals, as well as circuit training machines, a full weight set, etc. There are TVs either on each machine, or within view. It was awesome. The hotel also has a convenience store on-site, and a few different restaurants. When I went off-site, there were always taxis waiting out front. I had a really great stay there, and all of the staff was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “WHO WOULD HAVE THOUGHT, ONE BAD INCIDENT MAKES THE ENTIRE STAY MAGICAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: TinaSoBizee79
Reviews.Content: Everything you'd expect from the Hilton and more! Cleanest hotel I've stayed in... still smells brand new. Went to go for a run one afternoon on their enormous jogging trail, which is situated around their beautiful putting green. As soon as the door shut behind me, I instantly realized I left my room key inside. Happens all the time and it's such an inconvenience. Call front desk, they need id, security takes FOREVER... etc. etc. But not the Hilton Orlando. As soon as I got done calling the front by my elevator, they told me security would be up shortly to let me in. I was preparing to wait a while. But before I even made it back to my door to standby for Security, Eli was already sneaking up behind me to let me in. This security officer has to be the best in state! He was so courteous and understanding, making an embarrassing situation seem common and acceptable. Couldn't believe it. I made sure to offer a generous tip which he declined. He asks me if I know the way to the gym and trail since he sees that my attire suggests so. I tell him I haven't been yet. This officer WALKS ME all the way to the trail, stops at a diner along the way downstairs and grabs me a bottled water for my run!!! I am coming here every time I have business in Orlando. ELI IS THAT REASON. I hope to lose my keys every time I'm here too. He was the highlight of my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “A great New Years celebration”
Reviews.Author: mr jacksonville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to getaway for New Years at the Hilton Orlando. Our 3-night stay was very comfortable and relaxing to say the least. The hotel still looks and smells brand new. From the moment we pulled in to get our suitcases situated, the valets and bellhops were very friendly and directed me to the front desk. The parking concourse was self- sufficient and adequately spaced. Check in was a matter of seconds and being a hilton honors member, I requested an upgrade. Unfortunately, the upgrades were not available, but my 10.00 a day parking fee was waived! Our room was on the 17th floor and provided a nice view of the city. The amenities in the room included a mini-friedge, in-room safe, LCD with several channels and pay-per-view. Additionally, there was an MP3 compatible alarm clock, lounging chair, work desk, coffee maker and phone with voice mail. The bed was very comfortable with several pillows and the sheets were changed daily. The bathroom was immaculate, consisting of a large vanity mirror with a granite base. The floor and shower were lined with a beautiful tile. In short, the room itself was fresh, modern, and clean. Undoubtedly, this is a business hotel as it connects to the convention center. However, this is a great place for families and romantic getaways. During my first night, I went down to the sports bar and ordered a hamburger and fries. As a hotel guest, the charges were added to my checkout bill. I did take the time to explore the hotel and its amenities (this hotel is massive)! While I didn't get to everything, I can say: the pool is wonderful (the pictures don't do it justice). The ballroom is something to behold. The conference rooms are innumerable and well equipped. In summation, this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. This hotel can suit many needs, but the key as always is doing your homework and learning what the hotel is and what it has to offer. I made my decision to stay here in part because of tripadvisor reviews and pictures, and in part the hilton description and incredible rate I received. Some things to be aware of are the daily parking fee, the charge for wired and wireless internet, and the fact that this hotel can be very busy at times. It is in a great location off International drive, convenient to 1-4 and all the parks and outlets. Restaurants are in relative walking distance, though the hotel has plenty on-site. Me and my wife thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if the price is right, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay !”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another excellent stay at the Hilton Orlando. Since I live just a couple of hours away I like to use this property for a one or two night quick getaway, and it never disappoints. From Kit at check in, who was very polite and accommodating when I arrived earlier than planned, to the every-friendly staff everywhere my stay was perfect. As I spent the majority of my time at the pool, I can tell you the service there from the bar staff was the best I have ever experienced anywhere - if you go, try to sit in Roxann's section out by the pool, or if you are sitting under the covering try to sit in Dio's section - both are the best servers you will find ANYWHERE. Very friendly - very fast - and always remember me from visit to visit. If you are looking for a place to just relax, sit by a pool or lazy river - this is one I can highly recommend. Being located right on International Drive it also gives you plenty to do if you get bored of "relaxing" - but trust me, I don't think you will....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: allenrj
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, wonderful amenities, excellent staff. Be careful with the restaurants recommended by the concierge, not always the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: tenabeana
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. It was exceptionally clean and the staff went out of their way to help. I can't comment on the price as I was staying on business and did not make the arangements. There were taxi's there at all times which was convenient. This is connected to a convention center so there are A LOT of people aound. I visited the family pool which was not to full, I also vitited the quiet pool and only a handful of people were there. There was a full bar where you could order drinks and food as well. The Bistro on the LL was very good and the prices were reasonable for lunch, not so much for breakfast but reasonable enough for hotel restuarant I guess. The concierge was not very helpful finding a Japanese restuarant but did have ideas on other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Stephen is the BEST! Love him, love him, love the Orlando Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Queendrea
Reviews.Content: The Orlando Hilton is FAB-U-LOUS! When we arrived my colleagues and I had different experiences. Two of us had STEPHEN helping us. He was so nice and very helpful. I wanted a good view and he got me a great view of the exquisite pool area. He listened to our concerns and gave us everything we needed to have a great stay. The others went to Angela, she was very rude to them and said, "there's nothing I can do about that" to everything they asked about. Fortunately, Stephen fixed it for them and made them feel much better. He didn't even want a tip! Give Stephen a raise! (Give angela a broom).

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was amazing but the staff made the trip!”
Reviews.Author: jennaandmark
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the pool were amazing. But the staff was even better. They went above and beyond their job to make the stay incredible. Nicky and Kit at the front desk were especially great. They deserve acknowledgemet of their hospitality, which was well above what anyone could ever have expected, especially with thousands of teenagers staying at the hotel for DECA. Nicky and Kit truly made our trip and Hilton should feel lucky to have them!

Reviews.Title: “Appaling service, very average hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: charlotte_reviews
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights at the HILTON ORLANDO on a recent trip to Orlando. If this hotel is ranked 4th best hotel in Orlando on Tripadvisor, I wonder how the rest of properties must be! We were very happy to leave this place. This might be a great place if either: 1. You travel on an expense account and don´t care to be overcharged for everything 2. If you get a very cheap deal or even better get it free with your HH reward points 3. If you attend a conference at the nearby Orlando Conference Center Other than for the above specified reasons, I don´t understand why everyone here is raving about this place (granted that I have not stayed at any other property in Orlando, I am only comparing my other hotel experience with this one). You get very poor service, from check-in to restaurants, I got a special offer through Expedia and had to insist and show a written proof at check-in in order to get what I paid for! Only the pool staff and the very nice concierge girl were helpful and friendly. I would definitely be staying somewhere else in my next trip to Orlando and would not recomment it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: Brokerjay
Reviews.Content: After confirming my room reservation the morning of my arrival, the Hilton Orlando over booked the hotel! My stay was part of a very large conference (Craig Proctor) that had been booked for 6 months in advance. They never mentioned anything about it the morning I called to confirm the room. I have a bit of a phobia about dirty hotels so I did ALOT of research prior to my stay. I was satisfied with the reviews and past patrons comments. The reason I mention this is because when I arrived at the hotel, they inform me that they over booked the hotel but had made arrangements with the double tree hotel down the road. This hotel falls within my phobia issues as being old, dirty and certainly not where I expected or planned on laying my head that night. My cell phone service was interfering with the asbestos popcorn ceilings in my room. I can only imagine that the Hilton had ample time to make arrangements at the DT as well as produce a vert long apology and complimentary items for the "mishap". I understxndvthings happen but just tell people prior to arriving so other arrangements can be made suitinle to the patron. Just a bad decision for Hilton management.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: alanamom
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through Priceline. The hotel amenities were great. Self parking was convenient, plentiful and reasonably priced. The kids loved the lazy river and pool. The food was great - we ate by the pool twice and breakfast buffet once. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The hotel was filled with teenagers for grad night and the DECA convention. A large group of them stayed on our floor, but surprisingly enough the noise level was low. I lost some jewelry by the pool on our first night there. What could have been a disaster turned out to be a shining example of exemplary customer service from the pool staff that went above and beyond to help us. A special thanks to Dio for all his help, his honesty and integrity should be recognized and we thank him sincerely. I would absolutely recommend the hotel and we will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Executive lounge staff was very pleasant, friendly, and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: kraberdeen
Reviews.Content: A young man named Chris working in the executive lounge was very friendly and helpful. He was willing to help everyone and talk to everyone no matter their status. We paid the extra room rate to use the executive lounge as a fun perk for my wife and I. We didn't know what to expect as far as how we would be treated by your staff but we were treated very well by all the executive lounge staff. They were all very friendly and helpful. Thank you for a wonderful time at your Hilton in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: lzinsmaster11
Reviews.Content: Quite pricey but we got a convention discount so it was well worth it. The pool makes you feel like you're at a resort in Mexico. It even has a lazy river. Rooms are comfortable and bedding is plush and nice. No free shuttles to theme parks but all are w/in a 10 min drive. You can get on the toll road right by the hotel to get on I-4 (E or W) w/out having to actually pay the toll which is nice so you don't have to go all the way down International Blvd to get to I-4. Also abouto 2 miles from the world's largest McDonalds, Ripley''s Believe it or Not museum and lots of restaurants. Fun area to dine/drink/hang out. Right next to the convention center but about a 15 - 20 min walk (outdoors) if you're heading to the west building of the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this Hotel in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: JonVB
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. I travel every week and stay in Hilton Hotels from coast to coast. This is as good as it gets. If you are traveling with children you will be pleasantly surprised to know that the pictures of the pool areas don't do them justice. We actually chose to stay at the resort one day because of the pool and surrounding areas. When we checked in I informed the ladies at the desk that this trip was for my son. He has to deal with his dad travelling every week and this was his turn to stay in a hotel. When we arrived in our room, they had delivered a hand written note along with drinks and snacks for my son. GREAT TOUCH!!! You can also choose for upgrades if you are willing to pay a little extra. Being a Diamond member, I have access to the executive lounge with a light breakfast and snacks throughout the day. This has become rather crowded so the hotel opened a 2nd lounge on the lobby level. Much less crowded and allows you to sit outside:) The customer service was fantastic. The location was fantastic. The resort facilities are fantastic. The only negative were the "love bugs" that showed up on our last day. Apparently they come out in full force this time of year and there is nothing the hotel can do to prevent them. However, as we were leaving I did see the hotel management dressed in suits passing out refreshing water to those still in the pool area. All in all a great time and a great true RESORT hotel. Thanks Hilton Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Spring Break Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyFamily_03
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect for a family vacation. For the first time, we actually spent more time at the hotel then at the theme parks. Not planned, but with the hotel amenities and the service we never wanted to leave. The basketball court in and out of the pool had my 13 year old son occupied throughout the day. My husband and I actually enjoyed some free time lounging in the lazy river. The poolside service and restaurant were great. Paid a few dollars extra for a room with a pool view which was totally worth it. Spent 8 days and would have liked to stay more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort! Loved it, Can't wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: MInfurna
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 day stay at the Hilton Orlando. The hotel was clean, well maintained and just perfect in every way. The quiet pool, lazy river and tube slide kept us all very happy. The Family Pool was hectic and hard to get a chair--but it was still ok. The grounds are exceptional, the staff is friendly and accomodating. The room was spotless and we were very comfortable. It is close to everything, and they do have shuttle service to Sea World, but the I-trolly was what we used to come and go to Sea World at only $1.25 for adults and kids' are free. The grill by the pool was delicious, a little pricey but worth it, very convenient. My 2 boys' ages 8 and 10 had an absolute blast. We cannot wait to return to the Hilton Orlando. What a pleasant experience. Worth every penny for the resort like feel.

Reviews.Title: “Best in class”
Reviews.Author: coach_pilot
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel while attending a conference. Service, rooms, personnel, loaction are outstanding, prices on a higher level. Use the sports bar instead of the restaurant, the menu is short, but the prices are ok. Self parking for $12 per night is ok, wifi was included in the room rate. There is a starbucks in the house as well as a UPS center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, superb customer service!”
Reviews.Author: swgdezign
Reviews.Content: The food, the rooms, the people all made this a fabulous business trip!

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wildlotus2482
Reviews.Content: We loved the location. It’s about 15 minutes from the airport and located right off the highway and it’s only a 15-20 minute drive to Disney World. Also, Universal and the convention center are just down the street. The area had a very upscale, low key feel so after a day of craziness at Disney it was very relaxing to come back to the hotel. Don’t do valet unless you need to!!!! It’s $18 a day for valet and $12 for self park and the self park is so easy that why would you pay more for valet?! When you first arrive, drive up to the entrance and the valet man will tell you how to get to the self park area. Once you park, the lobby is so close! It’s so simple and there’s no waiting around for someone to go get your car and no need to tip! The hotel itself was beautiful. The lobby was gorgeous and front desk was nice, helpful, and no long lines. We never had to wait for an elevator either. Across the street from the hotel there was a McDonalds, Denny‘s, IHOP, Red Lobster, Olive Garden, lots of other restaurants and a Walgreens. We had a king room and thought it was spacious, decorated very nicely, exceptionally clean, and had a comfortable bed. We liked the large, flat screen tv with lots of HD channels. The internet was $15 for 24hrs and worked well, although that's pretty pricey. The pool area was wonderful. It included a family pool which was full of kids so we stayed away from that. There’s a lazy river and a quiet pool which is only called “quiet” because there’s no music playing there. Usually, there was a handful of kids there but it wasn't as bad as the family pool. Behind the pool was a basketball court, tennis court, volleyball court, and mini golf--all free. It’s a beautiful outdoor area, was kept clean, and we had a lot of fun. There’s also some fire pits that are turned on at night and they even sell smores kits! The only things we didn’t like were 1) When ever someone was in the hall we could hear everything. 2) The window drapes were hard to open and close with the placement of furniture in the way. 3) There wasn’t a little fridge in the room. 4) The room was a little more expensive than we prefer to pay. But because of its great location and proximity to the parks and airport, and awesome outdoor amenities, we'll always stay here when we're in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Can't be wrong if you choose this 4-star Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Proch_Family
Reviews.Content: We traveled with yound kids for 7 days. The stay is great in this hotel. The pool side dinner is the most amazing experience - great pool and dinning facility. Just to book the hotel in advance will make the stay more value. Most of all, close to everything - Sea World and Disney and outlet malls.

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel...almost flawless...new and perfect in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. Beds are plush. Pool flawless. Interior decorations nice. Staff could not be better. Great hotel. My one complaint. The $16 martini at the bar. I expect to pay a little more in a hotel, but that was over the top. So my advice is, if you want a drink here, byob.' The hotel was, by the way, a little crowded.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer0003
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at The Hiton Orlando since they opened last year. The hotel and grounds look as new as it did over a year ago. We enjoyed the pool, waterslide, lazy river and the basketball courts. We stayed here during Spring Break and it was amazing how clean and well run the outside facilities were. In a very busy pool area, the bathrooms were unbelievably clean at all times of day. We didn't have the opportunity to eat at the poolside restaurant, but the food looked and smelled delicious. Our room was on the executive floor where Cathy went above and beyond in service. She was so helpful with all of our questions and gave us great recommendations throughout our stay. She definitely added to the overall great experience we had. The standards at the hotel were very high. Within a 5-10 minute drive we found great restaurants & attractions along with Sea World / Aquatica minutes away. I would definitely stay here again. This was one of my favorite vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start?”
Reviews.Author: JoePistell
Reviews.Content: What was better? The GREAT and happy staff? The wonderfully clean bed? The great food? The outdoor pools were calling me, but, I was at the Automotive Marketing Boot Camp and I was so busy, I never made it outdoors! 5 stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: “True Service! Exceptional Event Host & Location”
Reviews.Author: RickC77
Reviews.Content: Colleagues and Business peers who attended Automotive Marketing Boot Camp overwhelmingly were truely Served by a staff with exceptional attention to detail. Hats OFF the the CHEFs who prepared 7 large group meals without flaw!!! They never came out yet... if they had they the opportunity... 175 People would have given them a STANDING Ovation!! Great people throughout, Hilton Orlando... Service Rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: rfontano
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Orlando Hilton was perfect! The staff was professional, friendly and efficient. These folks have the 10 foot rule down to a science. Nothing was overlooked, every meal was delicious. I switched hotels at the end of the conference due to location of events at the Rosen Shingle Creek, nice place but no where near the caliber of the Hilton. Thanks for a great conference! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: PlanetGemini
Reviews.Content: Seeking sun and a break from the long New England winter, we planned a fairly last minute trip to Orlando in April hoping to spend time hanging out by the pool and relaxing. We booked the Hilton Orlando based on Tripadvisor's good reviews and on the inviting photographs of the hotel's pool. When we arrived the lobby was full of people and we were told that there was a cheerleading competition at the nearby Convention Center and thus many teenaged girls staying at the hotel. In addition there were several other large groups holding conventions and staying there as well. I was dismayed and ready to leave imagining a long weekend of screaming teens and no sleep. Instead our room on the Executive Floor was far away from any of the choas and I don't think I've ever stayed at a hotel that was quieter or where I got better sleep. The beds were comfortable, the room very clean and quiet. There was one day by the pool where there were a lot of people but since the pool area is so spaced out, it never was an issue and we had no trouble finding chairs and while there were a zillion middle school girls miling around, it was never obnoxious. As part of our Executive Floor room, we enjoyed access to the Executive Lounge, which I highly recommend. It was great to get up in the morning and head down to the lounge where we enjoyed good coffee and a continental breakfast. In the afternoon they offered snacks and an honor system bar. Though we didn't use the bar, we did like being able to have late afternoon snacks to hold us over until dinner. The hotel staff that worked the lounge were very friendly, helpful and courteous as was the front desk staff as well. All in all we really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Orlando and would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seotraveler
Reviews.Content: I hosted a conference this month for 170 automotive professionals and the staff, food service, and banquets team were A++. The rooms were clean, beds SUPER comfortable, Spa staff professional, and the Spencer's Steak House inside the hotel was outstanding. Ask for Jackie!

Reviews.Title: “POOL WAS THE GREATEST EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI !”
Reviews.Author: webbknight
Reviews.Content: best pool area in Orlando with the best pool side food. We loved this place and we travel alot. so far the Orlando Hilton is the best in Orlando and for $139.00/nite ... you tell me ? international drive is spectacular and drove up and down just looking at the buildings such as wonderworks ,,, location location location ???? only Las Vegas hotels rival this monster ... stay and play and YOU write a review , I did !! see my photo at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Average room.”
Reviews.Author: Prax-Tammy
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was okay...nothing special. What you are paying for is the ouside. One night they had music blasting til 10 at night. They should have told us bec we could not sleep and we had an early flight. They also need to get new shampoo and Con. It smells horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, first class staff”
Reviews.Author: Lb1955
Reviews.Content: Directly across the street from the Orange County Convention Center. Our room was bright, clean, and comfortable. The amenities were amazing. An adult quiet pool, giant family pool with lazy river and water slide, putting greens, a great poolside bar ,and a quarter mile jogging track. Every member of the staff we encountered was friendly and provided great service.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hilton with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a convention at the Orlando Convention Center. The hotel is very close to the Convention Center (CC) - although a little far to walk when the weather is steamy and you are wearing a suit. Taxis are plentiful though and my particular convention provided shuttles to the CC. The hotel itself is very nice. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Beds are very comfortable. Although I didn't use the pool but it look extremely appealing with it's lazy river. I could see the pool from my room and it never seemed crowded. The fitness center was excellent with plenty of treadmills and stairmasters for cardio and weight machines, free weights, balls and mats. The lounge on the 19th floor for HH Gold and Silver members is very accomodating with breakfast in the morning, snacks and beverages throughout the day, and appetizers in the early evening. I'd recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hazelrah1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with easy access (Be aware that if using GPS there are several Hiltons in the area!). My partner and I stayed with the hotel the first week in April. Grounds and all facilities are lovely. We loved the lazy river. Restaurants are great;our favorite was the pub. The bar area is amazing and we liked the live piano music. Bedding is great and Crabtree and Evelyn bath products. I like to turn the thermostat down at night and the cooling system worked well, however I think it has an energy saver mode and would reset sometime during the night and we would wake up hot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing surprise... lots of nice touches for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: DTompkins3
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING about this stay was a wonderful surprise. I AM the princess and the pea. The room was clean, the bed was soooo comfortable, the rooms were quiet. There were actually cheerleaders and a drum team on our floor and I never heard them. We ate at the delicious hot breakfast buffet (FULL ARRAY of foods) every morning. The service at the restaurant was awesome. The concierge desk was more than helpful to find us adult things to do. Thank you Linda and Jessie for helping straighten out a rental car mess. The massuese in the spa was amazing and did exactly what I asked for in a massage. The spa facility itself was pristine and serene. I loved the robe, slippers , steam room and lounge. Very spacious workout area. Clean and neat.The pool area was particularly good because it was clean and huge, there was a quiet pool for we who left children home, but would def bring kids next time to enjoy the great pool area. Drinks at pool bar were a bit pricey... 10$ per. Only other complaint is that one of the major restaurants was closed Sunday night.Had looked forward to the steakhouse as it is described as grass fed beef. Will def return with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “First time guest - exceeded expectations - will return again”
Reviews.Author: jlask1
Reviews.Content: Great modern facility, room, pool. We stopped in Orlando on our way to Miami for kids spring break. Kids loved the pool so much that we delayed our trip to Disney for a few hours. The stay was so comfortable that we ended up coming back again a week later to break up our drive back north. Plan to stay again on future trips to Orlando or passing through to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if attending convention center”
Reviews.Author: rinis
