Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the convention center and was able to get a lower rate than the official conference hotel with a Florida resident rate. Location was great, quick access to the major roads and highway. Arrived at 7:00 pm and was quickly checked in, everyone was very nice and friendly. Asked about the local Publix and was given directions to one that was just a few minutes away. Was given room 406, with a view of the pool. Room was nice and clean, fridge was off, turned it on and put my groceries away and it quickly cooled down. Beds were very comfortable, pillows were nice and fluffy, but by the morning, they were flat, if they stayed fluffy, they would have been perfect. Access to the convention center was great. Had major thunderstorms come through and the covered walkway was wonderful! I felt bad for all those that had to cross International Drive in the rain to get to their hotel. Unfortunately due to the rains, was unable to use the pool or the lazy river, though they did look fabulous the last day of my stay, the only sunny day. Only one thing made me a little upset, I asked the concierge about the Disney Outlet stores, she didn't even let me finish and she just said - Downtown Disney. So again, I said, no, I am looking for the outlet stores, do you know which one might be better. She curtly said, there is only one. I said, oh I was not aware the other one closed. She said, go to Vineland. OK....obviously she was not having a good day, no directions or anything. So I asked, well could you tell me which outlet mall is closer? Her response - both. I knew that the one on the northern end was opened, so I went there. I never saw the young lady again, as I wanted to let her know she was giving out wrong information. Speaking of Disney, it was just a little less than 10 miles and less than 15 minutes to get to EPCOT drive if you were wondering. You could see Seaworld from the top floor of the convention center, so that was very near as well. I thought the parking was a little expensive, and thought that internet should be provided at their rates. Overall the hotel was nice, rooms were clean, quick access to the convention center, would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HilnMil
Reviews.Content: I love to travel and have stayed in many countries and lots of hotels. This hotel has snagged top place in that list. My daughter and I had plans to visit a number of tourist attractions while we were in Orlando and because the resort was so perfect, we cut those plans off site in half. First and foremost, the staff were exceptional. Right from our arrival to our departure. The staff who assist as you arrive are genuine, friendly and helpful... what a welcome! The reception staff are friendly, efficient and professional. I received great service from the consierge desk, they are patient and very helpful. We ate at the on site restaurant, Spencers, excellent menu, high standards from the kitchen... we enjoyed every meal there... top notch. Room service was very fast, I had never experienced this speed with quality before... cant say enough! There was a tragedy at the hotel while I was staying there which involved a family who were guests there. I saw how calm and professional the staff were dealing with the situation. They had to contend with a full hotel, media, police, you name it. As a guest, they minimised our exposure in an effort to ensure privacy and respect for the family involved. All the staff handled themselves in an exceptional manner during this traumatic time. My daughter an I never knew the hotel was full. No line ups, waiting around, looking for loungers... we loved every minute. The lazy river was fantastic, we spend the majority of our time by this area. Relaxing music played in the background and we could order drinks poolside as well as snacks. Everything worked great, was super super clean and beautifully decorated...very classy and tasteful. Well, thet's it from me, I have never had so many positives to say about a vacation thus far... thank you Hilton Orlando, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: millie64084
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveller, I was looking for a hotel that I could feel safe and secure in. This hotel provided that. My aim was to have a stress free week, relax and be left alone to chill and to see sights . That I accomplished with ease............. My compliments to the staff outside who open taxi doors for you, right through to the staff on the reception desk, excellent service. My gratitude also to the lady on the conceirge desk who provided absolutely top rate, 5 star service. I had a difficult problem that needed solving and she rang to make enquiries and found the answer. My sincere thanks to her. I have stayed at the Ritz hotels, both in the UK and USA, and I can honestly say the hotel staff certainly matchs the service you would expect from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: shalmunzies
Reviews.Content: It's a large business-oriented facility, but its got a great pool area and rec facilities.Rooms are standard Hilton - there are web specials around that make the rates very reasonable. Only downsides are the relatively expensive eateries(mostly deserted anyway) and $12 for self-parking,which had issues with swipecards while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Over all very good”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the end of February. After a truly horrendous nights stay at a sister hotel 4 hours drive away, I rang this hotel asking if it would be possible to check in early (we'd made the reservation some weeks previously). The staff member, on hearing the reason why I was requesting an early check in was most accommodating & in her soothing tones assured us we could. The journey took longer than anticipated & we arrived approx 2.30pm. At the desk I said my name & that I'd rung requesting early check in but, as it turned out, it wasn't that early after all. The staff member said that our room wasn't ready!!! I could have wept, we were sleep deprived & feeling very emotional & I now felt a twit for believing what I'd been soothingly told over the 'phone in the morning. The check in girl apologised but reiterated that our 'room type' wasn't ready. There was nothing we could do. We went for a lunch at the outside restaurant in the shade & that revived us. At 3pm the assistant rang my cell to let me know the room was ready & she would bring the key to us. I was relieved I didn't have to traipse back to reception. When the staff member arrived, she apologised again & said that we could have a credit towards out meal for being let down. This we appreciated, thank you. It wasn't the biggest deal that our room wasn't ready, but it was an issue as I'd rung to clarify the situation - & we were so sleep deprived, which wasn't their fault. Our room was on the top floor with fabulous views & it was spotlessly clean & the bed looked so inviting. That evening,at the front desk, I paid to use the computer to complete OLCI for our flight next evening. There is free internet access but only if you have your own laptop which I didn't, also, I don't know if that only applies to executive rooms - sorry. I tried to complet OLCI but the screen came up with ' we are unable to check you in at this time, please check in as usual at the airport'. Eeek! We didn't want to be bumped from what I knew was a stacked flight. There was nothing we could do. We returned to the front desk a while later to pay to use the computer again to complete OLCI & got chatting to a really nice employee, Matthew, at the Hhonors desk. I told him why we were going to use the computer again & he said he'd try the airline on his computer, we really appreciated this kind gesture. However, no luck, we'd just have to try again in the morning. We stopped a while & chatted & we said how lovely this hotel was, from the beautifully kept fllodlit grounds to the firepits to sit by & enjoy the evening air. Then we asked if we could book a late check out. Matthew said that we could have until 1pm complimentary or 3pm for $100. We decided this was a reasonable price to pay to enjoy all that this hotel has to offer so we agreed to pay the $100. As he was starting to carry out the task we said that we were so pleased to be at this hotel after the truly horrendous stay at a sister hotel. When we explained all that had gone on, he could hardly believe wahat we were saying.( However, you couldn't make it up) He very, very kindly said he'd waive the late check out fee for the distress that we had had to endure. I could have cried (again) for his kindness. He said that it was to begin to restore our faith in the Hilton group. We were nigh on speechless. Thank you Matthew, for being a truly outstanding member of staff & representative, no, ambassador for the Hilton group. I think I stood there with my mouth open wide like a total ejit. If I did, sorry!! We finally bid goodnight to Matthew & had a wonderful nights sleep. In the morning we had a delicious breakfast in the executive lounge with the complimentary Sunday papers in a quiet area, although the lounge generally was quite busy. Having said that, there was plenty of room & lots of fresh food to eat for everyone. We went down to reception after breakfast to pay agian for computer use & the receptionist said she'd try for us, thank you. However, still no joy (all turned out ok, we'd been moved to exit row in the bubble & the airline just needed to know that we were fit enough in the event of an emergency to operate the exit doors). We lounged by the quiet pool all morning reading. We ordered lunch from one of the frequently passing staff & it was good service & an excellent lunch. We relunctantly checked out late afternoon wishing that we could have stayed a few more nights. It's very weird at first walking around the hotel in casual attire with folks in black tie passing by but after a while you think nothing of it, after all this is the USA - love it! We'd happily return to this hotel to do absolutely nothing at all. Thank you again Matthew.

Reviews.Title: “Great but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: PaulyDean
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights because its nearby Disney World. The fitness center is huge and the pools are clean. They should lower the price a bit considering the recession.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: sftn
Reviews.Content: Great service. New, clean and quiet. Great pool and recreation amenities. We've stayed at a number of Orlando hotels and this is our best experience. Worth the money. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: aerodude87
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay during Spring Break. We spent three days at the Disney and Universal parks and saved one day to just relax at the hotel. I think our kids had more fun during that day than the others. Great pool area and pool side service. David's Club had the best burger and Greek flatbread I've ever had. Kristine at the conciege desk went out of her way to help me find my car keys which were lost at EPCOT. She must have spent over an hour on hold with Disney Lost and Found. Thanks to her, the keys were located and recovered successfully saving us a lot of time and grief.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch as a resort destination”
Reviews.Author: trugex
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay at a Disney property when visiting Orlando. However on this trip we skipped the theme parks and stayed at the Hilton. We were not disappointed. While the service is not quite up to the impeccable Disney standard, the property is a notch above the Disney moderate resorts. There are plenty of activites to keep everyone busy for the day. While it is not easily located via GPS (use Canadian Court in lieu of Destination Parkway), it is worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyFarkus
Reviews.Content: My ten-year-old daughter and myself just returned from a trip to Orlando. I chose the Hilton because of its amenities and close proximity to DisneyWorld. We were very happy with everything. It too us not 10 minutes to get to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot Center. Downtown Disney is also very close. The airport is about a 15 minute drive. We were able to check in a few hours early on the day we arrived; the process took about 5 minutes. In no time we were enjoying lunch at the Bistro restaurant on the lower lobby level. Yes, it was a little pricey for lunch but the service was great and the food quite good. The pool and lazy river were one of the highlights of our trip. Both were sparkling clear and the perfect temperature. Lots of big towels and plenty of lounge chairs. Petty annoyances included a few obnoxious unsupervised schoolboys (parents nowhere to be found) and randomly placed water canons along the lazy river that blasted you with cold water (they kind of ruined the relaxing effect). Service at the poolside bar/grill was very good. They even have sno cones for the kids. There is a very nice gift shop (for last minute souvenirs) and coffee/deli type place on the lobby level. Yes, merchandise and food are marked up but every hotel on earth does this. We ordered room service one night for dinner and it arrived within 30 minutes. $4.50 delivery charge plus 22% gratuity worked in (ouch) but you know what? You're on vacation. Treat yourself. Everything was delicious and portions were plentiful. We couldn't even finish it all. Our room was very clean. Having a refridgerator in the room really helped a lot. We purchased milk and cereal at a nearby Publix and saved a lot of money on breakfast. The shower was great - endless hot water. Pretty granite countertop too. Crabtree & Evelyn LaSource shampoo and soaps. Very nice. Personally I thought my bed was a little too hard but my daughter thought hers was perfect. Our view was not that great - it mostly consisted of the Convention Center's north concourse parking lot -but the poolview side is more expensive and I didn't come to Orlando to stare out a hotel window anyway. Not a big deal to me. I would absolutely love to stay at this hotel again. I was not happy having to leave. I would recommend it to anyone. It was a little bit more than I normally pay to stay somewhere but totally worth it. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “♥ Classy, Family Friendly, and Amazing Ammenities ♥”
Reviews.Author: Florida3bears
Reviews.Content: Hilton always seems to put much thought into the design and architecture of their facilities. While not only maintaining their class, it is very apparent they really aim to please their guests and make them as comfortable as possible. Prices are very competitive considering hotel scale. They offer areas so that adults can have privacy and seclusion to relax. They also offer areas for the kids to play. The lazy river is amazing. The foliage and urns surrounding the zero entry pool added nice flare also. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all traveling within the Orlando area for parks and recreation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service all around!”
Reviews.Author: Dsmart17
Reviews.Content: This property is a top shelf stay in Orlando. While I have stayed here before to attend a conference, at the adjacent convention center, this time i stayed with my family. The pool area was perfect and my 11 year old loved the water slide and lazy river ride. Ultimately the service at any hotel tops off a great experience and this Hilton did not disappoint. From the concierge to the parking attendance and especially the executive lounge...top-notch people. Finally, the location is perfect. In the middle of virtually everything Orlando has to offer at the Sea World end of I-Drive. Close but away from the commotion. I will return

Reviews.Title: “great concierge service”
Reviews.Author: vacation079
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of lodging at the Hilton Orlando a few weeks ago on business however; I made time for a lttle R&R, as well as sight seeing. Kristin Bonett provided me many sight seeing options. She is knowledgeable of what the city has to offer and was able to help me plan a wonderful day!!!!!!!!!! Unfortunately, during my next encounter with Kristin my day was not going so well. I had some minor difficulty with my bus arrangements coupled with being exhausted from my trip, Kristin asisted me with patience, professionalism and kindness while getting the job done!!!!!!!!!! She is a great employee!!!!!!! The Hilton is lucky to have her.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton with superb amenities”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: This is a newer Hilton with very comfortable rooms and excellent service. The executive rooms on the 18th and 19th floors also offer perks like a free continental breakfast and evening drinks/desserts. There are two outdoor pools, a lazy river, putting greens, and other outdoor things to do. Inside is a huge fitness area with Precor equipment. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great service, right next to convention center”
Reviews.Author: DavidHenry
Reviews.Content: Hilton is next to Orange County Convention Center - right next to North and South Concourse, about 15 minute walk from West Concourse. Perfect if you're attending a conference there. Staff is wonderfully attentive. I checked in and they came out from behind the counter to stand next to me and tell me about the hotel amenities. Seems to be their standard practice - a very nice touch. Rooms were modern as you would expect from a newer hotel and they were well maintained. Pools are excellent - you must spend at least a few hours there. Restaurants and bars in the building are all very good though there are many other very good choices if you choose to wander to any of the parks or I-Drive. Just tell the concierge what you're looking for - they know best. There is a minimart and a Walgreens within walking distance to stock up on the things you forgot. Stores in the Hilton are pricey. There is a Starbucks in the building. Wi-FI should be free, but it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great concierge.”
Reviews.Author: helenp353
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orlando Hilton was great. Jessie and Mary at the Concierge were absolutely the most helpful, patient, kind, knowledgeable, and just stellar in the help they provided. They worked with me in attaining dinner reservations when I was getting little satisfaction on my own. They provided us with coupons to the restaurants we wanted and to the spa in the hotel. All of the staff were efficient and the hotel very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: BizDevRoadee
Reviews.Content: All these reviews say it all. This hotel is great! I wish I could stay longer and enjoy the lazy-river, pools, putting course and outdoor jogging track. The gym is incredible. All the restaurants were good. Great staff and clean, comfortable rooms. It IS quite pricey, but hey it's Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel; great for business”
Reviews.Author: oregonsenior
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day conference at this hotel. As a frequent business traveler, I feel I have a good basis for comparison and this hotel did everything very well. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The on-site business center was staffed by a very helpful UPS employee (Randall Johnson) who went out of his way to assist customers with computer access, printing, and shipping. The front desk clerk (Cesia) made certain I had a room that met my special needs. When I encountered problems connecting to the internet, Adel responded immediately to my request for assistance and had the skills to quickly and accurately resolve the problem. The food served at the conference and in the executive center was very good and served by smiling staff members who were happy to assist in any way they could. Although the hotel had a lot of guests, there always seemed to be someone nearby to direct everyone to the correct meeting rooms. The room itself was clean, pleasant and comfortable. I really liked the super-rich body lotion and the silk-smooth, clean(!) duvet cover, as well as the comfortable mattress and pillows. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning the room each day and even left a hand-written thank you note for each day's tip. Rooms were quiet and parking was easily accessible. Although I did not personally dine in any of the 3 on-site restaurants, co-workers reported that the food was good and the prices for "David's" was very reasonable. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, if my business again sends me to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: hazban
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay followed by the three nights at the Hilton @ Disney World. Boy do I wish I had all the nights here! New property as previously described, great choice of dining (including Exec. area if included). After a week of 'healthy salads' enjoyed an excellent rib-eye in the up market, but not stuffy 'Spencer's' . They describe it as Sophisticated which might intimidate some, don't let it. Every staff member I met was on top of their game and anxious to please. The public areas are spacious and pleasently welcoming. Although I am comfortable in 'corporate' surroundings I think families are well catered for, the pool areas are very impressive. Though not next to any of the main attractions they are all within a short drive. Will def. return in in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Waterloonie
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, and everything still shines. Service was very good. Food was good. Pool area was really nice. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: dadpappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days before meeting up with our family at Disney. We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed at many of the Hilton properties. This is a lovely place, with 2 pools (heated), one an adult pool, plus a lazy river and hot tubs. A putting green and volleyball court are also on the grounds. The room was standard Hilton, with a frig and safe, great linens and pillows, and an air conditioner that worked and was nearly silent. There are excellent restaurants, and a small market, plus the bar near the pool. Food was excellent-although like most restaurants now, food was very salty for us-no problem though; just asked for no added salt and it was delivered. From the minute we checked in, service was gracious, but not pushy. We were greeted with courtesy at every turn. It seemed that the ethic of courteous service is more strongly emphasized here than at any hotel at which we have stayed. Just a lovely experience. The cons: service at the bar near the pool, although still very courteous, was bit bumpy at times. And I do think it is wrong to charge for parking-and it wasn't cheap- although I know many hotels do charge. We didn't rent a car-instead we walked to the corner and took the bus. Very handy. We may come back here to stay just because it is so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Pristine hotel oasis for a hard business trip.”
Reviews.Author: SixthSister
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, solid service. I didn't have time to enjoy the pool, but it looked beautiful - lazy river and all. Room service was yummy and fast. Bars and restaurants all very good and not as expensive as closer to Disney. My company used convention services for a large sales meeting as well as a cocktail party; the staff seemed inexperienced at first (late room set up, problems with AV) but made good on initial challenges. Catering excellent. Adjoined the convention center so location was perfect. Taxis were always waiting in the porte cochere. A colleague returned with his family shortly after our trip. Tip: Be sure to ask for a room close to the elevators as the hallways are VERY long and unwanted time on the feet, especially after a tough day working the convention floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with great staff and AMAZING pool!”
Reviews.Author: rdangel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few days in February before a cruise. The place was great. They upgraded me to an executive floor and I had access to the executive lounge. The rooms were a good size and the place was very nice. Very busy hotel, and great pools and service. Kids loved the lazy river and the pool, it was the perfect temperature. I did not like that you have to either pay $20 a day to valet, or $12 to self park, this should be free. There's nothing around the hotel but huge tracts of land and the convention center. Food is good at the poolside restaurant and at the full service restaurant. Albeit a bit pricey. The in hotel convenience store was good but also overpriced. I would definitely stay here again if in Orlando. Would probably prefer it over a disney hotel. Really great

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull with kids..no lifeguard”
Reviews.Author: Korn889000
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, nicest pool i ever went in. But no lifeguard, saw a 4 year old drowning with his parents pointing to me to jump in with my sneakers when i was walking by. I did of course, but expect to see kids drown at this hotel on lazy river due to lazy parents and no lifeguards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Orlando vacation with kids”
Reviews.Author: EricY_68
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the pool, water slide, and lazy river, and was relaxing for us parents to just let the kids go and play. Close to all the Orlando attractions, hotel restaurants were decent as well if you didn't want to venture out (though a few minutes' drive will get you to a wide variety of restaurants). Well worth the price and we'll be coming back again next time we hit the Orlando scene!

Reviews.Title: “I would clone their employees if I could and make the world better”
Reviews.Author: waterchick7960
Reviews.Content: I do not often "hug" hotel employees but that is what I did to Mr. Luis Otera. He was like a ray of sunshine, the epitome of fantastic and genuine guest service. I also had the pleasure of making the aquaintance of Linda Taylor, an absolutely charming and very vital personality and so cheerful and funny! I did not meet Brenda Fisher until Friday Feb. 18th but it made me wish I had met her on Tuesday! Your employees believe in and demonstrate a passion for what they do.I would recommend your hotel to anyone that asked and I will spread a positive sastifying message about your employees!Keep us the outstanding work. M. Rita Quedzuweit,Nestle waters employee.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: dkennedy5324
Reviews.Content: Great hotel service and staff absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST hotel stays in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: cwcmiami
Reviews.Content: We are part of a volleyball club that travels with over 100 people to Orlando 4 to 5 times a year for tournaments and have done so for over 8 years. The Hilton Orlando not only has accommodated us with great pricing and flexibility, but the facility itself is beautiful, clean, has many options for food and entertainment. It is probably one of the nicest places to stay in the Orlando area. From the group sales department to the front desk and all hotel employees......everyone was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Book a executive floor level room - it is worth the upcharge”
Reviews.Author: laud
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in 2010 and both times enjoyed the executive floor lounge. Excellent snacks through the day. Birdseye view of the back of SeaWorld. This hotel overall is delightful. The lazy river is full of cute surprises and playful features. One of the best Hiltons I have stayed at over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: kittycats5
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is beautiful from the rooms to the pool and lazy river. Close to all Disney attractions including Universal, Seaworld and Discovery Cove. Food was delicious and staff very friendly! We had adjoining rooms which was great for our children. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler53009
Reviews.Content: We traveled to sunny Orlando from cold and snowy Pennsylvania to visit family and take take in the sights. We were welcomed at The Orlando Hilton by a warm and friendly staff. Our room was clean and spacious. We had adjoining rooms perfect for a family with children. The lazy river, pool, and hot tub were so much fun! The meals we had at the hotel were very good. I like the fact that eventhough the hotel hosts conventions the business people and families never really meet due to a unique hotel design. We visited Seaworld and Islands of Adventure, only 1-2 miles from the hotel. Aquatica and Universal also close and only a few minutes ride to Disney attractions. I highly recommend staying at the Hilton Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the quality of the service and I felt very pampered”
Reviews.Author: Molly5283
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything one would need (especially quality and fun restaurants) while at the same time, the location makes it easy to access the other activities available in the area. We especially enjoyed a dinner at Spencers Restaurant. A massage at the Spa was great!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyManor
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel on the evening of 27 December and spent three nights in the hotel. This is a business hotel. Period. The concierge was particularly useless. Although they had maps of the theme parks, they were unable to give us any helpful information on them. Instead of admitting that they did not know, we were told categorically that Universal Studios was only opening at 9h00 whereas we found out that during the holiday week between Xmas and New Year the park was open from 7h30. More irritating was that the concierge discouraged us from buying the "fast passes" at Universal Studios. Given the amount of people that were visiting in that week, it would have been the BEST money we had spent, albeit that they are expensive. Instead out visit to the park was spent standing in extremely long ques. By the time we realised that the passes were the way to go, they were all sold out. Although the location is very close to Sea World all the other theme parks are a fair taxi ride away so I would not stay here if its for leasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at the Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: altace
Reviews.Content: It's always trying when you are at a business meeting. However, when you have a welcoming safe haven for retreat, it makes for a very pleasant stay. I would like to commend Megan, Chris, and Cara. They helped us with Spa reservations as well as being extremely accomodating while we enjoyed the lounge. This was evidenced both in the morning and evening. Nothing was too much to ask. We also really enjoyed Chris's sense of humor. It was an added bonus while visiting the lounge. All in all, it was these guys that would make me return to this Hilton should my travels take me to Orlando again! Thanks again guys, your'e the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: NikolaKujaca
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not staying in luxury hotels like this one, but still had several occasions when I did, so I believe I can give fair points for this one as well. First of all, the location of the hotel is outside of the Orlando it self. If you have business downtown, find something that is closer, since two way cab ride is app. $80. But, if you are looking for the hotel that would fulfill all your needs, if you like late dinners, looking for some night life, and have something to do during working hours at the Convention Center, THIS is it. Do not look any further! This hotel is the best Hilton I've ever stayed in. Perfect service, DHL office, Starbucks, corridor connection to the Convention Center if you are up for a morning walk... What can I say. Rooms are clean, and within the standards of high class rooms. Huge TV, great bed... Bathroom as well. Only downside is that they do not provide free internet, but if you are staying in this hotel, you can afford it, right? Another thing. I would recommend restaurants and clubs close to the hotel, going north on International drive... Walking distance. Have fun in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: nwlilac
Reviews.Content: I came to meet my husband, who had been at a convention for the week. We stayed the first night at another hotel (where he had been staying) - and coming here was a wonderful upgrade! The room was very nice, very quiet and a very comfortable bed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We liked the pool area, but maybe wouldn't have as much if it had been crowded (it was not). The spa service was good, but a little expensive. The food we had at the hotel was good (although not all the options were available to us, because the hotel wasn't very busy). The Marketplace (market) there is really handy for snacks, food, beverages, coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, Use your room safe if you can find it !”
Reviews.Author: Cannuk
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hilton Orlando for 2 days prior to Christmas and it was all due to the reviews on tripadvsior, the hotel was great everything we read about, until we decided to go swimming . Just prior to asking for our room to be made up, we came back and were getting ready for dinner and my partners gold committment ring which was on her finger prior to swimming , put away in a ziplock bag with other good jewlery, (as we never swim with rings on), in Her suitcase which was closed but not sipped up, we were gone for all of 2 hours, we just couldn`t believe it, we search high and low and reported it to the front desk, securtity was called , they said that they would look at who was in our room and question them, said that usually when this happens that the people involved just throw up their hands and say it wasn`t me! We were never told about a safe at check in, and looked in the usual place like the closet for one when we arrived, we did find it when searching for the ring . The safe is one of the drawers, the security guard said that they are trying to get the house keepers to leave this draw open when cleaning for new guests, but why would they when gold is at a new high, the ecomony is bad and its just before Christmas and you can easily go into a guest bag and help yourself. I asked the guard , why one piece only ? he replied that they don`t want todraw attention to themselves. This was a very disturbing unfortunate situation for us and we hope that it dosn`t happen to anyone else. I hope who ever has the ring enjoys the fact that they totally ruined our Christmas Cannuk in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, rooms standard.”
Reviews.Author: time_traveler99
Reviews.Content: Everything at this resort was brand new and clean. We ate at the executive level club room for nightly appetizer and drinks and then again at breakfast. The pool area is also very nice, large and clean as was the fitness center. My only complaint was that it smelled like something outside was burning, like a controlled burn somewhere and this smell got into the heating and cooling system of the hotel. We were concerned that the resort was on fire. It wasn't. Desk clerks could be friendlier and the location could be more convenient and easier to find. Those things are the reason I rated it very good rather than excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: mudslide
Reviews.Content: Large, new, modern hotel next to the convention center and in the busy International Drive area. About 15 minutes to Universal theme parks, about 20 minutes to Disney, and 5 minutes to Sea World. Good for meetings as well as families. This hotel is only about a year old and everything is clean. Rooms are comfy (and have a mini-frig & of course coffeemaker), restaurants are kind of expensive but good, and pool area is excellent - 2 pools, lazy river, 2 hot tubs, waterslide, basketball court, 9 hole putting area, cabanas, and fire pits. Nicest hotel gym that I've seen (lots of equipment), and the spa area looked good. The staff was very friendly and attentive. There is a concierge level lounge offering continental breakfast and happy hour - I believe you have to be staying on certain floors or have a particular type of reservation to get this. Breakfast buffet in the lower lobby restaurant was good. We also enjoyed the sports bar in the lobby area. There were always taxis outside at the entrance to the hotel ready to take us around. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: busterjosh
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. I am a very picky traveller and I have no complaints about this great place. Rooms are spacious and clean. Beds are comfy. Bathrooms are modern and clean. Staff are friendly. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eyedoctor28
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a number of resorts and hotels and Orlando, and this is one of the better ones for sure. The rooms are nice, your norm for a standard room. There are flat screen TVs and a small refrigerator which is always nice. The lobby is nice, the front desk at check-in wasn't the friendliest, but we checked in really late (around midnight) so we may have had the less-than-nice night staff that doesn't deal with as many people as the afternoon staff (just my guess based on the attitudes of the staff at that time). No big deal really, though. It is a convention hotel, the regular lobby isn't very large, but there's a pretty big walk-around area towards the convention side with some shops and restaurants/bars along the way. The pool area was definitely the best part of the hotel. The lazy river looked nice (though we didn't get in) and the main pool was large and not crowded. There is an "adult" pool towards the side with an adjoining hot tub which was much less crowded. The hot tubs were awesome and the fire pits outside were also a nice touch. There were serving marshmallows, graham crackers and chocolate by the fire pits to make smores which I thought was a cute/cozy addition which separates it from a stuffy/business-type convention hotel feel. The location is pretty nice, it is right off the highway and off of international drive.. so the main shops/restaurants/sites on international drive are just a short drive, as are disney/universal as the highway is right there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: abbalish
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Orlando for 5 nights, partially for a relaxing getaway with my husband and partially to attend some family reunion events. We arrived on Christmas day and were amazed to see that all the restaurants were open, and there were even free smores at the fire pit that night. The lobby is beautiful. The room was great and the bed very comfortable. The pool area was the best that I have seen at a hotel. The gym was very nice, as was the salon/spa (although the spa is pretty pricey). As diamond members, we were put on the executive level floor, which offered free breakfast and hors d'ouevres each night, and given free gym access (which would be $10/day) and internet access (which would be $15/day, I think). We ate at the Bistro, which was very tasty, but honestly we did most of our eating in the executive lounge, where it was free, and that food was quite good. The only kind of negative is the location. The hotel is kind of off by itself, with nothing much in walking distance. If your main goal is visiting the Disney attractions, you'd probably be better off in a Disney property, but if you're traveling for relaxation or a conference, that doesn't matter as much. Also, the surrounding highways can be a bit confusing. All in all, we had a great stay at the Hilton - if only the weather had cooperated a bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Viper131313
Reviews.Content: I MUST say this hotel was phenominal!!!! I had a problem with my both of my credit cards when I went to check in and let me just tell you......Rachel at the front desk was the BOMB !!! She totally helped me 10000% the day of check in so I could call my bank the next day & get the block removed off my credit cards! I have a 15 yr old daughter who also loves this hotel. We never made it to the water park on the grounds this time either (this was NOT our first stay there) but we will be going back for sure! We had gotten the Winter package which comes with 2 buffet breakfasts and we thoroughly enjoyed also. I cant say enough GOOD things about this hotal and about Rachel! Thank you Rachel for ALL of your help!! You really made our stay phenominal!!!! Deb Kelljchian

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Arneby
Reviews.Content: Hilton is usually deadly boring. Not this one. Newly opened, well laidout, nice pool garden and the fact that pets are allowed made this stay much nicer than anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hilton hotel i ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: 1965shkid
Reviews.Content: This is the best Hilton hotel. Stayed 4 nights with paid and points mix. Got upgrade to Club level as gold member. Everything fantastic: front desk staff, lounge, internet access, parking staff. Can watch Disney magic kingdom and sea world fire works from the room. Owesome, will stay again if back to Orlando. Also the bed is very comfortable, can compare with Westin heavenly bed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hilton experiences!”
Reviews.Author: sangman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many different Hilton properties (including those in Rome, Athens, Tokyo, Seoul, and etc) and I can tell you that Hilton Orlando is one of the best! The staff is very friendly; the pool is amazing with two jacuzzi pools open untill 1pm. The location is good, too - right off highway and close to everything (disney is within 15 minutes). The hotel is new- so the property is in a great shape. The only downside is its restaurants- but you can always dine out!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: touchofeurope
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on the reviews and we were somewhat disappointed. The main issue we had was the ridiculous way they charge for internet access. My husband and I run a business. When traveling, we both need to go online. At this hotel, the charge is linked to the COMPUTER, not to the room. So officially we had to pay the fee twice! $24 for 24 hours. Outrageous in this day and age. That automatically put a sour taste in our mouth. Self parking is also expensive considering the area is completely deserted and complimentary parking would be totally feasible. So in our case, add $36 to the cost of the room. Otherwise, it was basic, but fairly comfortable. Extremely hard uncomfortable beds, sadly. Service was OK. Not a hotel we'd return to.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than third time!”
Reviews.Author: triplover555
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this Hilton. We love it more each visit. We were upgraded to a parlour room which had a full living room and dining room table with seating for eight! It was a really great place for all of our friends to gather and spend time. The staff was very welcoming. The property is very modern and clean. Beds were comfy and the bathrooms were great! Our trip could have only been more perfect if the weather had cooperated and it was warmer outside. I truly believe if they could have controlled the weather, the staff at the Orlando Hilton would have done anything to make us happy!! Thank you! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Minthilltodd
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a new hotel convenient to the Orange County Convention Center. The rooms were well appointed with all the amneties but the price paid for internet access, the breakfast buffet and other services was not worth the price paid. The convention rate was $210 per net. Internet access was $15.00 and the breakfast buffett was $20.00. You can get the same type of services at a Hampton inn for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's class act hotel”
Reviews.Author: PedroSpiller
Reviews.Content: The large, light lobby, filled with fresh orchid arrangements wows you on the way in. After that the staff picks up -- clearly they have a sense of team and love their jobs. Of special note was the staff of the 19th floor executive lounge who knew our names after our first visit. Because it was three days of Christmas season, they were very, very busy but always smiling with a kind word. The manager worked hand in hand, seamlessly, with the team. Our room (1923) was extremely well equipped, clean, thoughtfully presented. Bed had double the pillows needed for sleeping and a fluffy, light, warm comforter. It felt like down but probably was not. If you use it turn the A/C down because otherwise you will be too warm. Had a lovely dinner at David's Club, an upscale sports pub. Recommend the prime rib. Atmosphere is relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “nice hilton hotel for Orlando vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ira_Sh
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for 6 days and this was very pleasant stay. The hotel is a new hotel, with beautiful interior design (the outside of the hotel doesn't reveal the gem it is inside). The hotel's stuff is great, starting from the vallet parking team, which is always ready to help and give directions (we've received a great recommendation to go to IHop near buy, which became our favorite place fot breakfast), the concierge desk, which was great and the bell service was outstanding,too. The rooms are a bit small, so is the bath which has a tub in it. The two things I didn't like were that the although our beds were made, the rest of the mess remained untouched.The shampoo was never refeeled, although there were 2 adults and 2 babies, we had only two towels.But a call to the guest servises resolved the situation, I just don't expect I have to ask for the shampoo. The hotel is a 20 minute ride to the Disney parks and a few minutes for the Seaworld and the premium outles, Publix(supermarket), gas station and a cleaning servise.All the restaurant are within easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: bahamamamalaurie
Reviews.Content: I never actually went to the pool because it was too cold so I can't say anything about that but this hotel was amazing! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the beds were so comfortable. It was in a convenient location, only about five minutes from Universal Studios. The great service continued after we arrived home. The hotel called and said they had found an item left in our room and they would be Fed Exing to us for free. I will definately be staying here again next year. Oh yeah, and we got a great rate as well..@$100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's good”
Reviews.Author: travelmaster
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, rooms, beds really comfortable, Good choice of restaurants and great swimming pool. Would stay again if in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hilton for a recent convention and was very impressed. We have tried the Peabody and Homewood Suites in past years but decided to give the Hilton a try due to its age and proximity. I was not disappointed. It is certainly a convention hotel, but offers ample features to keep your family busy. The hotel offers a great pool, slides, lazy river, miniture golf, fire pits, etc. The common areas are well laid out and almost assured I would continue to bump into customers and potentail customers. The connection to the South Hall of the Convention Center was great! The sports bar (Davids) was very nice. We sat and watched games, the food was good and the atmosphere was comfortable. I was a little less impressed with the Spencer's Steakhouse. It was good, but I expected a little better service and food quality for the price. Paying $35-$45 for a steak creates some serious expectations. My room could have been cleaned a little better. I am unforgiving of a less than spotless bathroom, and housekeeping could have done a better job. I let this slide a little bit because the bed was so comfortable. I always put a premium of a good night's rest and got it. On balance, I preferred this hotel to the Peabody and will book here again next year assuming the hotel maintains the pricing advantage we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MDgal76
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Hilton Honors Diamond member. We had 4 free nights at this hotel. It is my husband and I and our 2 boys, ages 7 and 10. We chose this Hilton because of the pool and lazy river and it's awesome! Requested and received free upgrade to a suite. Hotel staff always great. We're glad we had a rental car. Visited Hollywood Studios, Discovery Cove, Aquatica and SeaWorld. Hotel has a free SeaWorld shuttle but we didn't use it. Gold and Diamond Honors members get to use the Executive Lounge on the 19th floor for free breakfast and then snacks (dinner worthy!) from 5-7. Free internet for Diamond members. Otherwise would have been pricey. Alcoholic bevs at the pool bar $$ as was expected. There's nothing inexpensive about a trip to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Hotel With 5 Star Resort Pool”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: Finally a convention center hotel that realizes people want a nice area to relax when they are not at the convention! Rooms are new, outdoor complex was great, lazy river two hottubs, waterslide for kids, makes you want to invite your family and not have to change hotels when they arrive. The fireplace pits was a nice touch at night as well going out sitting around the fire was great. Pool side food was also good. large portions everything was really good. Basketball courts, putting area, and lawn volleyball was fun. We come to Orlando every year for a convention and this was the best stay yet. Spencers steak house, on property, was one of the best steaks in town. So many choices on International drive this one still stands out. Not having to leave the property to find this was great. Davids was also great and never busy. Sitting pool side for lunch was really nice, if you don't choose this property, go try the pool side lunch it will take you away from the rush of your convention.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Selena1722
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finally took our honeymoon after 21 years of marriage. We didn't want to leave. We felt like we were in paradise. The pools were amazing. We loved the lazy river. The rooms were very clean and the staff was terrific. We received a signed card from the front desk staff along with a dessert tray on our first night. We ate breakfast downstairs at the buffet. The food was great and the service was phenomenal. We plan on going back next year with our children. I enjoyed the fire pit that was lit up at dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: soxpatsdave
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member, I was very happy with this hotel. Would definitely recommend and go back. Super place. Pool, lazy river and slide great for kids. Close to SeaWorld and not far from WDW.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend! Easy Luxury, fab spa and gorgeous grounds”
Reviews.Author: Greenie_Christina
Reviews.Content: I snapped up a last minute deal on 3 nights here on Orbitz and ditched my prior reservations. This brand new hotel sparkles with panache from front door to poolside. Check in was smooth and courteous, and although I was early, they managed to rush room prep and I had a room before finishing lunch. Attached to the conference center, the hotel had scads of happy business travelers. Amazing linens and well appointed rooms were a welcome sight after a disappointing night at another area hotel. Food: Food was not its strong suit. I dined at the bistro, upscale burger spot, spa and room service. The bistro was unimaginative with oversized portions and costs. I ordered the panini of the day and received a grilled ham and cheese that wasn't even hot in the middle with no accompanying flavors to round out the salty meat. The burger place had nice atmosphere, but both app and main course were disappointing and even hard to finish. Room service breakfast, though, was excellent and at the perfect temp. The spa meal was one of the best meals I've had anywhere- a satisfying cool veg/potato salad, grilled bread, plus cheese and fruit. Bravo! Staff was fantastic despite food quality. Spa: Hello bliss! Every part of the spa experience was elegant and relaxing. I treated myself to several services, all of which were 15% off thanks to a referral coupon available from the neighboring restaurant hostess. It saved me a bundle! Location: It wasn't far from Universal, my destination, but the shuttle service wasn't spontaneous enough for me- ended up taking a lot of cabs. I recommend renting a car. Pool/grounds: what a gorgeous pool, pool bar and landscape. The lazy river was too active for my taste, much prefer to nearly be able to sleep while floating- this one routinely attacked floaters with sudden sprays and unavoidable waterfalls. Wasn't especially welcome on a cool day- perhaps very successful on a blistering hot florida summer day. In the evenings, two fire areas were popular and lovely to sit, gaze and relax. Overall, a hit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...would stay here again in a heartbeat when visiting Orlando!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travfam22
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during the 1st week of November for our annual trip to Orlando. After reading the numerous positive reviews, we decided to stay here instead of one of the Disney resorts. Excellent rates during this time. We saved soo much money! Close to the airport and Orlando's attractions. It felt like you were staying at one of the Disney resort hotels (for a fraction of the price). Beautiful pools. We loved the lazy river and family pool. It felt as if you were on an island. Tons of outdoor amenities. Grass volleyball courts, pool tables, foosball, really cool grass putting course (longest we have ever seen), tennis courts, and I could go on. Perfect for a family with tween and teens. The fire pits were stunning! The room was clean, comfortable and luxurious. No noise and people running through the halls like you'll hear at one of the Disney resorts. The concierge lounge was a great deal! Ate our breakfast and dinner here. Lots of really delicious appetizers. I would recommend this hotel to all of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this without hesitation!”
Reviews.Author: kjkmurphy
Reviews.Content: Hilton Orlando is very very nice. Immaculately clean rooms and hotel facilities. Nice pools including a lazy river. Service was perfect, fitness center facilities large and very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: jds00
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is a great hotel! The lobby was beautiful. Rooms were very clean and nice as well. They have a great pool area with a lazy river and adult pool. Will definately be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest Hilton you'll find”
Reviews.Author: dddane
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest straight-up Hilton I've ever been to (excluding the Waldorf-Astoria portfolio). It's nearly brand new and everything about the place is gleaming and in tip top shape. The staff included. The pool is amazing. They have three pools: a "quiet" pool (*not* kid free though, and definitely not smoke free), a very large main "family" pool complete with basketball hoops and a decent water slide. And a lazy river. The lazy river is fun for kids and adults alike, seriously fun! Also, there are hundreds of lounge chairs, it's not a problem finding one. Many of them are positioned in filtered sun so this can be good or bad probably depending on the time of the year. Finding a lounger that faces full sun that's not filtered can actually take some work, and not because of overpopulation but just because so many of them are in partial shade or facing the wrong direction. There is also waiter service at the pool, though they didn't come too frequently and we found it just as easy to walk to the pool's bar/grill to get ourselves our beer and what nots. They have a bacon cheeseburger and hand cut fries at the pool grill that's good and at $13 not a bad deal. Import beer was $6/pint, not bad for a Hilton. They didn't seem to mind having beers in the lazy river even. The only thing I saw them say "no" to anyone about was having a glass bottle near the pool, but they put everything in plastic when they serve it to you if they know you're going to the pool. The pool area also has some other recreation activities, all free, including volleyball, miniature golf (on real grass), pool tables, and foosball. The spa facilities and gym are $10/day/person for a day pass, but HHonors gold+ members get that complimentary. Even if you're paying $10/day, if you want a gym it's totally worth it. Their gym is as nice as any high end gym I've ever seen, complete with Precor AMT machines even. The spa facilities included the typical upscale locker room and showers, and steam room (inside each locker room, none of it is shared). They have the largest steam room I've ever seen in my life, though there was no button to turn the steam on and it didn't come on too frequently. HHonors gold+ also get complimentary access to the executive lounge, of course, which gets you free breakfast and snacks at night (they had pizzas one night when we went on a weekend night, on weekdays my SO told me the food was better--beef wellington even). Rooms are very nice. Fairly typical but nice. Nice high end tile work in the bathrooms. Nice tall shower head. The in room wireless worked really well, and it was fast ($15/day, unless you're HHonors). Nightly turn down service. Parking is $12/day for self park with full in/out privileges. (The convention center's parking next door is $11/day with no in/out). The convention center is directly adjacent, connected via walkways. Even the furthest end of the convention center isn't too far and the walkway has speed-walks part of the way. If you're wanting to get off the Hilton property, "The Pointe" is probably a 15 minute walk where you can pick from any number of both chain and non-chain restaurants and shopping. The room rate itself was super reasonable. We actually left the nearby Rosen Plaza early because it was so gross, and the Hilton was cheaper even when you factor in the parking fee. Incredible, as the Hilton is 1000 times nicer. I'd suspect their rates are probably going to be going up if they become more popular, but for now it's highly recommended! Cons: This place nearly glamorizes over-consumption and I didn't see a single recycling bin the entire time I was there. Other neighboring hotels have in-room recycling even. The pool area is several acres, how hard would it be to install a single recycling bin somewhere outside, or inside for that matter? HHonors members definitely get more value out of staying here than someone who doesn't have HHonors status. It's a Hilton, so they nickel and dime you for everything if you're not of a certain HHonors level. But even so, at the room rate they're charging, you're still getting a good deal. It's fantastic if you are a HHonors member with status, though, you get so much more. Also, chain smokers at the pool are at times hard to avoid. This was particularly annoying at the "quiet" pool (which had kids in it, btw, quiet is not the same as "kid free" I guess). It was impossible to sit anywhere in the quiet pool and not have to smell a nearby smoker's nastiness.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service, Amenities and Location”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta1958
Reviews.Content: I had stayed one night at a competing hotel along the International Drive strip that was not up to par, so I started checking and was able to grab a room at the Hilton - and with my AAA discount, a MUCH better deal. Beginning with the front door staff and bell desk, i was amazed at the difference between these two high-end hotels (the other shall remain nameless - I wouldn't want to embarrass them!). The room was second to none: one of the best beds I've ever slept in, great bathroom/shower facilities and a huge television. I'm just sad I didn't take advantage of the incredible pool and gym/spa amenities - but I WILL be back. While the Wi-Fi was a little pricey, the other amenities more than made up for that. While the bed, shower, television, etc. were great, they pale in comparison to the human aspect here: the employees here all went out of their way to ensure a great stay. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “NICE GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: christina0522
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around the time when it first opened. It was around October 2009, but the date of stay didn't go back that far. This hotel was very elegant. It was fun just to lounge around at the hotel and be lazy. We stayed here because my father-in-law had a show next door at the convention center, so we traveled with him and took our daughter to Walt Disney World. She loved the lazy river and the pool area. It was so relaxing. I didn't want to leave. I would recommend this hotel for families but more as a romantic getaway. They have cabanas and fire pits which would be really enjoyable for a couple to have drinks, relax, and have a good time. Also, be prepared to pay out the a$$ if you are going to Disney World. Like I stated above, we stayed here because of my father-in-law, so we had to take a taxi and that was about $40 bucks to get there. They have trolly stations right outside the hotel. We grabbed a trolly another day to take us to some outlet centers. Also if you are going to Disney World they will let you in for free if it is you birthday so my husband got in free because his birthday is October 10th :) an added bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chericlc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orlando Hilton 4 nights for a business trip recently. The hotel was brand new, immaculate and the service was great. All of the staff was friendly and went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. The concierge lounge and it's breakfast selection was one of the best we've seen. The room was great and very clean. The pools were gorgeous. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great service”
Reviews.Author: buriud
Reviews.Content: I came to Orlando to see the fun parks and i couldn't have come to a better location. Hotel is well positioned between the best parks , rooms are confortable and clean and service is high class. I got the best advice from the concierge regarding the parks. Special thanks to Matthew Baribeau for this. I totally recommend it ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: CarolDundee_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with this hotel as we were outbooked. We arrived at the hotel on a warm afternoon to be told our room had been cancelled! When we queried this more it turned around that we had been outbooked to the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek (which was fabulous) and seemingly had already been told! What?! We had been told already so why did we travel 4,500 miles from Scotland to go to a hotel that didn't have a booking for us. We had booked our trip in January so surely there could have been notice of the outbooking procedure. We were obviously extremely disappointed and very tired. We had travelled with a teenager and a baby so it was not the best situation. We did agree with the manager to split our stay and did eventually stay at this hotel. I don't know if I would stay here again as the Hilton Bonnet Creek was much better. Hilton Orlando was more of a city hotel. Alot of conventions and not much of an atmosphere. Rooms were nice and big. Beds comfortable. Nice pool. Lounge areas etc. all nice.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome, relaxing sleep and gigantic pool area”
Reviews.Author: Lloydsbroker
Reviews.Content: This is definetely one of the best Hotels I've ever stayed in and that means something as I have spent more than 1,000 nights abroad. Apart from the efficient and friendly service you never have the feeling to stay in one of those1,400 beds business hotels as the architecture does not give the impression that you are in such a big hotel. I enjoyed lazy river, a kind of pool-river where you can float on a rubber swim ring in a circle - very relaxing! Apart from this you have two large pools, two whirls pools and a water-slide - great for children. The food at the pool war was great and they have a great choice of drinks and several draft beers :-) Should you think of travelling to this place, you should treat yourself to an upgrade on the Executive Floor (19th floor). Apart from better rooms, complimentary breakfast and soft drinks and a goureous view you will enjoy the hospitality of Chris, who looks after the Executive Lounge and who is very friendly and helpful in all matters and arranges everything for you with a smile on his face. Make sure that you book well in advance or be flexible with you dates so that you can get a King Bed Room Executive Floor for about US$ 160.00. If you have bad luck and there is a convention going on, you will have to pay US$ 300.00 for the same room. By the way, from this hotel you can reach all main attractions of Orlando within a 10 minutes drive with you car but you will need a car. Steffen from Berlin, Germany

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FtLaudBob
Reviews.Content: I was awe struck by this hotel. It's huge! The lobby is the size of a football field, and beautiful. From what I was told it's only a year old and it shows. Everything is in top shape. Extremely modern decor. Walking distance to the convention center and a few restaurants. Rooms were spacious and nicely apointed. The hallways had art work on the walls and interesting lighting. We had a couple of apps in the restaurant and a few drinks, a bit pricey, but very good. Pool area has a water slide and "Lazy River" great for the kids. There is also an adults only pool as well. Not cheap by any stretch of the imagination but the hotel delivers at the price you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “New conference hotel great for families”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily84
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I recently stayed at the Hilton while my husband attending a conference at the convention center. The location was great and the hotel is very new. I do feel that we were charged for everything i.e. 14.95 daily for internet per device (pretty steep when you have 3 laptops and an Ipad...however, we where able to negotiate a more reasonable rate), $10 per person/day to use the work out room, $12/day self park or $20/day valet. After paying $310/night for our executive level room, I think that all of these charges are excessive, although we were able to visit the executive lounge. Our room, #1806 was directly under the foyer of the executive lounge where there are wooden floors. Every morning we where woken up by the foot steps (women high heals) walking back and forth on the wood floors. The "view" that we we paid extra for was very limited unless we turned our heads 45 degrees. If you reserve a room at this hotel, be sure that you do not get room 1806. I thought that the receptionists were very friendly, as well as the chamber maids, but the three waiters that we had during the three occasions that we ate lunch at the restaurants were apathetic ....like they knew that they were going to get 18-20 percent no matter what type of service they give you. This hotel is definitely not a Four Seasons or Ritz, but they charge similar prices. I guess it is the price of convenience to be close to the convention center. The pool and lazy river is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Pily_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Very close to Sea World. The pool is very nice it has a lazzy river pool which the kids loved and enjoyed. Highly recommended. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: DessislavaI
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Orlando for a conference - this is the ideal spot - it is walking distance to the conference center! The hotel is new, there are pool areas, a spa. You need to pay extra for some basics though - like internet in the rooms. It does not offer any extra services, so don't rely on being picked or dropped off at the airport. At the hotel there is a bar and a restaurant. The restaurant was closed for the night and I didn't feel comfortable to eat at the bar. There isn't much variety in restaurants around, so you will need to go to town or by taxi. If you end up with a bit of extra time, and you'd feel like a book or flipping through magazines - you will need to bring your own. In short - it is a basic sleep-and-attend-your-conference place. Nothing more. I'd recommend only its location to the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: AlohaHana
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this hotel!!! Loved the pool area the best with it's ultra fast slide and very relaxing lazy river. We had a blast stayin here. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: apv7
Reviews.Content: A Good value for a very nice hotel. Close to the attractions. I loved the grounds and the staff was extreamly helpful. I would definatly go back next time im visiting orlando. I also love visiting the outlets while im staying at Hilton Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silvis_Sandy
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful hotel. . Close to airport - short 10 minute drive. Only down side was price of snacks in snack shop. $3 for bottle of pop - across the street at Wlagreens, same bottle was .99 cents. Buy your snacks at Walgreens! The hotel is immaculate and every employee i came in contact went above and beyond to help. The grounds are beautiful - two pools, lazy river, outdoor fire pits, really, really nice. Located right next to convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice biz trip courtesy of Hilton Orlando”
Reviews.Author: drivin_n_cryin
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 6:30a and was promptly given a room with no hassles. Even during the morning rush, my room was quiet and no hallway noise woke me up. I forgot my iphone charger at home. When I told the front desk, the manager and bellman let me borrow their personal chargers. In the end, I left my phone with them to charge, and when I checked out, the check-out person double-checked that I had my phone back in my possession. I spent the evening after my meeting at the pool. There is a quiet pool and a large family pool. I really liked being able to read my book and chat on the phone quietly without the loud music and children of the family pool. But late in the evening, the best part is how quiet the family pool becomes. I used the massive water slide several times. It is such fun, even for adults!!! Service at the poolside restaurant was quick and personable. They even gave me a pizza box to go for my leftovers. The guest rooms have a hidden refrigerators so you can eat later and store stuff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The parking valet staff is amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: socalhappytraveler
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week on business, and Danny and his valet staff were absolutely amazing. They were hard working, eager to please, and just a wonderfully nice group of people. We were very pleased with the hotel altogether. It was a great place to stay. The pool was amazing too. I just wish we would have had time to take a dip. Oh well, there's always next time. I highly recommend the Hilton Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany302
Reviews.Content: The service at the concierge desk at the Hilton in Orlando was impeccable. Andrea Putzeys went above and beyond our expectations to help us plan various activities to do during our stay at the hotel. Upon approaching the desk, Andrea greeted us with a warm and welcoming smile, asked us a few questions about what we’d like to do, and within minutes had researched over 15 activities for us, all of which sparked our interest. Before we knew it, Andrea has us scheduled for an action-packed weekend with tickets for each activity in our hands. We were amazed at how smooth and easy the process was, and were extraordinarily impressed by the enthusiasm Andrea showed throughout the planning. Her excitement made us all the more eager for what was in store. Andrea followed up the deal by sending us champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and a personalized thank you card to our hotel room later that day, which made us feel beyond special. We ultimately had the most AMAZING adventure in Orlando, which included jet skiing, Wonderworks, City Walk, Universal Studios/Magic Kingdom, The Blue Man Show, and even a helicopter ride! None of this we would have know about if it wasn’t for Andrea’s hard work and hospitality. We would recommend the Hilton Hotel and their concierge service to any and everybody, and we hope that they too get the chance to work with someone as wonderful as Andrea.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Lounge is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: dlhargrove
Reviews.Content: Chris and Maria in the Executive Lounge were absolutely amazing. After a long day, I went up to have a glass of wine and snack before a conference reception. Didn't realize I had just missed the snacks. Chris went back to the kitchen and fixed a great little plate of cheeses and fruit for myself and a colleague. Now THAT'S what I call superb customer service. Bravo Hilton, for finding these gems.

Reviews.Title: “New, New, New and Very Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: MPatrick33629
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary hotel. WIth the hotel opened within the last year, everything was in perfect working order, quiet, spotlessly clean, impecaably designed and decorated, and super friendly from the moment one arrived until departure. With the wonderfully clean design, this was the perfect place to relax and enjoy all the amentities available, read, and use as a home base to explore the greater Orlando area. The dining room on the Lower Level has a terrific morning brunch. And again, everyone was so hospitable and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: ivan33LasVegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of 7 nights and I could not have been happier. We arrived a bit early but were offered an early check in. When we got to our room I was suprised to find a refrigerator in our room! Usually you have to pay extra for that. The rooms were were modern, new and roomy. The TV was a brand new 42 inch LG with HDMI input which was great so I could hook up my laptop and play my 2 year old's movies. We rented a car so nothing really ever seemed that far. The hotel is in the middle of Disney World, Sea World and Universal Studios. The pool is amazing! It was never very busy while we were there and the slide was great! Can't say enough good things about this place. Me and my family will be back in Sept 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Two Words For This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BBQFiend
Reviews.Content: The two words are Rick and Danielle! Two employees who exemplify what the hospitality world is all about. I was in town for The American Pizza Championships and my sister and I had a problem with Expedia. We went to the front desk to help solve the problem, and met Rick. He did everything right naturally-he wasn't a "trained what to say employee." After about 15 minutes of trying to figure out what happened, he moved us to a suite and sent free beer and soft drinks. Most of my experiences with front desks are not much to talk about, but this guy really cared, really took interest, and really solved the problem. Thanks Rick! Now Danielle-Unbelievably thorough and sweet. I own a few restaurants and she made me the best Mojito ever! Didn't have much time to talk to her, but when I did, she did what every bartender is supposed to do-make you feel great! Thanks Danielle and Rick, hope to see you next September ! Patrick Maggi

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!!!”
Reviews.Author: moppie16
Reviews.Content: You will never stay at another hotel like this...customer service was exemplary!!! There is no other place to stay in Orlando! The staff cannot do enough for the guests...I can't wait to return:)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation.....would be great for a conference”
Reviews.Author: enstormblue
Reviews.Content: We regularly travel to orlando for weekend trips to use the parks and lounge by the pools and have taken up trying various hotels in the area. We have stayed here and the bonnet creek resort and enjoy both very very much. The pros: - The pool is awesome, huge lazy river with zero entry and free......yep free tubes. We had to rent ours $10 a day at bonnet creek. Towels are free, the hot tubs are actually hot and there is 3 pools to choose from. The quiet pool is actually kept quiet and is seperated from the main area which is rather enjoyable. - Desk staff (the staff in general) here are the nicest friendliest staff I have had the pleasure to deal with when being in a hotel this size. Everybody makes a point to ask how your day is or strike up small talk without being annoying or pushy. The desk staff accomidated our every request and actually remembered who we were during the whole stay. I know its a minor thing but hey it was noticed. - Tennis courts, exercise room etc - We actually got to use the tennis court and its nice and new and well situated. I could see and issue in the cooler months of actually getting time on there because there is only one court. Exercise room wasn't used during our stay but its free to Hilton silver level members.....though i do have an issue with being charged at all. Equipment looks all brand new and situated in a nice well lit room. - Location: Covered access walkway to the main orlando convention hall which is right across the street. Located in short driving distance to sandlake road and all of the needed restraunts and entertainment. Heck i avoided I-4 my whole stay and for people who have used I-4 before thats a big deal. Cons: - Pay to park is still dumb in my oppinion. $12 a day here which is cheaper then bonnet creek but still a pain. We're used to having to pay to park so we expect it but be warned none the less. No level of honnors gets you free parking :\ - Pay for gym and internet..... again tad bit on the nickle and dimming side of things....When paying $100 plus a night we should be allowed to use such things at no charge, at least offer a slower version of internet for nothing, I'd be happy with that. - Noise: Walls are thinner then bonnet creek resort. not the point its unberable....we sept like logs all night. But if you have a noisier neighbor do expect to hear them a bit, also per usual the doors are heavy and tend to slam shut. - Not a major issue but i did notice the sheets still had a stain in some places on them, looked like makeup.
