Just saying if its visible like that on the top of the sheet housekeeping should have seen it and changed it right away, in their defense it was gone the second day so i was happy about that. -- Hilton Orlando is a great resort hotel and very enjoyable we will gladly be back and I even suggested it to a few friends and family members. Just keep in mind the misc. charges and you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swtprop
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked this hotel as a extended weekend getaway for Labor Day. Oh my, what an awesome hotel. I am never one to get into pools but couldn't resist the lazy river. The water temperature was just right. My family and I enjoyed our stay. My only complaint would be the softness of the bed and pillows. I could not get a good nights sleep because both were too soft. I opted to sleep in the chair. I am booking a room for next weekend as a romantic getaway and will have my own pillows in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but I have a gripe!”
Reviews.Author: Jackdel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for 10 nights with my 2 teenage boys. The hotel is excellent, has great facilities, e.g. great pool, gym etc. Rooms are very good and are kept very clean. I would recommend it to anyone as it's in a very good position too. I have to say I have a major gripe being asked to pay $12 per day just to park my car at the hotel I'm staying at, I've had many holidays in Orlando and have never been asked to pay such a fee - also it is $10 dollars each to use the gym per day - why should I have to pay to use a facility within a hotel I have paid to stay at - this does not make sense to me and Hilton should re-visit this policy. As stated I cannot fault the hotel it is very good, just the un-neccessary charges leave a bad taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: You can really tell that this hotel is rather new. Both the main areas and the room was top notch. We had a room at the executive floor, and took advantage of the snack served 5-7 pm and breakfast in the executive lounge. Great selection of food, attentive staff and not too crowded. The hotel itself is very large, so be aware that the lobby etc. can be very crowded at times. There seems to be a lot of conferences going on here, every day and at every time of the day. The pool/water area is a highlight – even adults (like us) had a blast in the river. Not much negative to say here, even though I cannot understand why new hilton hotels do not have soft-lock mechanism at the room-doors. When your neighbor slams the door, getting in or out, the whole room is shaking. Not a very pleasant way to wake up, especially if its 6am and you really wanted to sleep to 10am...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Macman433
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Clean and modern. Breakfast buffet was very well done and staff was friendly. Soiled by Disney Deluxe hotels but this was just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer services”
Reviews.Author: rex_stocking
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work, domestic and international. And I have never had better customer services at any hotel at any time. From the time I arrived at the Hilton Orlando to the time that I left. The entire staff went out of their way to see that I was taken care of. From the waitress Katie at David’s Club (hotel restraint) to Julie who volunteered to bring me a Strawberry shake just after I checked in at midnight and everyone in between. When return to Orlando for work or vacation the only place that I will stay is the Hilton Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A place of pleasure and service”
Reviews.Author: giach
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome and very obliging service. I had a suite on the 10th floor, which had a beautiful sight east. Being waken by the rising sun with a view onto the huge pool area. I liked the streak restaurant the most. I wasn't using the fitness room nor the wellness area. But that was due a lack of time. The conference area is huge. As a smoker I liked the fact, that I could smoke everywhere outside the hotel. At night the personel were very nice and let us having our drinks outside the hotel. Even ordering a pizza was no problem and quietly accepted. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: tmfl3801
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family last month.. the hotel is only a year old and is beautiful!!...there are two pools (one is for adults only) and a lazy river... they also have two fire pits..my family really enjoyed hanging around the pool area after being at the parks all day.. staying here again next time we visit Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to hang out after the parks”
Reviews.Author: schase412
Reviews.Content: We had two 9 year olds and I cannot say enough about how great the pool area is. After a day at the parks, we still had a couple of hours at the pool with the slide and lazy river. The slide does close at 9 which was a little too early but the lazy river is open until 10. The rooms are comfortable and clean but not extra roomy. It fits the two queen beds and a desk and chair. There is a little fridge. But we did not spend time in the room except to sleep so this was not a problem. I am very glad I listended to the reviews here and chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Timandjoholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a really good deal as the hotel was really quiet for the 4 nights. The rooms and beds were great. Queen beds, the room was super clean with a small fridge. The pools were warm and the lazy river was outstanding. No charge for the tubes which was nice and free towels. The one downside of this hotel is the cost of food and drinks around the pool. We stayed at 4 hotels in the orlando area and all upper end hotels and Hilton was the most expensive. A burger was around $14 and a drink was $10 so keep this in mind if that is important to you. As well they charge for Internet and the use of the gym. The gym was OUTSTANDING and lots of equipment and all brand new. But unless your a top end Hilton member you have to pay which is not clear when we booked as well for the internet which is around $15 a day. Great location as the hotel is very new and easy to get to shopping if this is part of your vacation and close to the parks. 5 mins to Sea world and right on International drive. Overall I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again as its a very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...stayed there twice during our 3 week trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: juicygirlfruit
Reviews.Content: Our 1st of 11 hotels we stayed in Florida and GA...and really enjoyed it. We began our journey in Orlando at this Hilton and it was a good choice. We stayed 2 nights in the beginning of our trip and 1 night at the end. We found a great price on Travel Zoo which included executive lounge breakfast & happy hour appetizers in the early evening. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was friendly & professional. We self parked for $12.. The room was nice, clean, comfy beds w/ a view of Sea World and the summer evening fireworks. Our children loved the lazy river and pool, which were clean, plenty of chairs and nice. The breakfast was good and happy hour appetizers became our dinner (kids like the pizza & chicken). A great way to save money on dinner especially for a family of 4. Also, a nice fitness center (free for Silver Hilton Honors members & $10 for all others). Close proximity to everything touristy and near the convention center. I have stayed at many of the Disney properties and other general hotels in the area and this rates with the best in Orlando. They do have shuttles to the parks but they are not free and the concierges are somewhat friendly & helpful. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for all, especially families if you get the executive lounge!!!!

Reviews.Title: “1ST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: LESLEYE_10
Reviews.Content: reception desk staff very friendly and helpful,the rooms are spacious and the beds are a dream to sleep in.it is placed in an excellent location for all the attractions of orlando and the restaurants are fabulous,you have to try breakfast,which is one of the best we have had in florida.the pool area is massive with areas for adults only,it also has a lazy river which is very relaxing.cant think of anything negative about this hotel 1st class

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Will stay there the next time I am in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: Mick342
Reviews.Content: I usually travel at least 1 week per month and have been doing so for several years. I must say that this hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed in. Nice rooms, nice bathroom with great big fluffy towels. Their swimming pools and the lazy river made a nice end to a long day of working a trade show. The only drawback to staying there was that the food and drinks in the hotel are expensive so I ate else were... Great Hotel, Great Experience...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: ratherBgolfing
Reviews.Content: 5 days, 4 nights. I will not be returning to the Hilton Orlando. I returned from my vacation this morning so disappointed in my personal experiences at this hotel. I am a fairly young man at 23 years of age, and decided to travel to Orlando with my significant other on a R&R trip before beginning grad school later this week. I did admit I was a bit young, but I do not find it acceptable or will not tolerate being looked down upon and mistreated because of that. The Concierge were the group of people we had problems and disputes with. KC, Laura, Mary and Kim. KC is fairly new to his job, but will try his best to help you with a smile on his face. The other 3 ladies have disregarded us, snapped at us in annoyance, hung up multiple times over the phone while trying to get some information from outside the hotel, rarely ever gave us correct information and treated us with NO respect. They acted more like clerks than a concierge team, more than willing to take our money when it came to purchasing tickets through them (Universal Studios, Disney World and shuttles), but that is all they did for us. I've dealt with a few 4-Diamond hotels in my time, and the concierge at this hotel were by far the worst. If you are from Orlando, know your way around and plan to spend most of your time within the hotel, this is a great place for you. But if you are from out of town looking for support in your stay, and would like to get the full experience of your trip... Please reconsider, because you will not find it here. -About a 15-20 dollar cab ride to Disney, Universal and Seaworld. -Restaurants are upscale and classy, visited all of them during our stay. A bit pricey, some more than others, but it was good food. -Cabana was $100 dollars to rent, worthwhile in my opinion. Complimentary drinks in mini-fridge, television, 2 pretty comfortable chairs and telephone. -Clean fitness center, was always quiet when I went at night. -Nice rooms for the price you pay. -Room service was better than expected, they were more than willing to work with the time restraints on some of the food I ordered (was able to order lunch during dinner times etc.) $4.50 delivery charge and 22% gratuity added to every order. -The Marketplace within the hotel has an excellent variety of food/snacks/drinks. Prices are a little higher than twice what you would pay at the grocery store. -Paid $14.95 a day for Wi-Fi which I feel should have been included. There are a handful of other hotels within the same area, take my advice and shop around a bit. It is not a cheap decision to make and will definitely want to make sure you get what you're paying for!

Reviews.Title: “Great lazy river and pool”
Reviews.Author: micaryan62
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton for one night after a week at the beach as we were flying through Orlando. Check in was very quick. There were a lot of people in the lobby waiting for check in, however, they were staffed up and I only had to wait a few minutes. I was lucky they had a room ready as we arrived before 4pm. Employee at check in was very nice. Only issue I had was they gave me a regular room when I had reserved a room on the Executive floor. I caught this before I left and she quickly changed my room. We spent the afternoon at the pool. It is a great pool. Huge and wonderful water slide. The lazy river was awesome. I thought I'd have to pay to rent a tube, but they were letting people use them for free. The only issue I had the entire trip was not really the fault of the hotel (although I think maybe they could have monitored the area a little better) was at the lazy; river. Some older kids would take two or three tubes and stack them up and ride around the river that way. Meanwhile, my kids and others were waiting for a tube. Also, because there were not tubes available a lot of older kids were just using it like a swimming pool and going around it with no tubes and running into my kids on the tubes. There were snowcones available poolside for $2 which was a nice treat for my kids. After spending the afternoon at the pool, we changed and went to the executive lounge. I normally don't spend the extra to stay at this level, but due to a nice special we got through Travelzoo I spent the extra. It was money well spent. The lounge was open from 5-8 pm. They had a nice assortment of food which we turned into our dinner before going to Downtown Disney. My son loved the chicken wings. They also had flatbread with some good toppings, nice vegetable tray, some sort of dessert, cheese and crackers. I am sure I am forgetting some of the other food out. Also had bottled water. We went back the next morning for breakfast and it was wonderful. Homemade oatmeal, muffins, bagels, nice assortment of dry cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt and yummy granola to name a few. Staff was very nice in this lounge and resplenishedt the food often and came to clear our plates when we went back for 2nds. The best part was they gave me a late checkout when I asked. We stayed out pretty late at Downtown Disney and when we got back around midnight I nicely asked if there was any late checkouts available. The lady checked her computer and asked if 12:30 would work? That extra 1.5 hours made a big difference as we could sleep in, eat breakfast and not feel rushed to pack up and get out. I would definitly come back to this hotel. Great day!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for the entire family.”
Reviews.Author: qtwendy0423
Reviews.Content: We booked the 30 hour package they had and loved it. We got to check in at 10 and check out at 4. There was plenty to do for everyone. The lazy river and slider were awesome and it was never to crowded. Pool table and foos ball were nice also. Rooms were spacious and clean. Beds were really comfy. Can't wait to go back and stay again!! Only downside was you have to pay for parking and internet. But we expected it from a big resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and will not Dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: johnucfsae
Reviews.Content: This hotel just opened last year, the service was great. It is basically attached to the Orlando convention center. Our room faced the convention center so the view was far less than spectacular, but that is the only negative that I can say. They do charge for parking, so be advised. The room was very nice, the room service was timely. The pool area was spectacular, would say it is as nice as any around Orlando, and we have stayed at many.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: 2travel_allover
Reviews.Content: I was in town with a high school reunion and this was our “host hotel.” We couldn’t have picked a better hotel. I was extremely impressed with the outstanding customer service I received. From check-in to the room attendants, to the bar staff at the pool…EVERYONE gave A+ customer service. This hotel should serve as a model for how to deliver excellent customer service. The staff really goes out of their way to make you feel special. The rooms are spacious and clean. I had a breathtaking view from the 9th floor. The 'blackout' shades are a nice touch and really help if you'd like to sleep in. I don’t normally visit hotel pools, but I’m soooo glad I visited this pool. I felt like I was on a tropical island. The drinks at the bar are delicious (I had a Caribbean Colada- $10 and a taste of a friend’s Mojito). Directly across the street there are plenty of food options (Denny’s, IHOP, McDonald’s, Red Lobster…). There are cabs that wait outside for passengers, so it’s not hard to hail a cab. The only negatives were that this hotel is SUPER crowded. I asked the concierge how many rooms were in the hotel and she said about 1,400…YIKES! There is always a steady flow of guests…even at 4 a.m. in the morning (don’t ask why I was up at 4 a.m. in the morning-LOL). It may be a little overwhelming if you aren’t used to crowds. Internet and parking aren’t complimentary and a cab to the FL mall will cost about $15-$20. This hotel is A+ and I can’t wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Picked hotel for great pool and so did half of orlando.”
Reviews.Author: ilovcole33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited to stay at the Hilton for the awesome pool. We knew the price was a bit steep but we would make a day of it by the pool instead of spending money at the parks. Well at every hotel I have ever stayed in you needed to be a hotel guest to use the pool, not this one. People would pay for parking and use the pool for the day. So too say it was a bit crowded would be a understatement. The main pool was so full and loud with children that wasnt even a possiblilty. The lazy was crowded also, the adult pool was pretty empty tho. The water was so hot it was not enjoyable and it was uncomfortable. Their were non guest drinking smuggled in wine and snacks out of their bags. While my husband spends 6 bucks on a beer !?! I dont get why their isnt someone checking for room keys before entering the pool. Not to mention we reserved a smoking room and when we got there we were put into a non smoking room. It was like it didnt even matter what we requested , we were getting whatever they wanted to give us. The walls are also paper thin so I hope nobody wants to get any sleep while your there. Its a dog friendly hotel , I found that out when I heard the room next store had 3 yelping dogs. Horrilbe overall , very very disappointed. Save your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MsVB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a rather large Hilton next to the convention center. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and left wishing we could stay another night. Access to Universal Studios was a 10-15 minute drive. The spa experience was possibly the best I've ever had. The rooms are typical new Hilton and we were very pleased to be on an HHonors floor without even requesting it. We also enjoyed watching the fireworks from one of the parks every nite from our room. The pools are very well done with different areas for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: our2010vacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our 30's and our kids are ages 6 and 8. We booked this hotel as part of a 5 day SeaWorld/Aquatica/Busch Gardens package through SeaWorld. The package included length of stay tickets to the parks and 5 nights at the hotel for $895. Which means that with hotel parking ($12 a day for self parking) our hotel cost was less than $60 a night! Check in/out: Check in was at 4:00 on Sunday 07/18/10 and every thing was perfect. We got upgraded to a pool view, and the guy at check in put us at the end of the hall next to the stairs "blacony" so that we could sit outside and see all of the area's nightly fireworks. Check out was smooth and everything was in order. The hotel: The hotel is really nice and self parking is very convienient. The room was a normal 2 queen room. The TV and fridge were really nice, but other than that the room was normal. Where this hotel is set apart from others is in thier friendly staff ( everyone was incredibly nice and upbeat without being over the top and insincere) and their amazing pool! The pictures do not do the pool justice!!! Hilton hit the nail on the head with this huge family pool! The lazy river is awesome (we liked it better than the one at Aquatica), zero entry on both ends is great, pool side foosball and pool tables at the pool bar, the water basketball court and slide are really cool for both kids and adults. There is also an "adults only" pool and hot tub which means that parents don't have to constantly tell thier children to settle down in the pool. Food: As usual on site dining and room service are extremely expensive so we opted to eat elsewhere. There are plenty of resturants close by - I wouldn't say within walking distance, however I did see some people walking. Cons:1) I called down on Sunday night to check on shuttle times for SeaWorld the next day (they offer complimentary shuttle service) and was given the wrong time so we missed the shuttle we intended to take. We ended up taking the last shuttle of the morning. 2) The beds had a line of food crumbs around them from where the vaccuum didn't clean well. 3) Internet is $15 a day - I know that most "nicer" hotels charge for internet, yet for the life of me I can't figure out why in this day and age... Tips: 1) If you stay here and plan on going to SeaWorld and/or Aquatica, take the shuttle in the am and a cab in the pm. A cab ride is around $10 with tip, whereas parking is $12 and with the shuttles and cab you get picked up/dropped off up front! 2) The hotel offers towels for the pool, so don't worry about bringing your own. I highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nevarena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ... along with our two boys (ages 7 & 3) booked this room through the Summer AAA promotion on the Hilton website...which gave us a fabulous rate (~ $108/nt). My son got sick on our day of departure and the hotel graciously pushed back our reservation one day and gave us the same rate for our entire stay. Check in was a breeze. The hotel is upscale without feeling stuffy. My boys loved the water slide and pool and my hubby loved the lazy river. There is also an "adults only" pool for a quieter time. The poolside bar is extremely convenient and the drinks were great. We asked for a "fireworks view" and were so happy that we did. The boys were in bed at a decent hour and we were still able to view the SeaWorld fireworks display. The queen-sized beds were extremely comfortable and the room was spacious. The HDTV was a big hit too. The food is a bit pricey onsite but there are tons of restaurants in the area. The only problem that we had was the self-parking (room keys did not work upon entrance or exit) but once again the staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. We will definitely be making this our "go-to" hotel in Orlando in the future. They even have a Starbucks onsite!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful, but very expensive. One HUGE problem”
Reviews.Author: GoingtoArizona
Reviews.Content: I was there for a family reunion a week ago and I must say that this hotel is absolutely beautiful!! The pool is fantastic and all of the amenities are great. However, it is EXTREMELY expensive!If you want to stay here then you most definitely will need some money if you want to order room service, play basketball, tennis, golf, etc. Everything about this hotel is expensive. However, you must pay for hotels like this. The only really bad thing that I can say about the hotel is that my room key NEVER worked to get out of the parking garage and that truly was a HUGE problem. However, they did have an attendent on duty at all times during the day that let you out which was nice. Also, BEWARE that if you are having a package shipped there via UPS there will be a handling fee!!! They tried to charge my mom almost $200.00 just for handling fees at the location on site. Other than that everyone was pretty nice and overall the stay was nice. If you have plenty of money and want to have an enjoyable yet expensive vacation then by all means stay here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: globefamily
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Orlando for my 5th anniversary with my husband and 19 month old. We wanted a really good experience because of the occasion and we got just that! When you walk in, the Hotel is very beautiful. There are huge chandaliers and marble floors. Very chic. The service at the front desk, the bell boy, the staff at the pool... basically everywhere we went..was polite, friendly, courteous, and helpful. We needed to find out what terminal we were flying out of in the morning and the front desk looked into it and promptly called us back. ROOMS: The rooms were a very good size. The LCD large flat screen TV was great for those times that we just wanted to relax. The washroom was modern, and the cleaning staff did a fantastic job each day. The beds were SUPER comfortable. We slept very well at the Orlando Hilton. EXECUTIVE LEVEL: I just want to mention that it's absolutely worth getting a room on the Executive Level (19th floor), which is where we stayed. The executive lounge is open from 6:30 am to 10pm and is staffed by very friendly and upbeat personnel. The benefit of having access to this lounge is enormous! You have access to a continental breakfast everyday from 6:30 to 11;00. Cereal, bread, bagels, croissants, danishes, fresh fruit, very, very tasty orange juice, milk, etc. are all served here. There's a machine that serves capuccino, lattes, etc. as well. Then there's snacks after breakfast, which includes cookies, etc. My husband and I really liked the hor d'oeuvres at dinner time. At times there were ribs, wings, chicken fingers, pizza, shrimp balls, ravioli, etc. It was always hot and fresh. Then if this weren't enough, desserts were served at 8pm, which included a wide assortment of mini cakes and pastries. There's free bottled water and if you bring your laptop with you, there's free Intenet access in the lounge also. And if you stay on the executive lounge this perk is all FREE!!!! AMMENITIES: The restaurants inside the hotel serve great food and they are fairly priced. The pool was AMAZING!!! They have two pools, one which has a very fun and fast slide. The greatest depth was a bout 4 feet 6 inches, so it's safe for the entire family. They even have a lazy river!!! It was was heated and was very relaxing. They also had shallow areas where our toddler splashed around and had a great time in. The gym is very, very high tech and state of the art. The treadmills all had a personal TV for you to enjoy. The weights included machines, as well as free weights. We've never seen such a nice gym at any other hotel, and we've stayed at quite a few in the 12 plus countries we've travelled to. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. If you want an excellent experience, this is where to stay in Orlando. LOCATION: The location is very convenient. It's located right by International Drive, which is where all the action is. International Dr. is very touristy and has a wide assortment of restauratns and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: mntnbikerbw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night AFTER our cruise on Royal Caribbean's Freedom of the Seas. Wonderful place. The room was nice sized and the bed was very comfortable. Service at the front desk was terrific but there was a bit of a snag when they couldn't find our breakfast coupons. They recommended two places to eat and both were fantastic. Thanks to Kim at the Concierge desk for hookin' us up at Moonfish as well. Great place and well worth the money (which wasn't very much for a king).

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ive seen in a while”
Reviews.Author: ebuge90
Reviews.Content: no need to take young kids to waterpark as hotel has huge pools best lazy river and great waterslide. also 2 hot tubs. service incredible and extremely friendly staff. my 7 year old boy and 4 year old daughter loved it. 5 minutes from sea world, 15 from magic kingdom. more expensive than budget hotels but well worth it. hotel brand new, september 09, extremely clean and comfortable. pool area is a beautiful backyard oasis. be aware of parking charge per day for rental car and there wont be any surprises. 1 minute drive to strip with every kind of restaurant and shopping u could imagine, or take bus

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! This place was so awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kmccoy4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 12 year old son and his friend here for the weekend. We just wanted to to go away for a weekend and relax and not have the crowds of the water parks. Now this hotel is no water park but it was almost as much fun. They had a great zero entry pool, a water slide, a lazy river, pool tables, foosball tables, a putting green, and a bar. The pictures just doesn't do this hotel justice. The rooms are a good size and the beds are great. The hotel seems to be new so everything is clean and updated. We only live about 45 minutes away but we will be back at this hotel soon! We were able to check in at 10am thinking we would go to the room during the day but we didn't leave the pool till 6pm. We were having such a great time we didn't want to leave. The only downfalls of this hotel are $12 to self park or $20 to valet a day. They also charge for internet per day. You can't bring your own food or drink to the pool, they want you to buy theirs and it is pricey but normal for a resort, portions aren't bad somethings you can even split. Most people get upset by the resort tax but all Orlando hotels have that tax!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenizeOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: My boytfriend surprise me with my birthday and engagement party in this Hotel. The staff new about it and made everything great for us. The rooms are fantastic. Don't forget to ask for the parlor room is great for small activities. The lobby is the perfect place to relax. And if you have time; go to Spencer steakhouse Restaurant, it has a great wine room. You will love it and the Manager is great .The River pool is refreshing... and the pools are very beautiful. We really had a memorable stay. I recommend it at one of the best... Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Bliss”
Reviews.Author: JenaJAkron_OH
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night at the Hilton Hotel in orlando off of Destination Pkwy and WOW!!!!!!! The pool area alone sold us. The pool was gorgeous and had a lazy river, music, amazing pool lounge/bar area, fire pit, cabanas- it was a complete treat! We were only able to stay for one night due to time constraints- but we are looking forward to booking our next vacation there in 2011. The decor of the lobby, room & grounds was CLEAN, spa-like, MODERN, fresh and very resort-like. The valet, Danny, welcomed me in and invited me to park and take a look around the hotel before we even booked a night there. I was so glad he did- and I am so glad we stayed- it was the highlight of our Florida vacation. We spent the day lounging at the pool with our 3 and 6 year olds and they LOVED the pool area. My husband and I both swam in the pool with the kids and enjoyed a wonderful day together. STAY HERE!!!! You will not be disappointed. P.S.- LOVED the patterned carpet and the bathroom tiles. :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - excellent staff, facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: mooresa
Reviews.Content: I booked the holiday as a surprise for my husband on our 2nd wedding anniversary and had emailed the hotel in advance to let them know. It was the 4th July weekend the hotel was busy however, the experience started at check-in where we were greated by excellent receiption staff who were aware of our anniversary and upgraded us to the 19th floor with great views of the 4th July fireworks and a king bed. On our 1st night we were sent a lovely gift and a note from receiption which was an extra special touch. The room was brilliant, clean, spacious had a fridge, large tv and very comfortable bed you coulldn't ask for anymore. Housekeeping staff were brilliant and always said hello when passing their cart in the hallway. We went down to the pool bar everyday it had a great atmosphere, food and the service was fast . The hotels facilities are 1st class there is so much to do you don't need to leave for the busy parks, the lazy river was a favourite and it was no problem getting a ring even on the holiday weekend. Location is perfect your right in the middle of i-drive so it's easy to get to all attractions. Overall This is one hotel you won't be disappointed with, it's exactly as it looks on the website - amazing, and the staff are 1st class. Well done Hilton Orlando

Reviews.Title: “The new Hilton Orlando ... nice, very nice”
Reviews.Author: AlexAttumalil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Hilton Orlando during our vacation to FL this year. We were only in town for a few days and Hilton offered reasonable rates. Let me talk about the things we liked ... It is a real kid friendly place. One large pool (max 4.9ft deep) with a nice water slide and warm towels. A sizable lazy river setup (3.5ft deep) with waterfalls, cannons, jets and bubbles. Around the pool there are tennis courts, basketball court, beach volleyball, nice cabanas, fire place and a pool side bar/lounge. Our little one was in heaven. We were given a room with two queens on the 10th floor (19 floors) facing SeaWorld and the pool. This gave us an opportunity to see the nightly fireworks (runs from July-Aug at 9:45pm). Rooms were sizable and came with a fridge and a safe (pretty well hidden inside the dresser). The staff was courteous and always willing to help. There are a few nice restaurants for dine in and or room service at a reasonable rate... about $12-$15. There is a Parking garage our back with ample partking, but will cost you $12/day. And that about covers it .... we liked it. Nothing fancy, but enough to make your stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel only 17th out of 347 in Orlando?”
Reviews.Author: hymeragal
Reviews.Content: Just don't see how it gets any better than this place! From the staff to the pool to the cozy beds to the food, this place is the BEST! Don't even think twice, just book it!!! The front desk clerk said with pride that they just received their four diamond status. If it was up to me, I'd give them six (if they go that high)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great pool, spotless”
Reviews.Author: jeji4
Reviews.Content: We are checking out of this hotel tomorrow and I can not say enough good things about it. the pools are wonderful. Very large family pool and nice adult pool too. Lazy river is a wonderful and water slide is lots of fun (and big). The service is spot on! Everyone is nice and seems to really care about stay. Hotel is not in middle of everything, but right off exit 72 (I-4) so easy to get to everything by car. Hotel is also beautiful with large and gracious lobby. Hilton has the Heavenly Queen beds which never fail to give a good night's sleep. We got a great deal here...$139 including full breakfast buffet. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Week”
Reviews.Author: mamasnaper
Reviews.Content: My children(ages 8,5,3) and my parents just spent a week in Orlando. We loved the hotel and the kids loved the pool. They were always there when needing something. We did valet the car - easier with the kids - and they were always there with directions and just very friendly. Our car was always ready by the time we called and went downstairs. My father thought this was the best - the hotel has everything. The only negative in the stay is it is busy with convention people, so if you want quiet and calm, you may want to stay somewhere else. We did upgrade to executive level which was worth it - we got breakfast and evening snacks and drinks. The lounge was always open for drinks and coffee and they kept the fridge stocked with bottled water for the go. We will definantly stay at this hotel again when the time comes.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good experience”
Reviews.Author: thecortex
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is an excellent property overall, especially if attending a conference at the nearby Orange County Convention Center. I've stayed here twice now for a total of 11 nights, so have a reasonable amount of experience on which to base my review. As a Diamond member, I've been upgraded both times to an Executive Level room on the 19th floor. Rooms are a good size with functional desk, bathrobes and a nicely appointed bathroom with beautiful tile shower. No bath, which may not work for families with small kids, but is ideal for business travel. The Executive Lounge offers an excellent Continental Breakfast (plus a couple of hot items) and one of the better Hors D'Oeuvre spreads I've seen at any U.S. Hilton. I haven't eaten at Spencer's (the steakhouse) but the food at David's Bar and the lower level coffee shop was consistently very good. The atmosphere at David's is pleasant and upscale and they have a decent selection of draft and microbrew bottles. The staff at the hotel are truly excellent and customer-friendly. I've been impressed with their positive attitude and willingness to help. For workouts, there is a top-notch gym with good locker room including shower and sauna facilities. Other than nickel and diming on things like in-room high-speed internet which apply to most full-service hotels, the Hilton Orlando is my hotel of choice if attending a convention or even as a base for sight-seeing as it's relatively close to Universal, Disney and Sea World. It's far nicer than the Peabody or Rosen properties up the street although they offer closer proximity to most of the the Convention Center (a plus in hot weather).

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian_FLBillmar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one evening at the Hilton Orlando so that we could be near the airport for an extra early flight the next morning. As a Hilton Gold member, I was upgraded to the Executive Level and provided access to the Executive Lounge Area. I was also told that there is a private consierge for the floor but we did not need these services. The Executive Lounge was great for hot h'oerdves between 5-7 and cookies/coffee/tea available around the clock. The breakfast was excellent and was served from 6:30 am. The lounge has an honor bar and wine was reasonable at $6 per glass. There is wifi and a quiet workstation area available if needed. The room - 1909 had 2 queen sized beds and was very comfortable, quiet and clean. The bed linens and comforter was so plush and "cushy" that I could have stayed in bed all day but did not because I wanted to use the pool. The pool contains a lazy river which is fantastic for both adults as well as children. The lazy river is not connected to the adult pool (quiet pool) or the other pool which was used by children and adults and which contained a basketball hoop in the water and a water slide. The pool area also has a bar and restaurant and the sandwiches were large for the price ($13 - turkey sandwich and huge side of fruits). The staff at the hotel are very accommodating and knowledgeable and will help in any way they can. My only criticism of the hotel was the fact that an Elks Convention was being held in the Convention Center and the huge lobby was very crowded. The Lobby Area also contains a snack shop/market shop with sandwiches, wine/beer/coffee and other items and all are also reasonably priced. Parking was $13. I would stay at this hotel again and feel that the comfort, convenience, and pool area alone are well worth the cost of parking! The hotel is right on I drive next to the convention center and connected to it and restaurants are within walking distance but you probably do not want to walk anywhere due to the extreme heat and humidity of Florida at this time of year (Summer).

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in hotels all over the country when attending Taekwondo competitions and this was the best.”
Reviews.Author: TaekwondoGirl
Reviews.Content: My son is a competitor in Olympic style Taekwondo and since he is still a minor I travel with him to major events all over the country. We have been to many major cities and have stayed in numerous hotels, even in Las Vegas. Service at the Hilton Orlando next to the Orange County Convention Center the weekend of July 4th was excellent. From the greating when pulling into the hotel to leaving the hotel four days later, every staff member was eager to assist and went out of their way to be helpful. My son suffered an injury while at the Taekwondo event which made it necessary to take him to the emergency room. The staff quickly printed out a copy of a map of the closest hospital and explained directions perfectly. I was able to get medical care for my son and have him ready to go for the competition the following day. The beds were wonderful, it was quiet at night, room service and the food was perfect. The price was incredibly reasonable considering what we have paid in other cities. Loved the stay and would stay there again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous end to holiday in an excellent hotel....”
Reviews.Author: marco37
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of our holiday before flying home.We had stayed in a villa for 11 nights then went on a cruise before selecting this hotel to end our holiday. It was fabulous!We arrived early at 12pm and there was no problem checking into our room early. Room was huge,luxurious comfortable beds and a beautiful bathroom. Spent the afternoon by the pool which is one of the best we have seen at any hotels.Our 6 year old daughter loved the lazy river and the slide into the pool. Everywhere totally spotless,friendly staff and we had a delicious breakfast prior to our departure. Our only regret is that we didn"t stay longer! Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but were just nasty when I requested a copy of my Bill.”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonkey_8
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, had a great stay, but going to rate One Star to get their attention, regarding my request for a bill post stay. I called on 6/23 and 6/24 to get a faxed copy of my bill and was shocked at how tough this was. First day I was told 'no problem' we will get it to you via fax. Second time the front desk was hostile and nasty, had someone tell me, we can't see that once you check out, though the person the day before had been able to do so, so was an obvious lie. Finally when I asked to talk to a manager on my 3rd call in 5 minutes, the person Nina (who is great), said let me take care of that for you, General Manager of Hotel, find out who was working front desk with Nina (two female voices), and keep your eye on them. The Finance Dept sent me a form to fill out, after I had already received my bill. I had a 4 star stay until this so have to go down to 1 star for their obfuscation and shoddy after stay attention.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pools and AMAZING service, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: babielo
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, extremely clean, tidy. Very friendly staff members. Checkin-checkout was a breeze. Immediate response to any of my needs! Hotel room was very clean, tidy, maid service came and was a breeze. View of my room to the pool was gorgeous! Temp in the room was always cool, and the flatscreen tv was nice! The only thing though, is that the services are a little pricey. $14 dollars to order a movie, and $250 for a 90min massage. Pool bar has amazing drinks and very quiet! Definitely respectful visitors! :) I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Servanda
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband and four year old grandson to Seaworld and stayed at the Hotel for the advertised water amenties such as the lazy river, pool, etc....we were not disappointed...we all had a great time and the staff both in the hotel and including starbucks, the parking attendant, etc. were all great in serving us with a great dispostion. The room was also clean and comfortable. Had a great three days. I will certainly make this hotel a point of destination when I visit Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Baron Hilton would roll over in his grave to see what room service has become”
Reviews.Author: gregp2
Reviews.Content: It was of paramount to Mr Hilton to have the highest standards for room service in the industry. Its hard to even wait for my meal when you pay $4.5 service delivery and 22% service on top of the food and the delivery service fee so .......a $14 chopped salad at a nice hotel, ok not bad I'll go for that. On top lets splurge and add a diet coke as I will be working a bit late in my room anyway. Assuming a $5 soda that sounds like about $19 bucks, but with service for delivery at $4.5 and adding another 22% service fee it quickly gets over $28??????????? Just for starters I have an ethical concern about charging 22% service fee on the $4.50 delivery service fee don't you? Lets do the math for my total amount due, 68% goes to the food I order, and 32% goes to the various fees for services............. Lets see when it gets here, I'm betting it will be on time~

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: justadude1986
Reviews.Content: This new Hilton in Orlando is absolutely amazing. The staff was wonderful, the hotel grounds are impeccable & the lazy river is awesome. It was not just an ordinary lazy river, it had water falls, bubbling portions & dancing water fountains. The room was beautiful and beds were flawless. I pride myself in all of the hotels I've stayed at in Orlando.. with that said I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: r0mantictraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to enjoy a fun filled weekend adventure in Orlando. Due to the proximity to the theme parks (in particular SeaWorld) we decided to go with this hotel. After our fast and hassle free check-in we were directed to the hotel concierge to arrange to have our complimentary shuttle take us to SeaWorld. The Concierge, Christine, was amazing!!! She sat with us for approximately 20 minutes helping us plan our weekend adventure. We told her that we had planned on going to SeaWorld one day and Universal the next. She told us what the best rides were and what time we should consider doing them so as to avoid the hot sun. She even gave us maps of SeaWorld and Universal to take with us. It was very nice how much attention she gave us, she kept insisting that she wanted us to have a wonderful and relaxing time and thus we did. That evening we had dinner at Spencer's, a steak restaurant in the property, it was delicious! Our waitress was so sweet. She arranged for us to have a romantic candlelight dinner on the small terrace just for the two of us. After our dinner we had a scrumptious surprise waiting for us. Christine had arranged to have chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne sent to our room. Her note indicated that she wanted us to start our vacation with a bang! Our room was nice, very clean but a little small. The king size bed was a bit overwhelming and the pillow were not as firm as I like so I had trouble sleeping the first night. Our view was awesome, we were on the highest floor (the Executive Floor) nothing interfered with our spectacular view of SeaWorld in particular the rollercoaster rides (the Manta & the Kraken). The next morning we were able to enjoy a complimentary buffet breakfast at the Executive Lounge before heading to SeaWorld. After a long day at SeaWorld we were able to come back to the hotel and enjoy the lazy river, which is a nice little treat! The next day we headed to Universal, unfortunately, the hotel does not provide a complimentary shuttle to Universal so we had to take a cab. The valets out front were very helpful in getting us one. Overall the hotel is beautiful, clean and new and above all, the staff is outstanding - we couldn't have asked for a better weekend get-away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business and family”
Reviews.Author: jcmallard1
Reviews.Content: New hotel. Great convention space and service. Food was good but expensive. Drinks are expensive but large selection. Starbucks in the lobby makes a great cap. McDonalds down the street for kids meal's which saved us money once my family came in later in the week. Rooms are large and clean and quiet. Nice bathroom but tub did not drain when taking a shower- yuck. Concierge was great- good deals on tickets after 2 for convention guests to theme parks. Pool area was super- lazy river, water slide and bar area. Pay extra to valet the car in the summer...just too hot to walk to get the car! Also paid $25 for a late 4 p.m. check out which was great as we did the pool instead of a water park! Located close to all attractions but far enough away to not feel like you are overrun with the park crowd. Overall a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: kevinwine69
Reviews.Content: stayed recently as part of an organised trip and was very impressed with this hotel.very spacious and welcoming,the staff were very friendly and accommodating,the rooms were pretty large and clean and the beds were great.pool area was nice and plenty of loungers.Breakfast was terrific,great choice of food and was delicious.Location wise was good as a $10 cab will take you to I Drive and stuff like sea world and universal.Bar 's are pretty hefty for drinks but it's a nice atmosphere.All in all would definitely stay here again next time in Orlando,had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: joshie15
Reviews.Content: Hi all, Have just returned from 10 day stay at the Hilton Orlando, this Hotel is fantastic! If you are considering this Hotel, please just book - you will love it! The staff are the best we have ever encountered in any hotel, they are always happy to see you. The great attention from Juan Garcia was second to none and I cannot thank the Hilton team enough for our terrific stay. I could talk all day about the rooms - all top notch, and the pool area is also terrific. Containing the best hotel lazy river I have ever been in, the pool offers both a relaxing experience and if you are in a family then a pool that is perfect for children. The pool bar is also fantastic and a good place to go if the sun and heat gets too much for you, with friendly staff and again entertainment for children with pool tables and table football available. Again if you are in any doubt please book this hotel, you will not be dissapointed. Thankyou again Hilton, Juan and the staff. The Cavills.

Reviews.Title: “There's better hotels with less fees but nice for the hotwire price.”
Reviews.Author: topherashley
Reviews.Content: Only reason we stayed here was the deal we got on hotwire. Hotel is in a great location! It is close to I Drive and Universal. Check in was a breeze and even got upgraded to a pool view. The room was clean and spacious, bathroom offers plenty of room. I really liked this hotel. However,the fees quickly got old. $12 to self-park, $25 for a late checkout (noon), $100 hold on my debit card (which is still pending 5 days later), $3.50 to get a soda from the vending machine, $10 for a stale bagel and cream cheese. Someone needs to remind Hilton this is ORLANDO not Manhattan. Had a small issue with a manager of the bistro. We came downstairs to eat breakfast around 10am. He told us we could not be seated because we were wearing flip flops. ??? We had planned on a quick bite to eat before walking out the door (across from the Bistro entrance) to the pool. Sorry I didn't have my dress shoes on to get breakfast at your hotel, I must have woken up in the Mandarin Oriental. The guy was a complete jerk about it, its not like we were wearing inappropriate material. I've stayed at multiple Ritz Carlton hotels (check my reviews) and been allowed at breakfast with my trusty Hurley t-shirt, O'Neil swimsuit and reef flip flops. After waiting 30 minutes for 3 bagels and 3 drinks ($32) we headed out to the pool This is a plus, the lazy river area is GREAT FOR KIDS and the pool is large enough to spread out. Didn't even notice there was an Adults only pool until much later in the afternoon. I'd recommend the hotel but the overzealous bistro manager (young Hispanic male, spiky hair, clean cut) needs a talking to.

Reviews.Title: “Newer Hilton”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orlando Hilton in the middle of April for 5 nights attending a convention. The hotel is newer and very large. It is everything you would expect from a Hilton. I stayed on the Executive level with access to the lounge. They had a very nice breakfast as well as evening snacks. I felt it was worth the extra $20 to stay on this level and not rely on room service for breakfast. The pool area is very nice and family friendly. Keep in mind this hotel is next to the large convention center as well as having its own convention space so the hotel will mostly be filled with business types. There are great restaurants in the area but require a cab ride to anywhere you want to go. Overall this is a great property with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNtraveler1998
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Hilton and could not be more pleased. The facility is 9 months NEW and it shows. They have done a great keeping it NEW. The ladies at the spa were friendly and professional. The self park attendants were always helpful and attentive and they even asked if we needed directions. The rooms are clean, fresh, and very comfortable. The bed was cozy and comfortalbe. The bathroom spotless and well furnished with shampoo, conditioner, lotion and plenty of towels and soap. This hotel is great for children of all ages. Basketball court, volleyball, badmitten, lazy river, kids pool, adult pool, hot tub, fire pit was great. They also had a putting green, water slide, bar with cafe. Everything you could need. We hated to leave and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Relaxing Stay - just beware they charge for parking”
Reviews.Author: RockChickX51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton this past weekend for my husbands birthday. I will say it was the most relaxing weekend I've had in a while. We arrived at 11am and there was a room was ready. The room was spotless. Bed was very very comfortable as was the leather side chair. Plenty of soft towels and pillows are provided in the room. The room also has blackout curtains which rocked. We slept in until 10am and didn't even know it. We stayed at the pool for most of our stay and it was nice. They provide beach towels down by the pool and always had clean ones ready. The drink/food service at the pool was quick and consistent. Our drinks were never empty. I was amazed at the cleanliness of the pool. There was always staff walking around straightening up chairs or picking up old towels. The hotel as a whole was very well staffed and cleaned. Elevators in the hotel were quick. At night the pool area has fire pits where you can sit and enjoy a drink. The waterslide was fun. It closes at 9pm and the rest of the pool area stays open until 11pm. During the day there were several people at the pool but it never felt crowded. The pool area is also very active at night because the bar is there and stays open late. This hotel does have a very "conventiony/business" feel to it which I expected. Only thing I did not like was at check out we were charged $12 to self park. A charge I was never told about. I don't think I've ever stayed somewhere where they charge guests to park. You have to show your room key every time you leave or come in the parking garage. On the day you check out you have to show parking garage security your bill proving that you're checked out in order to leave the garage, that was weird to me. I agree with the below poster that security is constantly walking around the place which can be a good or bad thing depending on how you see it. Overall I would stay here again if I could get the same great rate I did this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance In The Humidity”
Reviews.Author: pauditore
Reviews.Content: I really liked almost everything at this hotel, including the entry, seating, bars, pool and the rooms are great. This is a new hotel and the beds are really comfortable, the rooms spacious and TVs huge, although I never got to watch anything. The only thing I found strange was there were no glasses in the bathroom, when I inquired they said that they took them out because people were breaking them, well then put in plastic ones! After brushing your teeth you don't want to lean down and suck water out of a faucet. I also thought that the martini prices were way high at $16 dollars and they ranged from $12-$14-$16 depending on who the bartender was, that was strange. And I felt that there were way too many security people dressed in white everywhere, made me think that there was a lot of crime, it did not make me feel like I was safe as management thought after I asked them about it. I have never seen so many security people in any hotel in my travels over the last twenty years. In fact, I even stayed at the St Regis when the Ayatollah of Iran stayed there and did not see so much security. What I really liked was the seating and smoking areas in front of the hotel they were a really nice Oasis for us smokers, that was much appreciated. The majority of the staff especially bar staff were all good looking and obviously hand picked for the glamor effect. I did eat a burger the first night and appreciated that the bar served food until midnight that was nice. And I really loved the free pool at Davids and took advantage of it between meetings later in the afternoon that was fun. Overall a great hotel that needs to fix a few quirks.

Reviews.Title: “A new property with a few things to learn ~ I would recommend, however.”
Reviews.Author: yakadi
Reviews.Content: I have mixed reviews about this hotel so I will try to not put my PERSONAL opinion in this review (too much) and give you the facts.. The Goods.... *New hotel. Spotlessly clean. Super quiet in the hallways. Never heard another word from the rooms next to ours. The lobby, however, is a bit loud and noisy alllllll the time due to this hotel being attached to the Orange County Convention Center and catering, for the most part, to conventions. The week we were there - May 10th to the 14th, 2010 - was the same week the Department of Defense convention and two others were going-on which was apparently a "big" deal to the employeees *The hotel has a jogging/walking track out front. If you look at one of the pictures I posted, you can see part of it. It was being used quite regularly. *The gym was being utilized by several people every time I walked by and the view from the gym is probably fairly decent for the runners ~ because they can see all the people walking by in swimsuits going to the pool! HA *The hotel basically has a waterpark attached which is completely free and there is ALWAYS room for you to find a covered lounge chair or a seat around the bar. The "waterpark" area (as I refer to it) is THREE huge pools (one is adults only), a waterslide and a lazy river that is quite amazing. There is a pool bar/restaurant in the middle of all this and many people ate dinner or had hot wings and beer, etc out by the pool a lot. Very popular area but never felt crowded. The staff at the pool are fantastic. One hotel employee spent 30 minutes or so talking to my husband one evening while he was watching people in the lazy river and just helping with the rafts and such. They are "supposed" to close at 10pm but people were still enjoying the pool areas so they were still open at 11pm the night we left. Very nice. Also, the lady that was sitting at the top of the water slide was SUPER nice ~ I was concerned about going down because I was an adult and she said "O! You go! You go down once, you come back 10 times!" I laughed and went down and then practically ran up the stairs to go again. She laughed at me! She was correct!! Also, there are PLENTY of free, BIG towels for EVERYONE to use and they don't check them out to you, they aren't chintzy about it, they simply ask you if you want one or two or you can take them yourself. I have to say ~ the staff in the water area have the right attitude. It was fantastic out there whether it was 2pm or 10pm. Great job! *This hotel's location is fantastic. It is literally a 3 to 5 minute walk to I-drive and another minute to the I Ride Trolley stop. You can buy I Ride Trolley passes at the concierge desk - a week pass for unlimited rides, transfers, etc is only $8 per person. The I Ride Trolley will take you up and down I-drive anywhere you want to go and there is a map and list of places they go at every stop. The trolley is clean, quick, and super-safe. We walked to the trolley every day and went up and down I-drive to the IMAX cinema, to lots of different restaurants, to the grocery store, to the mall, etc. If you don't want to take the trolley, you can walk to IHOP, Denny's, Red Lobster, McDonald's, the gas station, and a small supermarket ~ all withiin 10 minutes away or less. SUPER easy to navigate. Once families with children learn about this hotel's location and the free waterpark, there will be more tourists here. For now, it is mainly all convention attendees. The Not~so~Goods... *The rooms are not as big as some other new Hiltons out there. We stayed at a new Hilton in Branson earlier this year (and we'll be staying there again in September) and their rooms and bathrooms, especially, are much bigger. *Room service is insanely expensive, even for a hotel. $4.50 surcharge on every order plus a 22% gratuity mandatory. I ordered a cobbler and wanted some ice cream ~sorry, you can buy a pint for $9 or none at all. Lame. *The Internet service in the rooms are not setup for wireless. There is a cable in your room for you to plug-in to your laptop and use. Then, it works great. Without this cable, you can forget it. I realize this is a semi no-big-deal BUT I like to sit on the bed and surf while my husband is sleeping. This was inconvenient because the cable is short and the plug is located on the desk. So, you have to set at the desk to use Internet. Even though the Internet specialist was nice when I called her, she actually said to me "Who uses wireless these days anyway??" Ummmm.... me. Our entire house is wireless. We have NOTHING wired. I didn't know people didn't use wireless. Kinda strange, I thought. The UGLY... DISCLAMIER ~ The three things below irked me, big time. It made me think I would probably not stay in this hotel again. It almost makes me wonder if we are going to keep our Hilton Honors account. Having said that... we are NEW Hilton Honors members so I'm sure we weren't treated nearly as well as Diamond members would be. However, because we travel a lot, we stayed in a Hilton in Branson we liked and we'll probably stay in a couple (maybe 3) more times this year and we thought we'd try to book Hiltons anywhere we go now. If I book another Hilton that acts like this Hilton, we won't bother. So... Ugly #1 - We booked this hotel February 16, 2010 as part of a flight package with Allegiant Air. I called the Hilton prior to pre-paying and asked about a smoking room because my husband smokes and it is MANDATORY that we get a smoking room. No problem, they said. I booked with Allegiant Air as a flight/hotel package. I called three days later and verified with Hilton that we would indeed get a SMOKING room. I also made sure I updated our Hilton Honors account with our top three preferences ~ Smoking, King Bed, and High Floor. All I really cared about was the smoking and I actually put that in the comments at the time we reserved the room. One week before we were to leave for our vacation (Sunday, May 2, 2010), I called the hotel directly to verify we were definitely being put in a SMOKING room. Yes, we were. We fly-in and go to check-in and he goes to verify our room and says "two doubles blah blah blah" and I say "I don't mind how many beds we have as long as the room is smoking." He tells me we were not reserved for a smoking room and "only 1% of our rooms are smoking." I told him I had called and verified this already. He couldn't help me because "we have a big Department of Defense convention here this week." Well, that's fine but we have a smoking room reserved. No. I ask for the manager or we are leaving. (We would have left, btw, no doubt about it) The manager says they have no smoking rooms. I tell him how I had called ahead. He says he cannot help me. So, I tell him I will have to find a room elsewhere. We stepped aside and I got my phone out and I was prepared to call the Hilton Honors main number first and if that didn't help, call Allegiant and move our room to another hotel as Hilton was by far NOT the cheapest package we could have gotten. As I am starting to dial (literally) he comes over and says they have a room that we MAY get but he'll have to go check and see if it smells like smoke or not. He says it is a room next to a smoking room and if it smells like smoke, we get it. If it doesn't, we don't. Guess what?? It smelled like smoke. So, he comes down and tells us we can have the room but then he basically admonishes us with a "shame on you" type of attitude and tells us had the room not smelled like smoke, we would have been out of luck. I will NOT write my opinion of this BS. You get ONE chance to make a FIRST impression and this just about RUINED it for me. I am livid just thinking about that situation. Ugly #2 - If you are a tourist or you want any information about SeaWorld, Universal Studios, Airboat tours, Disney, the I Ride Trolley, etc.... forget about asking the concierge desk. Seriously. They sell tickets to everything. We actually got two tickets to Universal and two I Ride Trolley weekly passes through them ~ very convenient. But the information??? Useless. One blonde girl actually told us "I live here. I've never been on the trolley." They couldn't even tell us where the trolley stop was ~ and we quickly learned (on our own) that is literally a 3 to 5 minute walk around the side of the hotel!!! We asked about the parks?? Nope. Hadn't been there. Didn't know. What was the best way to get to Universal Studios?? They didn't know. Does the trolley go to Universal?? Again, no clue. This same blonde girl says, as the guy next to her is shaking his head like he has NO CLUE, "Even though I live here, I've never been to these places." Then WHY are you working at a concierge desk??????????????????? Seriously. The ONLY person that had a clue abou ANYTHING was one girl, one morning, with brown hair, and she had a tag on her shirt that said "Lead Concierge" and I'm thinking she was the lead because she had actually been to one of the parks. The ONLY thing the other less-than-informed concierge employees could do was point to a fancy book of places to eat and tell us they could call and make reservations for us. Seriously. I suppose these people are trained for conventions. Tourists, beware. Ugly #3 - The I Ride Trolley stops at 10:30pm every night. Husband and I got stuck at a restaurant too late one night. I-drive EMPTIES about 11:00 pm and getting a taxi is IMPOSSIBLE. I used my Iphone and called two taxi places with NO answer. I finally called the Hilton and asked if they could call us a cab. She got directions to where we were at and my phone number and said she would call right away for us. Twenty-one minutes later, with husband and I waiting outside by the curb and getting quite concerned at this late hour, Yellow Cab calls me wanting to know our exact location. I made a comment about how much longer and you know what he told me???? He said the hotel had JUST called them. JUST called them. Seriously. I looked at my Iphone to verify what time it was when this happened. We had to wait for Yellow Cab to come get us. It was an exhausting evening and I was NOT happy with Hilton for handling the cab situation this way. It was ridiculous. Again, this hotel is ill-equipped to handle a lot of things at this point. Overall, if we ever stay at another Hilton that makes this kind of mistakes, we won't stay with Hilton again. The lazy river and the fantastic staff at the pool saved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DUTCHANDFREE54
Reviews.Content: this 1400 room relatively new hotel has a great number of services to offer.Rooms are small and appear cramped due to too much furniture, bathrooms are excellent. Key system is a sad joke, we had to get new keys five times during our stay....and since the self park garage gate is activated by the room key, this was a constant hassle, something I was informed they have had since opening eight months ago!! If this is the level of service, I rather go to the JW Marriott where service and mechanics are definitely superior.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: JBug83
Reviews.Content: Had one of the best hotel experience of my career! Kudos to the excellent management team for working right along with their employees. I loved that the staff had the "power" to do what was necessary real time to keep their customers happy. Fantastic pool, great food, excellent conference space, fabulous spa experience. No need to leave the hotel! For me, the Ritz has been surpassed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: johannah15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Orlando for Mother's Day weekend during our daughter's volleyball tournament at the Orange County Convention Center. There were several other volleyball families that stayed as well. I have to say from the moment of check-in the service was top notch. Staff is very friendly and helpful and most went above expectations. The hotel is so beautiful and clean. Rooms are a nice size. Beds are extremely comfortable. There backyard is like non-other in the area. Lazy river, large pools, 9 hole putting green, grass volleyball court, full basketball court, fire pits, great bar...and more. Very enjoyable for both adults and kids! We can't wait to go back with friends and family and set up a fun weekend of putting tournaments and olympic style games! Thanks for making our daughter's last volleyball weekend enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: OTAWAY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton in order to attend a convention in Orlando. My colleague and I chose the hotel based on our belief that the convention was going to be held in the East Building of the Convention Center across the street from the hotel, but our conference was held in the West Concourse creating a commute on a free shuttle bus to and from the convention center with set times for pick up and drop off. If distance is a concern, there are alternative hotels that are closer to the West Building, less expensive and within walking distance of some nice restaurants. Find out exactly which building your convention booked before you reserve your hotel rooms. We chose to rent a car to permit a more flexible schedule than the shuttle provided. Be aware that parking at the convention center is $11.00 per day. The hotel is brand new and sparkling clean. It offers the typically luxurious Hilton beds and amenities, but is not distinctive in appearance inside or out. The view from our window was of a giant parking lot and parking deck across the street and some industrial-looking buildings. In the land of Disney, the lack of any type of an interesting view or landscaping was startling. Try to request a pool view if you book your stay through this hotel. Pros: The staff are superb and most seem to genuinely like working at the hotel. There were many people who assisted us at the concierge desk and front desk, but I cannot remember their names. James, our valet parking attendant, was kind, prompt and left a thank you note in our rental car. Rorey, in David's Bar and Grill (on both occasions) was attentive, warm and entertaining. The pool area is beautiful and the lazy river provided some respite after a long day walking the conference center hallways. Lunch at David's and poolside was lovely and the food was fresh and nicely presented. Cons: The gentleman who checked us in truly did not know what he was doing and it took a long time to straighten out the room arrangements. This was the only person I met during the entire stay who was significantly below the service level of all other staff. The Executive Floor in other hotel chains typically offer additional amenities not provided to other guests. Not at this Hilton. You are charged if you want Internet access. The continental breakfast was edible, but not memorable in any way. One morning the hard boiled eggs (the only protein) were so cold that they were frozen inside. Food was not always promptly refilled (containers are small) and the tea selection, despite having a big box, was limited. There was plenty of milk for cereal in a separate area of the room, but the creamer for coffee/tea was frequently empty as well. We did not have a choice of newspapers in the morning. Yes, I know this comment is picky, but at Executive Level prices, I at least expect an option for the Wall Street Journal or the local Orlando paper and not have the only option as U.S.A. Today. Self-parking is $12.00 per day and valet parking is $20.00 per day. We opted for the valet parking and were not sorry, but many hotels in Orlando do not charge for parking at all. Air conditioning worked, but we seemed unable to chill the room sufficiently despite setting the thermostat at 66 degrees. All in all, a very clean, pleasant place to stay, but not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, convenient to I4.”
Reviews.Author: TrpReviwr
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for one night last week following a week-long Disney vacation. I was going to a conference and my workplace paid for one night at the Hilton Orlando so that I could attend the conference following my family vacation. We had a 1-year old and a 5-year old in tow. The hotel was super clean, even by my very high standards. The staff was excellent. The pool area seemed to be absolutely amazing; however, we never made it down there. We had a little min fridge in our room which worked out great. The hotel was convenient to the Orange County Convention Center and to I4. The ride to Disney was pretty quick too. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with amazing pool area”
Reviews.Author: Mamamolu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in April. Very posh and modern lobby, and super clean everywhere as this hotel has just been built. Chillin' in the lazy river was fab! The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is that the food wasn't all that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place for Business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Gabbys79
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at Hilton Orlando recently for a convention. My husband was with me as we were going on vacation afterwards and i was a little worried about what he would do whilst i was doing business. I neednt have worried. A first class gym, awesome pool and excellent restaurants kept him busy. The service was first class, rooms are huge and comfortable. Nothing was forgotten or bad. Every person friendly and happy to help. It is attached to the new side of the convention centre, and a stop behind the trolley.Location is like any other place, you still need to drive everywhere. We are happy to walk alot on vacation but the trolley is great. Taxi's arent too bad either. Breakfast was great, service great and eggs made to order. Clean and huge is what i can say. Would recommend for anyone conducting business, or anyone with kids as the pool is amazing with about 4 different pools - kids pools with slides and currents and an adults side.

Reviews.Title: “nice n elegant”
Reviews.Author: harpreet29
Reviews.Content: Good hospitality, nice n clean room, dinner was good.

Reviews.Title: “This isn't your normal Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: loveDCA
Reviews.Content: Leaving my opinion of Orlando aside---the Hilton Orlando is a gem in the rough. There's not much to walk to (but is there really anything on International Drive that you'd want to walk to?). Hotel was spotless (brand new, literally) and service was fantastic. Beautiful gym, pools, lazy river...and overall, a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TackSoCal
Reviews.Content: Great, clean resort property. Staff was exceptional! VIP lounge was first class, look for Shauna, particularly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “PET FRIENDLY - Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: VacaFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute booking due to our condo canceling on us. It was a Christmas at Disney vacation. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is super friendly and what's even better we were allowed to bring our 75 lb lab with us. The pool area was fantastic, the food was expensive but convienant but there are plenty of restaurants in the area. Absolutely a wonderful vacation. They had nice touches such as a fire at night and the kids made smores. It was a great great hotel and I am very very picking about where I stay and how I am treated with customer service. They are great! We have already recommended this resort to other family members that have just stayed there and they love it just as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: smcoyle
Reviews.Content: We had no idea this would be as nice as it was. Dana was very friendly and helpful with getting us checked in. Michael, in the Security Department, was friendly and knowledgeable with providing directions and times. The whole experience was incredible. We had a great time and hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Carlton could not have done it Better!”
Reviews.Author: triplover555
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at multiple HIlton properties with Diamond status. We were checked in by Dana and upgraded on arrival to Executive floor. Food was amazing in the lounge and the staff could not have ben more helpful. Phalcon was so attentive we felt very special. Floats were free in the lazy River. Pool was gorgeous and clean and warm. Everything about this hotel says they care about you. They pulled guys with suits on from the lobby to help take care of everything at the pool. The room was great. The housekeeper promised extra towels in the morning and actually delivered them the next day. This is a TEN STAR PROPERTY!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: hannahmak2
Reviews.Content: This new Orlando hotel is perfect! If your here on business or pleasure this hotel has something for everyone. We stayed here over our children's spring Break while visiting Seaworld, 1/2 mile away. Upon check in the lady asked us if we would like a Seaworld view. We stayed in room 1569 and every night at 9:50 we could watch the fireworks from our window. The positives of this hotel are Great pools, lazy river, pool bar, fire pit, volleyball & basketball courts & so much more. The downsides of this hotel are $12 parking per day, $10 per day for fitness center (which they do not tell you about) expensive restaurants, and it's connection to the convention center. You do feel isolated while staying in this hotel, but take a stroll 1 block and there you will find a Denny's, Ihop, Mcdonalds & Red Lobster.
