Stroll a little further about a mile or so and your in the hustle and bustle of International drive and all of the restaurants. Do talk to the Concierge's desk to get recommendations for pizza delivery, chinese delivery, grocery stores etc. There are wonderful places outside by the pool to enjoy your own picnic dinner. Use your imagination & your GPS and your options are endless.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible constant beeping!”
Reviews.Author: downtownresident
Reviews.Content: Great beds, nice room and amenities. It's a brand new hotel, so there really shouldn't be anything to gripe about. But, my big complaint is the constant beeping that lasts all day and night. I don't know if it comes from the nearby airport or some sort of construction, but it lasted the entire week I was here and never ceased, not even in the evening. Also the place is completely isolated. You really can't walk anywhere and to drive is to get on confusing interstates. Here on business, it was fine. I would have preferred something less expensive in a downtown area, however. The restaurants at the hotel are terrible, even though their menus sound fantastic. Spencers is average quality for a prices that you would expect from great restaurants. The food at the hotel's other restaurants is downright crap. This is a problem, because there is really nowhere else to go unless you brave some crazy interstate on foot or travel by car or cab. The hotel is also too large. It is like a giant cruise ship moored in a sea of expressways.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for Family (smallish kids/2 cool 4 u teens) Romance or Business”
Reviews.Author: ikosto823
Reviews.Content: This hotel is FANTASTIC! We had two rooms rsv'd and were pretty nervous about our late check in and the dwindling possibility of getting the rooms connecting. Aside from the 27 minute check in time in an otherwise empty lobby it was PERFECT! We got our two rooms thanks to the woman also behind the counter...(king for us dbls for the kids) and boy ! the girls thought we were royalty! The rest of the staff was beyond friendly, accommodating and polite. We planned on going to WDW, but ended up staying the day and just enjoying the pool and the many amenities the hotel has to offer. The AMAZING pool, slide, Lazy River, outdoor dining, cabanas, adults only/no kids nooks and crannies made this hotel one of our favorites and believe me, we stay in MANY. We didn't get to try the steakhouse there, but it smelled deliciously enticing. Maybe next time we stay we can enjoy that fab looking spa and explore the hotel a bit more if we can tear ourselves away from the pool area. The gym is new and WONDERFUL. Perfect for making sure you stay in your routine. There's a FIRE PIT! just think how romantic that would be, you and your loved one, cuddling up on a warm & breezy FLA nite, palm trees rustling, soft island music playing, sipping a cool drink and munching on something delectable from the kitchen? If you have kids they're playing within view... *sigh* For families with smallish ones- the pool is AMAZING! they will not get bored- trust us! a wading area, the slide, waterfall, bright colors, lazy river- jaw dropping to them! for the teens, the pool is still where it's at! Throw in the foosball tables, ping pong tables and little nooks to get away from us "lame" parents (but still be within a safe distance) and you can't beat it. Many connecting rooms based on what's available @ Ck in. COMFY beds and mini fridges in every room. Spacious NEW rooms and bathrooms, flat screen TV's work area's and the gotta have it! MP3 connections. Great location with many restaurant choices near by. EZ highway access and VERY close to the parks. The convention center is right behind the hotel, so even if you MUST be on business: rest assured, if you bring the fam= they won't mind spending the day at the hotel waiting for you! I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. Oh my gosh! WEDDINGS would be fantastic here!! With the level of excellence Hilton Hotels abide by & pride themselves on, I'm sure the " Check In Chuck" was straightened out. No worries there.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel but very business oriented”
Reviews.Author: ashea21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice although when booking I didn't expect it to be so convention/business oriented. Lots of different people and the lobby was always crowded, which didn't bother me but I know might bother some. The bed was VERY comfortable and the bathrooms clean and like-new. It was a bit chilly while we were there so we didn't get to experience the pool as much as I would have liked but the kids sucked it up and went in anyway. Even though it was chilly, the atmosphere was great and we sat in the jacuzzi or by the fire on a couple of nights. We spent the days at the parks and were so exhausted when we got back we typically ate at the hotel. The food was good, nothing spectacular but good. I recommend the ribs and the frozen malt cake, both were excellent!! Oh, and the staff was great, very friendly and VERY on top of things. Tip: We didn't rent a car, travelled by taxi instead. It was about $35-$45 to and from the airport, $15 to Universal and $6 to Seaworld. Make sure you ask for a metered cab! The hotel offered a free shuttle to and from Seaworld, but the shuttle was very unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hkosovich
Reviews.Content: Great restaurants, 24 hour gym, non-stop smiles. quiet floors, great for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay For Business Or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: AnotherFUN1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this new hotel recently, and we loved it! The hotel was recently completed, and it has a very modern, upscale design and feel. The hotel decor was very elegant, and the staff was very helpful. We were in town with a convention for a family member. The front desk staff was plentiful and attentive. The hotel was easily accessible from the highway, and it was only 15 minutes or so from the theme park properties. We ate at several restaurants, and they were fairly close to the hotel. The hotel itself offered a spacious lobby, nice concierge on the 19th floor, comfortable beds, clean rooms and some nice in-house restaurants and shops. Additionally, they had a large heated lazy river, family pool, and adults-only pool, with plenty of seating, a pool side bar, full-size basketball court, volleyball court, hot tub and water slide. The rooms were a little larger than average. The room offered a small refrigerator, nice sized safe (large enough for a large laptop, purses, cameras and other incidentals). The room also had a nice desk and chair, seating, and the +/- 46-inch HD TV was very nice. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and attentive. The hotel offers a parking garage at an additional cost/day. The room price is a little high, but fair considering it's a newly built hotel, great location, nice amenities and superior service. We did have some water/maintenance issues, which the hotel disclosed with an in-room letter in advance (but was not accurate as to when the service would be done and water unavailable.) But this was a short, minor inconvenience. Our only suggestions/request would be to offer free WIFI. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and we look forward to going back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good new hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateTosh
Reviews.Content: New hotel, very confortable rooms, excellent fitness center! They do charge parking, and it is not cheap. But what bothered us the most was: after staying 9 consecutive days we could not stay 1 hour after check out time without paying an extra fee. And check out time was 11am, usually is 12!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with beautiful poolarea!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hilton Orlando before leaving on a cruise. We made reservations for a non-smoking room and when we entered our room it was obvious someone had been heavely smoking in there! Within 5 minutes we were appointed another room, even with an upgrade to apologize! View on the beautiful poolarea which we unfortunately - due to the weather - haven't used. The hotel, the room, everything was very clean. Being European the breakfastbuffet was a nice surprise for us. Not only waffles, but much more! If we fly again on Orlando we would definitly choose to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing People and Service”
Reviews.Author: JoeDaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, upscale, has amazing people and great customer service. You are treated like a King from the moment you walk in the door. This is the best hotel I've stayed at in a long, long time, and I would be happy to stay there again! The beds and rooms are so comfortable. Joseph B. Daly, Exec. VP of Operations & Strategy, Comdata Corporation, Brentwood, TN

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with fabulous pool area”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails2U
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new, clean and pleasant with modern decor. Beds were very comfortable. We were here to go to Disney and do some shopping. Disney was about 20 minutes away, and was an easy drive. Shopping was also conveniently nearby, but traffic around International Drive was crazy. Service was wonderful. There was free parking behind the hotel, and you can print off your boarding passes quickly and easily in the business center. We had access to the executive lounge, which had a wonderful continental breakfast with fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt parfaits, pastries, croissants, juice, coffee, etc. In the evening, they had a delicious selection of appetizers (chicken in puff pastry, hummus, goat cheese/phyllo triangles, pot stickers, fruit/cheese tray, etc.). We also LOVED the pool and activity area. They have a huge basketball area, volleyball area, an amazing heated pool, waterslide and a heated lazy river as well. We were pretty stressed running around Disney, but one trip to the lazy river, with the tropical "muzak" and umbrella drinks, and we remembered we were on vacation again. We will definitely be back, and will spend more time at the pool next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but don't follow the directions on the hotel's website!”
Reviews.Author: EricEmmysMom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Orlando with my husband and ten year old twins and it was a wonderful experience. I've vacationed at many hotels in Orlando throughout the years and this hotel is comparable to The Ritz Carlton. The pool was perfect, it was heated and quite large with a fun waterslide. The heated pool was very important as the fahrenheit in Orlando that week didn't go above 65. The fitness center provided all the equipment you would need for a week and the spa was great and opened until 8pm which is a perk. The biggest complaint I had was the valet parking attendant tried to lead you to believe the self park garage was enormously inconvenient and far, which it was not. So don't fall for that line and save yourself the money by parking it yourself. The other issue was we couldn't get to the hotel using the Hilton website's directions! I even called the hotel when we found ourselves going around in circles and they confused me even more. We wound up giving up and grabbing dinner and what do we see as we look out the restaurant's window - The Hilton! We had to laugh. Google the directions instead! Don't say I didn't warn you!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth the price--print your reservation to get the room you want.”
Reviews.Author: RickNStl
Reviews.Content: Check in was a greeting and a smile which just covered up inefficiency or deception in assigning of rooms. For $250 a night, you expect a decent room as you reserved but I was shuttled off to a double room on the lowest floor overlooking the parking deck. When I asked for a King room as reserved, I was told by the ever smiling check-in clerk that my group had booked everyone in double rooms (and obviously not rooms with a view). Upon further protest, I was told that they had overbooked King rooms, and didn't have any to give out. Fortunately I had printed the reservation before leaving the office and it showed in black and white that my reservation was indeed a King room. So here I am, back on the lowest floor with a great view of the top of the canopy over the hotel entry. Nice. There are too many hotels in Orlando to stay here again. So long to those Hilton points.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Expereince at the Hilton Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: JustaGuyWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I statyed at the Hilton for a weekend marriage conference and very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff are extremely courteous, helpful, and professional. I truely have never seen a more preofessional staff at a hotel. I was impressed! The Hotel itself is beautiful! The lobby is spacious and gorgeous. The room was nicely decorated with lovely view. We got some of the best hotel sleep ever on the luxurious king-sized bed; the bed was very plush. The flatscreen tv was huge. The bathroom has plenty of space and looks new. Adn, most inportantly to a light-sleeper like me: the blinds on the windows completely block the light when closed and the room was very quiet! The conference rooms were outstanding as well. We were in more than one conference room over the weekend, and every one was spotless. The tables and chairs were very confortable. And the staff was impeccable! They were totally professional, and went out of their way to accomodate us. The catered food was excellent as well. I can get by on a pastry and a cup of joe, but the breakfast they served from the Hilton kitchen still makes my mouth water... They had the best scrambled eggs I've ever had at a hotel, the bacon was crispy, and the coffee was quite good! I recommend splurging on the valet, it's 20 bucks a day and can be charged to your room. The valet's are quick, professional, and freindly, and one even stopped in the middle of his duties to take a picture of my wife and I in front of their fountain. There are plenty of great restarurants, fast food joints, and other venues a minute or two up the road. And the Hotel is only 15 mintues from some great outlet shopping. The Hilton Orlando team made my weekend a pleasantly memorable one. When we come back to Orlando, my family will certainly be staying at th Hilton Orlando again! You might wonder if this review is made up by the hotel... Nope! I'm a regular guy and we really did have that great of an expereince here!

Reviews.Title: “A completely satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: vferrand1
Reviews.Content: I asked for the information to comment on the weekend I just spent at your Hotel. From the moment we arrived for a conference, your staff was more than personable, every request we had they were more than willing to do. Service was exceptional. The workout room was such a great experience, clean and new equipment, towels and water always filled. My stay was , arriving Friday, Feb. 5th at 9:00am for a 10:00 conference where we were greeted with such a welcoming friendliness, and till we left at 1:00 pm today, we were treated so well. I thank you for a relaxing weekend, and you have a standard that has been lost for so many years , and it is wonderful to see an organization with such professionalism with the perfect personal touch. I am looking forward to another opportunity to stay at your Hotel. Sincerely, Victoria Ferrand

Reviews.Title: “OK for conventions, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: strengthcoach
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Hilton Orlando, January 2010. I was there for business, but brought my wife and 2 small kids (8&3) with me. This is a big hotel off of International Drive, and it has its own convention facilities and is adjacent to the big convention center. The area is under a lot of construction; in fact the hotel is only several months old. It was clean, and very busy. The lobby/public areas were like a bee hive, with one convention after another coming and going. If you’re only going to Orlando to visit Disney/Universal, etc., this isn’t the place to stay at. In fact, you’ll need a rental car (but where don’t you in Orlando), and you’ll pay $12/ day to park, despite the fact that there is no shortage of parking. The restaurants in the hotel were average at best, and you’ll pay for the privilege of not getting in your car to go and eat. International drive, less than 1 mile away, might be the largest conglomerate of restaurants that I’ve ever seen. If you want a chain restaurant, it’s there. There must have been 150 restaurants in a 5 mile strip! As usual, my biggest complaint at this hotel was the lack of free wi-fi ANYWHERE in the hotel. This really annoyed me – a new hotel without free wi-fi. They charge $16/day + tax for it…. The pool complex looked great, but it was 35 degrees out when we visited! While the hotel was clean, and efficiently run, I would not stay there again, unless I had to for another business convention.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: crtsmom
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I've stayed in many types of hotels during my business and leisure travels, and I must say that the Hilton Orlando is one of the top of my list of favorites! After reading all the reviews today (I arrived home from Orlando today), I must say that I agree with most of the negatives mentioned in them. I checked in very early in the day (approx 1:00pm) and found a very long line with very few workers to assist with checkin. It easily took 30 minutes to check in. Please add more staff (especially on the day of check-in the day before the convention starts next door). I agree with the Hilton $15 a day internet access is a turn-off. Luckily I had borrowed a Verizon card to take with me so I didn't have to pay. Like mentioned in other reviews, smaller, cheaper hotels (even Hilton brands) offer free wi-fi at their locations. For a hotel aimed at business travelers (being directly connected to the convention center), you would think that they would offer that. The hotel uses transportation service for cab service, unless you specify you want a metered cab. I even shared a cab ride to the airport and it cost us $60, instead of the $23 or so charged to my co-passenger on the way TO the hotel. Be leary of that - you ride in style, but you pay for it. And know your rate up front. OK, enough of the negatives........... I must say, they have a vast exercise facility, a wonderful open lobby, and a great outdoor pool. The rooms are big, and the BED IS ONE OF THE BEST I'VE EVER SLEPT IN - I NEVER WANTED TO GET UP!!!!! But here's the highlight of my trip - after trying so hard to get all things packed up the night before, I forgot some of the extra stuff that I had carried to Orlando in my purse (stuff like office keys, checkbook, prescriptions) and took out to keep from hauling them around. I realized today when I landed back in Alabama that I had totally left those items in the top drawer of the dresser. I immediately called and talked to Security, and by 6:00pm tonight I had received an email from Security telling me that housekeeping had located the items, turned them into Security, and they are sending them to me tomorrow morning. IN A WORLD THAT WE LIVE FILLED WITH STRIFE AND TURMOIL, AND A BAD ECONOMY, ETC, THERE ARE STILL HONEST PEOPLE!!!! Thank you Hilton Orlando for providing a wonderful place away from home that I could work, and still feel like I was at home in my bed each night. VERY PLEASANT STAFF AND ALWAYS WILLING TO HELP!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, mediocre room service”
Reviews.Author: Marnix010
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed about this hotel. Besides all the things that you may expect in a hotel like this, I was particularly unhappy about a number of housekeeping things in my room: - The coverbed quilt was upside down, so with the open end of the quilt pointed towards the pillow side., so you look into the quilt filling. Doesn't feel hygienic. - No new coffee pads after 1st day, coffee maker left with used pads. - An rusty green copper 1-cent coin was stuck between drinking glass and it's paper cover. Disgusting. - Long hairs on bathroom floor when we arrived. Next day they were still there. - Body lotion was half empty. It had a perfume smell and shade of makeup on the outside, clearly from a previous guest. - There was a long hair hanging on the lamp above the sink. Very visible. It stayed there for 2 days. All these things really seem minor details. However, it was (1) the hilton with hilton prices and (2) all these things together in one room really makes more than a minor detail, despite all the brand new furniture, tv etc.etc. Besides all this, I think that parking should be free (it was not). The same is true for internet access (free in most hotels in the lower price range). You can get good (Starbucks) coffee in the so-called marketplace, but we were surpised that a dopio espresso costs $3.50, while it costs $1.95 in most other places, including Starbucks at the high-end Millennia Mall in Orlando. Even the airport is cheaper with $2.30. I won't return to the Orlando Hilton, even though enjoyed dinner at Spencer's steakhouse very much (but you do not need to stay in the hotel to visit it ;))

Reviews.Title: “The best pool in Orlando and a very very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SolPR
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Dec 28 till Jan 1 at the Hilton Orlando and just want to tell other travelers that this is by far one of the best hotels we have visited. Their river pool and facilities are the best... No, is their flat TV and the bed... No, is their breakfast buffet... No, is their spa and gym... No, is the staff... Hard to decide... Everything was better than expected for the price and the location! Will try to go back in summer to enjoy the pool! Tell the previous reviewer that for $1.25 in the I-Ride trolley, he/she could go by the entire I-Drive Avenue and all the restaurants and malls. The only negative feedback - as mentioned in previous reviews... be careful with the person who assigns the cabs at the hotel (I believe he does not work for the hotel, but he tried to trick us into paying $25 for a 5 minute ride to Marriott's Cypress Harbour). The situation with this person was the only negative experience. But apart from that, we had a fabulous time at the best of all... Hilton Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say a bad word”
Reviews.Author: JDK5
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and 3 small kids stayed. No complaints at all. I don't know how someone can say a bad word about this place. Super clean, super new, laid out very well. Pool area was super nice, and location location location!

Reviews.Title: “More like 5 stars, Stunning, perfect getaway for couples and families, ultimate luxury, awesome pool, terrific spa”
Reviews.Author: anya98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my boyfriend, it was a last minute trip to Florida , we were looking for sunshine and some rest and relaxation. This hotel made all this possible, my workaholic partner's first vacation in 9 years was perhaps his favorite and it was mine as well. I am a seasoned traveler and was very pleasantly surprised by the staff, the hotel rooms and of course its amazing amenities. This is the perfect hotel for people who like to sit by the pool or relax in the spa facilities. The beds are comfortable and the room is quite spacious. The whole hotel is immaculate and housekeeping are very caring and helpful. The front desk staff are super helpful, we arrived at 2 Am and were ushered in and welcomed warmly. I stayed from Christmas to New Years and it was magical. We opted for the valet parking which was worth every penny because we returned to the hotel quite late and tired and left early. TRY to avoid the 11 am checkout rush, however, the valet staff super speedy and attentive. The Spa is amazing, I used the gym facilities which over looked the sparkling pool and the steam room and spa was truly a 7 star experience. The pools are amazing, I loved the lazy river and the beach entry pools were warm even on chilly days. I would go back to this hotel just to sit by the pool and enjoy the sun. The hotel although not so close to theme parks is about 15 minutes from Magic Kingdom and 11 minutes to Universal is ideal. Its tucked away and not on a main street which I really adore.We did all the theme parks and was not overwhelmed with the driving to and from. Its grandeur and luxury is astounding. I am trying to convince my boyfriend to come back sooner than later. Definitely worth the extra fifteen minutes of driving to the theme parks. The whole hotel is run like a luxury fancy resort. There are also plenty of fast food joints around the corner and even a 24 hour diner which is useful. I was highly impressed by service and staff, cannot wait to come back. Try the Bahamas breeze restaurant a fun night out , drinks or a relaxing lunch on their patio, very close to hotel. Truly a remarkable experience. Email me with any questions :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel 1 of best in orlando..”
Reviews.Author: waders
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hilton orlando for 1 week over new year as soon as i arrived we was impressed very clean hotel lobby was beautiful and so were the rooms staff were fantasitic, we got at a great price but to be honest would of payed double the rooms are great size, is about 10 mins walk from point a small shopping area which has a few bars and shops and cinema worth taking a look, the only thing i found was wifi and car park was a little expensive as most hotle in us are free or half the price but still great hotel would go back tomorow, has a great pool area for kids and adults great food and a great spa and close to the motorway no:4 so easy if ya driving from airport you come off road and you see it allso close to sea world. their wasnt much info about bus etc to theme parks which a lot of hotels offer so dont no if they offer that which most hotels do, wot more can i say get it booked you wont be dissaponited after this we travelled to vegas and stayed in the bellagiso and the stanard of hotel was very close...

Reviews.Title: “awesome place, best exterior i have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: didotheslayer
Reviews.Content: i got this hotel through priceline for 60 a night, and it was the best deal ever. the hotel is new, huge, clean, with an amazing front desk service. and outside was just like paradise. pros; close to sea world, two heated pools and spas, great burger and salad at the tropic bar next to the pool, super comfy bed cons; internet not included, neither is the parking

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: KellyTravel
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to families!! We loved the heated pools, lazy river, executive lounge, and the hot tubs!! My 2 boys played basketball every night after the parks, and my husband and I loved the bocce ball court and the 9 hole putting green. Christina the guest services manager was so helpful, and we enjoyed seeing her in the executive lounge for breakfast and snacks at night. This is one of the best stays at Hilton we've ever had, and one of the best in Orlando by far!!! The beds are really comfortable, and the LG TV was a nice touch. They also served Smores and hot cocoa ever night too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good HOTEL - End of Holiday Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel85London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando for two nights in January 2010, as I was flying out of Orlando, at the end of a 14 night holiday. For a hotel of this size (1400 bedrooms) you would expect a buzz about the place, and you won’t be disappointed, the hotel has a real mix of customers from the business people attending a convention to the families on holiday with the kids. The rooms are of a good quality we stayed in an executive room on the 19th floor, this grants you access into there executive lounge, I can’t say I was too impressed with the facilities of this lounge and think more of an effort could be applied to the design and offerings of this facility. The real key to this Hotel is the resort facilities, the kids will be impressed with the Family Water park on site, this is coupled with the spa facilities. The Pool is heated and open to 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “a big corporate hotel on the outskirts - don't plan to walk anywhere”
Reviews.Author: LondonYoyo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando is almost exactly as other reviewers state - comfortable, great pool and grounds, good breakfast, friendly staff. If you're hitting the parks it's also a handy locale between. To add some measured criticism there are some big downsides too. Don't plan to walk anywhere for a night out. Yes it's just off International Drive but the south end where you won't find a bar within a mile or so. There are a couple of average drive by restaurants close enough - Red Lobster / Denny's - and an Esso On the Run petrol station. If you like to be in the heart of the action don't stay here. For such a big hotel with mile upon mile - almost - of dedicated parking, to charge 12 dollars a day is a ripoff. Add to that 15 dollars for wifi access per day. stay in any motel for a fraction of the price and it all comes for free. Why, Hilton? Don't forget this is a convention business hotel so expect huge amounts of people checking in and checking out - it takes ages. All in all it does what it does fairly well but if you seek more entertainment close by and some fairer charging policies, try elsewhere. Not wishing to detract by a personal experience, however, our room was also not serviced at 5pm when we got back from a long day. Not even a whisper of a free drink at the bar while we waited. Corporate and unflinching with a dash of well worn quality is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “New convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: TandTSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Good location (generally speaking, Orlando is a nightmare, because all is so spread out that you need your car for any little excursion, even for a grocery store you need your car...), but the Hilton is at least close to the main highway so you are not always in traffic jams. Hilton Orlando is new, so everything works, the rooms are nice and have all you need. The decor is OK, the beds are really good. It is good to stay in a new hotel so everything is in a good status (I wonder how the hotel looks in 5 years...). The staff is friendly - compared to other hotels of the same category and the same rate. Negative: - Car park card does not work properly, so you need to ask front desk again and again to reload your card - Why don't they include the price of the self car parking in the room rate? Nobody comes to Orlando without a car, so everybody has to pay extra for the car park. I personally hate this, I prefer to pay more for the room and not every little detail extra...but obviously many people prefer to pay separately, otherwise they would have changed that Overall a good four star hotel, from my point of view one of the better options in Orlando. Do not expect luxury or perfect service, but I must say usually the hotels in this level are always like that so I did not expect any luxury and was satisfied with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: chougrayson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best I've ever stayed in. Fantastic pools and nightime bonfire with smores. I have never been anywhere where the staff seems genuinely pleased you are there. So respectful and helpful. The gym - OMG!! Fantastic. It is as good as the pictures appear. The beds were so comfortable. I #1 recommend this place. We got the deal - 129.99 a night, but they added in a $50.00 a night refund for food,etc. Buffet is AWESOME!! Go there, you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Particular58
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky about cleanliness but I have to say that this hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed in. (My favorites are still the Marriott Vacation Club in Palm Shores and the Resort at Singer Island ) My husband and I wanted a place close by to go to for two days of relaxation after the holiday rush and we were not disappointed. We got an excellent rate through Sam's Club which included free breakfast buffet and an amenities credit of $50.00. We sked for a high floor and was able to view the fireworks on Jan. 1st.The Breakfast Buffett had healthy choices including omeltes made to order. The workout room is huge ! Everything is so clean and beautiful. It was too cold to go swimming, however, there were die hards in the pool. I didn't know it was heated but I still wouldn't have gone in ...the temperature outside didn't go over 55 degrees .There is a mini fridge but no microwaves in the room which is a drawback. I will definitely be going back !

Reviews.Title: “lots of potential, but problems exist”
Reviews.Author: cpapa84
Reviews.Content: In some respects, this hotel was fantastic. The grounds were unbelievable for a Hilton, especially one that is geared towards business travelers (connected to a Convention Center). It went over and above my expectations. The rooms were very nice (albeit small), but the outdoor areas were phenomenal. Fire pits with hot chocolate and smores, an amazing lazy river, an adult pool, kid pool with slide, jogging track, etc etc. They also had a very wide variety of restaurants. It was the kind of place where you could go there for a week and have no reason to leave. One note, I think it would be worthwhile to pay the extra $50 or whatever it costs to stay on the executive floor. You get free breakfast, free plentiful appetizers at dinnertime (for kids this could easily be their dinner), free internet which would otherwise cost $15/computer/day - meaning that if you and your spouse both have computers, it's going to be $30/day otherwise - Plus of course you have a place to hang out. It really was worth it. Ok, for the bad part. You can very, very clearly tell that this hotel is new. It was tremendously understaffed. Some staff were great (some that come to mind were Victor from the pool- he was incredible - Jason from the pool, Joanna at check in) but most of them seemed pretty incapable of getting anything done. Any time you walked by the front desk there was a line that was at least an hour long. Ordinarily this would not be a huge deal except that THINGS KEPT GOING WRONG. One morning we woke up to a marching band practicing directly outside our bedroom window in the convention center parking lot. You can't even make this stuff up. It sounded like we had just walked into a movie it was so loud. We then had to wait in that ridiculous line, at 8 am, on our vacation, to complain. They wouldn't move our rooms despite this UNBELIEVABLE noise. The marching band was still going on at 8pm that night when some of us wanted to go to sleep (keep in mind we had two rooms) so we had to go back to the front desk (another insane wait) to figure out what our options were (at this point at least they gave us the night free, but let me tell you, between the unbelievable noise and the hours we spent in line, it wasn't worth it). It ruined our whole day. Another day we came back from the pool to find out that we were locked out of our room and had no card access. We found this out at 6pm, when we were in a huge huge rush and had to just run into the room quickly to change before we had to be somewhere, easily 40 minutes away, by 7. Long story short, we were not given access to our room until 6:30 and at that point were not even given a new key. We thought maybe we did something wrong except that in the midst of the whole debacle (they kept promising us 5 more minutes, 5 more minutes, etc) the people staying across the hall got out of the elevator and they had the exact same thing happen to them! When we got back that night, we had to wait in another ridiculous, hour long line to get the key made, only to find out that they wouldn't give me the key because my name was not under the reservation (it was my mother's name- we have the same last name). Some other complaints: -Check in took just as long with the hour wait, the valet guys didn't tell us that the hotel cabs charge double the metered cabs on the street. -If you want a fairly priced cab, you have to specifically ask for a metered cab. We were charged $25 for a hotel cab to get to Universal and $12 to get back when we just grabbed a metered cab- what a ripoff to get there. -Room service screwed up my order twice in a row -Housekeeping was terrible. On the first morning I had spilled something in bed and needed the sheets changed. I called at 8 am and they said they'd be right there. I had to keep calling and eventually they came at 12. Another day we asked them to come back and they never did. Another day they came and left our door open.. anyone could have come and taken our things. So- all in all - while the property was GREAT, they have a lot of learning to do. I'm not sure that I would stay here again unless they really took care of all of these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Large Suites for HHonors Members”
Reviews.Author: jlgd1971
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay -- close to Disney and other attractions. Large rooms and good service. Easy transport to all of the area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PleasureCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I highly recmmend this hotel. It has lazy river, good size swimming pool, slides, hot tub, pool side restaurant, friendly and helpful staff, clean and relaxing environment......everything you need for vacation. It's a bonus as we stay in the hotel instead of going to other water parks.

Reviews.Title: “HHonors Diamond Review - Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: FLAGIRLMelbourne
Reviews.Content: It is really hard to get an exceptional room and wonderful pool together in a location you really want. The rooms themselves aren't anything special - rather small for a family of 4 and we ended up getting a second room. Where exceptional comes in is the Executive Lounge - The staff would was very accommodating - if you didn't see it, ask and they usually got it. They even had homemade gingerbread cookies! Hilton put out a very nice evening reception that could replace an evening meal. One night they had pizza and huge homemade meatballs. Breakfast was ok but as I told them, they need to do something about the vinegar taste in the egg yokes. I was told that they make these way ahead of time and then are stored which apparently makes them rubbery too. The mini danish and fresh fruit and berries were awesome. I save the best for last - the pool and activities. The pool is HEATED and felt wonderful. My kids loved the waterslide and the Lazy Lagoon was so much fun. In the afternoon, there was finger painting and other activities offered each hour at Cabana 1. In the evening, 7 to 8:30, Hilton provided everything needed to make Smores by the fire pit and hot cocoa to warm the tummy. This was a first for my kids and they couldn't get enough. Now that we know what to expect, we plan to stay here for our weekend staycations. The largest IMAX (Regal Cinemas) in Central Florida is at the Pointe a few blocks away and so worth it for movie buffs. I didn't try the spa but that's next on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Time....”
Reviews.Author: qbie27
Reviews.Content: From the time we came in to the time we left the *Staff* was very accommodating. The hotel has everything you need. The pool area is beautiful and a lot of fun for *Families* In the evening there is an open fire pit where you could enjoy listening to live music and roasting marshmallow. Starbucks Coffee is served :) Very Clean!! We absolutely *Loved* staying there and will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on international drive”
Reviews.Author: melanieWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec when the villa we were staying at in Davenport was burgled. The hotel is new and is close to everything on international drive. The rooms are very large and modern with 2 queen beds ,large plasma tv and a fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom has a bath and shower granite worktops. There are two pools ,large hot tub and a lazy river.I have stayed in loads of hotels on international drive but this is the best by far!!

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly luxury with hospitality galore”
Reviews.Author: BanditHiggins
Reviews.Content: We had our doubts about how well we would get along at the Hilton for 10 days while seeing the sights in Orlando but our fears were promptly put to rest. The staff was wonderful to us and our springer spaniel often going overboard to welcome us to any part of the hotel. The room service was spotless and prompt. Our every need was responded to quickly and efficiently. There were no airs of superiority just friendly helpful service and advice on where to go to enjoy ourselves. Our dog Bandit was the subject of many pets and hugs. There were absolutely no problems.

Reviews.Title: “A brand new hotel that runs like a seasoned veteran”
Reviews.Author: Slade M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando for an entire week on business. Absolutely the best service I have ever received from a large chain hotel. Everyone I walked by said hello or offered their assistance in some way. My room was very well appointed, and the food, both in David's and from banquets was very good. I would definitely stay here on a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “This New Hilton Orlando is the best !”
Reviews.Author: hiltonpointcollector
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I planned a 4 day trip to Orlando to celebrate our 30th anniversary. Since we stay almost exclusively at Hilton properties (in my opinion their HHonors plan has long been the best) I did a search of their properties in the Orlando area and found this beautiful freshly new hotel. It's next door to the Orange county convention center and this place has EVERYTHING DONE RIGHT and in a PERFECT LOCATION! This is 5 minutes from Seaworld, 15 from Disney/Epcot, on internatinal drive near all the shopping aand restaurants. If you check at the right time, you'll get a great value on the rate too! I phoned them and found out their was no conventionn going on for the dates I was requesting. As a result, they were offering an unbelievable rate. Since the place nowhere near capacity, the staff literally treated us like members of the family. Joan at the front desk checked us in, upgraded us to the executive floor and sent us a food surprise to help celebrate our special occasion. JJ, the concierge provided us with bus line information on international drive. In the executive lounge, Natasha, Vanessa and Megyn provided wonerful brakfast every morining and delicious snacks each evening. Even Joseph, the parking lot attendent took time to train us on using the key-card system and this save us from frustration. If you decide to go, don't forget to take advantage of the resort-like offerrings from this hotel: A huge exercise area, ourdoor fireplaces, a "lazy river" and a quiet pool just for adults which stays open till 11PM everynight. They also have a Spa and several restaurants which we did not use. Security at this hotel is top notch (we spent time with Michael, the head of their security force), so you can feel safe and won't have to worry about who is wandering around the grounds. I would go back in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & stay”
Reviews.Author: Samsrobin
Reviews.Content: The rating below from Leroyk was for another location-Bonnet Creek as Bonnet Creek was only open 3 months. This well-established hotel on Destination Parkway is within 5 min walking from Downtown Disney. The staff was so very helpful, and Preslie was especially kind to provide a surprise birthday cake for me in my room! The valet people were so pleasant and made you feel welcome from moment #1! My lovely room had a wonderful view of the local area and I just had such a delightful stay! I loved staying here and will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great location & Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: bill_250
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and very well located for the convention center (<10' walk). Nothing to complain about the hotel ! just great !

Reviews.Title: “New build nice job!”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: This was reminiscent of the old Fountain Blu in Miami Beach in it's hey day. love the self parking was on same level of the lobby just off the back!!

Reviews.Title: “Mould ! Don´t choose this hotel if you have any problem with allergy/asthma.”
Reviews.Author: LadyredOrlando
Reviews.Content: This brand new and very fancy hotel ha serious problems with mould. The first room we got was impossible to go inside but the second was a bit better and lastely the third was Ok if note free from mould. It opened September 2009 so the problem must come from mistakes done under the constructions of the hotel. I might guess rain during the construction in combination with a building where all windows are impossible to open which means that you can´t let fresh air in. Don´t choose this hotel if you have any problem with allergy/asthma.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, great restaurants, nice pool!”
Reviews.Author: MeIAmAlberta
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was wow. I have never stayed anywhere so extravagant, with all the decor, classy restaurants and staff opening doors and carrying your bags, etc. it was pretty neat. The trolley and some other eateries were only a short walk away. The pools and lazy river were great, with really nice landscaping. We were assisted with getting taxis and shuttles, which was also nice. Most of the staff were very helpful, with the exception of two at the registration desk who were not helpful at all. I was kind of put off on the first day. We had reservations for a room with two queen beds and were told that all those rooms were full, but we could have one with a sofa bed. I figured that this meant one bed and a sofa bed, but it was actually just a sofa bed. The room didn't have a regular bed! Also, it didn't have curtains that closed and the lights were always on outside, which made it difficult to sleep. After a couple days this was sorted out and, I admit, we got a discount on our stay. I also was not impressed with paying $15 to watch a movie. Overall, however, this was a good experience after we got our reserved room, (which, by the way, did have curtains that closed). If you go, try eating as Spencer's, it was so good! The staff in there are great too.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: 6001 Destination Parkway, Orlando, FL 32819
